text: The Shelbyville Municipal Planning Commission will meet on 07/25/2024 in a Special Called Meeting Session at 5:30 PM, Planning & Building Codes Building, 100 N. Cannon Boulevard. Call 931-488-4221 for any questions. Agenda: 1. Call to Order; 2. Roll Call; 3. Approval of Agenda 4. Constituents Comments; 5. New A. Consideration of Final Plat application, Park Place Townhomes, Horizontal Property Regime, Building No. 6, 967 Horse Mountain Rd., Tax Map and Parcel No. 078 038.02, 4.28 acres, zoned PUD. Black Diamond Construction, LLC., owner. B. Consideration of Final Plat application, Park Place Townhomes, Horizontal Property Regime, Buildings No. 5, 7, 8, 9, and 10, 967 Horse Mountain Rd., Tax Map and Parcel No. 078 038.02, 4.28 acres, zoned PUD. Black Diamond Construction, LLC., owner. 6. Adjourn.

The Shelbyville Municipal Planning Commission will meet on 07/25/2024 in a Regularly Scheduled Session at 6:00 PM, Planning & Building Codes Building, 100 N. Cannon Boulevard. MEETING NOTICE The City of Dunlap Planning Commissioners will meet in regular session, Monday, July 22, 2024. The meeting will be held at the George L. Wagner Municipal Building located at 15595 Rankin Av- enue. The meeting will begin at 5:00 p.m. PUBLIC NOTICE The following is a list of inactive Dunlap Water System, Dunlap Natural Gas System customers and Dunlap City Court. These persons are entitled to have full/partial meter deposit or refund of bond/ fines overage. Two forms of identification are re- quired to claim the property. All refunds listed be- low must, by law, be turned over to the state under the Unclaimed Property Act if they are not returned. The refunds of deceased persons belong to their rightful heirs. If you or someone you know are on this list, please contact City Hall at 949-2115, or visit our office weekdays between the hours of 7 a.m. to 4 p.m., by Monday, September 30, 2024. NOTICE OF GRAND JURY MEETING "Tt is the duty of your Grand Jurors to investigate any public of- fense which they know or have rea- son to believe has been committed and which is triable or indictable in this county. Any person having knowledge or proof that such an offense has been committed may apply to testify before the Grand Jury subject to the provisions of Tennessee Code Annotates, 40-12- 104." The foreperson of this county is presently: Bobby Page, 2844 Buf- falo Road, Hohenwald, Tennessee. "The Grand Jury will meet on Monday, August 5, 2024, at 9:00 a.m. You may be prosecuted for perjury for any oral or written statement which you may make under oath to the Grand Jury, when you know the statement to be false, and when the statement touches on a matter material to the point in question." This the 11th day of July, 2024. Barbara Hinson, Circuit Court Clerk Lewis County, Tennessee 30/4tc IN THE CHANCERY COURT FOR LEWIS COUNTY, TENNESSEE Garland C. Hunt and Sandra K. Hunt, Plaintiffs VS. Prime Land, LLC, a Florida Limited Liability Company, Defendant CIVIL ACTION NO. 2024-CV-60 NOTICE TO: Prime Land, LLC, a Florida Limited Liability Company Notice is hereby given to the above named defendant that a Complaint For Claim of Abandoned Mineral Interest was filed on July 12, 2024, in the Chancery Court for Lewis County, Tennessee, Civil Ac- tion No. 2024-CV-60, by Garland C Hunt and Sandra K Hunt, seeking a declaration that the mineral interest have been abandoned and reunit- ing these interests with the surface rights. The owners of the mineral rights have sixty (60) days in which to file an answer with the Clerk and Master; otherwise, the interest will lapse. Said property is located in the Tenth (10th) District of Lew- is County, Tennessee, and being Map 90, Parcel 002.08, described as of Record Book 102, Page 616 of Lewis County, Tennessee. After inquiring with the county property assessor, no tax is being paid on the mineral estate which un- derlies Garland C Hunt and Sandra K Hunt's surface estate and no use is being made of the mineral estate as defined in TCASS 66-5-108. Said mineral estate is of record in Re- cord Book 45, Page 766, Register's Office of Lewis County, Tennessee. The name of the mineral interest owner is Prime Land, LLC, a Florida Limited Liability Company. This notice will be published for three (3) consecutive weeks in the Lewis County Herald. This the 12th day of July, 2024. Kaitlin O. Bates, Lewis County Clerk and Master 31/3tc

NOTICE OF FORECLOSURE SALE Default having been made in the payment of assessments, dues, interest, debts, and obligations owing ALDENS GATE CONDOMINIUMS HOMEOWNERS ASSOCIATION, INC., by ROMAZ PROPERTY MANAGEMENT, INC., a Florida corporation, owner of Unit #3249-4B, Complex VI, Aldens Gate Condominiums, municipally known as: 3249 Thirteen Colony Mall, #4B; Memphis, Tennessee 38115, as established by that certain Master Deed for Aldens Gate Condominiums, dated September 5, 1984, of record in the Register's Office of Shelby County, Tennessee, as Instrument No. V6 9910, as amended by Instrument No. AT 4531, to be paid under the Master Deed, and the undersigned: (i) having been appointed as the Substitute Trustee of the Association by the Board of Directors of Aldens Gate Condominiums Homeowners Association, Inc., as evidenced by that certain Appointment of Substitute Trustee recorded in the aforementioned Register's Office as Instrument No. 24054908, and (ii) having been directed to advertise and sell the property described below for unpaid homeowner's association assessments, said indebtedness remaining unpaid, as well as other indebtedness due under the aforementioned Master Deed, and the power of sale being granted under Section 10(b) of the aforementioned Master Deed. THIS IS TO GIVE NOTICE that the undersigned will, on Friday, August 9, 2024.commencing at 12:00 noon at the southwest corner of the Courthouse, Memphis, Shelby County, Tennessee, and at the Adams Avenue entrance thereof, proceed to sell at public outcry to the highest and best bidder for cash, the following described property, to wit:Unit # 3249-4B, Complex VI, Aldens Gate Condominiums, as established by that certain Master Deed for Aldens Gate Condominiums, dated September 5, 1984, of record in the Register's Office of Shelby County, Tennessee, as Instrument No. V6 9910, as amended by Instrument No. AT 4531, to which Master Deed reference is made for a more particular description of the said property, together with an undivided 0.6516% interest in the common elements declared in said Master Deed to be appurtenant to said unit.Property Address: 3249 Thirteen Colony Mall, #4B, Memphis, Tennessee 38115Owner(s) of Property: Romaz Property Management, Inc., a Florida corporationOther Interested Parties: Tenants in possession (if any)Parcel Number: 074073-F00118 This sale is expressly subject to the lien of any real estate taxes assessed against the Unit due and owing; prior liens; encumbrances; easements; any other instruments of record; matters which would be disclosed by an accurate survey; the contents of that certain Master Deed of record as Instrument No. V6 9910, as amended by Instrument No. AT 4531; the contents of those certain easements of record as Instrument Nos. DX 1834, E2 1834, E6 6950, and E8 2620; the contents of the Charter of Aldens Gate Condominiums Homeowners Association, Inc., of record as Instrument No. V7 9330; subdivision restrictions, building lines, and easements of record in Instrument recorded in the Register's Office in Plat Book 30, Page 11, as amended and modified by those certain instruments of record in Book 5902, Page 472 and Book 59121, Page 150; and the rights of tenants in possession under unrecorded leases (if any); any and all rights of the debtor (if any) under the Soldiers' and Sailors' Civil Relief Act, 50 U.S.C. App. SS 501, et seq., as such may be amended from time to time; and tenants in possession under unrecorded leases (if any). All right and equity of redemption, homestead, and dower, and all other exemptions waived in said Master Deed and the title is believed to be good, but the undersigned will sell and convey only as the substitute trustee of the Aldens Gate Condominiums Homeowners Association, Inc., a Tennessee non-profit corporation, and not further or otherwise. If the highest bidder cannot pay the bid within twenty-four (24) hours of the sale, the next highest bidder, at their highest bid, will be deemed the successful bidder. THIS OFFICE IS A DEBT COLLECTOR. THIS IS AN ATTEMPT TO COLLECT A DEBT AND ANY INFORMATION OBTAINED WILL BE USED FOR THAT PURPOSE. M. Wayne Mink, Jr.Substitute Trustee for Aldens Gate Condominiums Homeowners Association, Inc.DINKELSPIEL, RASMUSSEN & MINK, PLLC1669 Kirby Parkway, Suite 106Memphis, Tennessee 38120(901) 754-7770July 12, 19, 26, 2024 Fd103249

FERGUSSON deceased, who died April 13, 2024, were issued to the undersigned by the Probate Court of Wilson County, Tennessee. All persons, resident and nonresident, having claims, matured or unmatured, against the estate are required to file the same with the Clerk of the above-named Court on or before the earlier of the dates prescribed in (1) or (2) otherwise their claims will be forever barred: (1) (A) Four (4) months from the date of the first publication of this notice if the creditor received an actual copy of this notice to creditors at least sixty (60) days before the date that is four (4) months from the date of the first publication; or (B) Sixty (60) days from the date the creditor received an actual copy of the notice to creditors if the creditor received the copy of the notice less than sixty (60) days prior to the date that is four (4) months from the date of first publication as described in (1)(A); or (2) Twelve (12) months from the decedents date of death.This the 10th day of July, 2024.JANET LEANNE FERGUSSONPERSONAL REPRESENTATIVEESTATE OF JOSEPH G. NOTICE JAMES MAYNARD The State of Tennessee, Department of Children's Services, has filed a Petition to Declare Children Dependent and Neglected as to Jenna James Maynard. It appears that ordinary process of law cannot be served upon you because your whereabouts are unknown. You are hereby ORDERED to serve upon Lauren Zechman-Denney, Attorney for the Tennessee Department of Children's Services, 600 Hearthwood Court, Cookeville, Tennessee 38506, (931) 372-7127, an Answer to the Petition to Declare Children Dependent and Neglected filed by the Tennessee Department of Children's Services, within thirty (30) days of the last day of publication of this notice, and pursuant to Rule 39(e)(1) of the Tenn. R. Juv. P. you must also appear in the Juvenile Court of Overton County, Tennessee at Livingston, Tennessee on the 18th day of September, 2024, at 9:00 a.m., for the Hearing on the Petition to Declare Children Dependent and Neglected by the State of Tennessee, Department of Children's Services. If you fail to do so, a default judgment will be taken against you pursuant to Tenn. Code Ann. SS 36-1-117(n) and Rule 55 of the Tenn. R. of Civ. P. for the relief demanded in the Petition. You may view and obtain a copy of the Petition and any other subsequently filed legal documents at the Juvenile Court Clerk's Office, Livingston, Tennessee. 7/17, 7/24, 7/31, 8/7

LOGUE, Substitute Trustee, pursuant to the power, duty, and authority vested in and imposed upon me in said Deed of Trust, will on August 16, 2024, at 10:30 a.m., prevailing time, at the front entrance of the Hamblen County Courthouse, 511 W 2nd N Street, Morristown, Tennessee, where foreclosures are customarily conducted, will offer for sale to the highest and best bidder for cash and free from the right of homestead, equity of redemption, and statutory right of redemption, all of which have been expressly waived by grantor as provided in said Deed of Trust, certain real property described in Hamblen County, Tennessee, more particularly described as follows, to wit:SITUATED in the First Civil District of Hamblen County, Tennessee, within the corporate limits of the City of Morristown, and being Lot No. 33A of Lochmere Subdivision as shown on plat of record in Plat Cabinet F, Slide F-146, in the Register's Office for Hamblen County, Tennessee, to which plat reference is here made for a more particular description.This conveyance is made and accepted together with and subject to all applicable easements, rights of way, conditions, reservations, limitations, covenants, restrictions, and building setback lines, including, but not limited to, such as are shown and noted on maps, plats, and surveys, and contained or cited in the chain of title to the property here conveyed. Deed of Trust (Revolving Line of Credit) from Charles R. Corlew to Michael Robertson, Trustee for Commercial Bank, in the amount of $20,000.00 dated June 20, 2018 and recorded in Book 1757, Page 231, as modified by that Modification and Extension Agreement recorded in Book 1822, Page 852, both in the Hamblen County Register's Office.2. Real Estate Deed of Trust from Charles R. Corlew to Christy Jayne Holden, Trustee for John W. Judgment Lien (Default) against Charles Randolph Corlew in favor of ORNL Federal Credit Union in the Hamblen County General Sessions Court, Case No. 140163, in the amount of $20,032.00 plus costs and interest, dated November 15, 2022 and recorded in Book 2010, Page 478, in the Hamblen County Register's Office.8. Notice of Lien filed by GEOServices, LLC against WELROC Enterprises, as owner, and Randy Corlew/WELROC Enterprises, as general contractor in the amount of $46,912.45 plus recording costs recorded May 18, 2020 in Book 1845, Page 801 in the Hamblen County Register's Office.9. Any rights of the owner of Lot 33B in and to the party wall dividing the residence located on Lot33A and the residence located on Lot 33B.10. Matters depicted and/or shown on that plat titled Lochmere S/D, Division of Lots 30-39, dated October 14, 1995 of record in Plat Cabinet F, Slide F-146, in the Hamblen County Register of Deeds office.11. You can read the report on our webpage at www.lincolncountybopu. com under the CCR tab. All customers will receive a copy in the mail and copies will be available at our Payment Center.

MALLORY VALLEY UTILITY DISTRICT The Board of Commissioners meeting is held at the District's office on the last Friday of each month, unless otherwise scheduled. The meetings begin at 12:00 p.m. For each public meeting, the District reserves a period for public comment to provide the public with the opportunity to comment on matters that are germane to the items on the agenda for the meeting. If you would like to comment during a meeting, please contact the General Manager, Jenny Clarke, at least 24 hours before the start of the meeting to schedule your time to comment. The Board of Commissioners may put reasonable restrictions on the period for public comment, such as the length of the period, the number of speakers, and the length of time that each speaker will be allowed to provide comment. To contact the General Manager, please email jclarke@mvud.org or call 615-628-0237. Jenny Clarke - General Manager Mallory Valley Utility District 465 Duke Drive Franklin, TN 37067 7/10/24, Williamson Herald

SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE'S NOTICE OF SALE Sale at public auction will be on August 27, 2024, at or about 11:00 AM, local time, at the north door of the Coffee County Justice Center 300 Hillsboro Boulevard, Manchester, TN 37355, pursuant to the Deed of Trust executed by Sean Stumpo and Shelby Stumpo, husband and wife, to Cella Stewart Rouse, as Trustee for Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc., acting solely as nominee for Legacy Home Loans, LLC dba Steadfast Mortgage dated December 20, 2022, and recorded in Book T1228, Page 597, Instrument Number 22011432, in the Register's Office for Coffee County, Tennessee ("Deed of Trust") conducted by Padgett Law Group, having been appointed Substitute Trustee, all of record in the Coffee County Register's Office. Default in the performance of the covenants, terms, and conditions of said Deed of Trust has been made; and the entire indebtedness has been declared due and payable. Party entitled to enforce the debt: Planet Home Lending, LLC Other interested parties: None The hereinafter described real property located in Coffee County will be sold to the highest call bidder subject to all unpaid taxes, prior liens and encumbrances of record: Legal Description: A certain tract or parcel of land lying and being in the 1st Civil District of Coffee County, Tennessee, being bounded and described as follows: Beginning at an iron pin in the westerly margin of Polk Street which iron pin is 165 feet from the southerly margin of Emerson Street; thence along the westerly margin of Polk Street S 49 deg. 26 min. W 85 feet to an angle iron; thence N 43 deg. 04 min. W 146 feet to an iron pin; thence N 47 deg. 13.5 min E 85 feet to a metal rod; thence S 43 deg. 05 min. E 149.3 feet to an iron pin; the same being the point of beginning, and being all of Lot Nos. 23, 25, 27 and the Southwesterly 10 feet of Lot No. 29 of Block "C" of the E.G. Daniel Subdivision, according to survey of Max Northcutt, dated July 25, 1984 and updated May 14, 1985. Being the same property conveyed to Sean Stumpo and Shelby Stumpo, husband wife by deed from Jonathan G. Dugdale, a single man, of record in Book W428, Page 545, or Instrument Number 22011431, Register`s Office of Coffee County, Tennessee. Street Address: The street address of the property is believed to be 608 Polk Street, Manchester, TN 37355, but such address is not part of the legal description of the property. In the event of any discrepancy, the legal description herein shall control. Map/Parcel Number: 076O A 013.00 000 Current owner(s) of Record: Sean Stumpo and Shelby Stumpo This sale is subject to all matters shown on any applicable recorded Plat or Plan; any unpaid taxes and assessments; any restrictive covenants, easements or setback lines that may be applicable; rights of redemption, equity, statutory or otherwise, not otherwise waived in the Deed of Trust, including rights of redemption of any government agency, state or federal; and any and all prior deeds of trust, liens, dues, assessments, encumbrances, defects, adverse claims and other matters that may take priority over the Deed of Trust upon which this foreclosure sale is conducted or are not extinguished by this Foreclosure Sale. PROPERTY IS SOLD WITHOUT ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, RELATING TO TITLE, MARKETABILITY OF TITLE, POSSESSION, QUIET ENJOYMENT OR THE LIKE AND FITNESS FOR A GENERAL OR PARTICULAR USE OR PURPOSE. The title is believed to be good, but the undersigned will sell and convey only as Substitute Trustee. The right is reserved to adjourn the sale to another time certain or to another day, time, and place certain, without further publication upon announcement on the day, time, and place of sale set forth above or any subsequent adjourned day, time, and place of sale. If you purchase a property at the foreclosure sale, the entire purchase price is due and payable at the conclusion of the auction in the form of a certified check made payable to or endorsed to Padgett Law Group. No personal checks will be accepted. To this end, you must bring sufficient funds to outbid the lender and any other bidders. Insufficient funds will not be accepted. Amounts received in excess of the winning bid will be refunded to the successful purchaser at the time the foreclosure deed is delivered. This property is being sold with the express reservation that the sale is subject to confirmation by the lender or trustee. This sale may be rescinded by the Substitute Trustee at any time. Public Notice Board of Commissioners & Planning Commission Special Joint Work Session Notice is hereby given that the Nolensville Board of Commissioners and Planning Commission will hold a special Joint Work Session on Wednesday, July 31st, 2024 at 6:00 p.m. The agenda will include a review of the first draft of the Pattern Book by the Town of Nolensville's Design Consultant and discussion by the Commissioners. The meeting will take place at Town Hall located at 7218 Nolensville Road. For more information on the Joint Meeting agenda items, please contact the Nolensville Planning Department via email at planning@nolensvilletn.gov, call (615) 776-6695, or visit the Town's website at www.nolensvilletn.gov. All published meeting agendas are found on the Town's website. All meetings are open and public sessions in accordance with law. All interested persons are urged to attend. For accommodations due to disabilities or other special arrangements, please contact the Town Recorder at mluster@nolensvilletn.gov or 615-776-6691. This request, if possible, should be made three (3) working days prior to the meeting. 7/10/24, Williamson Herald

Main Street, Lebanon, TN 37087, will be sold to the highest call bidder for cash free from all legal, equitable and statutory rights of redemption, exemptions of homestead, rights by virtue of marriage, and all other exemptions of every kind, all of which have been waived in the Deed of Trust, certain real property located in Wilson County, Tennessee, described as follows: Land In Wilson County, Tennessee And Being Unit No. 94 Of The Vineyard Grove Townhouses, A Townhouse Planned Unit Development, As Shown On Exhibit B To That Certain Declaration Of Covenants, Conditions And Restrictions For Vineyard Grove Of Record In Book 1899, Page 1962 In The Register's Office For Wilson County, Tennessee, Which Is Incorporated Herein By Reference For A More Complete Property Description. Included Herewith Is An Undivided Interest In The Common Elements Of The Vineyard Grove Townhouses Planned Unit Development As Set Forth In The Homeowners' Association Charter And Bylaws. The street address of the above-described property is believed to be 31 Torrey Pines Lane, Lebanon, TN 37087, but if such address is not part of the legal description of the property sold herein and in the event of any discrepancy, the legal description herein shall control. This sale is subject to all matters shown on any applicable recorded plat; any unpaid taxes; any restrictive covenants, easements or setback lines that may be applicable; any statutory rights of redemption of any governmental agency, state or federal; any prior liens or encumbrances as well as any priority created by a fixture filing; and to any matter that an accurate survey of the premises might disclose. In addition, the following parties may claim an interest in the above-referenced property: Owner of Property: Christina Hannah The United States of America, acting through the Rural Housing Service, Deed of Trust Book 2275, Page(s) 2427-2433 and/or Instrument # 23120091 The sale is subject to occupant(s) rights in possession of the premises. All right of equity of redemption, statutory and otherwise, and homestead are expressly waived in said Deed of Trust, and the title is believed to be good, but the undersigned will sell and convey only as Substitute Trustee. The right is reserved to adjourn the day of the sale to another day, time, and place certain without further publication, upon announcement at the time and place for the sale set forth above. If the sale is set aside for any reason, the purchaser at the sale shall be entitled only to a return of the purchase price. The purchaser shall have no further record against the grantor, the grantee or the trustee. Publication Dates: 7/17/2024, 7/24/2024, and 7/31/2024. NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING FOR CONDITIONAL APPROVAL OF THE SITE TREATMENT PLAN (STP) ANNUAL UPDATE FOR MIXED WASTE ON THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY OAK RIDGE RESERVATION The Tennessee Department of Environment and Conservation (TDEC) Division of Solid Waste (DSWM) and Division of Remediation -- Oak Ridge (DoR-OR) have conditionally approved The Department of Energy's (DOE) Annual Update to the Oak Ridge Site Treatment Plan (STP) for developing treatment capacities and technologies across the Oak Ridge Reservation (ORR). The Oak Ridge Office of Environmental Management (OREM) is located at 200 Administration Road Oak Ridge, TN 37831. TDEC invites the public to submit comments on the conditionally approved revisions during a 60-day comment period ending on Thursday, August 15, 2024. The STP delineates how DOE will treat the site's mixed wastes or develop/modify technologies when necessary to address generated and stored mixed waste at the site, under Section 3021(b) of the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA), as amended in the Federal Facility Compliance Act (FFCA). DOE and TDEC are parties to this agreement. A notice of availability of the revised STP was published in The Roane County News and The Courier News on July 10, 2024, for public review and comment. A public hearing has been requested and is scheduled for August 8, 2024, at the Division of Remediation, Oak Ridge Office. Information regarding public hearing details is included in this public notice. Following the receipt of the Annual Update, Version 28.0, of the Site Treatment Plan (STP) and the Semiannual Progress Report, TDEC has concluded under STP Section 2.5.1 that the proposed changes to the overall schedules and technology development approach not previously included in this STP constitute an STP revision. Specifically, DOE has proposed to extend a target for providing a preliminary (60%) design for the sludge processing facility by six (6) years to allow for evaluation of current technologies and technology maturation availabilities, as well as other treatment methods to ensure OREM is pursuing the best available means and methods to deal with the stored sludge volumes safely and effectively. This review process included an extension of the review period for thirty (30) working days, with additional extensions agreed upon to facilitate the incorporation of necessary changes to the mixed Transuranic (TRU) Sludge milestones. As stipulated in Section 2.5.2.1 of the STP, conditional approval of revisions to the STP is based on the determination that the revisions are acceptable, subject to the results of public comment and consultation with affected states and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). In line with this, and following our review, TDEC has conditionally approved the Annual Update to the STP, specifically concerning the revised mixed TRU Sludge milestones. These revisions are crucial for aligning with shared objectives and regulatory requirements, ensuring the safety and efficiency of mixed waste treatment processes on the ORR. To fulfill the requirements of Section 2.5.2.2, of the STP, TDEC is publishing this notice of availability of the revised STP for public review and comment. Additionally, the revised STP will be made available to affected states and the EPA for consideration and consultation. Final approval of these revisions will be determined within six months after TDEC's receipt of the proposed revision, under the stipulated review process. Furthermore, consistent with Section 2.5.3 of the STP, TDEC will engage in consultation with affected states and the EPA and seek public comments on the conditionally approved revisions. This is to ensure that all stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the decision-making process, enhancing transparency and collaboration in the management of mixed waste on the ORR. Following Section 2.8.5.2 of the STP, it is acknowledged that any milestones or target dates that are dependent upon the results of this deliverable review may be subject to adjustment. The DOE will provide written notification to TDEC of any necessary amendments to enforceable milestones or revisions to target dates, ensuring compliance with the conditions of approval. A public hearing will be held on Thursday, August 8, 2024, at the Division of Remediation, Oak Ridge Office located at 761 Emory Valley Road, Oak Ridge, TN 37830 as well as via video teleconference. Information on how to join online is provided below. An information session will be held from 5:30 p.m. to 6:00 p.m., EDT for the public to inspect the STP with representatives of DOE and TDEC. The formal hearing will begin at 6:00 p.m., EDT with a presentation from TDEC on the conditionally approved revisions followed by a presentation by DOE describing the activities to treat the Site's mixed wastes or develop/modify technologies when necessary to address generated and stored mixed waste at the Site. After the presentations, TDEC will receive oral comments on STP from the public that will be recorded. The public may submit written comments at the meeting. Those who wish to join the public hearing virtually can do so by using the following link: tn.gov/environment/notices/doe-stp/hearing. Information regarding how to join by computer will be posted to this website at least 3 days before the public hearing. Online participants will be able to view maps, pictures, and other content that will be shared. Electronic copies of the conditional approval for the STP can be viewed at https://www.tn.gov/environment/notices/doe-stp. Paper copies are available for review at The Oak Ridge Public Library, 1401 Oak Ridge Turnpike, Oak Ridge, TN 37830; DoR-OR Office, 761 Emory Valley Road, Oak Ridge, TN 37830. Phone: (865) 481-0995; Knoxville Environmental Field Office, 3711 Middlebrook Pike, Knoxville, TN 37921. Phone: 865-594-6035; and the DSWM Central Office located at the Davy Crockett Tower, 500 James Robertson Parkway, Nashville, TN 37243. Normal state office hours are 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. on weekdays, excluding legal holidays. The public is invited to submit written comments on the STP Semi-Annual Progress Report during a 60-day comment period, ending on August 15, 2024. To comment, contact Kristof Czartoryski at 865-250-9705 or Kristof.Czartoryski@tn.gov or Revendra Awasthi at 865-306-1862 or Revendra.Awasthi@tn.gov. Comments must be received by 4:30 p.m. EST on Monday, August 15, 2024, to assure consideration. TDEC is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action (EEO/AA) employer. TDEC does not unlawfully discriminate on any basis prohibited by applicable law in any of its programs, services, or activities. EEO/AA/ADAAA inquiries or complaints may be directed to the ADAAA Coordinator, TDEC HR Division, at (1-615-532-0200). Hearing-impaired callers may use the Tennessee Relay Service (1-800-848-0298). If it is hard for you to read, speak, or understand English, TDEC may be able to provide translation or interpretation services free of charge. Please contact Janelle Starke at 615-906-2950 for more information. If you would like to receive notices like this directly, contact the Public Participation Officer in DSWM's Central Office for a Mailing List Request form. Email Solid.Waste@tn.gov or call 615-532-0780. SECTION 00 11 13 - ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS Ripley Gas, Water, and Wastewater will receive separate sealed bids for Ripley Hwy 209 Water Line Replacement Phase | until July 31, 2024, at 11:00 am at 116 Church St., Ripley, TN 38063, and then at said office publicly opened and read aloud. Any person with a disability requiring special accommodation must contact Ripley Gas, Water and Wastewater no later than 7 days prior to the bid opening. The work to be bid on is as follows: e Installation of 3,220 Linear Foot of 12-inch Water Main Line (Including Valves, Fire Hydrants, and Service Connections) e The allotted time for construction is 180 calendar days This project is being supported with the Treasury, Coronavirus State and Local Recovery Fund grant funding. Therefore, certain restrictions and other federal requirements attach to this opportunity. All bid documents may be examined and obtained at the following: TLM Associates, Inc. 117 E. Lafayette St., Jackson, TN 38301. Hard copy sets require a $150 refundable deposit. A digital set may be obtained at no charge. Payment may be made by check, credit card, or ACH by contacting our office at 731-988- 9840 or receptionist@tlmae.com . Any non-winning bidder or non-bidder, upon returning the CONTRACT DOCUMENTS after BID opening and in good condition, will be refunded his/her payment. Ripley Gas, Water, and Wastewater hereby notifies all bidders that it will affirmatively ensure that in any contract entered pursuant to this advertisement will be afforded full opportunity to submit bids in response to this invitation and will not be discriminated against on the grounds of race, color, sex, or national origin in consideration for an award. Ripley Gas, Water, and Wastewater is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Any contract that uses federal funds to pay for construction work is a "federally assisted construction contract" and must include the equal opportunity clause found in 2 C.F.R. Part 200, unless otherwise stated in 41 C.F.R. Part 60. We encourage all small and minority owned firms and women's business enterprises to participate. No bidder may withdraw his bid within (60) days after the actual date of the opening thereof. PLEASE NOTE: Official plan holders list will only be the list maintained by TLM Associates, Inc. It is the sole responsibility of all plan holders, whether they have received digital downloads or paper copies of the plans and specifications, to periodically to check for Addenda which may have been posted on the following websites: e Go-DBE, www.tn.gov/generalservices/procurement/central-procurement-office--cpo-/go-dbe e Builder's Exchange, www.bxtn.org e Dodge Data & Analytics, dodge.docs@construction.com e West Tennessee Plans Room, www.wtplanroom.com TLM Associates, Inc. Page 1 of 2 00 11 13 Advertisement for Bids All bidders are required to be licensed in accordance with the General Licensing Act of 1976 (TCA Title 62, Chapter 6), also known as House Bill No. 2180. The Copeland "Anti-Kickback" Act is also applicable, which prohibits workers on construction contracts from giving up wages that they are owed. Contractors must not appear on the Sam.gov debarment list. A detailed listing of all subcontractors shall be provided by the Bidder. In accordance with the Contract Documents, documentation that the prospective General Contractor and its subcontractors meet minimum qualifications shall be provided and submitted. Subcontractors must also not appear on the Sam.gov disbarment list. Mark-ups on subcontractor work or Cost Plus Overhead will be disallowed for reimbursement. A bid bond or certified check for five percent (5%) of the total bid amount must accompany each bid. The successful bidder will be required to furnish a performance bond in the amount of his bid and shall, before entering into the work of said contract, be licensed as a contractor of Ripley Gas, Water and Wastewater. The owner reserves the right to waive any informalities or to reject any or all bids. TLM Associates, Inc. Page 2 of 2 00 11 13 Advertisement for Bids

Public Notice of Monthly Meeting The Board of Commissioners of the Milcrofton Utility District will meet on July 24,2024 at 9:00 a.m. for the regular monthly meeting at the district office located at 6333 Arno Road, Franklin, Tennessee. The public is invited to attend. Any member of the public who desires to speak during the public comment period of the meeting must notify the District's General Manager, Mike Jones, of his or her desire to address the board between 12:00 pm to 4:00 pm the fourth Tuesday of each month. Milcrofton is an equal opportunity provider and employer. Publication Dates L00000000

STATE OF SOUTHCAROLINA COUNTY OF GREENVILLE IN THE FAMILY COURT THIRTEENTH JUDICIAL CIRCUITC.A. No.: 2024-DR-23-1319 SUMMONS, NOTICE OF HEARINGExplanation of the Rights to an Attorney South Carolina Department of Social Services, Plaintiff,vs.Katie Wright, Efrain Sosa, Edger Hernandez, James Wills, John Doe, Defendants.In the Interest of:A minor child born in 2011.A minor child born in 2016.A minor child born in 2014.A minor child born in 2021.Minors all Under the Age of 18. TO: THE ABOVE NAMED DEFENDANTS: YOU ARE HEREBY SUMMONED and required to answer the Complaint in this action, a copy of which is hereby served upon you, and to serve a copy of your Answer upon the Plaintiff through its attorney at 352 Halton Road, Suite 100, Greenville, SC 29607, within thirty (30) days from the date of service, exclusive of the date of service, and if you fail to answer the Complaint within the time aforesaid, the Plaintiff will apply to the Court for judgment by default and for the relief demanded in the Complaint. You are further notified that you have the right to be represented by an attorney in all proceedings concerning this matter, and you are advised to have your attorney with you at any future hearing. You are further notified that if you are incompetent, the Plaintiff will apply to the Court to have a Guardian ad Litem appointed for you. If you cannot afford an attorney, the court will appoint an attorney to represent you. It is your responsibility to contact the Clerk of Court's Office, 350 Halton Rd, Greenville, SC 29607, to apply for appointment of an attorney to represent you if you cannot afford an attorney (take all of these papers with you if you apply). This is a new action. If you had an attorney appointed in a previous action, that attorney is NOT your attorney for this action. YOU MUST APPLY FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF AN ATTORNEY IMMEDIATELY. IF YOU DO NOT APPLY FOR AN ATTORNEY WITHIN THIRTY DAYS OF RECEIPT OF THE COMPLAINT, AN ATTORNEY WILL NOT BE APPOINTED FOR YOU. You are further notified that a final hearing has been scheduled for termination of your parental rights to the above-named children for September 4, 2024 at 1:00 p.m. and September 5, 2024 at 9:00 a.m. All hearings will take place at the Greenville County Family Court, 350 Halton Road, Greenville, South Carolina 29607. You are further notified that: (1) a Guardian ad Litem (GAL) will be appointed by this Court to represent the best interests of the minor children; (2) the GAL will provide this Court with a written report, including an evaluation and assessment of the issues before this Court along with recommendations; and (3) the GAL's written report will be available for review twenty-four (24) hours in advance of the final hearing at the GAL Program county office. S.C. DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES. Marianthe Richey (for Amanda Stiles)Attorney for Plaintiff, SC Bar # 101463Department of Social 352 Halton Road, Suite 100Greenville, SC 29607 864-467-4890 fax June 27, 2024Greenville, South Carolina

What is Child Find? Lauderdale County Schools Child Find Initiative The Lauderdale County School System's Child Find program identifies children between the ages of three and twenty-one with special education needs including developmental delays, specific learning disabilities, in- tellectual disabilities, speech/language impairments, vi- sual impairments, physical impairments, autism, serious emotional disturbance, multiple disabilities, intellectu- ally gifted, and traumatic brain injury. Educational needs are determined through parent interviews and child evaluations. Areas evaluated may include, but are not limited to: vision, hearing, speech and language, motor, cognitive, and adaptive development. Following the evaluation, if a child is determined to meet Tennessee State Eligibility Standards and to be in need of special education services, and Individualized Education Plan (IEP) will be developed for the child. This type of program is a free and appropriate program that meets the child's educational needs. For More Information Contact: Lauderdale County Schools Department of Exceptional Student Services Nicholas Stevens, Dept. Director 321 Armory Ave. Ripley, Tn. 38063 (731)-635-2941 (Phone) (731)-635-7985 (Fax) www.l|ced.net

PUBLIC NOTICE Williamson County is accepting bids for the renovation of portions of two Williamson County Health Department buildings. The Franklin location, 1324 West Main Street, Franklin, TN 37064 and the Fairview location, 2629 Fairview Boulevard, Fairview, TN 37062. This project is funded under a Grant Contract with the State of Tennessee and Williamson County ARPA funds. The pre-bid conference will be held at the Franklin location on July 17, 2024 at 10:00 a.m. Bids will be opened August 6, 2024, 2:00 P.M. The bid documents may be obtained at the Architect/Engineer's office by contacting Jared Brown, jbrown@woldae.com, Wold Architects and Engineers. 7/10/24, Williamson Herald

FORECLOSURE SALE NOTICE WHEREAS, RK Junior Contracting Services LLC, a Tennessee limited liability company, executed a Construction Deed of Trust dated May 27, 2022, of record at Book 9014, Page 635, Register's Office for Williamson County, Tennessee (the "Deed of Trust") and conveyed to Richard A. Bynum, as Trustee, the hereinafter described real property to secure the payment of certain indebtedness ("Indebtedness") owed to Studio Bank (referred to as "Lender" and sometimes as "Beneficiary"); and WHEREAS, default in payment of the Indebtedness secured by the Deed of Trust has occurred; and WHEREAS, David M. Anthony ("Trustee") has been appointed Substitute Trustee by Lender by that Appointment of Substitute Trustee of record at Book 9514, Page 493, Register's Office for Williamson County, Tennessee, with authority to act alone or by a designated agent with the powers given the Trustee in the Deed of Trust and by applicable law; and WHEREAS, Lender, the owner and holder of said Indebtedness, has demanded that the real property be advertised and sold in satisfaction of said Indebtedness and the costs of the foreclosure, in accordance with the terms and provisions of the loan documents and Deed of Trust. NOW, THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that the Trustee, pursuant to the power, duty and authority vested in and imposed upon the Trustee under the Deed of Trust and applicable law, will on Thursday, August 1, 2024, at 1:00 o'clock p.m., prevailing time, on the steps of the historic Williamson County Courthouse, 135 4th Ave S, Franklin, Tennessee 37064, offer for sale to the highest and best bidder for cash and free from all rights and equity of redemption, statutory right of redemption or otherwise, homestead, dower, elective share and all other rights and exemptions of every kind as waived in said Deed of Trust, certain real property situated in Williamson County, Tennessee, described as follows: Legal Description: The real property is described in the Deed of Trust at Book 9014, Page 635, Register's Office for Williamson County, Tennessee. Land in Williamson County, Tennessee, being Lot No. 103 on the Plan of The Reserve at Raintree Forest Section 4 of record in Plat Book P71, Page 49, in the Register's Office for Williamson County, Tennessee, to which Plan reference is hereby made for a more complete description of the property. Being a portion of the same property conveyed to RK Junior Contracting Services LLC, a Tennessee Limited Liability Company, by virtue of that certain Special/Limited Warranty Deed dated October 5, 2020, and being of record at Book 8224, Page 703 in the Register's Office of Williamson County, Tennessee. Map/Parcel No: 055-B-B-003.00 Street Address: The street address of the property is believed to be 1580 Eastwood Drive, Brentwood, Tennessee 37027, but such address is not part of the legal description of the property. In the event of any discrepancy, the legal description herein shall control. Other interested parties: Nashville Lumber Company, LLC; Meridian Capital Group, LLC. THIS PROPERTY IS SOLD AS IS, WHERE IS AND WITH ALL FAULTS AND WITHOUT ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND WHATSOEVER, WHETHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, AND SUBJECT TO ANY PRIOR LIENS OR ENCUMBRANCES, IF ANY. WITHOUT LIMITING THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, THE PROPERTY IS SOLD WITHOUT ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, RELATING TO TITLE, MARKETABILITY OF TITLE, POSSESSION, QUIET ENJOINMENT OR THE LIKE AND WITHOUT ANY EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, CONDITION, QUALITY OR FITNESS FOR A GENERAL OR PARTICULAR USE OR PURPOSE. As to all or any part of the Property, the right is reserved to (i) delay, continue or adjourn the sale to another time certain or to another day and time certain, without further publication and in accordance with law, upon announcement of said delay, continuance or adjournment on the day and time and place of sale set forth above or any subsequent delayed, continued or adjourned day and time and place of sale; (ii) sell at the time fixed by this Notice or the date and time of the last delay, continuance or adjournment or to give new notice of sale; (iii) sell in such lots, parcels, segments, or separate estates as Trustee may choose; (iv) sell any part and delay, continue, adjourn, cancel, or postpone the sale of any part of the Property; (v) sell in whole and then sell in parts and consummate the sale in whichever manner produces the highest sale price; (vi) and/or to sell to the next highest bidder in the event any high bidder does not comply with the terms of the sale. Substitute Trustee will make no covenant of seisin, marketability of title or warranty of title, express or implied, and will sell and convey the subject real property by Trustee's Quitclaim Deed as Substitute Trustee only. This sale is subject to all matters shown on any applicable recorded Plat or Plan; any unpaid taxes and assessments (plus penalties, interest, and costs) which exist as a lien against said property; any restrictive covenants, easements or setback lines that may be applicable; any rights of redemption, equity, statutory or otherwise, not otherwise waived in the Deed of Trust, including rights of redemption of any governmental agency, state or federal; and any and all prior deeds of trust, liens, dues, assessments, encumbrances, defects, adverse claims and other matters that may take priority over the Deed of Trust upon which this foreclosure sale is conducted or are not extinguished by this Foreclosure Sale. This sale is also subject to any matter that an inspection and accurate survey of the property might disclose. THIS 10th day of July, 2024. David M. Anthony, Substitute Trustee EXO LEGAL PLLC P.O. FORECLOSURE SALE NOTICEWHEREAS, RK Junior Contracting Services LLC, executed a Deed of Trust dated February 3, 2022, of record at Book 8901, Page 204, Register's Office for Williamson County, Tennessee (the "Deed of Trust") and conveyed to Richard A. Bynum, as Trustee, the hereinafter described real property to secure the payment of certain indebtedness ("Indebtedness") owed to Studio Bank (referred to as "Lender" and sometimes as "Beneficiary"); and WHEREAS, default in payment of the Indebtedness secured by the Deed of Trust has occurred; andWHEREAS, David M. Anthony ("Trustee") has been appointed Substitute Trustee by Lender by that Appointment of Substitute Trustee of record at Book 9417, Page 209, Register's Office for Williamson County, Tennessee, with authority to act alone or by a designated agent with the powers given the Trustee in the Deed of Trust and by applicable law; andWHEREAS, Lender, the owner and holder of said Indebtedness, has demanded that the real property be advertised and sold in satisfaction of said Indebtedness and the costs of the foreclosure, in accordance with the terms and provisions of the loan documents and Deed of Trust.NOW, THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that the Trustee, pursuant to the power, duty and authority vested in and imposed upon the Trustee under the Deed of Trust and applicable law, will on Thursday, August 1, 2024, at 1:30 p.m., prevailing Nashville time, on the steps of the historic Williamson County Courthouse, 135 4th Ave S, Franklin, Tennessee 37064, offer for sale to the highest and best bidder for cash and free from all rights and equity of redemption, statutory right of redemption or otherwise, homestead, dower, elective share and all other rights and exemptions of every kind as waived in said Deed of Trust, certain real property situated in Williamson County, Tennessee, described as follows:Legal Description: The real property is described in the Deed of Trust at Book 8901, Page 204, Register's Office for Williamson County, Tennessee. Land Situated in the Eleventh (11th) Civil District of Williamson County, Tennessee, being more particularly described as follows:Being Lot Number 3, of Arnold Homes, LLC Lots 1-3 Subdivision, as shown on plat entitled Minor Subdivison Plat, Arnold Homes, LLC Lots 1-3, of record at Plat Book P77, Page 106 in the Register's Office of Williamson County, Tennessee, to which plat reference is hereby made for a more particular description of said land.Being the same property conveyed to RK Junior Contracting Services LLC, herein by Warranty Deed dated February 3, 2022, of record at Book 8901, Page 201, in said Register's Office Tennessee.Map/Parcel No: 145-015.05Street Address: The street address of the property is believed to be 2630 Clayton Arnold Road (Lot Number 3, of Arnold Homes, LLC Lots 1-3 Subdivision), Thompsons Station, Tennessee 37179, but such address is not part of the legal description of the property. In the event of any discrepancy, the legal description herein shall control.Other interested parties: N/ATHIS PROPERTY IS SOLD AS IS, WHERE IS AND WITH ALL FAULTS AND WITHOUT ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND WHATSOEVER, WHETHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, AND SUBJECT TO ANY PRIOR LIENS OR ENCUMBRANCES, IF ANY. WITHOUT LIMITING THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, THE PROPERTY IS SOLD WITHOUT ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, RELATING TO TITLE, MARKETABILITY OF TITLE, POSSESSION, QUIET ENJOINMENT OR THE LIKE AND WITHOUT ANY EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, CONDITION, QUALITY OR FITNESS FOR A GENERAL OR PARTICULAR USE OR PURPOSE.As to all or any part of the Property, the right is reserved to (i) delay, continue or adjourn the sale to another time certain or to another day and time certain, without further publication and in accordance with law, upon announcement of said delay, continuance or adjournment on the day and time and place of sale set forth above or any subsequent delayed, continued or adjourned day and time and place of sale; (ii) sell at the time fixed by this Notice or the date and time of the last delay, continuance or adjournment or to give new notice of sale; (iii) sell in such lots, parcels, segments, or separate estates as Trustee may choose; (iv) sell any part and delay, continue, adjourn, cancel, or postpone the sale of any part of the Property; (v) sell in whole and then sell in parts and consummate the sale in whichever manner produces the highest sale price; (vi) and/or to sell to the next highest bidder in the event any high bidder does not comply with the terms of the sale.Substitute Trustee will make no covenant of seisin, marketability of title or warranty of title, express or implied, and will sell and convey the subject real property by Trustee's Quitclaim Deed as Substitute Trustee only.This sale is subject to all matters shown on any applicable recorded Plat or Plan; any unpaid taxes and assessments (plus penalties, interest, and costs) which exist as a lien against said property; any restrictive covenants, easements or setback lines that may be applicable; any rights of redemption, equity, statutory or otherwise, not otherwise waived in the Deed of Trust, including rights of redemption of any governmental agency, state or federal; and any and all prior deeds of trust, liens, dues, assessments, encumbrances, defects, adverse claims and other matters that may take priority over the Deed of Trust upon which this foreclosure sale is conducted or are not extinguished by this Foreclosure Sale. This sale is also subject to any matter that an inspection and accurate survey of the property might disclose. THIS 11th day of July, 2024.David M. Anthony, Substitute TrusteeEXO LEGAL PLLCP.O. Box 121616Nashville, TN 37212 david@exolegal.com 615-869-06347/10/24, Williamson Herald

NOTICE OF SALE OF REAL ESTATEWHEREAS, by deed of trust dated August 6, 2018, of record in Volume 1348 at page 715, in the Register's Office of Dickson County, Tennessee (the "Deed of Trust"), Kenneth S. Lewis conveyed the hereinafter-described real estate (the "Property") to Barney B. Regen, Trustee , to secure the payment of the indebtedness evidenced by a promissory note dated August 6, 2018, as modified by an agreement dated June 1, 2020, both executed by the grantor and made payable to First Federal Bank, together with all renewals, extensions, and modifications thereof (collectively, the "Note"); and WHEREAS, by instrument dated June 13, 2024, of record in Volume 1574 at page 1077 in the Registers Office of Dickson County, Tennessee, Benjamin C. Regen was appointed successor trustee under the Deed of Trust (the Successor Trustee); and WHEREAS, default has occurred in the payment of the Note and other provisions of the Deed of Trust have been violated, and First Federal Bank, the owner and holder of the Note, has declared the entire indebtedness due and payable, and has directed the Successor Trustee to foreclose the Deed of Trust in accordance with the terms thereof; THE PUBLIC IS HEREBY NOTIFIED that the Successor Trustee will sell the Property at public auction to the highest and best bidder for cash at the front door of the Dickson County Justice Center, 500 Spring Street, Charlotte, Tennessee, at the hour of 3:00 p.m. prevailing central time on Friday, August 9, 2024, in bar of the Grantors right and equity of redemption, and subject, inter alia, to all liens, encumbrances, and other defects in title having priority or preference over the Deed of Trust, including any lien for unpaid real property taxes; to the rights of tenants in possession, if any; and to all applicable and enforceable laws of governmental authorities having jurisdiction of the Property, whether or not such matters are disclosed by the public records of the county wherein the Property is located. The Property is described in the Deed of Trust as follows: Land in Dickson County, Tennessee, being Lot No. 2, on the Plan of Final Plat of the Lewis Property Subdivision, of record in Plat Cabinet J, Slide 127, Registers Office for Dickson County, to which plan reference is hereby made for a more complete description. Being a part of the same property conveyed to Kenneth S. Lewis and wife, Carol L. Lewis, by deed from H. Renee Filson, also known as Harritta Renee Filson, dated October 25, 2007, record October 30, 2007, of record in Volume 962, Page 916 in the Registers Office for Dickson County, Tennessee. Further being the same property conveyed to Kenneth S. Lewis by Quitclaim Deed from Carol L. Lewis, as recorded in Volume 1348, Page 713 in the Registers Office for Dickson County, Tennessee. The address of the Property is believed to be 1445 Rock Church Road, Dickson, Tennessee, but such address is not part of the legal description by which the Property will be sold, and in the event of a discrepancy between the legal description and the street address, the legal description will control. The Property is believed to be identified as Map 094-00-005.23 on the Dickson County tax map.The Property is believed to be improved. The right is reserved to adjourn the sale of the Property to another time and place without further publication upon announcement of such adjournment at the time and place set for the sale above; to adjourn the sale of the Property to another time and place without further publication upon announcement of such adjournment at the time and place set for the adjourned sale; and to repeat this process from time to time until the Property is sold by the Successor Trustee, or until the expiration of one (1) year following the originally scheduled date of sale, whichever occurs first. The right is reserved to cancel the sale of the Property at the request of the secured creditor, and to re-advertise the Property for sale at a later date, without diminishing, impairing, or otherwise affecting the priority of the Deed of Trust as a lien on the Property. If the highest bidder does not pay the bid price within twenty-four (24) hours of the sale, the right is reserved to sell the Property to the next highest bidder who is ready, willing, and able to purchase the Property for cash. The record owner of the Property is Kenneth S. Lewis. There is no record holder of any mortgage, deed of trust, or other lien which will be extinguished or adversely affected by the sale of the Property, and which mortgage, deed of trust, or lien, or notice or evidence thereof, was recorded in the public records of Dickson County, Tennessee, more than ten (10) days prior to the first advertisement of notice of sale. The Successor Trustee is unaware of any other party whose rights will be adversely affected by the sale of the Property pursuant to this notice except any heir or devisee of Kenneth S. Lewis, deceased. Upon information and belief, Kenneth S. Lewis is survived by a son, whose name is believed to be Kevin Lewis, but the Successor Trustee has no knowledge whether, and consequently no assurance is offered that, the said Kevin Lewis is in fact an heir or devisee of Kenneth S. Lewis, or whether Kevin Lewis is the only heir or devisee of Kenneth S. Lewis. The Successor Trustee is considered a debt collector within the meaning of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Accordingly, this notice is from a debt collector attempting to collect a debt and any information obtained will be used for that purpose.This 12th day of July, 2024./s/ Benjamin C. Regen Benjamin C. Regen, Successor Trustee

PUBLIC NOTIFICATION FORFLOOD HAZARD MAPPING REVISIONThe City of Murfreesboro and Rutherford County, inaccordance with National Flood Insurance Programregulation 65.7(b)(1), hereby gives notice of the Citys andCountys intent to revise the flood hazard informationalong Overall Creek and Puckett Creek. Specifically, theflood hazard information shall be revised along OverallCreek from approximately 580 feet downstream ofManson Pike to approximately 5,070 feet upstream ofManson Pike. Also, the flood hazard information shallbe revised along Puckett Creek from the confluence withOverall Creek to approximately 1,500 feet upstream ofthe confluence.As a result of the revision, the floodway along OverallCreek shall widen and narrow within the area of revisionand the floodway along Puckett Creek will remainunchanged. The 1% annual chance water-surfaceelevations shall increase and decrease along OverallCreek and decrease along Puckett Creek within the areaof revision. The 1% annual chance floodplain shall widenand narrow along both Overall Creek and Puckett Creekwithin the area of revision.If the public has any questions or concerns about theproposed changes to the FIRM or its effect on realproperty, you may contact Neel-Schaffer, Inc. (MichaelPhillips) at (615) 383-8420, or contact one of the localfloodplain administrators at one of the numbers listedbelow.Jennifer Knauf, PE, CFMProject Engineer, Floodplain AdministratorCity of Murfreesboro, TN615-893-6441Mike Hughes, PE, CFMCounty Engineer, Floodplain AdministratorRutherford County, TN615-898-7732To be run: July 16, 2024

INVITATION TO BIDSealed Bids for the project 2024 NORTH PALMERS CHAPEL ROAD WIDENINGPROJECT will be received by the City of White House Purchasing Department at2 pm local time, August 22, 2024, in City Hall, 105D College Street, White House,TN 37188, and then publicly opened and read aloud.Pre-bid questions will be received formally in writing via post or email until COBAugust 9th at CSR Engineering, Inc., 2010 Hwy 49E, Pleasant View, TN 37146 (c/oJason Reynolds) or email at jason.reynolds@csrengineers.com.The project generally consists of excavation, grading, milling, paving, striping andassociated miscellaneous work all within the City ROW along North Palmers ChapelRoad in the City of White House, TN.Copies of the Bid Documents may be obtained at CSR Engineering, located at 2010Hwy 49E, Pleasant View, TN 37146 at a cost of $100.00 for digital transmittal viaemail or disk drive. Printing of official bid documents shall be by the bidder. Unoffi-cial bid documents will also be posted to the City website and planrooms for adver-tising purposes only. No bids will be received by persons not on the official bid listfrom obtaining official Bid Documents.A bid bond of 5% of the bid is required on this project. The successful Bidder shall berequired to furnish separate one hundred percent (100%) Performance and PaymentBonds. The Performance Bond shall be in full force and effect for one (1) year afterthe date of final acceptance of the project by the City of White House.Each Bidder must be appropriately licensed as a Contractor in the State of Tennes-see as provided in T.C.A. 62-6-101. The Bidders name, license number, expirationdate, and that part of the contracting classification applying to the Bid shall ap-pear on the sealed envelope containing the Bid; otherwise, the Bid shall not beopened.Attention is called to the fact that the Contractor must ensure that employees andapplicants for employment are not discriminated against because of their race, col-or, religion, sex, or national origin. Each Bidder shall make positive efforts and areencouraged to use small and minority owned business enterprises on this project.The City of White House reserves the right to reject any or all bids or accept any pre-sented which meet or exceed these specifications, and/or which would be in the bestinterest of the City and will not necessarily be bound to accept the low bid.

The Town of Ashland City, Tennessee hereby provides certain financial information for the 2024-2025 budget in accordance with requirements of Tennessee Code Annotated Title 6, Chapter 56, Section 206. PUBLIC NOTICE Notice is hereby given that on Tuesday, June 25, 2024, the Board of Mayor and Aldermen of the City of Franklin, Tennessee, passed the following Ordinances: Ordinance 2024-15, An Ordinance To Remove 0.18 Acres Out Of The Central Franklin Overlay District (CFO) And Zone Into The Columbia Avenue Overlay District 1 (CAO1- Urban Commercial Development Sub-District) For The Property Located South Of South Margin Street And West Of Cummins Street, Located At 314 Cummins Street. Ordinance 2024-16, An Ordinance To Amend The Budget Of The City Of Franklin For Fiscal Year 2023-2024. Ordinance 2024-17, An Ordinance Of The City Of Franklin, Tennessee Adopting A Budget For The Fiscal Year 2024-2025; Providing An Effective Date. Ordinance 2024-18, An Ordinance Of The City Of Franklin, Tennessee Establishing The Municipal Property Tax Levy For The Fiscal Year 2024-2025; Providing An Effective Date. Ordinance 2024-19, An Ordinance Of The City Of Franklin, Tennessee To Amend Appendix A - Comprehensive Fees And Penalties, Chapter 17 Refuse And Trash Disposal, Of The Franklin Municipal Code To Increase The Fees For Collection Of Garbage And Refuse. Ordinance 2024-24, An Ordinance To Add A New Chapter 11 To Title 5 Of The Franklin Municipal Code To Create A Billing And Licensing Department And An Office Of The Billing And Licensing Director. The complete text of these Ordinances are on file at the Office of the City Recorder, City Hall, 109 Third Avenue South, Franklin, Tennessee, and may be inspected there between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. This summary is published in accordance with the provisions of Article V, Section 4, of the Franklin Municipal Charter. Respectfully submitted, Cayce Anderson Deputy City Recorder 7/10/24, Williamson Herald

ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS Project No. 1005-39 City of Sparta, Tennessee (Owner) Separate sealed bids for the 2022 ARPA Sewer System Rehabilitation - CCTV be received by the City of Sparta at City of Sparta, TN City Hall, 6 Liberty Square, City of Sparta, TN 38583 until 11 o'clock a.m., C.D.T Wednesday July 31, 2024, and then at said office publicly opened and read aloud. The Information for Bidders, Form of Bid, Form of Contract, Plans, Specifications, and Forms of Bid Bond, Performance and Payment Bond, and other contract documents may be examined at the following: Hethcoat & Davis, Inc., 278 Franklin Rd., Bldg 4, Ste 200, Brentwood TN 37027 Electronic copies of the drawings and specification, provided on CD, may be obtained at the office of Hethcoat & Davis, Inc. located at 278 Franklin Rd., Ste. 200, Brentwood, TN 37027 upon payment of $50.00 (non-refundable). The owner reserves the right to waive any informalities or to reject any or all bids. Each bidder must deposit with his bid, security in the amount, form and subject to the conditions provided in the Information for Bidders. All bidders must be licensed General Contractors as required by the Contractor's Licensing Act of 1994 of the General Assembly of the State of Tennessee, and qualified for the type of construction being bid upon. Attention of bidders is particularly called to the requirements as to conditions of employment to be observed and minimum wage rates to be paid under the contract, Section 3, Segregated Facility, Section 109 and E.O. 11246. No bidder may withdraw his bid within 60 days after the actual date of the opening thereof. 7/17, 7/24

City of Franklin Meeting Agenda Design Review Committee 109 3rd Ave S Franklin, TN 37064 (615) 791-3217 Monday, July 15, 2024 4:00 PM Board Room Notice is hereby given that a meeting of the Design Review Committee will be held on the date and time listed above at 109 3rd Ave. S., Franklin, TN 37064. You may call 615.791.3212 for additional information. For accommodations due to disabilities or other special arrangements, please contact the Human Resources Department at 615.791.3216 at least 24 hours prior to the meeting. The typical process for discussing an item in this meeting setting is as follows: 1. Applicant / staff presentation, and 2. DRC comments. Accommodations have been made to ensure that the public is able to view the meeting. The public may view the meeting in the following ways: * Watch the meeting on FranklinTV or the City of Franklin website. * Watch the live stream through the City of Franklin Facebook and YouTube accounts. * Attend in person in the Board Room. The public may also watch the meeting on the TV in the lobby. CALL TO ORDER CITIZEN COMMENTS (Open for citizens to be heard on any issue or concern, including those related to items on the agenda. Please submit a Speaker Card at the beginning of the meeting if you would like to address the Commission. If you would like to speak on an agenda item, the Chair will hold your comment until the public comment period associated with the item. As provided by law, the Commission shall make no decisions or consideration of action of citizen comments for items not on the agenda, except to refer the matter to the Planning Director/Staff for administrative consideration, or to a schedule the matter for consideration at a later date. Those addressing the Commission are requested to come to the microphone and identify themselves by name and address for the official record. The Chair may restrict the period for public comment, including the length of the public comment period, the number of individuals who can speak and the length of time each individual may speak. When time allows, the standard individual public comment time is two minutes.) Comments on agenda items may be made in person at city hall or by emailing planningintake@franklintn.gov before noon on the day of the meeting. Emailed comments will be provided to the Commission and included in the minutes, but not read aloud in their entirety during the meeting. APPLICATIONS 1. Discussion Of An Addition (Principal Building) And Site Alterations At 231 Myles Manor Ct. (Jasmine Grove); Amanda McCreary, Applicant. 2. Discussion Of New Construction (Accessory Structures) And Alterations At 315 4th Ave. S.; Ben McCreary, Applicant. 3. Discussion Of An Addition (Principal Building) At 114 Lewisburg Ave.; Megan Glenn, Applicant. 4. Discussion Of Alterations (Principal Building And Accessory Structure) At 1009 Fair St.; Noel Jones, Applicant. 5. Discussion Of Alterations (Building 9 & 10) And New Construction At 230 Franklin Rd. (The Factory); Greg Gamble, Applicant. text: NOTICE WILLIAMSON COUNTY IS SEEKING TO ADOPT THE 2018 INTERNATIONAL ENERGY CODE WITH THE 2009 TABLES IN ACCORDANCE WITH RULE 0780-02-23-.02 AS ADOPTED BY THE TENNESSEE STATE FIRE MARSHALS OFFICE. PRIOR TO CONSIDERATION OF THE ADOPTION OF THE 2018 EDITION, A COPY OF THIS DOCUMENT WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR INSPECTION FOR A PERIOD OF NINETY (90) DAYS BEGINNING ON THE DATE OF PUBLICATION OF THIS ADVERTISEMENT. THOSE WISHING TO INSPECT THIS DOCUMENT MAY DO SO MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY FROM 8:00 AM TO 4:30 PM (LEGAL HOLIDAYS EXCLUDED) AT THE OFFICES OF THE WILLIAMSON COUNTY CLERK, COUNTY ADMINISTRATIVE COMPLEX, 1320 WEST MAIN STREET, SUITE 135, FRANKLIN, TENNESSEE. ANYONE REQUESTING AN ACCOMMODATION DUE TO DISABILITIES SHOULD CONTACT RISK MANAGEMENT DEPARTMENT AT 615-790-5466. THIS REQUEST SHOULD BE, IF POSSIBLE, MADE THREE (3) WORKING DAYS PRIOR TO THE DATE ONE WISHES TO INSPECT THE ABOVE NOTED DOCUMENT. IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF WILLIAMSON COUNTY, TENNESSEE CITY OF FRANKLIN, TENNESSEE, Petitioner, v. CIVIL ACTION NO.: ZARING HOMES, INC. and WILLIAMSON COUNTY, TENNESSEE, Respondents. PETITION FOR CONDEMNATION COMES NOW the Petitioner, City of Franklin, Tennessee, and for its cause of action would respectfully show unto the Court as follows: 1. The Petitioner, City of Franklin, Tennessee, is a municipal corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of the State of Tennessee. 2. The Respondent, Zaring Homes, Inc., is the Owner of certain property located within the corporate city limits of the City of Franklin, Tennessee, more particularly described in the Warranty Deed of record in Book 1163, Page 674, in the Register's Office of Williamson County, Tennessee, subject to possible claims for city and county taxes. For the purpose of service of process, the Petitioner, City of Franklin, Tennessee, asserts that Respondent Zaring Homes, Inc., is a corporation that is no longer in existence. The Petitioner is therefore requesting an Order Allowing Service by Publication in order to perfect service upon Respondent Zaring Homes, Inc. A Motion for Order Allowing Service by Publication has been filed contemporaneously with this Court, along with an Affidavit in Support of Motion for Order Allowing Service by Publication. 3. The Respondent, Williamson County, Tennessee, is made a party to this action because of its interest in property taxes from the subject property. For the purpose of service of process, this Respondent may be served through its attorney, Kenneth J. Young, at 4068 Rural Plains Circle, Suite 100, Franklin, Tennessee 37064. 4. The Petitioner, in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Tennessee and Public Acts of Tennessee as contained in the Tennessee Code Annotated, and acts all amendatory thereof and supplementary thereto, particularly Tenn. Code Ann. SS 29-17-301, et seq., Tenn. Code Ann. SS 29-17-901, et seq., Tenn. Code Ann. SS 7-35-101, and Tenn. Code Ann. SS 7-35-403, and Article II, Section 1(6), of the Charter for the City of Franklin, has the right to acquire certain property rights for the completion of the Del Rio Pike Improvements Project, with specific authority set out by the City of Franklin Board of Mayor and Aldermen in Resolution 2022-17. 5. The Petitioner brings this action for the purpose of acquiring by the exercise of eminent domain, the right, title, and interest of the Respondents in the condemned property herein described, the same being the real property described in the document attached hereto as Exhibit A and as shown on the map attached hereto as Exhibit B, both of which are incorporated by reference as if copied fully herein. The purpose of this action is to acquire right-of-way and temporary and/or permanent easements across the above-referenced property which are necessary for roadway improvements, more specifically known as the Del Rio Pike Improvements Project. 6. The Petitioner is entitled to immediate possession of the property sought to be condemned. 7. Pursuant to the provisions of Tenn. Code Ann. SS 29-17-902, the Petitioner has determined the amount of damages to which the Respondents are entitled because of the taking of said property or property rights and, accordingly, has deposited the amount of Three Thousand Two Hundred Twenty-Five and 00/100 Dollars ($3,225.00) with the Clerk of the Court simultaneously with the filing of this Petition for Condemnation by making a formal tender. WHEREFORE, PREMISES CONSIDERED, PETITIONER PRAYS: 1. That a copy of this Petition for Condemnation and Notice of Filing Petition for Condemnation and of Setting for Hearing be issued and served upon the Respondents and that they be required to answer the same as provided by law. 2. That, pursuant to Tenn. Code Ann. SS 29-17-903, after thirty (30) days from the date of service of this Petition for Condemnation, if the Respondents do not contest the Petitioner's right to acquire the property sought to be taken, an Order of Possession be entered giving the Petitioner the right of possession of the property described herein. 3. That the Court grant all necessary Orders for the condemnation and appropriation of the condemned property, including a Writ of Possession if required. 4. That all proper proceedings be had hereunder that are necessary for the condemnation and appropriation of the property in fee simple or easement, if applicable, so that the Del Rio Pike Improvements Project may be constructed thereon. 5. That the right, title, and interest of the Respondents in and to the condemned property, the same being the real property described and depicted in Exhibit A and Exhibit B to this Petition for Condemnation, be divested out of said Respondents and vested in the City of Franklin, Tennessee, as set out herein. 6. That the Petitioner be awarded all such other, further, and additional relief as appears just under the facts and laws of this case. 7. That the deposited funds be distributed according to law and that in accordance with Tenn. Code Ann. SS 26-5-108, the Clerk be directed to ascertain and report any taxes due and unpaid which constitute a lien on the condemned property and to satisfy said lien out of the funds deposited herewith prior to the withdrawal of the funds by the Owner(s). Respectfully submitted, /s/ William E. Squires Shauna R. Billingsley (No. 23362) City Attorney shauna.billingsley@franklintn.gov William E. Squires (No. 21020) Assistant City Attorney bill.squires@franklintn.gov J. Blake Harper (No. 36819) Staff Attorney blake.harper@franklintn.gov 109 Third Avenue South Franklin, Tennessee 37064 Telephone: (615) 550-6603 Facsimile: (615) 550-6998 Attorneys for Petitioner City of Franklin, Tennessee 7/10/24, Williamson Herald

Subdivision, as shown by plat of record in Deed Book 20, Page 367, Register's Office, Bedford County, Tennessee. Parcel ID: 078G-L-031.00-000 Commonly known as 123 Butler Ave Shelbyville, TN 37160 The street address and parcel number(s) of the above described property are believed to be correct; however, such references are not a part of the legal description of the property sold herein, and, in the event of any discrepancy, the legal description herein shall control This sale is subject to tenant(s)/ occupant(s) rights in possession. This sale is subject to all matters shown on any applicable recorded plat; any unpaid taxes; any restrictive covenants, easements, or setback lines that may be applicable; any statutory rights of redemption of any governmental agency, state or federal; any prior liens or encumbrances as well as any priority created by a fixture filing; and to any matter that an accurate survey of the premises might disclose. In addition, the following parties may claim an interest in the above-referenced property: Justin C. Jones and Brenna K. Jones, Heritage South Community Credit Union. If the United States or the State of Tennessee have any liens or claimed lien(s) on the Property, and are named herein as interested parties, timely notice has been given to the applicable governmental entity, and the sale will be subject to any applicable rights of redemption held by the entity as required by 26 U.S.C. SS 7425 and/or Tennessee Code SS 67-1-1433. All right and equity of redemption, statutory and otherwise, homestead, and dower are expressly waived in said Deed of Trust, and the title is believed to be good; however, the undersigned will sell and convey only as Substitute Trustee. The transfer shall be AS IS, WHERE IS, AND WITH ALL FAULTS, and without warranties of any kind, express or implied, as to the condition of the Property and the improvements located thereon, including merchantability or fitness for particular purpose. Trustee shall make no covenant of seisin or warranty of title, express or implied, and will sell and convey the subject real property by Substitute Trustee's Deed only. The right is reserved to adjourn the day of the sale to another day, time, and place certain without further publication, upon announcement at the time and place for the sale set forth above. This property is being sold with the express reservation that the sale is subject to confirmation by the lender or trustee. This sale may be rescinded by the Substitute Trustee at any time.
