text: Early Notice and Public Review of a Proposed Activity in a WetlandTo: All interested Agencies - Federal, State, and Local - Groups and Individuals.This is to give notice that Industrial Development Board of Fentress County, Inc under CFR 24 Part 58 has conducted an evaluation as required by Executive Order 11988 and/or 11990, in accordance with HUD regulations at 24 CFR 55.20 Subpart C Procedures for Making Determinations on wetland protection, to determine the potential affect that its activity in the wetland will have on the human environment for a TN Department of Economic & Community Development, Appalachian Regional Commission Grant under TN-21185-2023Industrial Development Board of Fentress County, Inc plans to disseminate Appalachian Regional Commission Grant (ARC) funds to a sub-recipient for the purpose of clearing sixty acres of wooded area in the Clarkrange Regional Business Park. The proposed project(s) is located at International Dr in Clarkrange, Fentress County, Tennessee. According to The U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service it was clear that wetland features (coded as R5UBH and R4SBC) are present.R4SBC - RiverineSystem Riverine (R): The Riverine System includes all wetlands and deep-water habitats contained within a channel, with two exceptions: (1) wetlands dominated by trees, shrubs, persistent emergents, emergent mosses, or lichens, and (2) habitats with water containing ocean-derived salts of 0.5 ppt or greater. A channel is an open conduit either naturally or artificially created which periodically or continuously contains moving water, or which forms a connecting link between two bodies of standing water.Subsystem Intermittent (4): This Subsystem includes channels that contain flowing water only part of the year. When the water is not flowing, it may remain in isolated pools or surface water may be absent.Class Streambed (SB): Includes all wetlands contained within the Intermittent Subsystem of the Riverine System and all channels of the Estuarine System or of the Tidal Subsystem of the Riverine System that are completely dewatered at low tide.Water Regime Seasonally Flooded (C): Surface water is present for extended periods especially early in the growing season but is absent by the end of the growing season in most years. The water table after flooding ceases is variable, extending from saturated to the surface to a water table well below the ground surface.R5UBH - RiverineSystem Riverine (R): The Riverine System includes all wetlands and deep water habitats contained within a channel, with two exceptions: (1) wetlands dominated by trees, shrubs, persistent emergents, emergent mosses, or lichens, and (2) habitats with water containing ocean-derived salts of 0.5 ppt or greater. A channel is an open conduit either naturally or artificially created which periodically or continuously contains moving water, or which forms a connecting link between two bodies of standing water.Subsystem Unknown Perennial (5): This Subsystem designation was created specifically for use when the distinction between lower perennial, upper perennial, and tidal cannot be made from aerial photography and no data is available.Class Unconsolidated Bottom (UB): Includes all wetlands and deep-water habitats with at least 25% cover of particles smaller than stones (less than 6-7 cm), and a vegetative cover less than 30%.Water Regime Permanently Flooded (H): Water covers the substrate throughout the year in all years.There are three primary purposes for this notice. First, people who may be affected by activities in wetlands and those who have an interest in the protection of the natural environment should be given an opportunity to express their concerns and provide information about these areas. Second, an adequate public notice program can be an important public educational tool. The dissemination of information about wetlands can facilitate and enhance Federal efforts to reduce the risks associated with the occupancy and modification of these special areas. Third, as a matter of fairness, when the Federal government determines it will participate in actions taking place in wetlands, it must inform those who may be put at greater or continued risk.Written comments must be received by Industrial Development Board of Fentress County, Inc at the following address on or before 07/18/2024Industrial Development Board of Fentress County, IncP.O. Box 427Jamestown, TN 38556Attention: Joe Wheeler, Chairman, Fentress County IDB(931) 879-9948. Comments may also be submitted, or further information can be requested via email at jacob@jamestowntn.org. A full description of the project may also be reviewed from 8am - 4:00pm at 114 Central Ave E, Jamestown, TN 38556Date: 07/3/2024Name of Certifying Officer: Joe WheelerTitle of Certifying Officer: Chairman, Fentress County IDB

NOTICE OF FORECLOSURE SALE WHEREAS, by Deed of Trust (the ''Deed of Trust'') dated April 24, 2020, of record at Record Book 960, pages 979-981, Register's Office for Bedford County, Tennessee, TAMMY TITUS did convey unto JOHN T. BOBO, as Trustee, a certain tract of real estate hereinafter described, to secure a certain indebtedness set out in said Deed of Trust; and WHEREAS, GLENN E. EAST and wife, JOYCE C. EAST is the owner and holder of the note secured by said Deed of Trust hereinabove referred to; and WHEREAS, the said John T. Bobo, Trustee, is unable to act as Trustee under the Deed of Trust and I have been appointed Substitute Trustee by the owner and holder of the note by instrument of record at Record Book 1121, pages 533-534, Register's Office for Bedford County, Tennessee; and WHEREAS, the said real estate described in said Deed of Trust is as follows: Lying and being in the Eleventh (11th) Civil District of Bedford County, Tennessee, bounded and described as follows, to-wit: Being all of the property shown on the plat of the Sarah Frances Brown subdivision of record in Plat Cabinet "B" Envelope 106, Register's Office of Bedford County, Tennessee, to which reference is here had for a more detailed description of same. Being the same property conveyed to Tammy Titus by Deed from Glenn E. East and wife, Joyce C. East, dated April 18, 2020, said Deed being of record in Book D356, page 896, Register's Office of Bedford County, Tennessee. This conveyance is subject to any and all existing easements and restrictions of record. WHEREAS, said Deed of Trust was made to secure the payment of a notetherein set out and contained the power to sell in the case of default in the payment of said note and interest at maturity; and WHEREAS, the maker of said note has defaulted in the payment and the maintaining of required insurance thereof, and the owner and holder of said note has declared the entire amount due and payable and has requested the undersigned to foreclose said Deed of Trust according to its terms in order to collect said note. NOW, THEREFORE, I, the undersigned DAVID D. PARSONS, Substitute Trustee, will, in accordance with the terms set out in the Deed of Trust above referred to, on Friday, August 9th, 2024, at 10:00 A.M. CST, at the South entrance of the Bedford County Courthouse in Shelbyville, Tennessee, offer for sale and sell the above-described real estate at public auction to the highest and best bidder for cash in bar of equity of redemption and free from homestead and dower, all in accordance with the provisions of said Deed of Trust and the laws of Tennessee controlling such sales, subject, however, to all outstanding real estate taxes. The right is reserved to adjourn the day of the sale to another day and time certain without further publication and in accordance with law upon announcement of said adjournment on the day and time and place of sale set forth above. The failure of any high bidder to pay the purchase price and close the sale shall, at the option of the Substitute Trustee, be cause for rejection of the bid, and if the bid is rejected, the Substitute Trustee shall have the option of making the sale to the next highest bidder who is ready, willing, and able to comply with the terms thereof. The proceeds derived from the sale of the property will be applied as provided for in said Deed of Trust. Said Deed of Trust is made a part hereof as if copied verbatim herein. This sale of the Property shall be subject to any and all unpaid taxes, assessments, rights-of- way, easements, protective covenants or restrictions, liens, and other superior matters of record which may affect said property; as well as any prior liens or encumbrances as well as priority created by a fixture filing; and/or any matter that an accurate survey of the premises might disclose. If the U. S. Department of Treasury/ IRS, the State of Tennessee Department of Revenue, or the State of Tennessee Department of Labor and Workforce Development are listed as interested parties in the advertisement, then the Notice of this foreclosure is being given to them and the sale will be subject to the applicable governmental entities' right to redeem the property, as required by26 U. S. C. SS 7425 and T. C. A. SS 67-1-1433. The sale will be conducted subject (1) to confirmation that the sale is not prohibited under the U. S. Bankruptcy Code and (2) to final confirmation and audit of the status of the loan with the holder of the Deed of Trust. The address of the above-described property is believed to be 2129 Halls Mill Rd., Shelbyville, Bedford County, Tennessee, but such address is not part of the legal description of the property sold herein, and in the event of any discrepancy, the legal description herein shall control. This property is further identified as being Map 028, Parcel 008.01, on the records of the Tax Assessor of Bedford County, Tennessee. THIS LAW FIRM IS ATTEMPTING TO COLLECT A DEBT. ANY INFORMATION OBTAINED WILL BE USED FOR THAT PURPOSE. This 9th day of July, 2024. David D. Parsons, Substitute TrusteeLaw Office of Joe M. Lambert, Jr.100 Public Square North, Suite 3Shelbyville, TN 37160(931) 684-9600 (July 17th, July 24th, and July 31st, 2024)

NOTICE OF A PUBLIC MEETING OF THE INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT BOARD OF WILLIAMSON COUNTY, TENNESSEE AND A PUBLIC HEARING RELATIVE TO A PROPOSED BOND ISSUE NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that The Industrial Development Board of Williamson County, Tennessee (the "Board") will hold a special meeting and public hearing (pursuant to Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code) on Monday, July 22, 2024, commencing at 3:00 p.m., local time, in the first floor conference room of the Williamson County Administrative Complex, 1320 West Main Street, Franklin, TN 37064 to consider and act upon all business which may properly come before the Issuer. At this meeting the Board will consider such business as may properly come before it, including but not limited to, consideration of 1) a state grant request for TruGreen Limited Partnership and 2) approval of (i) the issuance by the Board of its Multifamily Housing Revenue Bonds in one or more series (the "Bonds"), in a principal amount not to exceed $60,000,000 in the aggregate, pursuant to Title 7, Chapter 5, Part 1, and (ii) the loan by the Board of the proceeds of the sale of the Bonds to Elmington Capital Group, LLC or an affiliate thereof (the "Borrower") to finance the eligible costs of the acquisition, construction, reconstruction, installation and equipping of an approximate 220-unit low and moderate income housing facility to be located at 151 Cool Springs Boulevard in the City of Franklin, Tennessee, to be developed, owned and operated by the Borrower. The Bonds will be limited obligations of the Board payable solely from the loan repayments to be made by the Borrower to the Board, and certain funds and accounts established by the trust indenture for the Bonds. THE BONDS, IF ISSUED, SHALL NOT REPRESENT OR CONSTITUTE A DEBT OR PLEDGE OF THE FAITH AND CREDIT OR THE TAXING POWER OF THE BOARD, WILLIAMSON COUNTY, THE STATE OF TENNESSEE OR ANY POLITICAL SUBDIVISION THEREOF. At the time and place set forth above, the Board will also hold a public hearing relative to the proposed issuance of the Bonds. The public hearing will be held pursuant to the requirements of Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code. Any person interested in the issuance of the Bonds or the location or purpose of the facilities to be financed with the proceeds of the Bonds is invited to attend the public meeting and public hearing (which may be continued or adjourned to a later date), and they will be given an opportunity to express their views both orally and in written form concerning the proposed issuance of the Bonds and the financing of the Project with the proceeds thereof. Additional information concerning the above may be obtained from, and written comments should be addressed to, Ken Young, attorney for the Board, Buerger, Moseley, & Carson, PLC, Two Town Center, 4068 Rural Plains Circle, Suite 100, Franklin, Tennessee 37064, telephone number (615) 794-8850. This notice is given pursuant to the provisions of Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 1, of the Tennessee Code Annotated, as amended, Sections 8-44-101 through 8-44-111, inclusive, of the Tennessee Code Annotated, as amended, and Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Industrial Development Board of Williamson County, Tennessee 7/10/24, Williamson Herald

ATTENTION PAST AND CURRENT EMPLOYEES OF FENTRESS COUNTY, TENNESSEE NOTICE TO PARTICPATE IN ACTUARIAL STUDY FOR TENNESSEE CONSOLIDATED RETIREMENT The State of Tennessee Consolidated Retirement System has authorized and approved Fentress County, Tennessee to fund an Actuarial Study under Tennessee Code Annotated Section 8-35-236. This statute allows any retired member, or member who has completed or will complete one (1) year of membership in the Tennessee Consolidated Retirement System, to be entitled to establish retirement credit for time during which they were employed by Fentress County, Tennessee. THIS INCLUDES PAST AND CURRENT EMPLOYEES AND APPLIES TO ALL DEPARTMENTS OF FENTRESS COUNTY GOVERNMENT WITH THE EXCEPTION OF FENTRESS COUNTY BOARD OF EDUCATION. IF YOU WERE OR ARE AN EMPLOYEE OF FENTRESS COUNTY, TENNESSEE AND YOU INTEND TO ESTABLISH PRIOR SERVICE CREDIT, YOU MUST PROVIDE YOUR INTENTION TO DO SO AND BE INCLUDED IN THE ACTUARIAL STUDY BY: July 19, 2024. CALL OR COME BY: Fentress County Human Resource Office 931-879-3010 IF YOUR DOCUMENTED INTENT TO PARTICIPATE IS NOT RECEIVED BY: DATE, YOU WILL NOT BE ALLOWED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE STUDY AND WILL BE BARRED IN THE FUTURE IF FENTRESS COUNTY ELECTS TO AUTHORIZE THE FUNDING OF SUCH PARTICIPATION BY A LATER RESOLUTION.

NOTICE OF SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE'S SALE WHEREAS, default has occurred in the performance of the covenants, terms and conditions of a Deed of Trust dated July 17, 2020, executed by JAMES STEVE GUESS conveying certain real property therein described to MEGAN K. TROTT, as Trustee, as same appears of record in the Register`s Office of Bedford County, Tennessee recorded July 20, 2020, in Deed Book TD969, Page 427; andWHEREAS, the beneficial interest of said Deed of Trust was last transferred and assigned to PennyMac Loan Services, LLC who is now the owner of said debt; andWHEREAS, the undersigned,Rubin Lublin TN, PLLC, having been appointed as Substitute Trustee by instrument to be filed for record in the Register's Office of Bedford County, Tennessee.NOW, THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that the entire indebtedness has been declared due and payable, and that the undersigned, Rubin Lublin TN, PLLC, as Substitute Trustee or his duly appointed agent, by virtue of the power, duty and authority vested and imposed upon said Substitute Trustee will, on August 20, 2024 at 11:00 AM at the main entrance to the Bedford County Courthouse, 1 Public Square, Shelbyville, TN 37160, proceed to sell at public outcry to the highest and best bidder for cash or certified funds ONLY, the following described property situated in Bedford County, Tennessee, to wit: A CERTAIN TRACT OR PARCEL OF LAND LYING AND BEING IN THE 7TH CIVIL DISTRICT OF BEDFORD COUNTY, TENNESSEE, BEING BOUNDED AND DESCRIBED AS FOLLOWS: BEGINNING AT THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A LOT HEREIN CONVEYED AT AN IRON PIN IN THE SOUTH BOUNDARY LINE OF HICKORY DRIVE; SAID BEGINNING POINT BEING THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF LOT 12 AND THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF LOT 11 AND FROM SAID BEGINNING POINT RUNNING THENCE WITH THE SOUTH MARGIN OF HICKORY DRIVE NORTH 89 DEG. 15 MIN. EAST 100 FEET TO AN IRON PIN; THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE LOT HEREIN CONVEYED AND THE WEST CORNER OF LOT 13; THENCE SOUTH 00 DEG. 45 MIN. EAST 224 FEET TO A STAKE AT A FENCE LINE; THENCE. SOUTH 89 DEG. 15 MIN. WEST WITH A FENCE LINE 100 FEET TO A STAKE ON THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THIS PROPERTY AND THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF LOT 11; THENCE NORTH 00 DEG. 45 MIN. WEST 224 FEET TO THE POINT OF BEGINNING. Parcel ID: 078G H 01300 000659 PROPERTY ADDRESS: The street address of the property is believed to be 300 HICKORY DR, SHELBYVILLE, TN 37160. In the event of any discrepancy between this street address and the legal description of the property, the legal description shall control.CURRENT OWNER(S): ESTATE AND/OR HEIRS AT LAW OF JAMES STEVE GUESS , LORRIE THOMPSONOTHER INTERESTED PARTIES: The sale of the above-described property shall be subject to all matters shown on any recorded plat; any unpaid taxes; any restrictive covenants, easements or set-back lines that may be applicable; any prior liens or encumbrances as well as any priority created by a fixture filing; and to any matter that an accurate survey of the premises might disclose. This property is being sold with the express reservation that it is subject to confirmation by the lender or Substitute Trustee. This sale may be rescinded at any time. The right is reserved to adjourn the day of the sale to another day, time, and place certain without further publication, upon announcement at the time and place for the sale set forth above. All right and equity of redemption, statutory or otherwise, homestead, and dower are expressly waived in said Deed of Trust, and the title is believed to be good, but the undersigned will sell and convey only as Substitute Trustee. The Property is sold as is, where is, without representations or warranties of any kind, including fitness for a particular use or purpose. THIS LAW FIRM IS ATTEMPTING TO COLLECT A DEBT. ANY INFORMATION OBTAINED WILL BE USED FOR THAT PURPOSE. text: IN THE FOURTH CIRCUIT COURT OF DAVIDSON COUNTY, TENNESSEEATNASHVILLE MIRIAM'SROMISEPetitioner,v.HEATHER ANGELLRespondent. IN THE MATTER OFCHEYENNE HOPE ANGELLA CHILD UNDER EIGHTEEN (18) YEARS OF AGE,D.O.B. 11/23/23 Case No. 24A-32 ORDER OFPUBLICATION This matter came to be heard upon motion by Miriam's Promise on June 21, 2024, before the Honorable Stanley A. Kweller, Judge, Fourth Circuit Court Davidson County, Tennessee. It appearing from the Motion and supporting Affidavit that Respondent Heather Angell cannot belocated upon diligent search and inquiry so that ordinary process of law cannot be served upon her; service of process by publication is ordered and she is hereby required to appear and answer or otherwise defend against the Petition for Termination of Parental Rights within 30 days after the date of the last publication of this notice; otherwise, a default judgment will be entered against Respondent for the relief demanded in the complaint. It is ORDERED that Petitioner be allowed to proceed with substituted service and that this notice shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation in Davidson County, which is the last known whereabouts of Respondent and the place of the child's birth and in Lincoln County, Tennessee, which is Respondent's last known address, once a week for four (4) consecutive weeks. This the 21st day of June, 2024. STANLEY A. KWELLER, JUDGE APPROVED FOR ENTRY:Lisa L. CollinsSup. Ct. No. 160354501 CharlotteAvenue, #90744Nashville,Tennessee 37209(615) 269-5540LCollins@TN adoption.comAttorney forPetitioner, Miriam's Promise

NOTICE OF SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE'S SALE OF REAL ESTATE WHEREAS, on June 26, 2020, ALICE ANN HUNT (deceased), by a Deed of Trust of record in Record Book 1049, at Page 696, in the Register's Office of Gibson County, Tennessee, conveyed the following described property in trust to secure the payment of a Promissory Note in the original principal amount of Eighteen Thousand Seven Hundred Fifty-Two and 93/100 Dollars ($18,752.93), payable to SECURITY BANK & TRUST COMPANY, Successor by Merger to The Farmers & Merchants Bank; and WHEREAS, the undersigned was appointed Substitute Trustee by SECURITY BANK & TRUST COMPANY, the legal owner and holder of the said Note, by appointment executed on June 7, 2024, and recorded in Record Book 1105, at Page 1063, in the Register's Office of Gibson County, Tennessee; and WHEREAS, default has been made in the payment of said indebtedness and other provisions of the Deed of Trust have been violated, and SECURITY BANK & TRUST COMPANY, the lawful owner and holder of the said indebtedness, has declared the entire amount due and payable as provided by the Deed of Trust in accordance with the terms thereof, and instructed the undersigned to foreclose. NOW, THEREFORE, the public is hereby notified that the undersigned Substitute Trustee will sell the hereinafter described real estate at public auction, to the highest and best bidder, for cash in hand paid in certified funds paid at the conclusion of the sale, or upon a credit bid from a bank or other lending entity pre-approved by the Substitute Trustee. The auction shall occur at the south door of the Courthouse at Trenton, Gibson County, Tennessee, on Tuesday, August 6, 2024, at 2:00 oclock p.m., said property to be sold in bar of the equity of redemption and subject to the lien of all special assessments against it. Lying, and being situate in the City of Dyer, 21st Civil District of Gibson County, Tennessee, bounded and described as follows; to-wit: BEGINNING at a stake in the South margin of Walnut Street, Austin Jewell's Northwest corner; thence with the South margin of Walnut Street West 96.8 feet to a stake at Ronnie D. Woods' Northeast corner; thence with Woods East line South 100 feet to a stake, Woods' Southeast corner and at another Jewell Northwest corner; thence East 96.7 feet with Jewell's North line toa stake, Jewell's interior corner; thence with Jewell's West line North 100 feet to the point of beginning. Description was taken from prior conveyance. It being the same property as that described in a Limited Warranty Deed from Farmers & Merchants Bank, to Alice Ann Hunt, dated December 4, 2008, and of record in Record Book 932, page 33, in the Register's Office of Gibson County, Tennessee. Alice Ann Hunt died intestate, a resident of Gibson County, Tennessee, on June 27, 2022. Map 061D, Group L, Parcel 003.00 The street address of the above-described property is believed to be 331 Walnut Street, Dyer, Tennessee, but such address is not part of the legal description and in the event of any discrepancy, the legal description herein shall control. SALE IS SUBJECT TO TENANT(S) RIGHTS IN POSSESSION. This sale is subject to all matters shown on any applicable recorded plat; any unpaid taxes; any restrictive covenants, easements, or setback lines that may be applicable; any statutory rights of redemption of any governmental agency, state or federal; any prior liens or encumbrances as well as any priority created by a fixture filing; and to any matter that an accurate survey of the premises might disclose. Other interested parties: None. Title to said property is believed to be good, but the undersigned will sell as Substitute Trustee only and will assign to the purchaser all covenants of warranty contained in said Deed of Trust. The sale held pursuant to this Notice may be rescinded at the Successor Trustee's option at any time. Said sale may be adjourned to another time or may be postponed to another date by public announcement at the appointed time of sale without readvertisement. This office is a debt collector. This is an attempt to collect a debt and any information obtained will be used for that purpose. WITNESS my signature, this the 16th day of July, 2024. KIZER, BONDS, HUGHES & BOWEN, LLC BY: STEPHEN L. HUGHES Substitute Trustee P. O. Box 320 Milan, TN 38358 (731) 686-1198

PUBLIC NOTICE Notice is hereby given by David Jackson, County Mayor of Marion County, Tennessee that the County has received an offer to purchase from David Gene Rector, in the amount of $3404.74 on property identified as Map 133N, Group A, Parcel 038.00 on the records of the Assessor of Property of Marion County, Tennessee. Pursuant to the provisions of T.C.A. Section SS67-5-2507, sale shall not become final until (10) days after the publication of this notice. During said ten (10) day period, any other party interested in purchasing the above referenced property may increase the offer (s) made for the land as stated herein by ten percent (10%) or more. Upon such increase, the County Mayor shall notify all parties, and a date shall be fixed when all parties shall appear and make offers, with said land to be sold to the party making the highest and best offer. Dated this 18" day of July, 2024. David Jackson Marion County Mayor

Notice 1 -- Holder Publication dates: Thursdays, July 18 and 25 and Aug. 1 July 18, 2024 July 25, 2024 Aug. 1, 2024 766 words NOTICE OF SALE OF REAL ESTATE WHEREAS, by Deed of Trust dated March 25, 2022, and recorded on April 5, 2022 appearing of record in Record Book 490 page 655, in the Register's Office of Chester County, Tennessee, Christopher L. Holder and Breanna Holder conveyed to William T. Chapman, Trustee, certain real estate therein described, to secure the payment of a certain indebtedness therein set forth to The Peoples Bank; and WHEREAS, Breanna Jordann Holder's interest in the property was divested and the same vested in Christopher Lee Holder by Final Divorce Decree of record in the Chancery Court of Chester County, Tennessee, and recorded in Record Book 512, page 330 in the Register's Office of Chester County, Tennessee. WHEREAS, default has been made in the payment of the indebtedness secured by the Trust Deed, and The Peoples Bank the lawful holder of the note evidencing the indebtedness has declared the entire balance due and payable; and WHEREAS, Charles C. Exum was appointed Successor Trustee by instrument appearing of record in Record Book 519, page 457 in the Register's Office of Chester County, Tennessee. NOW, THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that on August 13, 2024.at 1 o'clock p.m., at the front door of the Court House in Henderson, Chester County, Tennessee, I will sell to the last, highest and best bidder for cash and in bar of all rights to homestead, curtesy and dower, appraisement, and the marshalling of liens and assets relating to the property; equitable and statutory rights of redemption after foreclosure sale, all of which were expressly waived to the extent not prohibited by law, the following real estate, lying and being in the Second Civil District of Chester County, Tennessee, and more particularly described as follows: BEGINNING ata point in the centerline of Johnson Crossroads Road, which point is the Southeast comer of William Kirk as recorded in Deed Book 89, Page 841 Register's Office of Chester County, Tennessee, said point being the POINT OF BEGINNING; thence with the centerline of Johnson Crossroads Road the following two calls S.16deg18'09" E., a distance of 70.74 feet; thence S. 18deg 35'25"E., adistance of 207.96 feet to a cotton spindle set; thence on new lines of Liles, the following two calls S. 71deg21'08"W., adistance of 345.49 feet; thence N. 18deg38'52"W.., a distance of 422.85 feet to an iron pin set on the South line of Kirk; thence with the South line of Kirk, the following two calls N. 75deg46' 17"E., a distance of 158.09 feet to an iron pin set; thence S. 73deg59'28"E., passing an iron pin found at 202.93 feet an continuing fora distance of 232.17 feet to the POINT OF BEGINNING. Containing 3.00 acres as surveyed by Advanced Land Surveying, Inc., R.L.S. #2127 on October 29, 2021. There is a mobile home assessed to the property. Being the same property conveyed to Christopher Holder and wife, Breanna Holder, by deed dated November 1, 2021, appearing of record in Record Book 483, page 560, in the Register's Office of Chester County, Tennessee. Being the same property conveyed to Christopher L. Holder from Breanna] ordann Holder by Final Decree appearing of record as Docket No. 2023-CV-1441 in the Chancery Court of Chester County, Tennessee and also filed for record in Record Book 512, Page 330, in the Register's Office of Chester County, Tennessee. Map 023 Parcel 003.04 Description taken from Record Book 483, page 560 in the Register's Office of Chester County, Tennessee. No opinion is rendered by the undersigned as to the accuracy of the legal description. The street address of the property is 115 Johnson Crossroads Road, Jacks Creek, TN. Said property will be sold by me as Successor Trustee only and subject to any unpaid taxes and assessments and all valid restrictions, covenants or easements, if any, of record on said property, and subject to any and all other liens having priority over the Trust Deed. The Successor Trustee reserves the right to make oral announcements at the time of the public sale which shall apply to the terms of the sale. The Successor Trustee may postpone any sale hereunder to another time or place by so announcing to all present at the time and place of the sale scheduled herein, without the necessity of any further notice whatsoever. INTERESTED PARTIES: Christopher L. Holder and Breanna Holder. THISIS FOR THE COLLECTIONOFA DEBT AND ANY INFORMATION OBTAINED WILL BE USED FOR THAT PURPOSE. /s/ Charles C. Exum Charles C. Exum, Successor Trustee Rainey, Kizer, Reviere & Bell, P.L.C. 105 South Highland Jackson, TN 38301 731-423-2414

PUBLIC NOTICE Invitation to Bid Hamblen County Government is seeking sealed bids for: RFID System for New Justice Center (RFP 2024-07). Bid specifications are available for download at www.hamblencountytn.gov under the Proposals and Bids tab. Hard copies of the bid specifications are available at the Hamblen County Mayor's Office, 511 West Second North Street, Morristown, TN 37814 during normal business hours. Sealed bids must be submitted clearly labeled as stated in the specifications and delivered to the Hamblen County Mayor's Office no later than 2:00 p.m. Thursday, August 8, 2024, at which time they will be publicly opened in the West Wing Conference Room at this same address. Questions should be directed to Barbara Horton in the Hamblen County Mayor's Office at (423) 586-1931. Hamblen County Government reserves the right to accepting and/or rejecting any and/or all proposals when doing so serves the best interest of Hamblen County Government. Run Dates:07/18/2024

SUPERIOR COURT DEPARTMENT OF THE TRAIL COURT SUFFOLK, ss. 150 SEAPORT LLC, PLAINTIFF V ANDI NORA NELSON A/K/A NORA T. NELSON, DEFENDANT CIVIL ACTION NO.: 2484CV00137G ORDER OF NOTICE BY PUBLICATION TO: Andi Nora Nelson a/k/a Nora T. Nelson WHEREAS a civil action has been begun against you, by Complaint in Massachusetts Superior Court wherein Plaintiff is seeking to recover from escrow deposits that you have allegedly made and forfeited pursuant to certain purchase and sale agreements relating to two properties in Boston, Massachusetts. WHEREAS it appears to the Court from the Complaint and Plaintiff's Ex Parte Motion for Order of Notice by Publication on Andi Nora Nelson a/k/a Nora T. Nelson (which filings may be accessed through the online docket at https://www.masscourts.org/eservices/home.page.2) that no one can find you and that no personal service of the Complaint may be made upon you, it is ORDERED, pursuant to Mass. R. Civ. P. 4(e)(5), that notice of this suit be given to you by publishing in the Memphis Commercial Appeal and Boston Globe once per week for two weeks. WE COMMAND YOU, if you intend to make any defense, that on or by August 19, 2024 (the return day), or within such further time as the law allows you, do cause your written pleading to be filed in the office of the Clerk of Court, Suffolk County Superior Court, 3 Pemberton Square, Boston, MA 02108, with a copy to be served upon the Plaintiffs attorney, Ryan M. Rosenblatt, Esq., Sullivan & Worcester, LLP, One Post Office Square, Boston, Massachusetts 02109, and further that you defend against said suit according to law if you intend any defense, and that you do and receive what the Court shall order and adjudge therein. If you fail to meet the above requirements, judgment by default may be rendered against you for the relief demanded in the Complaint. Unless otherwise provided by Rule 13(a), your answer must state as a counterclaim any claim which you may have against the Plaintiff which arises out of the transaction or occurrence that is the subject matter of the Plaintiffs claim or you will be barred from making any such claim in any other action. SO ORDERED. Dated this 6th of June, 2024 /s/ Justice of the Superior Court

ELECTION NOTICE November 5, 2024, General Election To Fill Vacancy County Commission, Districts 1 & 7, Seat A To the voters of Franklin County, TN, due to a vacancy, notice is given that an unexpired two-year term for the office of County Commission, Districts 1 and 7, Seat A will be included with the general election to be held on Tuesday, November 5, 2024. Relevant dates are as follows: Qualifying Deadline - Thursday, August 15, 2024, at 12:00 noon Withdrawal Deadline - Thursday, August 22, 2024, at 12:00 noon C/ Nominating petitions for independent candidates interested in filling the vacancy may be obtained from the Franklin CountyElection Commission office. C/ Independent candidates must file their original nominating petition in the county election commission office no later than the qualifying deadline stated above. C/ Candidates interested in representing either the Republican or Democratic Party for the office must contact the chairman of their respective party to be considered for nomination. Political party nominees, if any, must be certified to the county election commission office no later than the same qualifying deadline stated above. OFFICE LOCATION: Franklin County Annex MAILING ADDRESS: 839 Dinah Shore Blvd., Suite 1, Winchester, TN 37398 PHONE: 615-967-1893 FAX: 931-967-5317 EMAIL: franklin.commission@tn.gov WEBSITE: www.franklincotn.us/election_commission.html OFFICE HOURS: _ 8:00 to 12:00, 1:00 to 4:30 Monday through Friday Franklin County Election Commission Daniel J. Sidley, Chairman Patty Priest, Secretary Lisa D. Mason, Member Andy Groves, Member Joy C. Spencer, Member Margaret Ottley, AOE

LEGAL PUBLICATIONNOTICE OF MEETING OF THE HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES BOARD OF THE CITY OF CLEVELAND AND PUBLIC MEETING OF THE INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT BOARD OF THE CITY OF CLEVELAND, TENNESSEETHE HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES BOARD OF THE CITY OF CLEVELAND (the Board), will meet in public session at 8:30 a.m. local time, on Thursday, July 25, 2024, in the Upstairs Meeting Chamber of the Cleveland Municipal Building located at 190 Church Street, Cleveland, Tennessee, for the purpose of considering and transacting all business which may properly come before the Board, such business to include, but not necessarily be limited to, the request of Hamilton Health Care System, a Georgia nonprofit corporation, for final approval of the issuance of up to $325,000,000 by the Board of its qualified 501(c)(3) bonds as defined in Section 145 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code), for hospitals or other healthcare facilities (the Bonds) for the benefit of HHCS to (a) finance or refinance, in whole or in part, the cost of the acquisition, construction, installation and equipping of certain healthcare facilities, equipment and improvements to be owned or operated by HHCS or one of its affiliates, located at 2305 Chambliss Avenue, Northwest, Cleveland, Tennessee 37311 (the maximum stated principal amount of the Bonds to be issued to finance facilities at these locations is $325,000,000) (collectively, the Facilities); and (b) pay all or a portion of the costs of issuance of the Bonds.THE INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT BOARD OF THE CITY OF CLEVELAND, TENNESSEE will hold a public meeting at the same place immediately following the Health and Educational Facilities Board meeting for the purpose of considering and transacting all business which may properly come before the Board.Additional information concerning the above may be obtained from, and written comments should be addressed to, Ginger Buchanan, Esq., 423 Broad Street NW, Cleveland, Tennessee 37311, telephone number (423)614-4035.Rufus Triplett, ChairmanJuly 18, 2024

NOTICE OF INTENT 10 VOLUNTARILY DISSOLVE A LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY Notice is given that a Notice of Intent to Welcome Home Real Estate, LLC, a Ten- nessee Limited Liability Company with its registered office at 611 Swansons Ridge Rd, Chattanooga, Hamilton County, Ten- nessee, has been delivered to the Secre- tary of State for filing in accordance with the Tennessee Limited Liability Company Act. Pursuant to the provisions of T.C.A. SS 48- 245-502, all creditors, individuals or enti- ties who have or may have claims of any type or nature against the Company are hereby notified to submit, in writing, the fol- lowing information: (a) The name, address and telephone number of the creditor/claimant; (b) The dollar amount of the claim; and (c) A brief description of the type and na- ture of the claim. The information required by (a) through (c) should be submitted to 611 Swansons Ridge Rd, Chattanooga, Tennessee 37421, Attention: Kenneth Schoening. Notice is further provided that, except as to claims that are contingent at the time the Company filed its Notice of Intent to Dissolve or claims that arise after the filing of said Notice of Intent to Dissolve, a claim against the Company not otherwise barred will be barred unless a proceeding to en- force the claim is commenced within two years after the publication of this Notice. This 31 st day of May, 2024. /s/ Kenneth Schoening Kenneth Schoening, Member

NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING CONCERNING THE ADOPTION OF AN ORDINANCE TO AMEND THE SELMER ZONING ORDINANCE Notice is hereby given that a public hearing will be held before the Mayor and Alderman on consideration of the following amendment to the Zoning Ordinance: AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE TEXT OF THE SELMER MUNICIPAL ZONING ORDINANCE BY CHANGING PUBLIC HEARING ON PROPOSED AMENDMENT The hearing will be held pursuant to the provisions of Sections 13-7-203 Tennessee Code Annotated. Said hearing will be held at the meeting of the Mayor and Alderman on Tuesday, August 13 , 2024, beginning at 7:00 p.m. at the Selmer Town Hall. A copy of the proposed ordinance is available for review at Town Hall. Sherry Inman Mayor

Franklin County Government is seeking bids to construct a new facility for Franklin County Animal Control to be located adjacent to the Franklin County Judicial Center at 440 George Fraley Parkway, Winchester, TN 37398. Bids will be received by Franklin County Government, Winchester, Tennessee, at the Franklin County Finance Office, PO Box 518, 851 Dinah Shore Boulevard, Winchester, TN 37398, until 12:00 PM CDT, local time, on Wednesday, August 14, 2024. All bids must be sealed and marked "Franklin County Animal Control" on the exterior of the envelope. Bids will be opened at 2:00 PM CDT, local time, on Wednesday, August 14, 2024 at the Franklin County Annex Small Conference Room, 851 Dinah Shore Boulevard, Winchester, TN 37398. A pre-bid conference will be held at 10:00 AM CDT, local time, on Thursday, July 25, 2024 at the Franklin County Annex Small Conference Room. Direct any questions in writing to Jonathan Adams, Construction Administrator: jonathan.adams@gmcnetwork.com. Full sets of contract documents may be purchased beginning July 18, 2024, at Lellyett and Rogers Co., 1717 Lebanon Rd., Nashville, TN 37210. Contract documents may be examined on and after July 18, 2024, at the following locations: Nashville Contractor's Association, Inc. and Reprographics - P.O. Box 2048, Smyrna, Tennessee 37167 (615) 254-8346 Associated General Contractors - 2924 Foster Creighton Drive, Nashville, Tennessee 37204 (615) 244-6344 ConstructConnect www.constructconnect.com (800) 901-8667 Dodge Data and Analytics |= www.construction.com (877) 784-9556 All bids will be submitted by licensed & insured business/contractors with an official bid packet, signed, dated, sealed & marked with notation with the Bid Title & Date. Franklin County Reserves the Right to Reject Any and/or All Bids. All bidders shall adhere to Title VI of the Civil Rights Act enacted in 1964 which states that "No person in the United States shall, on grounds of race, color, or national origin, be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or subjected to discrimination under any program or activity receiving federal financial assistance', state of Tennessee funding, and/or Franklin County funding.

LEGAL NOTICE Notice is hereby given that Cadence Bank, 201 South Spring Street, Tupelo, Lee County, MS 38804, has made application to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and the Mississippi Department of Banking and Consumer Finance for consent to establish a branch bank to be located at 3634 Austin Peay Highway, Memphis, Tennessee 38128. Any person wishing to comment on this application may file his or her comments in writing with the Regional Director of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation at its Regional Office at 600 North Pearl Street, Suite 700, Dallas, TX 75201, or with the Commissioner of the Mississippi Department of Banking and Consumer Finance, Post Office Box 12129, Jackson, Mississippi 39236, not later than August 2, 2024. The non-confidential portions of the application are on file in the above offices and are available for public inspection during regular business hours. Photocopies of the non-confidential portion of the application file will be made available upon request. This notice is published pursuant to Part 303.7 of the Rules and Regulations of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and Section 81-7-1, Mississippi Code of 1972. FOR SALE - NOTICEThe Town of South Carthage is receiving bids for the sale of one(1) 2009 Ford Crown Victorian until Thursday August 1, 2024,at 3:30 p.m. (local time). Qualifying bids will be opened at Townof South Carthage City Hall at 4:00 p.m. August 1, 2024.The Town has placed a reserve (minimum bid) amount on thevehicle of $1,250.For more information, contact the South Carthage City Hall at615-735-2727, Monday thru Friday between the hours of 8:00a.m. and 4:30 p.m.Joey Nixon, Mayor, Town of South Carthage106 Main St. South Carthage, TN 37030The vehicle is being sold as is and may be inspected duringnormal business hours at the South Carthage City Hall. It is theresponsibility of the bidder to see that a bid is properly addressedand received at the South Carthage City Hall. All bids should bein a sealed envelope and marked on the envelope 2009 FordCrown Victorian Bid. No faxed, emailed, or verbal bids willbe accepted.

NOTICETRUSTEE'S SALE OF REAL ESTATEWHEREAS, on the 17th day of August 2017, by Deed of Trust recorded in the Register's Office at Jacksboro, Tennessee, in Trust Deed Book 668 at Page 595, KRYSTYNA BLOCKER HURLEY AND HUSBAND, DERRELL L. HURLEY, conveyed to DAVID REYNOLDS, TRUSTEE, the herein described real estate, to secure the payment of the following indebtedness: one note of even date executed by KRYSTYNA BLOCKER HURLEY AND HUSBAND, DERRELL L. HURLEY payable to PEOPLES BANK OF THE SOUTH, in the original amount of $55,920.00 and;WHEREAS, default has been made in the payment of said indebtednesses and other provisions of the Trust Deeds have been violated, and Peoples Bank of the South the holder of said indebtedness has declared the entire amount due and payable as provided in said deed of trust, and the Trustee has been directed to foreclose the deed of trust. In accordance with the terms thereof, the public is hereby notified that the undersigned Trustee will sell the hereinafter described real estate at public auction, to the highest and best bidder, for cash in hand in front of the Courthouse door in Jacksboro, Tennessee, at the hour of 11:00 o'clock a.m., on the 9th day of August, 2024, said property to be sold in bar of the right and equity of redemption and all other rights and exemptions, and subject to the following conditions: unpaid property taxes and other prior encumbrances of record.Lying and being in the Second Civil District of Campbell County, Tennessee, described as follows:Being Lot 572, Phase 3 of Clearwater Cove Subdivision (formerly Villages at Norris Lake), as shown on recorded plat in Plat Cabinet A, Slide 575, in the Registers Office for Campbell County, Tennessee, to which reference to said plat is hereby made for a more particular description.This conveyance and the real property referenced above are made subject to all matters appearing on the plat of record at Plat Cabinet A, Slide 575, Registers Office, Campbell County, Tennessee, and the Declaration of Restrictive Covenants for Clearwater Cove, of record at Book 125, Page 285, et. Seq., Registers Office, Campbell County, Tennessee.This being the same property conveyed to Krystyna L. Blocker-Hurley and husband, Derrell L. Hurley by Warranty Deed dated August 4, 2017 of record in Deed Book 509, Page 338, in the Registers Office forCampbell County, Tennessee.PROPERTY ASSESSORS ID:116I-D-022.00To the best of the Trustee's knowledge, information and belief, there are no tax lien claimants upon the subject property which would require notice pursuant to Tenn. Code Ann. 35-5-104 and 67-1-1433 (b)(1) and 26 U.S.C. 7425.To the best of the Trustees knowledge, persons who have interests in the subject property, other than the borrower and who are entitle to notice are: Clearwater Cove on Norris Lake Homeowners Association, 257 Prestige Ridge LaFollette, TN 37766Pursuant to the above described Deeds of Trust, the Trustee may sell the property by lots or as a whole, whichever generates the highest overall bid. The proceeds from the sale of the above- described property shall be applied in accordance with the provisions of the above-described Deed of Trust. Should the highest and best bidder fail to comply with the terms of the sale, then the Trustee shall have the option of accepting the second highest bid, or the next highest bid, which the buyer is able to comply. The Trustee shall also have the right to adjourn the sale to another date certain without further publication but upon announcement before or during the sale.This is an attempt to collect a debt and any information obtained will be used for thatpurpose.This the 3rd day of July, 2024./s/ _David ReynoldsDAVID REYNOLDS, TRUSTEE

CITY OF ADAMSVILLE JOB OPENING Street Department Utility Worker The City of Adamsville, Tennessee seeks a Street Dept Utility Worker. Candidate must be able to lift 75 pounds and the ability to perform hard labor for extended periods of time in all-weather conditions and after hours when necessary. Candidate must be able to work on-call when needed. Candidate must adhere to all safety policies and procedures. Candidate must be trustworthy and have a positive attitude. Candidate must have the ability and willingness to establish a working relationship with other employees and citizens. Position requires a high school diploma or equivalent. Candidates for this position must be able to pass physical, drug screen and background check. Applications will be available at Adamsville City Hall during regular business hours. The deadline for applications will be when job is filled. The City of Adamsville, TN is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, the City will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals. The City encourages both prospective and current employees to discuss potential accommodations with the employer.

SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE'S SALE Sale at public auction will be on August 28, 2024 at 11:00AM local time, at the front door, Sequatchie County Courthouse, 22 Cherry Street, East, Dunlap, Tennessee pursuant to Deed of Trust executed by Franklin D. Bushman and Joyce Bushman, to Old Republic Nat'l Title Co., Trustee, as trustee for GreenPoint Credit, LLC on September 7, 2001 at Book TD138, Page 454; conducted by LLG Trustee TN LLC, having been appointed Substitute or Successor Trustee, all of record in the Sequatchie County Register's Office. Default has occurred in the performance of the covenants, terms, and conditions of said Deed of Trust and the entire indebtedness has been declared due and payable. Party Entitled to Enforce the Debt: Wells Fargo Bank, National Association, not in its individual or banking capacity, but solely as Trustee on behalf of the Madison Avenue Manufactured Housing Contract Trust 2002-A, its successors and assigns. The real estate located in Sequatchie County, Tennessee, and described in the said Deed of Trust will be sold to the highest call bidder. The terms of the said Deed of Trust may be modified by other instruments appearing in the public record. Additional identifying information regarding the collateral property is below and is believed to be accurate, but no representation or warrant is intended. Street Address: 3199 Lewis Chapel Rd, Graysville, Tennessee 37338 Parcel Number: 045 002.30 Current Owner(s) of Property: The Heirs of Joyce Bushman This sale is subject to, without limitation, all matters shown on any applicable recorded plat; any unpaid taxes; any restrictive covenants, easements, or setback lines that may be applicable; any statutory right of redemption of any governmental agency, state or federal; any prior liens or encumbrances including those created by a fixture filing or any applicable homeowners' association dues or assessments; all claims or other matters, whether of record or not, which may encumber the purchaser's title and any matter that an accurate survey of the premises might disclose. The following parties may claim an interest in the above-referenced property to be affected by the foreclosure: any judgment creditor or lien holder with an interest subordinate to the said Deed of Trust or any party claiming by, though, or under any of the foregoing. Such parties known to the Substitute Trustee may include: All parties claiming by, though, or under Joyce Bushman. Terms of Sale will be public auction, for cash, free and clear of rights of homestead, redemption and dower to the extent disclaimed or inapplicable, and the rights of Franklin D. Bushman and Joyce Bushman, and those claiming through him/her/it/them. Any right of equity of redemption, statutory and otherwise, and homestead are waived in accord with the terms of said Deed of Trust, and the title is believed to be good, but the undersigned will sell and convey only as Substitute Trustee. The right is reserved to adjourn the day of the sale to another day, time, and place certain without further publication, upon announcement at the time and place for the sale set forth above. If you purchase a property at the foreclosure sale, the entire purchase price is due and payable at the conclusion of the auction in the form of a certified/bank check made payable to or endorsed to LOGS Legal Group LLP. No personal checks will be accepted. To this end, you must bring sufficient funds to outbid the lender and any other bidders. Insufficient funds will not be accepted. Amounts received in excess of the winning bid will be refunded to the successful purchaser at the time the foreclosure deed is delivered. This property is being sold with the express reservation that the sale is subject to confirmation by the lender or trustee. This sale may be rescinded only by the Substitute Trustee at any time. If the Substitute Trustee rescinds the sale, the purchaser shall only be entitled to a return of any money paid towards the purchase price and shall have no other recourse. Once the purchaser tenders the purchase price, the Substitute Trustee may deem the sale final in which case the purchaser shall have no remedy. The real property will be sold AS IS, WHERE IS, with no warranties or representations of any kind, express or implied, including without limitation, warranties regarding condition of the property or marketability of title. This office may be a debt collector. This may be an attempt to collect a debt and any information obtained may be used for that purpose.LLG Trustee TN LLCSubstitute Trustee10130 Perimeter Parkway, Suite 400Charlotte, NC 28216Phone (704) 333-8107Fax (704) 333-8156File No. 20-120712T29-31

Public NoticeTennessee Department of Environment and ConservationDivision of WaterResourcesNotice Requesting Public Comments on DraftPermit ActionsFile # NRS24.067 The purpose of this notice is to advise the public of the following proposed permit action and solicit comments and information necessary to evaluate the potential impact of the proposed activities on the aquatic environment. Pursuant to The Tennessee Water Quality Control Act of 1977, T.C.A. SS69-3-108 and Tennessee Rules, Chapter 0400-40-07, the proposed activity described below has been submitted for approval under an Aquatic Resource Alteration Permit and Section 401 Water Quality Certification. Section 401 of the Clean Water Act requires that an applicant obtain a water quality certification from the state when a federal permit is required. This notice is intended to inform interested parties of this permit application and draft permit and rationale, and to ask for comments and information necessary to determine possible impacts to water quality. At the conclusion of the public notice period a final determination will be made whether to issue or deny the permit. APPLICANTKristen Cecala735 University AvenueSewanee, Tennessee 37383302-354-2296 PROJECT DESCRIPTION / PURPOSEThe applicant proposes to divert up to 10% of the stream flow in four streams for one year. The flow is to be returned 50 meters downstream. The purpose of the work is for biological research. LOCATIONThe project is in an unnamed tributary to Little Fiery Gizzard Creek, ab unnamed tributary to Cave Cove Branch, an unnamed tributary to Pennykin Branch, and Qualls Spring Branch in Grundy and Morgan counties: Site 1 Latitude 35.226259 Longitude -85.772713Site 2 Latitude 35.252057Longitude -85.748681Site 3 Latitude 36.066173 Longitude -84.716592Site 4 Latitude 35.226259 Longitude -85.772713 To view the proposed location of these impacts and the watershed condition, visit the Division's map viewer at http://tdeconline. tn.gov/dwr/ and search on the permit number or coordinates listed in this Public Notice. PERMIT WRITER Robert D. BakerTennessee Department of Environment &ConservationDivision of WaterResources, NaturalResources UnitDavy Crockett Tower500 James Robertson Pkwy, 9th FloorNashville, Tennessee 37243615-532-0710robert.d.baker@tn.gov ANTIDEGRADATIONThe affected waters have available parameters for water withdrawal. The unnamed tributary to Little Fiery Gizzard Creek is an Exceptional Tennessee Water. As described in the accompanying permit rationale, the Department has made a preliminary determination that the proposed activity will result in de minimis degradation. FACTORS CONSIDEREDIn deciding whether to issue or deny this permit, the Division will consider all comments of record and the requirements of applicable federal and state laws. The division will consider the nature, scale and effects of proposed impacts. The Division will consider practicable alternatives to the alteration, loss of waters or habitat, diminishment in biological diversity, cumulative or secondary impacts to the water resource, and adverse impacts to unique, high quality, or impaired waters. In making this decision, a final determination will be made evaluating appreciable permanent loss of resource values and proposed compensatory mitigation to ensure the project will not result in no overall net loss of state water resources values. HOW TO COMMENTTDEC is requesting public comment on this proposed permit action. Obtaining a broad range of facts and opinions on Agency actions is one of the best ways to ensure appropriate decisions. Persons wishing to comment on the proposal are invited to submit written comments to the Division. Written comments must be received within thirty days following distribution of the approved public notice materials (including signage and newspaper ad). Comments will become part of the record and will be considered in the final decision. The applicant's name and permit number should be referenced. Send all written comments to the Division's address listed below to the attention of the permit coordinator. You may also comment via email to water.permits@tn.gov. PUBLIC HEARINGInterested persons may request in writing that the Division hold a public hearing on this application. The request must be received by the Division within the comment period, indicate the interest of the party requesting it, the reason(s) a hearing is warranted, and the water quality issues being raised. When there is sufficient public interest in water quality issues, the Division will hold a public hearing in accordance with 0400-40-07-.04(4) (f). Send all public hearing requests to the attention of the permit coordinator at the address listed below or via email to water.permits@tn.gov. Any scheduled public hearings will be advertised through a similar public notice process. After the Division makes a final permit determination, a permit appeal may be filed by the applicant or by any person who participated in the public comment period whose appeal is based on comments given to the Division in writing during the public comment period or in testimony at a formal public hearing. If it is hard for you to read, speak, or understand English, TDEC may be able to provide translation or interpretation services free of charge. Please contact Alisha Looper at 615-571-4470 or alisha.looper@tn.gov. Si le resulta dificil leer, hablar o comprender ingles, TDEC puede proporcionarle servicios de traduccion o interpretacion sin cargo comunicandose con Alisha Looper al 615-571-4470 o alisha. looper@tn.gov. FILE REVIEWThe permit application, supporting documentation, including detailed plans and maps, draft permit and rationale, and related comments are available for review on the internet at the Division's data viewer at Report on Permits (tn.gov) by entering the permit file number listed in the title of this Public Notice. The file may be viewed and copied at the address listed below.Tennessee Department of Environment &ConservationDivision of WaterResourcesNatural Resources UnitDavy Crockett Tower, 9th Floor500 James Robertson ParkwayNashville, Tennessee 37243

BID NOTICE The Sequatchie County Board of Education is accepting sealed bids for Construction and In- stallation of 95 Solid Wooden Lockers for the football field house. Each locker will measure ap- proximately 24 inches wide x 24 inches deep x 7 feet tall. Each locker will have a lock box for small personal belongings located on an upper shelf. A sitting bench will include an open-air cubby for shoes under the bench and hooks to hang cloth- ing. All lockers will be stained and/or have a du- rable poly finish. All sealed bids are to be turned in and clearly marked "Football Locker Bids" to the Sequatchie County Board of Education at PO Box 488 / 878 Cordell Drive, Dunlap, TN 37327. Bids will be ac- cepted until 12:00 noon CT, July 26, 2024. Late bids will not be accepted. Bids will be opened on July 29 at noon. For more information, contact the Board of Education at (423) 949-3617. Bid specs are available at Sequatchie County School Board. The Board reserves the right to accept or reject any or all bids. Sarai Pierce, Director of Schools T29-30

CITY OF MADISONVILLEINVITATION?TO?BID The City of Madisonville Streets Department is accepting bids for the following paving projects: 1) 1.5 Overlay from intersection of Magill Street on Church Street to Monroe Street 2) 1.5 Mill and overlay from intersection of Warren Street on Magill Street to Main Street 3) Niles Ferry Road from Raper Road to Hill Street with the following alternates: a) Complete Overlay b) Spot patching as painted out on the roadsBid Specifications for Asphalt Overlay Contractor responsibilities: Clip edges of street of grass and sweep and blow clean. Mill tie in joints at beginning and end of project Install total square footage of asphalt surface paving at 1.5 deep using E surface mix unless otherwise specified. All street/road measurements must be confirmed prior to bid. Must furnish its own traffic control. If sewer manholes or utility valves are present, the contractor is required to furnish all materials and labor to adjust to proper height. All work is to be performed by an insured, licensed contractor which should be provided with the bid. Sealed bids need to be sent or delivered to City of Madisonville - Attn: Ashley Russell, 400 College St N, Madisonville, TN 37354. Bids will be opened on Thursday, August 1, 2024 at 2:00 PM. For questions regarding these projects, please contact Tracey Green at (423)442-9416.

text: NOTICE FROM THE HENRY COUNTY ELECTION COMMISSION 215 Grove Blvd. Suite B Paris, TN 38242 731-642-0411 Monday-Friday 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. Notice is hereby given that the Federal/State General/Municipal Elections are hereby called for in Henry County, TN for Tuesday, November 5, 2024 at all vote centers to elect the following: FEDERAL/STATE GENERAL/MUNICIPAL ELECTIONS President US Senate * US House of Representatives District 8 State Senate District 24 * State House of Representatives Districts 74 & 76 City of Cottage Grove - Mayor City of Cottage Grove -- Alderman (4 Positions) City of Henry -- Mayor City of Henry -- Alderman (2 Positions) City of Paris - Commissioner (2 Positions) City of Puryear -- Mayor City of Puryear -- Alderman (2 Positions) City of Puryear -- Recorder The deadline to qualify for all offices listed for the Federal/State General/Municipal Elections will be Thursday, August 15, 2024 at 12:00 noon. The last day to register to vote is Monday, October 7, 2024. Early voting begins on October 16, 2024 and ends on October 31, 2024. VOTER ID LAW Federal or state government issued photo ID is required to vote. To learn more about this law and its exceptions, please call the Henry County Election Commission at 731-642-0411 or visit GoVoteTN.com Pursuant to TCA 2-3-109, notice is hereby given that the elderly voters or voters with disabilities assigned to vote in precincts where the polling place is inaccessible, may vote early at the Election Commission Office during the early voting dates or by an absentee ballot by mail. Any elderly voter or voter with a disability desiring to vote at the Election Commission Office on Tuesday, November 5, 2024, must notify the Election Commission Office in writing by October 26, 2024. HENRY COUNTY ELECTION COMMISSION Steve Goggans, Chairman Sylvia Humphreys, Secretary Jim Poe,Member ArtSmith,Member Bennie Akers, Member DeLaina Green, Administrator of Elections

REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS The City of South Pittsburg, Tennessee is requesting proposals from licensed, non- profit, public benefit dental and/or medical service providers for the potential use, lease, and occupancy of an existing dental office facility owned by the City and lo- cated at the old South Pittsburg National Guard Armory building off 10 th Street in South Pittsburg. The facility consists of ap- proximately 1,400 square feet of useable space and is currently built to accommo- date a dental health practice. Proponents must be capable of providing free or low- cost dental and/or medical and/or vision health services to eligible patients in the City of South Pittsburg and surrounding areas. Proponents should be aware that the City is currently considering plans to construct a new facility adjacent to the ex- isting facility that could include up to 2,500 square feet of space built out to accommo- date such low- cost or free services to eli- gible patients, with such new facility space currently designed to accommodate a den- tal health practice. Specifications for or de- scriptions of such plans under consideration may be obtained from South Pittsburg City Hall, 204 West Third Street, South Pittsburg, Tennessee 37380, telephone # 423-837-5012, during regular business hours. All proposals must be submitted to the at- tention of South Pittsburg Mayor Saman- tha Rector in a sealed envelope at City Hall no later than August 1st , 2024, at 12:00 A.M. /P.M. Central time. Proposals will be opened on August 1st, 2024, at 2:00 A.M. /P.M. in the City Hall. Please in- clude on the outside of all submission en- velopes the proposer's name, address, telephone number, and any relevant li- censing information. The City may use any or all proposals received for the purpose of determining and/or soliciting funding re- quirements for the Project. The City re- serves the right to accept or reject any and/or all proposals. The City of South Pittsburg, Tennessee Samantha Rector, Mayor

Invitation to BidThe Jefferson County (JC) Purchasing Department will be accepting sealed bids for "Class III Solid Waste Disposal Services" for the JC Sanitation & Landfill. Will need to be capable of disposing approximately 450 tons of Class III waste per month for approximately six (6) months to one (1) year. A 50-mile round trip from 650 Grove Road, Dandridge, TN 37725 is desirable. Sealed bids should be labeled "Class III Solid Waste Disposal Services" and either mailed to the Jefferson County Finance Department to the attention of Purchasing Agent Julie Anglea, at P.O. Box 1749, Dandridge, TN 37725, or dropped off at 1244 Gay St., Dandridge, TN 37725. Sealed bids will be accepted until 2:00 p.m. Wednesday, July 31, 2024 at which time bids will be opened in the Finance Department conference room. For specifications, bid documents, and further information please go to jeffersoncountytn.gov/finance-department or contact David Gaut Director of JC Sanitation and Solid Waste at (865) 397-3544 or dgaut@jeffersoncountytn.gov. Jefferson County reserves the right to accept or reject any and all bids and to waive all irregularities in the receipt/handling of bids. The awarded bidder must be in good standing with the County of Jefferson.*7:18, 7:25

NOTICE OF SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEES SALE WHEREAS, default has occurred in the performance of the covenants, terms and conditions of a Deed of Trust dated June 10, 2020, executed by AMBER NICOLE ROBERTS and CHRISTIAN MATTHEW THOMPSON conveying certain real property therein described to TONY GREGORY, as Trustee, as same appears of record in the Register`s Office of Hardeman County, Tennessee recorded June 11, 2020, in Deed Book 775, Page 130; and WHEREAS, the beneficial interest of said Deed of Trust was last transferred and assigned to PennyMac Loan Services, LLC who is now the owner of said debt; and WHEREAS, the undersigned,Rubin Lublin TN, PLLC, having been appointed as Substitute Trustee by instrument to be filed for record in the Registers Office of Hardeman County, Tennessee. NOW, THEREFORE, notice is hereby given that the entire indebtedness has been declared due and payable, and that the undersigned, Rubin Lublin TN, PLLC, as Substitute Trustee or his duly appointed agent, by virtue of the power, duty and authority vested and imposed upon said Substitute Trustee will, on August 15, 2024 at 2:00 PM at the West Door of the Hardeman County Courthouse, 100 North Main Street, Bolivar, TN 38008, proceed to sell at public outcry to the highest and best bidder for cash or certified funds ONLY, the following described property situated in Hardeman County, Tennessee, to wit: BEGINNING AT A POINT IN THE SOUTH LINE OF BUSTER KING ROAD, SAID POINT BEING SOUTH 87 DEGREES 35 MINUTES WEST 209 FEET FROM VIRGIL HOWELL NORTHEAST CORNER, THENCE (1) ALONG BUSTER KING ROAD, SOUTH 87 DEGREES 35 MINUTES WEST, A DISTANCE OF 330 FEET; THENCE (2) SOUTH 02 DEGREES 25 MINUTES EAST, A DISTANCE OF 800 FEET, THENCE (3) NORTH 87 DEGREES 35 MINUTES EAST, A DISTANCE OF 330 FEET; THENCE (4) NORTH 02 DEGREES 25 MINUTES WEST, A DISTANCE OF 800 FEET TO THE POINT OF BEGINNING, CONTAINING 6.06 ACRES. Parcel ID: 156 017.01 PROPERTY ADDRESS: The street address of the property is believed to be 2070 BUSTER RD, MIDDLETON, TN 38052. In the event of any discrepancy between this street address and the legal description of the property, the legal description shall control. CURRENT OWNER(S): AMBER NICOLE ROBERTS, CHRISTIAN MATTHEW THOMPSON OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES: The sale of the above-described property shall be subject to all matters shown on any recorded plat; any unpaid taxes; any restrictive covenants, easements or set-back lines that may be applicable; any prior liens or encumbrances as well as any priority created by a fixture filing; and to any matter that an accurate survey of the premises might disclose. This property is being sold with the express reservation that it is subject to confirmation by the lender or Substitute Trustee. This sale may be rescinded at any time. The right is reserved to adjourn the day of the sale to another day, time, and place certain without further publication, upon announcement at the time and place for the sale set forth above. All right and equity of redemption, statutory or otherwise, homestead, and dower are expressly waived in said Deed of Trust, and the title is believed to be good, but the undersigned will sell and convey only as Substitute Trustee. The Property is sold as is, where is, without representations or warranties of any kind, including fitness for a particular use or purpose. THIS LAW FIRM IS ATTEMPTING TO COLLECT A DEBT. ANY INFORMATION OBTAINED WILL BE USED FOR THAT PURPOSE. Rubin Lublin TN, PLLC, Substitute Trustee 3145 Avalon Ridge Place, Suite 100 Peachtree Corners, GA 30071 rlselaw.com/property-listing Tel: (877) 813-0992Fax: (470) 508-9401#235103

ADVERTISEMENT FOR BID McNairy County, Tennessee (Owner) Sealed bids for alternate flooring will be received by McNairy County at the McNairy County Courthouse, Mayor's Office, 2nd Floor, 170 West Court Avenue, Selmer, TN 38375 until 10:00 A.M., C.ST., Thursday, August 1, 2024, and then at said office publicly opened and read aloud. Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope, bearing on the outside the name and address of the Bidder and the words "McNairy County LPRF Alternate Flooring': If forwarded by mail, the sealed envelope must be enclosed in another envelope addressed to: Mayor Larry Smith McNairy County 170 West Court Avenue Selmer, TN 38375 The Bid Package must be requested by contacting Casey Smith at Southwest Tennessee Development District by emailing your request to csmith@swtdd.org. Bid Packages will be issued by electronic mail in PDF format. Questions concerning the bid package may be submitted electronically to csmith@swtdd.org . Questions will not be accepted after 12:00 p.m. CST Monday, July 29, 2024. The Owner reserves the right to waive any informality or to reject any or all bids. No Bidder may withdraw his/her bid within 60 days after the actual date of the opening thereof. Bid will be awarded on a unit price/lowest most responsive Bidder. McNairy County is an equal opportunity employer. Mayor Larry Smitih Published July 18, 2024

NOTICE OF SALE OF REAL PROPERTYIN THE MATTER OF:ESTATE OF ROBERT BRUCE CAMPERDOCKET NO. 25304In obedience to an "ORDER" in the Chancery Court of Paris, Henry County, Tennessee, entered on April 18, 2024, in the above styled case, Docket Number 25304, I, Albert Wade, Jr., Special Commissioner, will on August 2, 2024 at 10:01 A.M., in the Henry County Chancery Courtroom, Room 105, 101 West Washington Street, Paris, Tennessee, offer for sale to the highest and best bidder the property belonging to the decedent in this cause and more specifically described as follows:One tract of land lying and being in the Sixth (6th) Civil District of Henry County, Tennessee, in the city of Paris. Identified on the 2023 Tax Roll in the office of Property Assessor of Henry County, Tennessee, as Tax Map 52, Parcel 16.01. Of record in Record Book 132, Pages 53-55, in the office of Register of Deeds of Henry County, Tennessee. Legal DescriptionBeginning at a fence post in the west right-of-way of the Como-Puryear county surfaced road, in the north boundary line of F. F. Gallion; thence with Gallion's north line N. 88 deg. 00 min. west 389.5 feet to an angle iron in the east boundary line of Ernest Camper; thence with the east line of Camper, N. 4 deg. 40 min. West 296.3 feet to a steel pipe in the south margin of the Arch L. Ford county gravel road, N. 88 deg. 15 min. East 402.5 feet to an iron nail at the intersection of the south boundary line of the said Arch L. Ford road with the western margin of the said Como-Puryear road, S. 2 deg. 0 min. E. 321.5 feet to the point of beginning, containing 2.80 acres, more or less, according to survey of H. Gordon Higgs, Registered Land surveyor No. 97.This being the same property conveyed to Robert B. Camper by warranty deed of Fred Camper and wife, Rita Camper dated December 29, 2003, of record in Record Book 132, Pages 53-55, ROHCT.There is permanently situated on this tract a 1974 Richardson mobile home, manufacturer's identification number 2444R3LD DE 1733 A, as is described in Title number 18492342This property consists of approximately 2.8 /- acres of improved real property. The property address is 2645 Foundry Hill Road Puryear, TN 38251; sale signs will be posted.TERMS OF SALE FOR REAL PROPERTY: The above real property will be sold for cash with ten percent (10%) of the sale price deposited with Chancery Court on the day of the sale and the balance due upon confirmation of the Court. The sale will be held open for ten (10) days (until August 12, 2024, at 12:00 Noon) during which time a person may come into the office of the Clerk and Master at the Henry County Courthouse and raise the highest bid received at the auction by ten percent (10%) and will be required to deposit ten percent (10%) of the raised bid price with the Court. Upon the bid being raised, a second and final auction will be held at the Henry County Courthouse, Chancery Courtroom, Room 105, 101 West Washington Street, Paris, Henry County, Tennessee, on August 13, 2024, at 1:00 P.M. The highest bidder at the second and final auction will be the buyer. Should the bid NOT be raised the high bidder from the first sale will be the successful buyer. Possession of the real property will be upon delivery of the deed. Property taxes for the year 2024 will be assessed to the buyer.This property is offered and sold as is, in the present condition, with no warranties or representations, express or implied, not noted herein. While Chancery sales are conclusive upon all parties to the action and generally confer a good title, nevertheless there is no warranty of title. The sale is subject to the confirmation of the Court.Albert Wade, Jr.Clerk and MasterSpecial Commissioner101 W. text: NOTICE OF RATE INCREASES Regarding Garbage Collection Dear Town of Selmer Utility Customer, This letter serves as notice to inform you of the upcoming utility rate increases for garbage collection services that will appear on your August 2024 billing cycle. Within the last two years the expense of collecting garbage within McNairy County has been on the rise. The Town of Selmer has tried hard to keep from passing these increased expenses onto the residents; however, we have now reached a point where we have no other choice. Effective July 1, 2024, the following increases will be implemented. The rates for residential garbage collection: 1. Within the Town of Selmer limits will increase to $20.00 2. Outside the Town of Selmer limits will increase to $23.00 The rates for commercial garbage collection (dumpster and other methods) within and outside the Town of Selmer limits will increase 30%. Thank you for being a valued utility customer! Town of Selmer Sanitation Department

text: WINCHESTER UTILITIES WINCHESTER, TENNESSEE INVITATION TO BID FOR CONSTRUCTION OF BIBLE CROSSING FORCE MAIN CONTRACT A AND B Sealed Proposals for the construction of the Bible Crossing Force Main Contract A and B project are invited and will be received at the office of the Winchester Utilities, 219 Second Avenue NW, Winchester, Tennessee 37398, Attention: Mr. Jason Allman, Wastewater Supervisor on or before 2:00 P.M. local time on Tuesday, August 8, 2024 and immediately thereafter all bids will be publicly opened and read aloud. The project will include the following described construction: The furnishing, installing, and testing of approximately 21,000 linear feet of 16" C-900 PVC Force Main and 700 linear feet of 16" Force Main by directional and jack bore methods. Testing, bypass wastewater pumping, unclassified excavation, backfill, tie-ins, working in close proximity with other utilities and structures, restoration, asphalt pavement repair and maintenance, and all other appurtenances and other work as shown on the Construction Drawings or indicated in the Contract Specifications. Official (numbered) Bid Documents may be obtained at the office of Water Management Services, LLC, 2 International Plaza, Suite 401, Nashville, Tennessee 37217 (telephone: 615- 366-6088). A nonrefundable fee of $150.00 must be made for each set obtained. This project is being funded by Local Fiscal Recovery Funds and all bidders shall review and comply within the program requirements. Subject to the provisions of Chapter 6 of Title 62 of the Tennessee Codes Annotated, the Contractor's attention is directed to the Tennessee Codes Annotated Section 62-6-119 which states that it will be necessary for each bidder to show evidence ofa license before his bid will be considered and that the license number, expiration date, and that part of the classification applying to the bid appear on the envelope containing the bid; otherwise the bid shall not be opened. Winchester Utilities reserves the right to reject any Proposal for failure to comply with all requirements of the notice or of any of the Contract Documents; however, it may waive any minor defects or informalities at its discretion. Winchester Utilities further reserves the right to reject all Proposals. Dated at Winchester, Tennessee this 10th day of July, 2024.
