text: ELECTION NOTICE STATE AND FEDERAL GENERAL ELECTION TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 5, 2024 Notice: Pursuant to T.C.A. Section 2-12-111 (A) notice is hereby given that on Tuesday, November 5, 2024, the State and Federal General Election will be opened and held in all voting precincts in Franklin County. Offices for State and Federal General Elections: President of the United States United States House of Representatives, 4th Congressional District Tennessee Senate, 16th District Tennessee House of Representatives, 39th Representative District Offices for Monteagle Municipal Election: Mayor & 4 Aldermen Further information may be obtained from the Franklin County Election Commission Office. The deadline to register to vote in this election is Monday, October 7, 2024. Registrations by mail must be postmarked no later than Monday, October 7, 2024. If you register to vote by mail, state law requires that you vote in person the first time. The Franklin County Election Commission is located at 839 Dinah Shore Blvd., Suite 1, Winchester, TN 37398. Office hours are 8:00 to 12:00 noon and 1:00 to 4:30, Monday through Friday. Phone number 967-1893. Federal or Tennessee State issued photo ID is required to vote, unless an exception applies. College student IDs will not be accepted. To learn more about the law and its exceptions, please call 931-967-1893 or visit GoVoteTN.com. Franklin County Election Commission Daniel J. Sidley, Chairman Patty Priest, Secretary Andy Groves, Member Lisa D. Mason, Member Joy Spencer, Member Margaret Ottley, Administrator of Elections

WINCHESTER UTILITIES WINCHESTER, TENNESSEE INVITATION TO BID FOR CONSTRUCTION OF MOUNTAIN VIEW PUMP STATION MODIFICATIONS Separate sealed proposals for the Mountain View Pump Station Modifications are invited and will be received at the office of the Winchester Utilities, 219 Second Avenue NW, Winchester, Tennessee 37398, Attention: Mr. Jason Allman, Wastewater Supervisor on or before 1:30 P.M. local time on Tuesday August 8, 2024 and immediately thereafter all bids will be publicly opened and read aloud. The project will include the following described construction: Furnishing and installation for the rehabilitation of Winchester Utilities Riverview Wastewater Pumping station, including bypass pumping, the removal of designated equipment and appurtenances, an additive alternative that includes the preparation and painting of walls, floor, and structural steel beams, and all other work as shown on the contract drawings while limiting interruptions to the current pumping facilities. Official (numbered) Bid Documents may be obtained at the office of Water Management Services, LLC, 2 International Plaza, Suite 401, Nashville, Tennessee 37217 (telephone: 615-366-6088). A nonrefundable fee of $100.00 must be made for each set obtained. This project is being funded by Local Fiscal Recovery Funds and all bidders shall review and comply within the program requirements. Subject to the provisions of Chapter 6 of Title 62 of the Tennessee Codes Annotated, the Contractor's attention is directed to the Tennessee Codes Annotated Section 62-6- 119 which states that it will be necessary for each bidder to show evidence of a license before his bid will be considered and that the license number, expiration date, and that part of the classification applying to the bid appear on the envelope containing the bid; otherwise the bid shall not be opened. Winchester Utilities reserves the right to reject any Proposal for failure to comply with all requirements of the notice or of any of the Contract Documents; however, it may waive any minor defects or informalities at its discretion. Winchester Utilities further reserves the right to reject all Proposals. Dated at Winchester, Tennessee this 10th day of July, 2024.

NOTICE OF PUB- LIC HEARING Notice is hereby given that the City of Malvern, Arkan- sas will hold a public hearing on Monday, July 22, 2024, at 6:00 PM in the Malvern City Council Room loc- ated inside the Malvern Police De- partment located at 110 E. Main St. The purpose of this hearing is to dis- cuss: 1. The City's ap- plication for an Outdoor Recre- ation Matching Grant (50/50 up to $500,000) from the Arkansas Depart- ment of Parks, Her- itage and Tourism. 2. The proposed development of re- creational facilities in Malvern; Splash Pad. 3. Resolution No. 20-2024, which au- thorizes the mayor to apply for the grant and outlines the City's commit- ments. All Malvern cit- izens are encour- aged to attend this hearing to learn about the grant process, ask ques- tions about the proposed project, and provide feed- back on the plans for recreational fa- cility improve- ments. Comments and questions from the public are wel- comed and will be considered before any final decisions are made. Copies of Resolu- tion No. 20-2024 and related docu- ments are on file at the City Treasures office for review by interested citizens prior to the public hearing. The City Parks Committee and City Council wel- come public input on this important community devel- opment initiative. For questions or more information, please contact Mayor Weldon at 501-332-3638 or mayor@malvernar. SOV Paid by the City of Malvern Finance Department in the amount of $133.25. #176934 7/13

Request tor Statement of Quailitic- ations for Title Services The city of Paragould is request- ing Statements of Qualifications on behalf of the Land Bank Com- mission from qualified firms that have the capacity and proven ex- perience to provide title search, report and closing services for residential properties in the city's newly established overlay dis- tricts. The Land Bank Commission for the city of Paragould was estab- lished in 2023 and has, within the last few months, began to ac- quire properties in the Northend Overlay District. With significant interest from the general public to acquire such properties, the Com- mission requires title search, re- port services, and title insurance policies to fulfill mandated legal requirements for the sale of these properties. Proposals will be evaluated based on the firm's proximity to the project, familiarity with the city, qualifications of proposed team members, and prior closing experience. The city will make its selection based on the informa- tion provided and background/ref- erence checks made by the city. The qualification statement should include: 1. A cover letter 2. General firm qualifications 3. Similar closing experience Statements of qualifications Should not exceed 10 pages. All responses should be submit- ted to the Mayor's office by Au- gust 2, 2024. Please submit (1) paper and (1) electronic copy of the proposal. Proposals must be submitted in a sealed envelope with the proposal title and closing date clearly identified. Late pro- posals will not be accepted. Mayor J osh Agee 301 West Court Street Paragould, AR 72450 All costs associated with the pre- paration of the statement in re- sponse to the RFQ will be the re- sponsibility of the preparer and will not be reimbursed. The city of Paragould reserves the right to reject any and all pro- posals and to waive irregularities in proposals received in re- sponse to the RFQ. Filing of a proposal with the city in response to this invitation shall constitute an agreement of the proposer to these conditions. This ad paid for by the City of Paragould, General Fund in the amount of $295.20.

SUBSTITUTE TRUSTEE'S NOTICE OF FORECLOSURE SALE WHEREAS, Gary E. Seals, executed to B. Timothy Williams, Trustee, for Farm Credit Mid-America, PCA, an Open-End Deed of Trust dated June 13, 2018, and recorded in Book RB 323, page 88, in the Bledsoe County, Tennessee Register of Deeds Office (the "Deed of Trust"), to secure the payment of indebtedness described therein; WHEREAS, by instrument dated July 2, 2024 and recorded in Book RB 390, page 211 in the Bledsoe County, Tennessee Register of Deeds Office, Kennerly, Montgomery and Finley, P.C., was appointed Substitute Trustee under the Deed of Trust, with all the rights, powers, privileges and immunities of the original Trustee named in said Deed of Trust; WHEREAS, default has been made in the payment of the indebtedness secured by said Deed of Trust, and Farm Credit Mid-America, PCA (the "Creditor"), the present holder and owner of the debt secured, has requested the undersigned to advertise and sell at a foreclosure sale the property described below, all of said indebtedness and obligations having matured by default in the payment of a part thereof, at the option of the holder thereof. NOW, THEREFORE, by virtue of the power and authority vested in Kennerly, Montgomery and Finley, P.C., as such Substitute Trustee, under the Deed of Trust, at the request of the Creditor, the undersigned, Kennerly, Montgomery and Finley, P.C., or its agent, will on Thursday, August 8, 2024 commencing at 11:00 a.m. at the Front Door of the Bledsoe County Courthouse in Pikeville, Tennessee, proceed to sell at public outcry to the highest and best bidder for cash, the property located in Bledsoe County, Tennessee, that is a portion of the property that is the subject of the Deed of Trust, and that is more particularly described below (other tracts of property are described in the Deed of Trust but not included in this sale). Situated in the Third (3rd) Civil District of Bledsoe County, Tennessee, bounded and described as follows, to-wit: BEGINNING at a hickory tree with a large hacked X, said hickory tree is the southeast corner of Ferrell and the northeast corner of Seals (68/63), and the northwestern corner to which this is a part; thence leaving said point, N 34-22-21E, 142.81 feet to a point; thence N 20-51-45E, 306.57 feet to a fence corner of Ferrell: thence with Ferrell (286/284), S 73-36-49E, 789.38 feet to a large oak tree marked with an X; thence N 54-50-54E, 292.97 feet to a large oak tree marked with an X; thence S 48-58-10E, 422.84 feet to a fence corner; thence N38-54-46E, 130.38 feet passing rebar at 121.50 feet to the south western margin of an easement; thence with said easement in part and Neergaard Lane. S 51-19-42E, 24.72 feet; thence S 48-45-36E, 41.77 feet; thence S 40-54-39E, 222.70 feet: thence S 38-57-59E, 366.02 feet; thence S 42-41-38E, 159.16 feet; thence S 41-13-44E, 154.46 feet; thence S 39-45-49E, 275.21 feet to a point: thence S 40-21-17W, 8.13 feet to an iron rod; thence S 40-21-17W, 252.87 feet to an iron rod; thence S 40-51-59W, 161.08 feet to an iron rod; thence S 47-51-43W, 150.39 feet to an iron rod; thence S 60-13-50W, 178.73 feet to an iron rod; thence S 15-40-10W, 471.81 feet to an iron rod; thence S 08-32-22W, 116.36 feet to an iron rod in the line of the aforementioned Seals: thence N 40-05-27W, 786.03 feet to an iron rod; thence S 41-16-13W, 125.14 feet to an iron rod; thence S 26-22-07W, 322.49 feet to an iron rod; thence S 76-05-29W, 418.91 feet to an iron rod; thence N 20-39-47W, 357.39 feet to a fence corner; thence N 17-52-23W, 1464.71 feet to the point of BEGINNING containing 74.63 acres. as per survey of Dion Ault RLS #2678 dated 08/11/10, description written May 21, 2015. ALSO CONVEYED HEREIN is the following described easement being sixteen feet in width and described as follows: Beginning at the intersection of eastern margin of Neergaard Lane and the center line intersection of the drive leading to the home of Neergaard, said intersection is the apparent ending of the county maintained. Neergaard Lane and also shown by an unrecorded plat beginning at line sixteen (L16); thence with said northeastern margin of a gravel lane/easement the following calls: N 42-17-12W, 158.80 feet; thence N 38-33-32W, 365.66 feet: thence N 40-30-12W, 224.00 feet; thence N 48-21-11W, 43.21 feet; thence N 50-55-17W, 62.60 feet. Said described line is the northeastern sideline of a sixteen foot easement to serve the above described tract. This easement is intended to start at the county roads' ending and continue running with said gravel lane to give the property accessibility. There is specifically less and excepted from the above-described property those portions conveyed in the following deeds: 1. That property conveyed in the Warranty Deed from Gary E. Seals, a single man, to James L. Weber and Jacquelyn M. Weber, husband and wife, dated April 11, 2022 and recorded in Book RB 366, page 664, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office. 2. That property conveyed in the Warranty Deed from Gary E. Seals to Garrett J. Grolemund and wife, Kristin Grolemund, dated May 19, 2022 and recorded in Book RB 368, page 399, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office. 3. That property conveyed in the Warranty Deed from Gary E. Seals and Lorene Seals, widow of Bill Edd Seals, deceased, as of June 1, 1992, to Belinda D. Foy, dated May 26, 2022 and recorded in Book RB 369, page 73, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office. 4. That property conveyed in the Warranty Deed from Gary E. Seals to Richard L. Rios, II, and Heather M. Rios, dated June 16, 2022 and recorded in Book RB 369, page 197, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office. 5. Conveyance of a non-exclusive right of ingress, egress, utilities and maintenance across a 25 foot easement from the end of Neergaard Lane as granted to James Bradley and wife, Makalah Bradley in that Warranty Deed dated May 26, 2022 and recorded in Book RB 368, page 754, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office. Being a part of that property conveyed to Gary E. Seals by Warranty Deed from Edward Slone, Trustee of The Edward Slone Living Trust, dated April 20, 2016 and recorded in Book RB 302, page 492, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office. Tax Parcel I.D.: Believed to be CLT# 121-014.00 and a portion of CLT# 121-014.05 and a portion of CLT# 121-015.00 Common Description/Property Address: Believed to be the Gary E. Seals Property, 0 Neergaard Lane, TN 37327. (However, the legal description shall control in the event of any inconsistencies between the legal description and address or tax parcel identification number.) Other parties interested: Citizens Tri-County Bank; L. Thomas Austin, Trustee; Paul Allen England, Successor Trustee; Lorene Seals; Michele Sanborn and Chris Sanborn The sale of the property will be on an "as is-where is" basis subject to all defects in the title to the property, if any, and all defects in the condition of the property, if any. The sale will be subject to any encumbrances having lien priority over the Deed of Trust, including, without limitation, any unpaid ad valorem taxes or other taxes. The undersigned is aware of no lien claims of the State of Tennessee required to be identified by T.C.A. SS 35-5-104. The undersigned is aware of no lien claims of the United States required to be identified by T.C.A. SS 35-5-104. Without limitation, the sale will also be subject to the following matters as applicable and as the same may affect the property: (1) Rollback taxes as may be assessed against the subject property by virtue of that Application for Greenbelt Assessment-Agricultural made by Gary E. Seals and recorded in Book RB 303, page 191, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office; (2) Rights of others in and to the use of a 16 foot wide easement extending from the terminus of Neergaard Lane (public) and running to surrounding properties. This right of way was previously described in that Deed of record in Deed Book 51, page 357, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office; (3) Rights of others in and to the use of a non-exclusive 25 foot wide easement for ingress, egress, utilities and maintenance as described in that Warranty Deed to James Bradley and wife, Makalah Bradley dated May 26, 2022 and recorded in Book RB 368, page 754, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office; (4) The Bledsoe County Property Assessor's Tax Map identifies the subject property as Tax Parcel 014.00 on Tax Map 121. This tax parcel as shown on the Bledsoe County Property Assessor's Map does not conform along its western boundary with the subject property as described in the deed to Gary E. Seals in Book RB 302, page 492, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office, less the current out conveyances. Further, it appears that a portion of the subject property may overlap with the boundary of Tax Map 121, Parcel 014.05 and with the boundary of the 141 acre parcel conveyed to Citizens Tri-County Bank by Successor's Trustees Deed from Paul Allen England, Successor Trustee, dated November 29, 2023 and recorded in Book RB 384, page 434, in the Bledsoe County Register of Deeds Office (Reference Tax Map 121, Parcel 015.00); (5) any rights or claims of tenants, licensees, or parties in possession, if any, under any unrecorded leases, easements, licenses, or agreements; (6) any matters that would be disclosed by a current and accurate survey or inspection of the property including issues regarding the boundaries of the property, encroachments, and overlaps, if any, and the exact amount of acreage of the property; (7) any lien, or right to a lien, for services, labor or material furnished, imposed by law and not shown by the public records; (8) subject to the rights of the public in and to any portion of the subject property lying within the bounds of any public road or right of way; (9) any lien arising pursuant to the Hazardous Waste Management Act of 1983 and any amendments thereto; and (10) any law, ordinance or governmental regulation restricting or regulating or prohibiting the occupancy, use or enjoyment of the property or regulating the character, dimensions, or location of any improvement now or hereafter erected on the property, or prohibiting a separation in ownership or a reduction in the dimensions or area of the property, or the effect of any violation of any such law, ordinance or governmental regulation. The undersigned will sell and convey only such title as it holds as Substitute Trustee. The proceeds of the sale will be applied in accordance with the terms of the Deed of Trust and applicable law. The sale will be subject to all matters, if any, having lien priority over the Deed of Trust being foreclosed. The undersigned reserves the right to postpone the sale to another time and date certain upon announcement by the Substitute Trustee or its agent at the time and place of sale. The undersigned reserves the right to conduct the sale through its duly appointed agent. If one or more apparently successful bidders fail to comply with the terms and conditions of the sale, the undersigned shall have the right to accept the next highest bid until a bidder whose bid has been accepted shall have complied with the terms and conditions of the sale, all without the necessity of re-publishing notice of the sale./s/ Kennerly, Montgomery and Finley, P.C.Kennerly, Montgomery and Finley, P.C., Substitute Trustee550 Main Street, Ste. 400Knoxville, Tennessee 37902865-546-7311B29-31

text: RENOVATION OF THE FORMER HEALTH DEPARTMENT BUILDING FOR FREESTANDING EMERGENCY CARE FACILITY McNAIRY COUNTY 725 POPLAR AVENUE, SELMER, TN 38375 ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS Bidders can gain access to the project for inspection by calling Lashlee-Rich, Inc. ask for Jim Atkins 731.414.2678 or Garrett Lashlee 731.487.6106. Bidders may submit bids for project described in this Document. Submit bids according to the Instructions to Bidders, See Bid documents for details. Project Identification: RENOVATION OF THE FORMER HEALTH DEPARTMENT BUILDING FOR FREESTANDING EMERGENCY CARE FACILITY Project Location: 725 Poplar Ave., Selmer, TN 38375 Owner: McNairy County, TN Architect: Vaughan Associates Incorporated, 403 North Parkway, Suite 202, Jackson, TN 38305 Bids will be received for the following Work: See Bid Packages, Section 00 00 06 including: Drywall Electrical Acoustical Ceilings Mechanical and Plumbing Resilient Flooring Site Grading Resinous Flooring Selection Demolition Painting Proposed forms of contract documents, including plans and specifications, are on file at the following: Vaughan Associates Architects Incorporated. Builder's Exchange, 2728 Eugenia Avenue Suite 108, Nashville, TN 37211, www.bxtn.org Dodge Data & Analytics, dodge.docs@construction.com Copies of the documents must be obtained by providing a deposit to Lashlee-Rich, Inc. Each Bidder will received one (1) set of plans and specifications by depositing $300.00 with Lashlee-Rich, Inc. Additional complete sets may be purchased at their own expense. Such deposit will be 100% refunded to the persons who return the plans, specifications, and other documents in good condition within 10 days after the bid opening. Digital versions of the documents may be purchased by bidders at their own expense from Hub-City Blueprint, Jackson, TN 38301. The Owner requires a copy of your Affidavit and Certified Application, for The Tennessee Drug Free Workplace Program to be placed in a separate envelope and attached to the outside of the envelope containing your bid. The Bid envelope will not be opened unless the separate envelope contains your completed and signed affidavit, and certified application, (NO EXCEPTIONS ALLOWED). Refer to Specification Section 00 00 11 - Drug Free Workplace Affidavit form. Owner will received sealed bids until the bid time and date at the location given below. Owner will consider bids prepared in compliance with the Instructions to Bidders, and delivered as follows: Bid Date: August 16, 2024. Bid Time: 2:00 p.m., local time. Location: ZOOM MEETING OPENING IN OBSERVANCE OF COVID19 PRECAUTIONS McNairy County reserves the right to reject any and all bids to waive any informality in the bidding whenever such rejection or waiver is in the interest of the Owner. Bidders can gain access to the project for inspection by calling Lashlee-Rich, Inc. ask for Jim Atkins 731.414.2678 or Garrett Lashlee 731.487.6106. A certified check or bank draft, payable to Lashlee-Rich, Inc., U.S. Government bonds, or a satisfactory bid bond executed by the bidder and acceptable sureties in an amount equal to five (5) percent of the bid shall be submitted with each Labor and Material Bid in excess of $25,000. No bids may be with-drawn for a period of 90 days after opening of bids. Owner reserves the right to reject any and all Bids and to waive any informalities or irregularities. Effective January 1, 2011, a masonry subcontractor must be licensed with an "LMC" classification in order to bid or to be listed on the outside of bid envelope as a Licensed Masonry Contractor (LMC) when the masonry portion is $100,000 or more (including materials and labor). The BC-9 or BC will not be acceptable. Bidders must be properly licensed under the laws governing their respective trades and be able to obtain insurance and bonds required for the Work. A Performance Bond, separate Labor and Material Payment Bond, and Insurance in a form acceptable to Owner will be required of all successful bidders whose bid exceeds $25,000.00. The successful bidders will be required to furnish and pay for satisfactory performance and payment bond, bonds or insurance surety. All bidders, regardless of bid amount will be required to maintain and pay for all required insurance coverage. All bidders shall comply with Public Chapter 587 of 2007 as codified in the Tennessee Code Annotated Section 49-5-413, which required all contractors to facilitate a criminal history records check conducted by the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation for each employee prior to permitting the employee to have contact with the students or enter schools grounds when students are present. As a convenience to bidders, bids may be emailed to the office of the Construction Manager at bidbox@lashleerich.com. For emailed bids to be considered, they must be time stamped before 12:00 noon on bid day. For emailed bid requiring bid bonds or Drug Free Affidavits, these documents must be attached to the bid. Emailed copies of Bid Security checks will not be accepted.

ORDINANCE NO. 2024-/ AN ORDINANCE TO AUTHOR- IZE THE EXECUTION AND DE- LIVERY OF ACOMMUNITY DE- VELOPMENT GRANT AGREE- MENT; TO DECLARE AN EMER- GENCY; AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES. WHEREAS, Jackson County, Arkansas (the "County") desires to enter into a Community Devel- opment Grant Agreement (the "Agreement") with Tupelo Brake Solar, LLC, a Delaware limited li- ability company (the "Company") and an affiliate of Next Era En- ergy Resources; WHEREAS, pursuant to the Agreement, the County will co- operate (as specified in the Agreement) in the Company's de- velopment and construction of a solar-powered electricity generat- ing facility and related or ancillary facilities supporting or beneficial to the operation of such facility; and WHEREAS, pursuant to the Agreement, the Company will make a community development payment to the County and to the Jackson County School District and the Newport School District, to be used by the County and the School Districts for the construc- tion, repair, or maintenance of public infrastructure or com- munity development projects or for the support and/or improve- ment of public services provided by the County and the School Districts. NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT OR- DAINED BY THE QUORUM COURT OF JACKSON COUNTY, ARKANSAS: Section 1. There be, and there is hereby, authorized and directed the execution and delivery of the Agreement, and the County Judge and County Clerk are hereby authorized to execute, ac- knowledge, and deliver the Agreement for and on behalf of the County. The Agreement is hereby approved in substantially the form submitted to this meet- ing, and the County J udge is hereby authorized to confer with the Company in order to finalize the Agreement with such changes as shall be approved by such per- sons executing the Agreement, their execution to constitute con- clusive evidence of such approv- al. Section 2. This ordinance being necessary for the immediate pro- tection of the health, safety and welfare of the citizens of J ackson County, Arkansas, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this ordinance shall be in full force and effect from and after its pas- sage. PASSED and APPROVED this 11th day of July, 2024. /s/) eff Phillips, County J udge ATTEST: /s/Melanie Clark, County Clerk {SEAL} This publication was paid for by Jackson County at a cost of $89.00

JACKSON COUNTY ORDIN- ANCE NO. 2024-6 BE IT ORDAINED BY THE QUORUM COURT OF JACK- SON COUNTY, ARKANSAS; AN ORDINANCE TO BE EN- TITLED: AN ORDINANCE ENACTING AND ADOPTING A SUPPLE- MENT TO THE CODE OF OR- DINANCES FOR JACKSON COUNTY, ARKANSAS, AND DE- CLARING AN EMERGENCY. WHEREAS, American Legal P ub- lishing Corporation of Cincinnati, Ohio, has completed the 2024 S- 25 supplement to the Code of Or- dinances for Jackson County, Arkansas, which supplement con- tains all ordinances of a general and permanent nature enacted since the adoption of the Code of Ordinances for J ackson County, Arkansas, and previous supple- ments thereto, and WHEREAS, American Legal P ub- lishing Corporation has recom- mended the revision or addition of certain sections of the Code of Ordinances which are based on or make reference to sections of the J ackson County Code and the Arkansas Code Annotated; and WHEREAS, it is the intent of the Quorum Court of Jackson County, Arkansas, to accept these updated sections in accord- ance with the changes of the law of the State of Arkansas and Jackson County; and WHEREAS, it is necessary to provide for the usual daily opera- tion of the county and for the im- mediate preservation of the pub- lic peace, health, safety and gen- eral welfare of the county that this ordinance take effect at an early date; NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT OR- DAINED BY THE QUORUM COURT OF JACKSON COUNTY, ARKANSAS: Section 1. That the 2024 S-25 supplement to the Code of Ordin- ances for J ackson County as sub- mitted by American Legal Pub- lishing Corporation of Cincinnati, Ohio, and as attached hereto, be and the same is hereby adopted by reference as if set out in its en- tirety. Section 2. Such supplement shall be deemed published as of the day of its adoption and approval by the Quorum Court of J ackson County, Arkansas, and the Clerk of J ackson County is hereby au- thorized and ordered to insert such supplement into the copy of the Code of Ordinances kept on file in the Office of the Clerk. Section 3. This ordinance is de- clared to be an emergency meas- ure necessary for the immediate preservation of the peace, health, safety and general welfare of the people of this county, and shall take effect immediately upon its passage and approval. PASSED AND ADOPTED by the Quorum Court of] ackson County, Arkansas on this 11th day of J uly, 2024. DATED: 7/11/2024 APPROVED: /s/J eff Phillips, County Judge ATTEST: Melanie Clark, County Clerk This publication was paid for by Jackson County at a cost of $101.00

NOTICE Madison County Telephone Company, Inc. is the Eligible Telecommunications Carrier for universal service purposes within its prescribed service area. Our service area is Huntsville, Forum, Kingston, and Witter. Universal service was established to help provide essential telecommunications services to all citizens. Madison County Telephone Company provides single party residential service for $19.50 per month. The single line business rate is $21.00 per month. The customer also receives access to Emergency Services, Directory Assistance, Local Usage, Long Distance Carriers, Operator Services, Telecommunications Relay Services, Touch Tone Service, Toll Blocking Services and other services designated for persons with disabilities. Use of these services may result in additional charges. Madison County Telephone Company offers Lifeline Discount to qualified low-income customers. As of December 1, 2020, the monthly phone discount is $5.25, bundled voice/broad-band and broadband only discount is $9.25. However, due to FCC Subscriber Line Charge Rules, voice-only lifeline subscribers will see a full $6.50 credit. Toll Blocking and a waiver of the deposit if Toll Blocking is selected are also available to qualifying Lifeline customers. If you have any questions about the qualifications of the Lifeline programs or to request an application, please contact Madison County Telephone Company at (479)738-2121. Our office is located at 113 Court Street, Huntsville, AR 72740.Madison CountyTelephone Co., Incwww.madisoncounty.net

Specifications may be found online at www.greenevilletn.gov under Current Solicitations or by con- tacting Scott Keith at skeith @ greenevilletn.gov. All bids must be sealed and mailed to Greeneville Town Hall, 200 N. College St., Greeneville, TN 37745. Envelopes must be marked "Roll Off RFP". Bids will be opened in the board- room of Greeneville Town Hall on Wednesday, July 31, 2024, at 9:00 am. The Town reserves the right to reject any and/or all bids, to waive technicalities or informalities, and to accept any bid deemed to be in the best in- terest of the Town. 7.18.24

STATEMENT OF NON-DISCRIMINATION Madison County Telephone Company, Inc. is the recipient of Federal financial assistance from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) prohibits discrimination in all its programs and activities on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, and where applicable, sex, marital status, familial status, parental status, religion, sexual orientation, genetic information, political beliefs, reprisal, or because all or part of an individual's income is derived from any public assistance program. (Not all prohibited bases apply to all programs.) Persons with disabilities who require alternative means for communication of program information (Braille, large print, audio-tape, etc.) should contact USDA's TARGET Center at (202) 720-2600 (voice and TDD). To file a complaint of discrimination, write to USDA, Director, Office ofCivil Rights, 1400 Independence Avenue, S.W., Washington D.C. 20250-9410, or call toll free (866) 632-9992 (voice) or (800) 877-8339 (TDD) or (866) 377-8642 (re-lay voice users). USDA is an equal opportunity provider and employer.

Exhibit "D" APPROPRIATION ORDINANCE NO. 2024 - 17 BE IT ENACTED BY THE QUORUM COURT OF SALINE COUNTY, STATE OF ARKANSAS, AN ORDINANCE TO BE EN- TITLED: "AN ORDINANCE APPROPRIATING FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE STATE BOARD OF ELECTION COMMISSIONERS OFFICE FOR SUPPLEMENTAL STIPEND TO ELECTION WORKERS FOR THE YEAR 2024." WHEREAS, the County Clerk received a check from the Arkansas State Board of Election Commissioners ("State Board") for the stipend for the Election Coordinator to attend training and pass the Preferen- tial Primary Election test required by this designated County individu- al; and, WHEREAS, the County compensates the County Clerk Office Man- ager / Election Coordinator, for performing such duties; and, WHEREAS, the County Clerk requests to appropriate these funds re- ceived from the State Board to pay an additional stipend/bonus to the County Clerk Office Manager / Election Coordinator; and, WHEREAS, the County will be responsible for FICA and APERS em- ployer portion for this stipend/bonus to the County Clerk Office Man- ager / Election Coordinator; and, WHEREAS, the Finance Committee previously met and approved this request. NOW THEREFORE BE IT ORDAINED BY THE QUORUM COURT OF SALINE COUNTY, ARKANSAS: Article 1. That Fund 1000 - County General Fund shall be increased by the County Treasurer with additional Anticipated Revenues of $500.00 for the year 2024. Line Item Description Amount 1000.8719 Reimbursement-Elections $500.00 Article 2. That $500 is hereby appropriated in Fund 1000 - County General Fund, Election Worker Pay-Election Commission budget as follows: Line Item Description Amount 1000.0109.1036 Employee Bonus $500.00 1000.0109.1006 Social Security Match $38.25 1000.0109.1008 Retirement Match $76.60 Article 3. It is deemed necessary for the smooth operation of Saline County Government that this ordinance be approved. DATE: JULY 15, 2024 APPROVED: MATT BRUMLEY, SALINE COUNTY JUDGE This publication paid for by Saline County Judge Financial Mgt. Dept. and cost $163.80.

IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF MADISON COUNTY, ARKANSASCIVIL DIVISIONCENTENNIAL BANKAn Arkansas Banking Corporation, PLAINTIFFvs. CLARENCE P. MOORE andKRISTY D. MOORE, DEFENDANTSCase No. 44CV-23-29NOTICE OF COMMISSIONER'S SALE Notice is hereby given that pursuant to the authority and direction of a certain Judgment, decree and order of sale rendered in the Circuit Court of Madison County, Arkansas, on the 10th day of June, 2024, in the cause of Centennial Bank vs. Clarence P. Moore and Kristy D. Moore, Case No. 44CV-23-29, in which Centennial recovered judgment against the Defendants, in the Judgment amount as stated, and against the real property herein described, together with further interest thereon, until paid; including attorney's fees and costs and which Judgment appears of record in the proceedings of said court in the office of the Circuit Clerk and Ex-Officio Recorder in said county and said judgment and costs not having been paid within the time required by said decree and said judgment having been declared a lien upon the real property hereinafter described and said real property ordered sold to satisfy the same. NOW, THEREFORE, the undersigned, as Commissioner of said Court will, on the 15th day of August, 2024, at 10:00 a.m., expose for sale at public outcry to the highest bidder on a credit of three (3) months in the lobby of the Madison County Courthouse in Huntsville, Arkansas, between the hours prescribed by law for judicial sales the following described real estate situated in said county and state, to-wit:A part of the NW 1/4 of the NW 1/4, Section 25, Township 14 North, Range 28 West, Madison County, Arkansas, being more particularly described as follows, to wit: Beginning at the NW Corner of said forty acre tract, said point being a found iron pin and running thence S 87deg20'34" E 1006.94" to a set mag nail along centerline of Arkansas Highway #16; thence following said centerline the following 4 courses: S 12deg59'48" E 47.54'; S 15deg23'21" E 176.89'; S 17deg38'58" E 59.55'; thence along a curve to the left with a radius of 460.46 feet and a chord bearing and distance of S 40deg02'40" E 336.36' to a found mag nail; thence leaving said centerline and running S 53deg30'36" W 286.18' to a found iron pin; thence N 87deg27'35" W 1099.76' to a found iron pin; thence N 02deg31'20" E 699.92' to the point of beginning, and containing 18.24 acres, more or less. For informational purposes only: 181 Madison 4110, Elkins, AR 72727. The purchaser at said sale will be required to pay 10% of the purchase price down at the time of sale and to execute a bond with sufficient sureties thereon for the balance of the purchase price, bearing interest from the date of sale until paid at the rate of 10% per annum, due in three (3) months and a lien will be retained on said real property sold to secure payment of the purchase money. DATED this 9th day of July, 2024.Tiffany McDanielMadison County Circuit ClerkPrepared by: Jay B. Williams, ABA#90014WILLIAMS LAW FIRM100 W. Main StreetGentry, AR 72734-8231(479) 736-8800 |Fax: (479) 736-3170jay@williamslawfirm.net Attorney for Centennial Bank

text: Pupiic Meeting Invitation The City of Sherwood invites its citizens and other interested per- sons to a public meeting in the Council Chambers, located in the Police and Courts Building at 2201 East Kiehl Ave., Sherwood, AR 72120, on July 22, 2024 at 5:30 pm. The purpose of the meeting is to identify potential improvements to Duran Park. Following the iden- tification process, city officials will select the priorities to be submit- ted to the Arkansas Department of Parks, Heritage and Tourism for an Outdoor Recreation Matching Grant application. Ethnic minori- ties, persons with disabilities, sen- ior citizens and special interest groups are encouraged to attend and participate. For those unable to attend the meeting you may watch it via the City of Sherwood's YouTube Chan- nel at https://www.youtube.com/@City- ofSherwoodArkansas. Written comments may be emailed to ap- baldwin@cityofsherwood.net or mailed to Sherwood City Hall ATTN: GRANTS DEPT, 2199 East Kiehl Avenue, Sherwood, AR 72120. 421204z

10: Scnools in J ackson County Date: April 26, 2024 Re: Equalization Board Appoint- ment According to A.C.A. 26-27-304 (b)(1)(A)(i), For the purpose of making the selection of its mem- bers of the county equalization board as provided in this section, the school district's superintend- ent or designee of each school district in each county shall serve as the representative of his or her respective school district. (ii) The representative of the school districts of each county shall hold a meeting during the month of May of each year in which the term of any of their members of the county equaliza- tion board shall expire. (B) The county judge shall serve as chair of the meeting and shall issue the call for the meeting, which shall specify the time, date, and place of the meeting. (C) (i) The selection of members of the county equalization board shall be by majority vote of the school board representatives present, and no action shall be taken unless there is a quorum present. Currently, this selection is Mr. J im Young. | have spoken with Mr. Young and he has expressed his willingness to remain in position, if you choose to do so. County J udge J eff Phillips has called a meeting of the School Superintendents in the County to meet on Monday, May 6th at 9:00 A.M. in the Jackson County Judges Office located on the second floor of the courthouse. If you are unable to attend this meeting, please let me know. Regards, Melanie Clark

NOTICE TQ PUBLIC OF APPLICATION FOR REZONING NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN THAT an application for rezoning has been filed with the Paragould City Planning Commission by Donald Gage and Kathy Gage wherein the request is made to change the zoning classification of the following described lands located in the Northwest corner of Fairview Road and Mt. Carmel Road, Paragould, Arkansas, from "AG" Agricultural Use Zoning Classification to "R-2" Residential Use Zoning Classification: That part of the SE% of the SW% of Section 23, Township 17 North, Range 5 East, being more partic- ularly described as follows: Be- ginning at the Southeast corner of said SE% SW; run thence North 00deg34' East 207.7 ft; run thence South 89deg49' West 279.4 ft; run thence South 00deg22' East 208.88 ft; run thence North 89deg34' East 276.0 ft to the true point of begin- ning, containing 1.33 acres, more or less, SUBJ ECT TO the right of way of Fairview Rd along the South side thereof, the right of way of Mt. Carmel Rd along the East side thereof, and any utility easements or rights of way of re- cord. A public hearing on said applica- tion for rezoning will be held by the Paragould Planning Commis- sion at 6:30 p.m. on Thursday, August 1, 2024, in the board- room located in the Paragould City Hall Building at 301 West Court Street, Paragould, Arkan- sas. All parties in interest may be heard at the above stated time and place or may notify the Plan- ning Commission by letter of their position on said application. The application for rezoning is on file for public inspection at the City Clerk's office in the Parag- ould City Hall Building. DATED this 16th day of J uly, 2024. PARAGOULD PLANNING COM- MISSION By: /s/ Alana House, Secretary

TRUSTEES NOTICE OF DE- FAULT AND INTENTION TO SELL YOU MAY LOSE YOUR PROP- ERTY IF YOU DO NOT TAKE IMME- DIATE ACTION. THIS IS AN ATTEMPT TO COL- LECT A DEBT AND ANY INFORMA- TION OBTAINED WILL BE USED FOR SUCH PURPOSE. On August 30, 2011, Gayle B. Knotts and Jack G. Knotts exe- cuted a Deed of Trust in favor of Ann Orsi-Smith, as Trustee for ONE REVERSE MORTGAGE, LLC, which was recorded on Septem- ber 12, 2011, as Instrument No. 201107431 in the real property records of Cleburne County, Arkansas. The party initiating foreclosure can be contacted at or in care of its servicer initiating foreclosure at: PHH Mortgage Cor- poration, 1 Mortgage Way, Mt. Laurel, NJ 08054, at Telephone No. 1.800.330.0423; and The default for which foreclo- sure is made is the property ceased to be the principal resi- dence of a borrower for a reason other than death and the property is not the principal residence of at least one other borrower as re- quired by the terms of the Note and Security Instrument. Because of the failure to cure the default the indebtedness was acceler- ated, is now therefore wholly due and the Beneficiary has requested the property be sold to satisfy said indebtedness. On Wednesday, August 7, 2024 on or about 10:00 AM, the follow- ing described real property will be sold at the front door entrance of the Cleburne County Courthouse, 301 West Main St, Heber Springs, AR 72543, to the highest bidder for cash: Land Situated in the County of Cleburne in the State of AR. Lot Number Thirteen (13), View Point Estates Subdivision, Cle- burne County, Arkansas, as filed February 10, 1983, in the plat records of Cleburne County, Arkansas. More commonly known as 170 Tracy Ann Ter, Shirley, AR 72153. There may be occupants that claim an interest in the real prop- erty herein based upon said occu- pancy. The undersigned is the Substi- tute Trustee for the beneficiary and is acting on behalf of and with the consent of the beneficiary who is exercising its power of sale under Ark. Code Ann. Section 18- 50-115 which implies a power of sale in every Deed of Trust of real property situated in this State that is duly acknowledged and recorded. The sale is subject to all mat- ters shown on any applicable recorded plat; any unpaid taxes; any restrictive covenants, ease- ments, or setback lines that may be applicable; any statutory rights of redemption of any governmen- tal agency, state or federal; any prior liens or encumbrances as well as any priority created by a fixture filing; and to any matter that an accurate survey of the premises might disclose. Unless discharged by bank- ruptcy, if your property is sold, then you will remain liable for any deficiency and an action for col- lection may be brought against you. The sale held pursuant to this Notice may be rescinded at the Substitute Trustee's option at any time. The right is reserved to adjourn the day of the sale to an- other day, time and place certain without further publication, upon announcement at the time and place for the sale set forth above. The property is being sold "as is" with no representation as to its condition THE TERMS OF SALE ARE CASH THE DAY OF SALE AND ALL TRANSFER TAXES WILL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE PURCHASER. If the sale is set aside for any reason, the Pur- chaser at the sale shall be entitled only to a return of the deposit paid. The Purchaser shall have no further recourse against the Grantor, the Grantee, the Benefici- ary or the Trustee. Witness my hand this 15th day of May, 2024. Marco lacobacci, Attorney at Law, Bar Number 2022038 Substitute Trustee for MORT- GAGE ASSETS MANAGEMENT, LLC F/K/A REVERSE MORTGAGE SO- LUTIONS, INC. Mackie Wolf Zientz & Mann, P.C. text: NOTICE TO CREDITORSAs required by TCA SS30-2-306Estate of WAYNE SHELTON REED, DeceasedNotice is hereby given that on July 9 of 2024 Letters Testamentary (or of Administration as the case may be) in respect of the estate of WAYNE SHELTON REED, who died 4/21/2024, were issued to the undersigned by the Tipton County Chancery Court of Tipton County, Tennessee. All persons, resident and non-resident, having claims, matured or unmatured, against the estate are required to file the same with the Clerk of the above-named Court on or before the earlier of the dates prescribed in (1) or (2) otherwise their claims will be forever barred:(1) (A) Four (4) months from the date of the first publication (or posting, as the case may be) of this notice if the creditor received an actual copy of this notice to creditors at least sixty (60) days before the date that is four (4) months from the date of the first publication (or posting); or(B) Sixty (60) days from the date the creditor received an actual copy of the notice to creditors, if the creditor received the copy of the notice less than sixty (60) days prior to the date that is four (4) months from the date of the first publication (or posting) as described in (1)(A); or(2) Twelve (12) months form the decedent's date of death.Date: 7/9/2024, WAYNE SHELTON REED, Administrator; Rikky Herbert, Atty.; Gina Smith, Clerk & Master, 1801 S. College St, Suite 110, Covington, TN; personally appeared before me, the undersigned Clerk of Tipton County Chancery Court of Tipton County, Tennessee, and made oath that the attached notice, being in the form required by Tennessee Code Annotated SS30-2-306 shall be published in The Leader, a newspaper published in Tipton County, Tennessee.18jul2w

NOTICE TO CREDITORS #24P1213ESTATE OF CHERYL LYNN YORK. Notice is hereby given that on the 11th day of July, Letters of Authority in respect to the estate of, CHERYL LYNN YORK who died on 06/02/2024 were issued to the undersigned by the Circuit Court of Davidson County, Tennessee Probate Division. All persons, resident and non-resident, having claims, matured, or un-matured, against the estate are required to file same with the clerk of the above name court on or before the earlier of the dates prescribed in (1) or (2), otherwise their claims will be forever barred: (1) (A) Four (4) months from the date of the first publication (or posting, as the case may be) of this Notice if the creditor received an actual copy of the Notice to Creditors at least sixty(60) days before the date that is four (4) months from the date of the first publication (or posting); or (B) Sixty (60) days from the date the creditor received an actual copy of the Notice to Creditors, if the creditor received the copy of the Notice less than sixty (60) days prior to the date that is four (4) months from the date of the first publication (or posting) as described in (1) (A); or Twelve (12) months from the decedents date of death this 02nd day of JUNE 2024. Personal Representative(s); MARJORIE ANDREWS BRISTOL 919 CONFERENCE DRIVE SUITE 4-324 GOODLETTSVILLE, TN 37072; Attorney for Personal Representative(s); BRISTOL, MARJORIE ANDREWS 919 CONFERENCE DR STE 4-324 GOODLETSVILLE, TN 37072; Publish dates July 18 and July 25, 2024

gpn05 MDJ-5197 MDJ-5197 GPN-5 ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS Cobb County-Marietta Water Authority will receive sealed bids from vendors for 36" Ductile Iron Pipe to keep on inventory for pipeline replacement or repairs. Bids shall be received by the Cobb County-Marietta Water Authority at 1170 Atlanta Industrial Drive, Marietta, Georgia, 30066 prior to 2:00 p.m., local time, July 11, 2024, for the Project known as: Invitation to Bid Purchase of 36" Ductile Iron Pipe Cobb County-Marietta Water Authority Transmission Division Bids will be publicly opened and read aloud on July 11, 2024, at 2:00 p.m., local time. Bids received after the designated time for receival of bids will not be considered. Unsealed bids, including facsimile bids or bids sent by e-mail, will not be considered. The Owner of the project is Cobb County-Marietta Water Authority. The ductile iron pipe shall only be manufactured by American Cast Iron Pipe Company; substitutions are not allowed. Bidders shall inform themselves concerning Georgia Laws and comply with same. Bids must be signed in ink by a company official that has authorization to commit company resources. A complete copy of the bid documents may be obtained from the Owner's Procurement Coordinator, at procurement@ccmwa.org. The Issuing Office address is: 1170 Atlanta Industrial Drive, Marietta, Georgia 30066. The Owner will in no way be liable for any costs incurred by any Bidder in the preparation of its proposal in response to this Advertisement for Bids. All bids will remain subject to acceptance for a period of 30 calendar days from the bid opening date, but Owner may, in its sole discretion, release any bid and return the bid prior to that date. The Owner reserves the right to reject any or all bids, to waive informalities and re-advertise. Cobb County-Marietta Water Authority Cole Blackwell, CPA General Manager 6:28; 7:5-2024

NOTICE OF SALE ABANDONED VEHICLE SALE (2024- 2) ABANDONED MOTORCYCLE SALE (2024- 2) TAKE NOTICE that the City of Camden shall expose for sale at a Public Auction in accordance with N.J.S.A. 39:10A-1 on WEDNESDAY, July 17,2024 at 11:00 a.m. at The "Original" W. Hargrove c/o Camden Towing 1507 State Street Camden NJ 08105 the described Motor Vehicles, which came into possession of the City of Camden through abandonment or failure of owner to claim same. CONDITIONS OF SALE 1.All vehicles are offered on an "AS IS," and "WHERE IS" condition. 2. The purchasing agent reserves the right to accept or reject any or all bids. The award of bids on the vehicles will be made at the discretion of the purchasing agent. 3. All bidders are strongly urged to physically inspect all vehicles for sale prior to bidding. 4. All listed vehicles may be inspected from 10:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. on the date of the sale. 5. All bidders must be eighteen (18) years of age with a valid driver's license. 6. All transaction payments are in cash, money orders, or certified checks only and payable to The City of Camden 7. Rightful owner of record may claim vehicle during normal working hours prior to auction providing all liens/fees have been brought to account. 8. All inquires should contact the Parking Authority, Camden, New Jersey, telephone number (856) 757-9300. 9. In the event of inclement weather, the auction will be held in the lobby of the building. NOTICE TO BIDDERS PLEASE TAKE NOTICE TAKE that sealed bids will be received by the Borough Clerk for the Borough of Fair Lawn (the "Borough"), Bergen County, New Jersey at the Municipal Building, Council Chambers, 8-0l Fair Lawn Avenue, Fair Lawn, New Jersey 07410, on Wednesday, July 31, 2024 at 11:00 a.m., prevailing time, at which time and place bids will be opened and read aloud for: LEASE OF SPACE FOR CELLULAR COMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT AT FAIR LAWN DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS COMPLEX 20-05 SADDLE RIVER ROAD, FAIR LAWN, NJ 07410 Bidders shall submit an original copy of their bids by certified mail, overnight or express mail or hand-delivery, in a sealed envelope, addressed to the Borough Clerk's Office at the address above, and clearly marked on the outside with the bidder's name and address and bearing the words "Public Bid: Lease for Space for Cellular Communications Equipment at Fair Lawn Department of Public Works Complex, 20-05 Saddle River Road, Fair Lawn, New Jersey 07410." All bids must be received by the Borough Clerk's Office on or before the date and time set forth above. Bids received by the Borough will be date and time stamped upon receipt. Bidders are solely responsible for the timely delivery of their bids and any bid received after the date and time specified above will not be considered but will be returned unopened to the Bidder. It is anticipated that an award of a lease shall be made by resolution of the Borough Council no later than the second regular meeting of the Borough Council following the completion of bidding. Prospective Bidders must contact the Borough Clerk's Office, telephone 201-794-5340, between the hours of 8:00 A.M. and 5:30 P.M., Monday through Thursday, excluding legal holidays or by emailing bids@fairlawn.org to arrange for pick-up, mailing or emailing the bid package to prospective Bidders. The Borough accepts no responsibility for timely delivery of bid packages, whether mailed or emailed, or for a Bidder's inability to download emailed bid documents. Copies of the bid package will be available at no charge after the Bidder registers with the Borough. NO BIDS MAY BE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY. Each bid must be submitted, in writing, on the bid forms furnished in the bid specifications. A certified check, cashier's check or bid bond in the amount of ten percent (10%) of the bid, but not in excess of Twenty Thousand Dollars ($20,000), must be submitted with the bid, guaranteeing that if a contract is awarded, the bidder shall execute the contract and deliver the bond(s), if any, required by the bid documents. The bid bond shall be obtained from a surety company that is authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey. Such Bid Bond shall not contain any conditions to the obligations of the surety company issuing the Bid Bond. Bid Bonds signed by an Attorney-in-Fact shall be accompanied by an executed and certified Power-of-Attorney. The minimum bid, which is equivalent to the annual rent for the first year of the lease, shall not be less than $1,750 ("Minimum Rent"), and shall be escalated over the term of the lease agreement by 2% annually. The initial term of the lease shall be for five (5) years, with an option to renew, within the Borough's sole discretion, for four (4) additional five-year terms. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27-1 et seq. The successful Bidder shall submit copies of the New Jersey Business Registration Certificate(s) for itself and all subcontractors prior to award of a contract. The successful Bidder shall enter into a lease agreement with the Borough in a form prepared by the Borough, a copy of which will be kept on file with the Office of the Municipal Clerk. The lease agreement shall be entered into within twenty-one (21) days of the award of the bid. The Borough reserves the right to reject any or all bids, to waive immaterial informalities, or to accept any bid which, in the opinion of the Borough, is in the best interests of the Borough, all in accordance with the New Jersey Local Lands and Buildings Law, N.J.S.A. 40A:12-l, et seq. In the event of a tie bid, the Borough shall award the bid to the bidder that, in the Borough's sole discretion, best serves the public interest. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq., and N.J.A.C. 17:27. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of the New Jersey Prevailing Wage Act, N.J.S.A. 34:56-27 and the New Jersey Local Lands and Buildings Law, N.J.S.A. 40A:12-1 et seq. The Borough reserves the right to reject any or all of the bids or waive any informalities therein pursuant to and in accordance with applicable law. Nicholas J. Magarelli, RMC Municipal Clerk, Borough of Fair Lawn The Record/Herald News 07/10/2024 (172) Fee:$55.36 AD # 10358362

BOROUGH OF FAIR LAWN COUNTY OF BERGEN STATE OF NEW JERSEY NOTICE TO PROPOSERS REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS FOR AN INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL ADVISOR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SALE OF THE BOROUGH'S WATER SYSTEM The Borough of Fair Lawn, New Jersey (the "Borough") is seeking sealed proposals for the services of an independent financial advisor (the "Financial Advisor") pursuant to the competitive contracting process set forth in N.J.S.A. 40A:11-4.1 et seq. The Borough is seeking sealed proposals from qualified Financial Advisors to perform an analysis of all options available to the Borough in connection with the lease or sale of the Borough's water system pursuant to the Municipal Sale or Lease Law, N.J.S.A. 40:62-3 et seq. (the "Act"). The Financial Advisory's scope of services will be to evaluate the Borough's water system and review, analyze and prepare a report on the following: a. the value of the system; and b. the short and long-term impacts to ratepayers of the cash-flow structure of a proposed sale of the water system. A copy of the Request for Proposals (RFP) may be obtained by emailing bids@fairlawn.org or by contacting the Municipal Clerk, Fair Lawn Municipal Building, 8-01 Fair Lawn Avenue, Fair Lawn, New Jersey 07410, telephone 201-794-5340, Monday through Thursday, between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 5:30 p.m. All proposals shall be submitted using the specified forms and format and delivered to the Municipal Clerk in a sealed envelope marked "Request for Proposals for Independent Financial Advisor" no later than Wednesday, July 31, 2024 at 10:00 a.m. prevailing time, when the proposals will be opened and read aloud at the Council Chambers on the Second Floor of the Fair Lawn Municipal Building at the above address. Late proposals will not be accepted. The Borough of Fair Lawn reserves the right to consider the proposals for sixty (60) days after the receipt thereof, and further reserves the right to reject any or all proposals, to abandon the procurement process, to waive any informality and make such awards or take such action as may be in the best interest of the Borough, all in accordance with applicable law. Any award of a contract hereunder shall be made in accordance with the competitive contracting process, N.J.S.A. 40A:11-4.1 et seq. The selected proposer shall be required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et. seq., N.J.A.C. 17:27 (Affirmative Action), P.L. 1963. C150, and Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12101, et. seq.), and N.J.S.A. 52:32-44 (Business Registration) and shall submit proof of the same. Nicholas J. Magarelli, RMC Municipal Clerk, Borough of Fair Lawn The Record/Herald News 07/10/2024 Fee:$52.80 AD # 10358134

PUBLIC NOTICE LEGAL NOTICE FOR PUBLIC COMMENT ON STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES USDA HOUSING PRESERVATION GRANT 2024 FINANCIAL WELLNESS INSTITUTE intends to apply to the United States Department of Agriculture, Rural Housing Services (RHS) for grant funds to aid in the preservation of homes occupied by the very low & low income homeowners in BURLINGTON, ATLANTIC, CUMBERLAND, GLOUCESTER AND SALEM COUNTIES. RHS Housing Preservation funds will be for needed and critical repairs. The application will seek up to $50,000 to address these property needs and maintain the housing stock in rural BURLINGTON, ATLANTIC, CUMBERLAND, GLOUCESTER AND SALEM COUNTIES. The USDA Rural Housing Services requires FINANCIAL WELLNESS INSTITUTE to provide the public with an opportunity for comments to the proposed project to assure that the proposed Housing Preservation Grant program is beneficial and does not duplicate current activities and to make available for public review the Statement of Activities, which outlines the planned proposed program to be submitted to the RHS for consideration for funding. FINANCIAL WELLNESS INSTITUTE's Housing Preservation Statement of Activities is available and may be reviewed at during the normal business hours of M-F 9:00 A.M. UNTIL 4:00 P.M. by appointment. A fifteen (15) day comment period is required to allow for public review of the proposed program. Comments may be submitted at via mail to PO BOX 5656, DEPTFORD, NJ 08096 or at 1200 S. DELSEA DRIVE, SUITE ONE, WESTVILLE, NJ 08093, during normal business hours of 9:00 A.M. UNTIL 4:00 P.M. Monday through Friday. Should the public have any question as to this notice they may contact Wanda Hardy at 856-251-0311. Wednesday, July 3, 2024 Cost $59.32 7/9/24 1T (10887581)

PUBLIC NOTICE The Linden Board of Education awarded an Extraordinary Unspecifiable Service contract. The resolutions and contracts are on file at the 2 East Gibbons Street Linden, NJ 07036. Documents are available for inspection by the public per N.J.S.A. 18A:1BA-5. Division of Local Government Services pursuant toN.J.A.C. S:34-2 allows for all above service contracts to be considered extraordinary unspecifiable services in accordance with the requirements thereof. The administration/health benefit broker issued an RFP for Prescription and Health Insurance Coverage and received multiple competitive quotations. This contract is with the New Jersey State Health Benefit Plan for the medical for one year for the period of July 1, 2024 through June 30, 2025 for health insurance benefits for approximately $21,000,000. This contract is with the Benecard for one year for the period of July 1, 2024 through June 30, 2025 for health insurance benefits for approximately $5,061,000. The following resolution was adopted at the April 25, 2024, 2023 Board of Education meeting: BE IT RESOLVED The Linden Board of Education located at 2 East Gibbons Street in Linden, NJ 07036 hereby elects to participate in the Health Program provided by the New Jersey State Health Benefits Act of the State of New Jersey (N.J.S.A. 52:14-17.26 and N.J.S.A. 52:14-17.46.2) and to authorize coverage for all the employees and their dependents thereunder in accordance with the statute and regulations adopted by the State Health Benefits Commission and/or School Employees' Health Benefits Commission. The District will be maintaining Benecard as our Prescription Drug Plan. This plan is comparable in design to the State Employee Prescription Drug Plan. The District will be maintaining Delta Dental as our dental plan. The District elects 25 hours per week (average) as the minimum requirement for full-time status in accordance with N.J.A.C. 17:9-4.6. As a participating employer the District will remit to the State Treasury all charges due on account of employee and dependent coverage and periodic charges in accordance with the requirements of the statute and the rules and regulations duly promulgated thereunder. The District hereby appoints John Serapiglia to act as Certifying Officer in the administration of this program. This resolution shall take effect immediately and coverage shall be effective as of 07/01/2024 or as soon thereafter as it may be effectuated pursuant to the statutes and regulations (can be no less than 75 or 90 days pursuant to the provisions of N.J.S.A. 17:9- 1.4). ($35.88)

Bids may also be submitted to the School Business Administrator/Board Secretary or his designee at the bid opening meeting, prior to the advertised date and time. On the advertised date and time, the School Business Administrator/Board Secretary shall publicly receive and open all bids. No bids shall be received after the time designated in the advertisement. (N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-21(b)). "Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27 et seq." NOTICE OF MEETING PLANNING BOARD OF THE CITY OF ENGLEWOOD Please take notice that in accordance with the provisions of the Open Public Meetings Act, N.J.S.A. 10:4-6, et. seq. and P.L.2020 Chapter 11 approved on March 20, 2020, permitting public meetings to be conducted by means of communication or other electronic equipment, and in consideration of various Executive Orders issued by the Hon. Philip D. Murphy, Governor of the State of New Jersey declaring a State of Emergency and Public Health Emergency in the State of New Jersey, and most recently Executive Order 292 permitting certain public meetings to remain remote. In further consideration of the current coronavirus pandemic, the Planning Board of the City of Englewood will hold one of their regularly scheduled meetings for the month of July 2024 on July 11, 2024 at 7:30 PM by remote video/audio conference. There will be no in-person meeting. The meeting would otherwise have taken place in the Council Chambers at the Englewood Public Safety Complex, 73 South Van Brunt Street, Englewood, New Jersey 07631. The remote meeting may include the adoption of minutes and resolutions, completeness reviews and the granting of related waivers, and public hearings on applications for development and such other matters as may come before the Board, including a closed session. Formal action may be taken. The agenda listing the matters to be considered, and related materials, will be placed on the website of the City of Englewood (www.cityofenglewood.org) for public inspection, and is subject to change. If a member of the public lacks the ability to access the agenda or related materials, or otherwise encounters difficulty in accessing the agenda or related materials, that member of the public may contact Paris Myers, Board Secretary at 201-871-6637 or at pmyers@ cityofenglewood.org to make alternate arrangements to review the agenda and related materials The remote meeting will take place by way of Zoom Conference. Instructions to access the remote meeting and procedures for participating are as follows: Please click the link below to join the webinar: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/86427873502?pwd=AwJJxGIL_DdNZzo3weeFvWDfD2WIaA.EGyXxurP4nFj5HWJ Passcode: 086215 Or Telephone: Dial (for higher quality, dial a number based on your current location): 1 646 931 3860 US 1 929 205 6099 US (New York) Webinar ID: 864 2787 3502 Passcode: 086215 Remote meeting access instructions will be posted on the website of the City of Englewood and will be included on the agenda for the meeting. Any interested party encountering difficulty in accessing the remote meeting may contact Paris Myers, Board Secretary at 201-871-6637 or at pmyers@cityofenglewood.org. The conferencing services offered by Zoom can be accessed via the Zoom App which can be downloaded to a computer or mobile device prior to the remote meeting. Members of the public may participate in the remote meeting according to the customary practice and procedures of the Planning Board of the City of Englewood. This notice is given pursuant to the provisions of the Open Public Meetings Act (N.J.S.A. 10:4-6, et. seq.) and related Guidelines for Remote Public Meetings issued by the Division of Local Government Services (DLGS). The Guidelines have not been statutorily adopted or judicially interpreted. While the Board has attempted to ensure that the procedure to be followed for the conducting of the remote meeting complies with all applicable laws and regulations, the Board cannot provide legal advice to the applicants or the public as to whether the remote meeting does in fact comply, or whether the Guidelines and the Boards decision would be sustained following legal challenge in the Superior Court of New Jersey. IN THE JUVENILE COURT OF LOWNDES COUNTY STATE OF GEORGIA IN THE INTEREST OF: JUVENILE CASE NO: 092-22J-0535 S.H. P., A Minor, DOB: 11/10/2016 AGE: 07 Years SEX: Male SUMMONS AND PROCESS A Petition for Termination of Pa- rental Rights has been filed in this court concerning the above children. A copy of that Petition is attached to this summons. This is a summons requiring you to be in court. If you fail to come to court as required, you may be held in contempt of court and punished accordingly. Now therefore, you, the parties named above, are commanded to be and appear on the date and time stated below, and to remain in attendance from hour to hour, day to day, month to month, year to year, and time to time, as said case may be continued, and until discharged by the court, and you are commanded to lay any and all other business aside and to be and appear before the Juvenile Court of Lowndes County, Geor- gia , located at 120 Prison-Farm Rd, Valdosta, GA 31601 on Au- gust 20th, 2024 at 9:00 o'clock a.m. for the Motions hearing on the Petition for Termination of Parental Rights, and you the said parent, guardian or legal custodian are likewise hereby commanded to be and appear with the aforesaid children in said court at the time and place above stated, each of you then and there to make defense thereto and to show cause why said chil- dren and all parties named herein should not be dealt with accord- ing to the provisions of the law. If you fail to appear, the court can terminate your rights in your ab- sence. NOTICE OF EFFECT OF TERMINATION JUDGMENT Georgia law provides that you can permanently lose your rights as a parent. A petition to termi- nate parental rights has been filed requesting the court to termi- nate your parental rights to if you fail to appear, the court can termi- nate your rights in your absence. lf the court at the trial finds that the facts set out in the petition to terminate parental rights are true and that termination of your rights will serve the best interests of your children, the court can enter a judgment ending your rights to your children. If the judgment terminates your parental rights, you will no longer have any rights to your children. This means that you will not have the right to visit, contact, or have custody of your children or make any decisions affecting your chil- dren or your children's earnings or property. Your children will be legally freed to be adopted by someone else. Even if your parental rights are terminated: (1) You will still be responsible for providing financial support (chil- dren support payments) for your children's care unless and until your children is adopted; and (2) Your children can still inherit from you unless and until your children is adopted. This is a very serious matter. You should contact an attorney imme- diately so that you can be pre- pared for the court hearing. You have the right to hire an attorney and to have him or her represent you. If you cannot afford to hire an attorney, the court will ap- point an attorney if the court finds that you are an indigent person. Whether or not you decide to hire an attorney, you have the right to attend the hearing of your case, to call witnesses on your behalf, and to question those witnesses brought against you. If you have any questions con- cerning this notice, you may call the telephone number of the clerk's office which is 229-333- 5135. READ CAREFULLY Any party to this matter is entitled to representation by an attorney. If the Court determines that said party is unable, without undue financial hardship to provide pay- ment for an attorney and all other legal expenses for representa- tion, then such party becomes an "indigent person" and is en- titled to counsel as provided by O.C.G.A. SS 15-11-103. All parties who feel that they cannot afford an attorney are hereby required to personally contact the Lown- des County Juvenile Court, 327 N. Ashley St. 1st Floor, Valdosta, GA 31601, Monday through Fri- day between 9:00 a.m. through 5:00 p.m. to determine whether they are entitled to the appoint- ment of an attorney. In the event any party to this matter fails to PERSONALLY contact said Lowndes County Juvenile Court prior to the date set for a hear- ing on this matter, said party will be deemed to have waived the right to appointed representation and the Court will proceed ac- cordingly. NO CONTINUANCES OF THIS MATTER SHALL BE GRANTED BY THE COURT FOR THE PURPOSE OF OBTAINING COUNSEL, except in those situ- ations where the interests of two or more parties conflict, and the same is determined by the Court. Further, pursuant to O.C.G.A. SS 15-11-700, please be advised that Personal Health Information (PHI) will be disclosed. Each par- ty should seek to protect their PHI as that party deems appropriate. TO: Mother, China Z. Pace Putative Father, Roderick Hous- ton You are hereby given notice, pur- suant to O.C.G.A. 15-11-283(c), that: "The notice shall advise the bio- logical father who is not the legal father that he may lose all rights to the child named in the petition brought pursuant to this article and will not be entitled to object to the termination of his rights to such child unless, within 30 days of receipt of notice, he files: (1) A petition to legitimate such child; and (2) Notice of the filing of the petition to legitimate with the court in which the termination of parental rights proceeding is pending." Further, pursuant to O.C.G.A. 15- 11-283(e): "The court may enter an order terminating all the parental rights of a biological father, including any right to object thereafter to such proceedings: (1) Who failed to file a timely petition to legitimate the child named in the petition brought pursuant to this article and notice in accordance with subsection ( c) of this Code section; (2) Whose petition to legitimate is subsequently dis- missed for failure to prosecute; or (3) Whose petition to legitimate does not result in a court order finding that he is the legal father of the child named in a petition brought pursuant to this article. READ CAREFULLY Any party to this matter is entitled to representation by an attorney. If the Court determines that said party is unable, without undue financial hardship to provide pay- ment for an attorney and all other legal expenses for representa- tion, then such party becomes an "indigent person" and is en- titled to counsel as provided by O.C.G.A. In the event any party to this matter fails to PERSONALLY contact said Pierce County Juvenile Court prior to the date set for a hear- ing on this matter, said party will be deemed to have waived the right to appointed representation and the Court will proceed ac- cordingly. FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE NORTH HALEDON SCHOOL BOARD ANNOUNCES CANDIDACY INFORMATION July 3, 2024 The North Haledon School District has information available for citizens interested in running for the board of education. The North Haledon Board of Education will have three (3) vacancies in the November 5, 2024 Annual School Election. Three (3) full term seats on the school board each with a term of three years. A candidate must file a nominating petition with the county clerk for their name to appear on the ballot during the November Annual School Election. The deadline to submit the nominating petition is 4:00 p.m. Monday, July 29, 2024. The election is scheduled for Tuesday, November 5, 2024. Prospective school board candidates can download candidate information from the New Jersey School Boards Association's web site at NJSBA School Board Candidate Kit. The School Board Candidate Kit includes information about nominating petitions, legal qualifications for school board candidacy, and the role of the school board member. Information about the New Jersey School Ethics Act and important dates in the school election process are also included. "The work of a school board has become increasingly complex, but rest assured, if you're elected or appointed to your school board, you won't 'go it alone.' NJSBA is New Jersey's only service organization whose sole mission is to train, assist and represent the state's local boards of education. With the New Jersey School Boards Association offering support and training, you will find your term of service on your district board extremely rewarding." Karen Cortellino, M.D, president, New Jersey School Boards Association. By Order of: Tina Iaccheo Business Administrator /Board Secretary North Haledon Board of Education 7/9/24 $70.52

This Notice is being published in accordance with the New Jersey Municipal Land Use Law. Scott J. Good, Esquire Cooper Levenson, P.A.
