HUNTERDON COUNTY EDUCATIONAL SERVICES COMMISSION SPECIFICATIONS BID # NP072425 HUNTERDON COUNTY EDUCATIONAL SERVICES COMMISSION PUBLIC/NONPUBLIC AND OUT DISTRICT HANDICAPPED STUDENT TRANSPORTATION 2024 - 2025 School Year 1. All transportation bidders shall comply with the rules and procedures of the New Jersey State Department of Education pertaining to transportation as they now exist or may become effective during the term of the contract. If awarded a contract, your company/firm will be required to certify to the Board of Directors that you are in compliance with the Omnibus Transportation Employee Testing Act of 1991 and associated regulations. A statement of assurance is required in this Bid. 2. Transportation equipment shall meet all current federal and state requirements governing pupil transportation. 3. All vehicles shall be systematically inspected twice within the year to ensure that such vehicles and equipment are in safe and proper operating condition. Vehicles are to be obviously identified as "School Vehicles". All buses will be 8 years old or newer with a 54 passenger capacity unless otherwise specified. 4. Contractors shall ensure that every school bus driver will: a) immediately inform the principal(s) of the receiving school(s) and the school business administrator or designee of the district board of education providing the transportation following an accident which involves an injury, death, or property damage, b) complete and file the accident report as prescribed by the Commissioner of Education and deliver it to the principal(s) of the receiving school(s) by the conclusion of the next working day, and c) deliver the report to the school business administrator or designee of the district board of education providing the transportation after it is signed by the principal(s) of the receiving school(s) in accordance with N.J.A.C. 6A:27-12.2. In addition, the driver must also complete and file a motor vehicle accident report in accordance with N.J.S.A. 39-4:130. 5. All transportation contracts require the approval of the County Superintendent of Schools. Pupil transportation contracts are deemed to include all the rules and procedures pertaining to pupil transportation though not expressly stated. 6. Payments to contractors shall be made after the fifteenth day of the month provided that an appropriate voucher is prepared by the contractor according to Commission specifications and is submitted before the fifth of the previous month. Ten equal payments will be made. Payment will be withheld if ALL Contracts are not returned with the appropriate paperwork within 10 days after receipt of such documents. 7. The term of the contract shall commence with the opening of schools in August and shall terminate with the closing of schools in June. 8. Bids shall be submitted on a per diem basis. If any change in the described route results in increased or decreased miles in excess of 10%,the amount of the contract shall be adjusted by a per mile charge (not to exceed $2.50/mi.) as specified in the bid 9. The net result of any mileage adjustment to a nonpublic school transportation contract shall not exceed the maximum cost per student in accordance with N.J.S.A. 18A:391a. 10. Bids shall include the cost of liability insurance in the amount of at least $5,000,000 liability insurance. A certificate of insurance is to accompany the bid and must name the contracting board of education as an additional insured party of the policy. No contract shall be valid without the certificate of insurance. The successful bidder's insurance company shall forward notice, in the event of cancellation of the policy, ten (10) days prior to the date of termination of the coverage specified. 11. Each bid shall be accompanied by a bid bond or certified check for five percent (5%) of the amount of the annual contract cost but in no case may exceed $50,000. The Bid Bond shall include the Bid number of the bid for which it is submitted. This guarantee shall be made payable to the Hunterdon County Educational Services Commission Board of Directors. Such deposit shall be forfeited upon refusal of a bidder to execute a contract; otherwise, checks shall be returned when the contract is executed and a surety (performance) bond is filed with the Hunterdon County Educational Services Board of Directors. The bid security check for unsuccessful bidders will be returned as soon as possible after the bid opening, but in no event later than 30 days after the bid opening. When a bid is accepted by Hunterdon County Educational Services Commission and the contractor is notified, this shall constitute a binding agreement whereby if the contractor fails to begin the route and the Commission has to contract with another contractor at a higher rate, the difference in the per diem rate for the full 182 days will be deducted from the first check paid to the contractor for any other routes being run. If no other routes are being run, the bid bond will be forfeited. 12. A Corporate Surety Bond in an amount equal to the amount of the annual contract shall be required of the successful bidder. The Surety Bond shall include the Multi Contract Number(s) or Route number(s). A personal bond will be accepted for Temporary Contracts, under threshold, non-renewable contracts and addendums for increases ONLY. Special consideration by the School Business Administrator will be given to vendors after 5 years successful experience with the Educational Services Commission for acceptance of a personal bond. Each bid shall be accompanied by a signed statement, (Prescribed Form of Questionnaire), included in these specifications. 13. It is the intent of the Board of Directors to award a contract for transportation as soon as possible after the date set for the opening of bids and to require the successful contractor to provide transportation for the period August, 2022 through June, 2023 accepting such days as may be declared holidays or "no school" days as established by the school calendar. Routes may be continued for extended summer programs to maintain consistency for special education students. 14. In an emergency where the contractor cannot meet the schedule, or if the school has a change in schedule, the party responsible for any change shall immediately notify the other party. 15. The school calendar, copy attached, is part of these specifications and of the contract. In the event the school is closed due to inclement weather or other emergencies, the contractor shall be notified as soon as possible by the public school authorities. Contractors are advised to listen to school closing announcements broadcast over local networks. 16. The transportation contractor shall only transport passengers assigned by the district board of education. Children belonging to drivers may not ride any route under this contract. No route contained in these specifications may be combined with any other route. The vehicle(s) assigned to the routes specified herein shall not be utilized for other purposes during the time periods designated by the route descriptions. 17. No transportation contract shall be subcontracted without the prior written approval of the Board of Directors. 18. Vehicle(s) shall arrive and/or depart the assigned school(s) no earlier or later as indicated on the enclosed route description. 19. The Board of Directors reserves the right to make modifications of routes subject to the provisions of the rules of the State Board of Education. 20. Any modifications to these specifications after the public advertisement for bids and prior to the scheduled bid opening, will be made known by certified mail or emailed to all bidders who received specifications. 21. In the event the contractor fails to provide service in accordance with these specifications and stated requirements, the contractor shall be considered in breach of contract. Cancellation of the contract and/or enforcement of Contractor's Performance Bond may result in accordance with local board policy. Bids are to be placed in a sealed envelope plainly marked, "TRANSPORTATION BID." Along with the Bid Number "NP072425". Bids will be received at Hunterdon County ESC, 27 Belvidere Avenue, Clinton, New Jersey 08809 up to 11:00 AM prevailing time on Tuesday, July 9, 2024 Any bid received after the time and date specified will not be considered. If forwarded by mail, the sealed envelope containing the bid form and bond, and marked as directed, must be enclosed in another envelope and addressed to the Hunterdon County Educational Services Commission, 27 Belvidere Avenue, Clinton, New Jersey 08809 .The Board of Directors will assume no responsibility for delivery of the bid on time. 22. During the term of the transportation contract and on days when school is in session the successful bidder will be expected to maintain an operational base staffed by a responsible person who can be easily reached by telephone between the hours of 7:00 AM and 4:00 PM, or later if vehicles are still on the road. 23. The contract shall be awarded on the basis of cost per vehicle. Any change in the described route resulting in an increase or decrease, shall be adjusted in price on the basis of an extension cost per mile. 24. The contract shall not be affected by the number of pupils being transported. If the number of pupils transported increases beyond the original estimation, there will be no charge for these additional pupils until the legal capacity of the vehicle(s) to be used is reached; and if the number of pupils to be transported shall be less than the original estimation, there will be no deduction in the sums to be paid the contractor. 25. For each route bid upon, the bidder shall state a single sum which shall be the bidder's per diem rate or charge for the use of the vehicle and for all transportation services for all pupils eligible under the contract. The bid shall also stipulate the additional cost per vehicle mile for individual extensions of this route which are in excess of 10% of the vehicle mileage originally established by these specifications. Conversely, the cost of the contract will decrease if the mileage of the route decreases by a minimum of 10%. "Deadhead miles are not to be considered. All such requests for increases should be received by the Commission in writing within TEN calendar days that such extensions commence. After ten days it will be assumed the extension has been made at NO CHARGE and the contractor will forfeit his right to an increase. The Commission reserves the right to deny any requests for extensions received at a later date. Similarly, if the Coordinator requests a mileage reading on a route where pupil deletion(s) may entail a cost reduction on a route, the contractor has FIVE calendar days from the date of the Contractor's notification of the deletion to supply the Coordinator with this information. In the absence of this information after the time limit, the Coordinator alone will determine mileage and any necessary reduction in contractual payments. 26. On routes which require transportation to more than one school the successful bidder will be expected to follow the school calendar and daily scheduled hours of EACH school, including early dismissals as may be scheduled by the individual school. No additional payments shall be made to contractors for early dismissals, special examination schedules, detours, extra sessions, etc. 27. Should a bus attendant or aide be required on a particular route, the bidder shall provide a separate per diem cost for the attendant. 28. Subject to the Board's right to reject all bids, the contract shall be awarded to the qualified and responsible bidder who offers to perform all the transportation services prescribed by these specifications for the lowest annual total cost. 29. The award of the contract shall be subject to all the provisions of Title 18A of the Revised Statutes applicable thereto and all pertinent regulations of the Department of Education of the State of New Jersey including, but not limited to, requirements relating to the form of contract and to approval of all proposals by the County Superintendent of Schools. The successful bidder will be considered an independent contractor and shall not be deemed to be an agent, servant, employee, or representative of the board of education. 30. Where alternate bids are specified, the Board of Directors may elect to award the contract(s) on the basis of either the base bid or the alternate bids whichever in its judgment it shall determine to be in the best interest of the Board of Directors. Alternate bids MUST SPECIFY INDIVIDUAL PER DIEM COSTS FOR EACH ROUTE IN THE COMBINATION. In the event one combination route is canceled, the per diem rate must be held for the remaining route. 31. This in no way abrogates the rights of the Board of Directors to reserve unto itself the opportunity to waive any informalities in, or to reject any and/or all bids. The Board of Directors reserves the right to make awards in the best interests of the Board of Education consistent with the law. 32. The contractor receiving the bid award will contact the parent or guardian as soon as possible to make them aware of the transportation arrangements for their child. Where applicable the contractor will contact the school to make necessary arrangements. (Special Needs) 33. The contractor must have sufficient inventory on hand before bidding to execute the service being bid or the bid will be rejected. 34. In the event the contractor fails to provide service in accordance with these specifications and stated requirements, the contractor will be considered in Default of contract and subject to a per diem penalty deduction based on a 182 day school year, as follows: A. Tardiness without good cause 2 Times the Per Diem cost of route per occurrence. or notification. B. Driver/Contractor failure to 2 Times the Per Diem cost of route per occurrence pick up all pupils assigned to a route or missing stops. C. Failure to operate either 2 Times the Per Diem cost of route per occurrence morning and/or afternoon Plus $250.00 per Occurrence for A. B. or C. 35. Special Needs Route information sheets (With a description of the actual streets traveled.) must be in the possession of the Transportation Coordinator of the ESC before the route begins. "The direction of the vehicle from the last stop shall be along the safest most direct route to the destination." The mileage in these reports is used to bill constituent districts. If after the first three days of school the mileage figures and routing information have not been received in writing, the Commission's October payment to you will be delayed accordingly. Route information must be included for each student and must include a description of the actual streets traveled. 36. There are several routes with one or two stops. Bidders are encouraged to suggest the consolidation of routes and include them in their bids. They will be considered as alternatives bearing in mind the cost savings, length of time on the bus for students, safety and impact on other routes. Other issues may impact the decision to accept or reject these route alternatives. The decision will be made at the discretion of the Commission. At all times the best interest of the students and the districts will be of the utmost importance. Alternative bids MUST CARRY INDIVIDUAL ROUTE PER DIEM COSTS for the routes being consolidated. Should one of the consolidated routes be canceled, the contract will be adjusted to reflect the per diem rate for the remaining route. REPORTING STUDENT LEFT UNATTENDED ON THE SCHOOL BUS Every owner/operator of a school vehicle shall immediately inform the administrator or principal of the receiving school and the chief school administrator of the district board of education providing for the transportation or their designee following an incident in which it has been determined that a student has been left unattended on the school bus at the end of the route. School district or school bus contractor personnel who discover, or to whom it is reported, that a student has been left on a school bus shall immediately report the incident to the owner/operator of the vehicle. A student is considered to have been left unattended on the school bus at the end of the route when the driver has left the vicinity of the bus. The "End of a Transportation Route", pursuant to N.J.S.A. 18A:39-26, "Terminates at the point where all of the children leave the bus and before the driver moves on to the next route" . EQUIPMENT 1. Transportation equipment (vans, buses, safety vests, car seats, etc.) shall be provided by vendors and meet all current federal and state requirements governing pupil transportation and any additional specifications of the district(s) boards of education. All wheelchair securements are to be a minimum 5 point system. 2. All vehicles being used under this contract shall be equipped with working two way radios/phones. FCC guidelines will be adhered to. 3. All vehicles shall be systematically inspected twice within the year, as per state law. No vehicle having failed DMV inspection shall be used for student transportation until necessary repairs have been made and the vehicle has passed reinspection. 4. The Board of Directors or designee reserves the right, during the term of the contract, to inspect for approval, any vehicle in use on routes covered by the contract and further has the right to ride any vehicle or route covered by the contract. 5. The contractor must provide and maintain an adequate number of vehicles including spares, to safely transport any and all students assigned to the routes contained in this bid and to assure uninterrupted service in the event of mechanical breakdown. 6. The Board of Directors will not reimburse the contractor for the cost of repairs for any damages to the vehicles caused by students or other occurrences. 7. All vehicles must be identified as "school vehicles" while in use under contract for Hunterdon County Educational Services Commission. 8. Maintenance and supervision of the route and vehicle must be provided by the contractor within twenty (20) miles of HCESC Transportation Terminal (2026 Rt. 31 North, Glen Gardner, NJ) in Hunterdon. DRIVERS 1. The contractor shall provide the Board of Education or designee, prior to the first day of school, a list of drivers whom he proposes will drive vehicles under this contract, and including names, phone number, and driver's license number. This information shall be provided to the Commission on the route information worksheet, which must be completed before the execution of a contract. This information shall periodically be updated during the term of the contract, when changes occur. All routes must have a steady driver assigned to maintain consistency. 2. All drivers under contract shall have complied with the State Rules and Regulations pertaining to the fingerprinting process. Please be sure to complete form NJSA 18A:39-18 license/criminal history background check for submission to the county superintendent before the start of school. FIRST PAYMENT WILL BE WITHHELD UNTIL THIS IS RECEIVED. Also, a statement of assurance regarding non-criminal employment check pursuant to chapter 116 laws of 1986 and supplementing title 18A:-6 must be submitted to the Transportation Coordinator before the first contract payment is made. 3. Drivers and Sub Drivers must familiarize themselves with their routes and stops by actually driving the route, noting stops, before the first day the contract begins. It is the contractor's responsibility that the drivers meet these requirements at no cost to the Board of Directors or designee. 4. The contractor will ensure that every school bus driver will immediately inform the Board of Directors or designee following an Accident which involves an injury, death, or property damage. The driver must complete and file the accident report as prescribed by the Commissioner of Education in quadruplicate and deliver it to the Board of Directors or designee by the Conclusion of the next working day. The driver must also complete and file a motor vehicle accident report in accordance with NJSA 394:130. 5. Seating charts for each route shall be provided by the driver according to N.J. Administrative Code 6:21-11.3 paragraph E. By the third week in September all charts should be finalized and submitted to the Board of Directors or designee. Seating charts are to be updated as needed throughout the school year and a copy available in each vehicle. 6. If, in the judgment of the Coordinator, any driver of a vehicle operating under a coordinated contract shall be deemed to be an unsuitable person to drive a school bus because of lack of driving skill, inability to control pupils, smoking in the vehicle, failure to comply with the rules and regulations, incapacity, unbecoming conduct, or other good cause, The Board of Directors, through the office of the Transportation Coordinator, may request the contractor to remove the driver in question. If the contractor shall fail to comply with the request, the Board may require the contractor to show cause why his failure to comply shall not be deemed to constitute a breach of contract and the Board may take necessary steps to annul the transportation contract. 7.The driver shall be a reliable person of good character who shall possess the qualifications and communication skills necessary to perform the duties of the position, and comply with the rules set forth for drivers in all federal, state and local regulations. This shall include but not be limited to being able to speak clearly and be understood on the two-way radio system. 8. If a pupil assigned to a special education route is not present at the assigned bus stop for three consecutive days the contractor shall report this absence to the Transportation Coordinator. 9.The bus driver shall be in full charge of the school bus at all times and will be required to report unmanageable students to the Transportation Coordinator and principal of the receiving school, in writing. 10. Drivers/Aides are required to wear Picture ID Badges at all times. AIDES 1. The successful bidder will be expected to employ aides who are reliable persons of good character who shall possess the qualifications and communication skills necessary to perform the duties of the position and who can discharge their duties effectively. All requirements for finger-printing and background checks will be completed by the contractor before an aide or substitute aide is assigned to any Commission route. 2. If, in the judgment of the Coordinator, the aide is unsuitable for a particular route, the Coordinator will require the contractor to replace the aide immediately. If the Contractor shall fail to comply with the request, the Board of Directors may require the contractor to show cause why his failure to comply shall not be deemed to constitute a breach of contract and the Board may take necessary steps to annul the transportation contract. 3. The aide's duties shall include but not be limited to the following: * Assist pupils on and off the vehicle, to and from their seats. In special cases, assistance may be necessary to and from the front door of the pupil's residence and the entrance of the school. * Buckle pupils in seats and ensure that they remain buckled. * Assign seats and insure that pupils are directed to their specific seat. * Maintain order on the vehicle. * Maintain a vigilant watch over the vehicle and clearly report any incidents which occur on the vehicle in writing to the Coordinator. 4. Since the aide is the contractor's primary contact with parents and pupils, they also possess a public relations function as well, and should be trained in dealing with handicapped pupils and their parents. 5. The contractor shall supply a back-up aide if the regular aide is unavailable on a particular day. Failure to run a route without the aide or a suitable substitute assigned to it, will be considered contractual default and result in a penalty charge of the per diem cost of the aide. The continued or excessive absences of an aide on a route is grounds for termination of the transportation contract. 6. All drivers and aides are required to comply with tuberculosis testing. ALL DRIVERS/AIDES HIRED BY A CONTRACTOR TO BE USED ON COMMISSION ROUTES WILL BE REQUIRED TO ATTEND ANY APPLICABLE IN-SERVICE WORKSHOPS CONDUCTED BY THE COMMISSION. IF THE DRIVER/AIDES ARE UNABLE TO ATTEND A REPRESENTATIVE FROM THE OFFICE MOST BE THERE. Piggy Backing is forbidden 1. The Commission expressly forbids the practice of "piggybacking" i.e., a contractor transporting pupils other than those designated on the original route list or added to the route on a vehicle carrying pupils whose transportation has been arranged through the Commission. The converse is also forbidden in that no contractor shall transport pupils whose transportation has been arranged through the Commission on vehicles contracted through any other sources (School Districts, other Commissions, parents, etc.). This applies also to the co-mingling of different contracts all operating under the authority of the Commission. 2. A contractor found to be engaging in said practice will face immediate cancellation of the contract(s) on which the infraction occurred and/or a reduction of the per diem cost of the route(s) involved for each day the infraction occurred. Either or both options will be taken at the discretion of the Board through the office of the Transportation Coordinator. The per diem penalty shall apply regardless of whether the co-mingling occurred on one or all of the daily trips on the route(s) involved. PRESCHOOL HANDICAPPED All routes which entail the transportation of pre-school handicapped pupils must meet the following minimum requirements: 1. Children four years and under must be in a child safety seat or a 5-point harness. 2. There will never be more children in a vehicle than there are child restraints and seat belts. 3. The penalty for infractions is the withholding of the per diem cost of the contracted route for each day the infraction occurred. Continued infractions will be considered contractual default. 4. All child restraints used must be federally approved and dynamically safety tested. 5. Additional pre-school pupils to the route must be provided with the required seating. AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EXHIBIT A MANDATORY EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY LANGUAGE N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. (P.L.1975, c.127) N.J.A.C. 17:27 et seq. GOODS, GENERAL SERVICES, AND PROFESSIONAL SERVICES CONTRACTS During the performance of this contract, the contractor agrees as follows: The contractor or subcontractor, where applicable, will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex. Except with respect to affectional or sexual orientation and gender identity or expression, the contractor will ensure that equal employment opportunity is afforded to such applicants in recruitment and employment, and that employees are treated during employment, without regard to their age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affection-al or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex. Such equal employment opportunities shall include, but not be limited to the following: employment, up-grading, demotion, or transfer; recruitment or recruitment advertising; layoff or termination; rates of pay or other forms of compensation; and selection for training, including apprentice-ship. The contractor agrees to post in conspicuous places, available to employees and applicants for employment, notices to be provided by the Public Agency Compliance Officer setting forth provisions of this nondiscrimination clause. The contractor or subcontractor, where applicable will, in all solicitations or advertisements for employees placed by or on behalf of the contractor, state that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex. The contractor or subcontractor will send to each labor union, with which it has a collective bargaining agreement, a notice, to be provided by the agency contracting officer, advising the labor union of the contractor's commitments under this chapter and shall post copies of the notice in conspicuous places available to employees and applicants for employment. The contractor or subcontractor, where applicable, agrees to comply with any regulations promulgated by the Treasurer pursuant to N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq., as amended and supplemented from time to time and the Americans with Disabilities Act. The contractor or subcontractor agrees to make good faith efforts to meet targeted county employment goals established in accordance with N.J.A.C. l7:27-5.2. The contractor or subcontractor agrees to inform in writing its appropriate recruitment agencies including, but not limited to, employment agencies, placement bureaus, colleges, universities, and labor unions, that it does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, creed, col-or, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, and that it will discontinue the use of any recruitment agency which engages in direct or indirect discriminatory practices. The contractor or subcontractor agrees to revise any of its testing procedures, if necessary, to assure that all personnel testing conforms with the principles of job related testing, as established by the statutes and court decisions of the State of New Jersey and as established by applicable Federal law and applicable Federal court decisions. In conforming with the targeted employment goals, the contractor or subcontractor agrees to review all procedures relating to transfer, upgrading, downgrading and layoff to ensure that all such actions are taken without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, consistent with the statutes and court decisions of the State of New Jersey, and applicable Federal law and applicable Federal court decisions. The contractor shall submit to the public agency, after notification of award but prior to execution of a goods and services contract, one of the following three documents: Letter of Federal Affirmative Action Plan Approval; Certificate of Employee Information Report; or Employee Information Report Form AA-302 (electronically provided by the Division and distributed to the public agency through the Division's website at: http://www.state.nj.us/treasury/contract_compliance/. The contractor and its subcontractors shall furnish such reports or other documents to the Division of Purchase & Property, CCAU, EEO Monitoring Program as may be requested by the office from time to time in order to carry out the purposes of these regulations, and public agencies shall furnish such information as may be requested by the Division of Purchase & Property, CCAU, EEO Monitoring Program for conducting a compliance investigation pursuant to N.J.A.C. 17:27-1.1et seq. STOCKHOLDER DISCLOSURE 1.All bidders are hereby notified that every corporation and partnership, according to the provision of Chapter 33, Laws of 1977 of the State of New Jersey, must submit a statement prior to the receipt of the bid or accompanying the bid, setting forth the names and addresses of all stockholders in the corporation or partnership who own 10% or more of its stock, of any class or of all partners in the partnership, who own 10% or greater interest therein, as the case may be. If one or more such stockholder or partner is itself a corporation or partnership, the stockholders holding 10% or more of that corporation's stock, or the individual partner's 10% or greater interest in that partnership, as the case may be, shall also be listed. The disclosure shall be continued until names and addresses of every non-corporate stockholder, and individual partner, exceeding the 10% ownership criteria established in this act, has been listed. BUSINESS REGISTRATION 1.All bidders are hereby notified that every business organization must submit with their bid a copy of their Business Registration Certificate, in compliance with P.L. 2004, c 57 of the State of New Jersey. DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING 1.If awarded a contract, your company/firm will be required to certify to the board of education that you are in compliance with the drug and alcohol requirements of the Omnibus Transportation Employee Testing Act. BACKGROUND CHECK 1.The contractor shall ensure compliance with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 18A:39-17 through 20 governing criminal history background checks, and shall annually submit documents necessary to obtain the driver abstract records to the county superintendent of schools on or before August 31 or upon employment for newly hired drivers. TUBERCULOSIS TESTING 1.The contractor shall ensure that all bus drivers and bus aides are tested for tuberculosis infection in compliance with N.J.A.C. 6A:32-6.3. DISCLOSURE OF POLITICAL CONTRIBUTIONS 1.The contractor is advised of the responsibility to file an annual disclosure statement on political contributions with the New Jersey Election Law Enforcement Commission pursuant to N.J.S.A. 19:44A-20.13 (P.L. 2005, c.271, s.3) if the contractor receives contracts in the aggregate in excess of $50,000 from public entities in a calendar year. It is the contractor's responsibility to determine if filing is necessary. Additional information on this requirement is available from ELEC at 888-313-3532 or at www.elec.state.nj.us. DRIVER AND AIDE TRAINING 1.The contractor shall ensure compliance with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 18A:39-19.2 and 3 governing the training of school bus drivers and aides, and shall annually submit required documents to the county superintendent of schools on or before August 31 or upon employment for newly hired drivers and/or aides. https://www.nj.gov/education/finance/transportation/training/dis/ https://www.nj.gov/education/finance/transportation/training/requirements.pdf MAINTENANCE OF CONTRACT RECORDS 1.The contractor is advised that relevant records of private vendors or other persons entering into contracts with covered entities are subject to audit or review by the Office of the State Comptroller pursuant to N.J.S.A. 52:15C-14(d). The contractor shall maintain all documentation related to products, transactions, or services under this contract for a period of five years from the date of final payment. Such records shall be made available to the New Jersey Office of the State Comptroller upon request. DISCLOSURE OF INVESTMENT ACTIVITIES IN IRAN/PROHIBIT RUSSIA-BELARUS ACTIVITIES 1.All bidders must complete a certification attesting, under penalty of perjury, that neither the person or entity, nor any of its parents, subsidiaries, or affiliates, is identified on the Department of Treasury's chapter 25 list as a person or entity engaging in investment activities in Iran, or provide a detailed, accurate and precise description of such activities. Failure to complete the certification will render a bidder's proposal non-responsive. INCLUDED WITH THE BID, BIDDERS MUST PROVIDE THE FOLLOW: 1.A brief historical background of your company, including Bus Terminal location, number of school buses and the resumes of all management staff assigned to service the contract. 2.Demonstration of satisfactory experience and operational capability to perform the requirements of the contract. Include a list of school districts you serve and names and phone numbers of contact persons. NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARINGPublic notice is hereby given that on Wednesday, July 31, 2024, at 7:00 p.m. in the basement of the Orderville Town Office, located at 425 East State Street, Orderville, Utah; 1. Bids-The Ocean County Utilities Authority, Bayville, New Jersey, will receive sealed Bids delivered to 501 Hickory Lane, Bayville, New Jersey 08721, for Contract No. SD2314 SWPCF Aerated Grit Chamber Improvements until 2 p.m., local time, on Thursday, August 8, 2024 when all Bids duly received will be opened publicly and read aloud. 2. Project Description-Contract No. SD2314 SWPCF Aerated Grit Chamber Improvements, the Work, includes, but is not necessarily limited to the demolition, removal, and replacement of new grit removal systems in all three (3) Aerated Grit Chambers (AGC) including the rehabilitation of the chambers' interior concrete surfaces, removal of existing steps and installation of new FRP ladders in all three (3) access hatches. The site is located at the Southern Water Pollution Control Facility (SWPCF), 150 Cedar Run Dock Road, West Creek, NJ 08092. 3. Bidding Documents-Full sets of Bidding Documents may be picked up from The Ocean County Utilities Authority, 501 Hickory Lane, Bayville, New Jersey 08721, on or after Tuesday, July 9, 2024 on Business Days between the hours of 8:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. A non-refundable check in the amount of $50 made payable to the Ocean County Utilities Authority, will be required for each set of complete Bidding Documents requested by a prospective Bidder or any other party. Cash or credit cards are not accepted. If a check is mailed, please direct it to the attention of the Engineering and Construction Department. Provide the name of the individual at the firm that is requesting the Bidding Documents to whom all correspondence generated during the bid period may be addressed (i.e. Item No. 6 below). Bidding Documents will be shipped only if the requesting party includes their overnight shipping service number. 4. Bid Security-In accordance with N.J.S.A. 40A:11-21, each Bid shall enclose Bid Security, as specified in the Instructions to Bidders, in the amount of ten percent (10%) of the Bidder's Bid, but not in excess of $20,000. 5. Site Visit/Pre-Bid Conference - A site visit/pre-bid conference will be held on Thursday, July 25, 2024 at 9 a.m. at the Southern Water Pollution Control Facility, 150 Cedar Run Dock Road, West Creek, New Jersey, 08092. The site visit/pre-bid conference will take approximately 2 hours. Although not mandatory, all Bidders (or their authorized representatives) are encouraged to attend the site visit/pre-bid conference. Other parties interested in the Work are encouraged to attend the tour and pre-bid conference. Please copy the Engineering and Construction Department Contract and Office Specialist Daniela DeVita (ddevita@ocua.com) on any e-mails or correspondence you may send to the Construction Manager or the Authority. The Authority is doing everything within its capabilities to protect employees' health, safety and welfare, while at the same time continuing to provide the level of services expected by our participants. We are committed to ensuring the workplace is safe and healthy for all employees. As a potential Bidder for this Project, the Authority asks that you screen any proposed attendees that you may have attend any site visit. Limit attendance to one attendee from your firm at the most. It is also asked of you, to perform a specific screening of your employee(s) whom may be assigned to attend these meetings out of an abundance of caution and in the interest of public health. 6. Addenda-Notice of revisions or addenda to advertisement or bid documents shall be in accordance with N.J.S.A. 40A:11-23(a) and N.J.S.A. 40A:11-23(c). 7. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27 et seq. equal employment opportunities; N.J.S.A. 52:25-24.2 corporate, LLC, and/or partnership ownership; N.J.S.A. 52:32-44 business registration of public contracts; and the "Public Works Contractor Registration Act," N.J.S.A. 34:11-56.48. 8. Local Public Contract Requirements-The New Jersey Department of Labor and Workforce Development Prevailing Wage Determination for the Work is Confirmation No. 80824. 9. New Jersey Election Law Enforcement Commission-Bidders will be required to comply with the requirements of the New Jersey Election Law Enforcement Commission pursuant to N.J.S.A. 19:44A-20.4 and N.J.S.A. 19:44A-20.27. 10. Surety Bonding a. Bidders are required to comply with N.J.S.A. 40A:11-21, 40A:11-22, and 40A:11-23.2 and furnish all guarantees and certificates with the bid, in accordance with applicable laws. b. In accordance with N.J.A.C. 7:22-3.17(g) and N.J.A.C. 7:22-4.17(g), all applicable surety bonds required in connection with the advertisement and award of building contracts or sub-agreements must be written by a surety company listed on the Federal Treasury List (Department Circular 570-Surety Companies Acceptable on Federal Bonds), incorporated herein by reference. Copies of this document may be obtained from the United States Department of Treasury, Financial Management Service or their web site www.fms.treas.gov/c570/c570html. 11. Requests for Interpretation-All questions or inquiries concerning the Bidding Documents or the Work shall be submitted in writing to the Engineer. 12. Award-The Owner will act within sixty (60) days after the date of Bid opening to award the Contract to the lowest responsible bidder, reject all Bids or take any other appropriate action. The Owner expressly reserves the right to reject Bids, waive any minor informalities or non-material exceptions, re-advertise for Bids or withhold the award for any reason the Owner determines, in accordance with the applicable law. Any award may be made beyond sixty (60) days after any agreed upon extension of the award period, between the Bidders and Owner. The award of this contract is subject to the 10-day review period provided by N.J.S.A. 40:20-71.3. 13. Prevailing Wages-The New Jersey Prevailing Wage Act, N.J.S.A. 34:11-56.27 et seq. is hereby made a part of the Contract. The Contractor's execution of the Agreement is its guarantee that neither it nor any subcontractors it has employed to perform the Work are listed or are on record in the Office of Commissioner, Department of Labor and Workforce Development, as one who has failed to pay prevailing wages in accordance with applicable law. 7/9/2024 (85.36)

SHERIFF'S SALE mercercounty.org or nj.com SUPERIOR COURT OF NEW JERSEY CHANCERY DIVISION MERCER COUNTY Docket No. F-004522-21 PNC BANK, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION, plaintiff Vs. PEDRO A. COLON JR. & KELLY MCGEE, Defendant Execution. By virtue of the above stated writ of execution to me directed and delivered, I will expose for sale at public venue, on July 10, 2024, between the hours of twelve and five o'clock in the afternoon of said day, that is to say at two o'clock p.m. in the Court House, in the City of Trenton, in the in the County of Mercer and State of New Jersey. Property to be sold is located in the TOWNSHIP OF HAMILTON, County of MERCER, State of New Jersey. Premises commonly known as: 637 NORWAY AVENUE, HAMILTON, NJ 08629 Being Known as: Lot 37, Block 1875 on the official Tax Map of the TOWNSHIP OF HAMILTON. Dimensions: 19FT. X 100FT. Nearest Cross Street: GREENWOOD AVENUE The Sheriff hereby reserves the right to adjourn this sale without further notice by publication. *Subject to any unpaid taxes, municipal liens or other charges, and any such taxes, charges, liens, insurance premiums or other advances made by Plaintiff prior to this sale. All interested parties are to conduct and rely upon their own independent investigation to ascertain whether or not any outstanding interests remain of record and/or have priority over the lien being foreclosed and, if so. the current amount due thereon. If the sale is set aside for any reason, the Purchaser at the sale shall be entitled only to a return of the deposit paid. The Purchaser shall have no further recourse against the Mortgagor, the Mortgagee or the Mortgagee's attorney. ***If after the sale and satisfaction of the mortgage debt, including costs and expenses, there remains any surplus money, the money will be deposited into the Superior Court Trust Fund and any person claiming the surplus. or any part thereof, may file a motion pursuant to Court Rules 4:64-3 and 4:57-2 stating the nature and extent of that person's claim and asking for an order directing payment of the surplus money. The Sheriff or other person conducting the sale will have information regarding the surplus, if any. The occupancy status of the property is: OCCUPIED BY UNKNOWN The above advertisement does not constitute a full legal description of the Real Estate. The full legal description is available at the office of the County Clerk during regular business hours. (Full legal description consists ONLY of outside dimensions.) The approximate amount of the judgment sought to be satisfied by the sale is the sum of $239,284.91 plus interest and costs. At the time of the Sale, Twenty Percent of the amount bid will be required as a Deposit by the Purchaser, in Cash, Money Order, Certified Check, Cashier's or Treasurer's Check. The Balance is payable Ten Days from the date of sale, in Cash, Money Order, Certified Check, Cashier's Check, or Treasurer's Check, with lawful interest calculated on the Balance Due, from the end of the redemption period, until Balance is paid. The Sheriff hereby reserves the right to adjourn the sale in this case without further notice by publication. Approximate Upset Price: $148,468.78 If after the sale and satisfaction of the mortgage debt, including costs and expenses, there remains any surplus money, the money will be deposited into the Superior Court Trust Fund and any persons claiming the surplus, or any part thereof, may file a motion pursuant to Court Rule 4:64-3 and 4:57-2 stating the nature and extent of that person's claim and asking for an order directing payment of the surplus money. The Sheriff or other person conducting the sale will have information regarding the surplus, if any. The defendant may request two statutory postponements prior to the sale, not exceeding four weeks for each one. The fee for each is $28 payable only in cash or money order. PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS NOTICE DOES NOT APPLY TO THE TENANTS LIVING AT A PROPERTY UNLESS SPECIFIED BY A COURT ORDER. John A. Kemler, Sheriff Attorney BROCK & SCOTT, PLLC 844-856-6646 Attorney File # 21-04977 FC01 Sheriff's # 24001525 Prt fee:$315.00 June 18, 25, July 2, 9 -1a

text: ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS Project No: P1261-00 New Forest Fire Tower Location: Jackson State Nursery, 370 East Veterans Highway Jackson, Ocean County, NJ A MANDATORY PRE-BID MEETING IS SCHEDULED FOR 10:00 A.M. JULY 31, 2024. LOCATION: JACKSON STATE NURSERY 370 EAST VETERANS HIGHWAY JACKSON, OCEAN COUNTY, NJ 08527. GPS COORDINATES (40.099655, -74.316512) CONTACT PERSON: EUGENE CARDONE VIA OFFICE (609) 633-2648 OR VIA CELL (609) 306-2574. ONLY BIDS SUBMITTED BY CONTRACTORS WHO ATTEND THIS MEETING WILL BE ACCEPTED. ALL BIDDERS MUST BE CLASSIFIED WITH DPMC WITH ONE OF THE FOLLOWING TRADES: Single Bid (lump sum all trades) General Construction (C008) OR General Construction / Alterations & Additions (C009) CCE: $1,815,626 IN ACCORDANCE WITH N.J.S.A. 52:32-2, THIS PROJECT SHALL BE BID AS A SINGLE BID (LUMP SUM ALL TRADES). BIDDER MUST BE CLASSIFIED THEMSELVES OR NAME THEIR CLASSIFIED SUBCONTRACTOR(S) FOR THE FOLLOWING TRADE(S): Structural Steel & Ornamental Iron (C029) HVACR (C032) Electrical (C047) Failure to list all of the required DPMC Classified sub-contractors will render the bid non-responsive. A list of Classified Contractors / Sub-Contractors are available at the following Web site: http://www.state.nj.us/treasury/dpmc/contract_search.shtml If your firm is not classified with DPMC, you can apply for DPMC classification at: https://www.njportal.com/DPMC/ClassificationRequest/. If you have any questions about classification, please contact the classification unit by emailing Katie Karr at Katie.Karr@treas.nj.gov, Kyle Hannon at Kyle.Hannon@treas.nj.gov or Suzette Shuffler at Suzette.Shuffler@treas.nj.gov. ELECTRONIC BIDDING Paper bids WILL NOT be accepted for this procurement. Bid Proposals will be received from Bidders electronically ONLY via the Bid Express service until 2:00:59 P.M. on August 15, 2024, at which time the bid proposals submitted will be publicly opened and read in the DPMC Offices, Division of Property Management & Construction, 33 West State Street, 9th Floor, Trenton, NJ 08608. Enrolling with Bid Express is free go to www.bidexpress.com to set up your account. Once you have an account, you can view this procurement and download all related documents, as well as any future procurements that DPMC does through Bid Express. The fee schedule is available on the web site. All fees are directly payable to Bid Express. Bid Documents may be examined by appointment only (BUT NOT OBTAINED) at the DPMC Plan Room by contacting Anthony Mangine at Anthony.Mangine@treas.nj.gov. The DPMC Plan Room is located at 33 West State Street, 9th Floor, Trenton, NJ 08608. Pursuant to N.J.A.C. 17:13, this project has been designated as a Small Business Set-Aside Opportunity. Note: This contract includes a goal of awarding 25 percent of the total contract value to a Small Business Enterprise (SBE) at either the prime or subcontract level. The firm determined to be the lowest responsible bidder must produce copies of approval notice from the Division of Revenue and Enterprises Services designating the prime or subcontracting firm as a Small Business Enterprise prior to the award of contract. All questions concerning the Small Business Set-Aside Program should be addressed to: Division of Revenue and Enterprises Services Small Business Enterprise Department of the Treasury 33 West State Street, 5th Floor P.O. Box 026 Trenton, NJ 08625-0026 Phone: 609-292-2146 www.state.nj.us/njbusiness/contracting Bidders must be classified by the Division under N.J.S.A. 52:35-1 et seq and must submit bid security as provided in Instructions to Bidders and General Conditions, Revised December 2015. No bidder may withdraw his bid for 60 calendar days after the opening. The State may reject any and all bids in accordance with applicable law. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27. CHRISTOPHER R. GEARY, ASSISTANT DEPUTY DIRECTOR CONTRACTS & PROCUREMENT DIVISION OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT & CONSTRUCTION STATE OF NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY P. O. BOX 034 TRENTON, NJ 08625-0034 7/9/24 $202.03

Superior Court of New Jersey Chancery Division: GLOUCESTER County Docket No: SWC-F-004987-24 NOTICE TO ABSENT DEFENDANTS From The State of New Jersey to: ELITE HOLDINGS NJ LLC; AVIRAM ADI You are hereby summoned and required to serve upon GREENSPOON MARDER LLP whose address is 100 W. Cypress Creek Road, 7th Floor, Ft. Lauderdale, FL 33309, telephone number 954-491-1120, an Answer to the Complaint filed in a civil action in which EF MORTGAGE LLC is Plaintiff and ELITE HOLDINGS NJ LLC, et al., are the Defendants pending in the Superior Court of New Jersey Chancery Division, GLOUCESTER County, and bearing Docket No. SWC-F-004987-24, within thirty-five (35) days after 7/9/24, the actual date of such publication, exclusive of such date. If you fail to do so, judgment by Default may be rendered against you for the relief demanded in the Complaint. You shall file your Answer and proof of service in duplicate with the Clerk of the Superior Court, Hughes Justice Complex, P.O. Box 971, Trenton, New Jersey 08625, in accordance with the rules governing the courts. You are further advised that if you cannot afford an attorney, you may call the Legal Services office in the county where you live. If you do not have an attorney and are not eligible for free legal assistance, you may obtain a referral to an attorney by calling the Lawyers Referral services. If you cannot afford an attorney, you may call the Legal Services office in the county where you live or the Legal Services of New Jersey Statewide Hotline at 1-888-LSNJ-LAW (1-888-576-5529). If you do not have an attorney and are not eligible for free legal assistance, you may obtain a referral to an attorney by calling one of the Lawyer Referral Services. A directory with contact information for local Legal Services Offices and Lawyer Referral Services is available in the Civil Division Management Office in the county listed above and online at http://www.judiciary.state.nj.us/prose/10153_deptyclerklawref.pdf This action has been commenced and is pending to foreclose a mortgage and recover possession of certain lands and premises, as follows: The mortgage being foreclosed is dated November 30, 2022 and made by ELITE HOLDINGS NJ LLC, with AVIRAM ADI, as personal guarantor which Mortgage was recorded in the GLOUCESTER County Clerk's Office on December 7, 2022 in Book 17840, Page 288, et seq. The lands and premises affected by this action and for which possession is sought are commonly known as 398 FRIENDSHIP ROAD, EAST GREENWICH TWSP, NJ 08020, and also known as Lot 7 in Block 206 as shown on the Tax Map of the City of EAST GREENWICH TWSP, GLOUCESTER County, New Jersey. You are a Defendant because ELITE HOLDINGS NJ LLC, with AVIRAM ADI, as personal guarantor executed the Note and Mortgage and because this action seeks to foreclose any potential interest ELITE HOLDINGS NJ LLC; AVIRAM ADI, et al, might have on the mortgaged property subject to this foreclosure action. Dated: July 3, 2024 /s/ Michelle M. Smith Michelle M. Smith, Clerk of the Superior Court 7/9/24 $112.66

MIDDLESEX COUNTY UTILITIES AUTHORITY NOTICE TO BIDDERS FOR CONTRACT NO. 24-9SW FURNISHING OFF-ROAD TIRES FOR VARIOUS HEAVY EQUIPMENT FOR THE MIDDLESEX COUNTY LANDFILL NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that sealed bids for Contract No. 24-9SW/Furnishing Off-Road Tires for Various Heavy Equipment for the Middlesex County Landfill, will be received by the Middlesex County Utilities Authority, County of Middlesex, State of New Jersey (the "Authority"), at its offices located at 2571 Main Street Extension, Sayreville, New Jersey, 08872, until 11:00 AM on Thursday, August 15, 2024. The bids will be publicly opened and read aloud at the Authority's Administration Building located at the same address at 11:00 AM that same day. Services under this Contract shall include furnishing off-road tires for various heavy equipment for the Middlesex County Landfill. Information concerning this procurement is provided in the Authority's Request for Bids ("RFB") for such services. A copy of the RFB, which includes the Specifications and Contract Documents, Form of Contract and other Bid requirements, may be obtained only from Quest Construction Data Network (QuestCDN) at www.questcdn.com. QuestCDN is a web-based platform for project advertisements and bid documents. Prospective Bidders will need the seven-digit QuestCDN Project number (eBidDoc(tm)) 9200963 to locate the bid documents on the QuestCDN website search page. Bids will not be accepted from any prospective Bidder who has not downloaded the Contract documents through QuestCDN. Contact Quest Customer Support at 952-233-1632 or support@questcdn.com for registration and downloading assistance. The RFB may be viewed at www.questcdn.com or in person at the Authority's offices at 2571 Main Street Extension, Sayreville, NJ 08872, prior to purchasing. The Authority will not be responsible for RFB documents obtained from other sources. No Bid will be accepted after the above referenced date and time. Any Bid received after the due date, whether by mail or otherwise, will be returned unopened. Each Bidder must submit with its Bid, Bid Security in the amount, form and subject to the conditions set forth in the RFB. Bids must be submitted in sealed envelopes with the name "Contract No. 24-9SW/ Furnishing Off-Road Tires for Various Heavy Equipment for the Middlesex County Landfill" clearly marked on the outside of the envelope. Bids may not be e-mailed, faxed or transmitted over the telephone. Bidders are required, when applicable to this RFB, to comply with the requirements of the Business Registration Act (N.J.S.A. 52:32-44); the State's Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Laws and Regulations (N.J.S.A. 10:2-1 et seq., N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27-3.7 and 3.8); the Americans with Disabilities Act (42 U.S.C. 12101); and the New Jersey Campaign Contributions and Expenditure Reporting Act (N.J.S.A. 19:44A-1 etseq.). Any questions regarding this "Notice" should be directed to Deirdre Berry, at dberry@mcua.com. Please call Ms. Berry at 732-721-3800, ext. 589 to confirm receipt of any submitted questions. The Authority reserves the right to waive any informalities or reject any and all bids in accordance with the Local Public Contracts Law, N.J.S.A. 40A:11-1 etseq., as well as any other applicable law. John Wiley Chairman Middlesex County Utilities Authority Sayreville, New Jersey ($60.06)

If you have any questions about classification, please contact the classification unit by emailing Katie Karr at Katie.Karr@treas.nj.gov, Kyle Hannon at Kyle.Hannon@treas.nj.gov or Suzette Shuffler at Suzette.Shuffler@treas.nj.gov. ELECTRONIC BIDDING Paper bids WILL NOT be accepted for this procurement.Bid Proposals will be received from Bidders electronically ONLY via the Bid Express service until 2:00:59 P.M. on August 15, 2024, at which time the bid proposals submitted will be publicly opened and read in the DPMC Offices, Division of Property Management & Construction, 33 West State Street, 9th Floor, Trenton, NJ 08608. Enrolling with Bid Express is free - go to www.bidexpress.com to set up your account. Once you have an account, you can view this procurement and download all related documents, as well as any future procurements that DPMC does through Bid Express. The fee schedule is available on the web site. All fees are directly payable to Bid Express. Bid Documents may be examined by appointment only (BUT NOT OBTAINED) at the DPMC Plan Room by contacting Anthony Mangine at Anthony.Mangine@treas.nj.gov. The DPMC Plan Room is located at 33 West State Street, 9th Floor, Trenton, NJ 08608. Pursuant to N.J.A.C. 17:13, this project has been designated as a Small Business Set-Aside Opportunity. Note: This contract includes a goal of awarding 25 percent of the total contract value to a Small Business Enterprise (SBE) at either the prime or subcontract level. The firm determined to be the lowest responsible bidder must produce copies of approval notice from the Division of Revenue and Enterprises Services designating the prime or subcontracting firm as a Small Business Enterprise prior to the award of contract. All questions concerning the Small Business Set-Aside Program should be addressed to: Division of Revenue and Enterprises Services Small Business Enterprise Department of the Treasury 33 West State Street, 5th Floor P.O. Box 026 Trenton, NJ 08625-0026 Phone: 609-292-2146 www.state.nj.us/njbusiness/contracting Bidders must be classified by the Division under N.J.S.A. 52:35-1 et seq and must submit bid security as provided in Instructions to Bidders and General Conditions, Revised December 2015. No bidder may withdraw his bid for 60 calendar days after the opening. The State may reject any and all bids in accordance with applicable law. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27. CHRISTOPHER R. GEARY, ASSISTANT DEPUTY DIRECTOR CONTRACTS & PROCUREMENT DIVISION OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT & CONSTRUCTION STATE OF NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY P. O. BOX 034 TRENTON, NJ 08625-0034 July 9, 2024 ($65.52)

A public hearing on this application will be conducted on Thursday, August 8, 2024 at 2:00pm in the Community Room at the Cumberland County Library, 800 E. Commerce Street, Bridgeton, NJ. Commerce Street, Bridgeton, N.J. at (856) 453-2224, within 14 days of the scheduled meeting. Cumberland County cannot provide any accommodation not requested. Execution of sale of mortgaged Premises. By virtue of a Writ of Execution, directed to me (the "Sheriff of Cumberland County" or "Sheriff"), out of the Superior Court of New Jersey, in the above entitled matter, I shall expose for sale to the highest bidder by Public Auction to be held at the Cumberland County Sheriff's Office located at 220 N. Laurel Street, City of Bridgeton, County of Cumberland, State of New Jersey 08302, on: Wednesday, the 17th day of July next, at 2:00 P.M. [prevailing time] all of that certain tract of land, situate, lying and being in the CITY of VINELAND, County of Cumberland and State of New Jersey: PROPERTY COMMONLY KNOWN AS:1367 IROQUOIS COURT, VINELAND, NJ 08361 TAX LOT: 16 F/K/A 22 BLOCK: 6306 F/K/A 971.01 DIMENSIONS OF LOT: 92 X 177 NUMBER OF FEET TO NEAREST CROSS STREET: 334 FEET FROM KICKAPOO TRAIL THIS CONCISE STATEMENT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A FULL LEGAL DESCRIPTION. THE FULL LEGAL DESCRIPTION CAN BE FOUND IN THE OFFICE OF THE CLERK OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY IN BOOK 4073 AT PAGE 5168 OCCUPANCY STATUS: OWNER THIS SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE MADE SUBJECT TO THE FOLLOWING: * Any and all unpaid taxes, assessments, water and sewer charges and/or liens (if any). Any and all interested parties must check with the tax collector, municipality, and/or utilities authority for the exact amount(s) due; * Any and all prior mortgage(s), judgment(s), and/or lien(s) (if any); * Any and all condominium association and/or homeowner association liens (if any) which may exist. * Zoning ordinances, easements, restrictions, and/or covenants of record (if any); * The rights of tenants and/or occupants of the property (if any); * Federal, state, and/or local laws, rules, regulations, and/or ordinances including, but not limited to, the "Community Wealth Preservation Program" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - modified January 12, 2024); * The rights (including, but not limited to, the right of redemption) of the United States of America (if any); and * Such state of facts as an accurate survey, title search, and/or physical inspection of the property may reveal. * 2024 QTR 2 DUE: 05/01/2024 $1,944.45 OPEN; SUBJECT TO POSTING * WATER: VINELAND MUA 640 E. WOOD ST. VINELAND, NJ 08360 856-794-4021 ACCT: 262580 TO: 04/11/2024 $955.07 OPEN PLUS PENALTY. * ELECTRIC: VINELAND MUA 640 E. WOOD ST. VINELAND, NJ 08360 856-794-4021 ACCT: 262580 TO: 04/11/2024 $2,078.85 OPEN PLUS PENALTY * TRASH: VINELAND MUA 640 E. WOOD ST. VINELAND, NJ 08360 856-794-4021 ACCT: 262580 TO: 05/31/2024 $24.00 OPEN PLUS PENALTY FOR SALE INFORMATION, PLEASE VISIT AUCTION. AT WWW.AUCTION.COM OR CALL (800) 280-2832. Subject to any and all prior matters, liens, and/or encumbrances. Any and all interested parties shall conduct and rely solely upon their own independent investigation to ascertain whether any outstanding interest(s) remain of record and/or have priority over the mortgage/lien being foreclosed; and, if so, the current amount due thereon. Interested parties are further directed to review the Notice of Sale (see New Jersey Court Rule 4:65-2 and N.J.S.A. 46:26A-11) on file in the Sheriff's Office prior to bidding. ALL PROSPECTIVE BIDDERS ARE ADVISED TO FAMILIARIZE THEMSELVES WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - MODIFIED JANUARY 12, 2024) (HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM") PRIOR TO BIDDING. THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE CANNOT AND WILL NOT PROVIDE INTERESTED PARTIES WITH ADVICE REGARDING THE APPLICATION OF THIS PROGRAM. THE APPROXIMATE AMOUNT OF THE JUDGMENT TO BE SATISFIED BY SAID THIS SALE IS $296,501.12, WITH INTEREST COSTS OF THIS SALE. PLAINTIFF HAS ADVISED THE SHERIFF THAT A GOOD FAITH ESTIMATE OF THE "UPSET PRICE" ON THE DAY OF THE SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE $322,500.00. The Upset Price on the day of the Sheriff's sale shall not increase by more than three percent (3.0%) from the Upset Price originally provided in the notice served upon the defendant. If this Sheriff's Sale is delayed or postponed, or if circumstances occur that require unforeseen advances to protect the borrower or the foreclosed upon residential property in the event of vandalism, weather damage, or other emergency property preservation needs, the Upset Price may be adjusted to reflect these costs. EXCEPT AS SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR IN THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", the successful (i.e. high) bidder shall tender a deposit in the amount of twenty percent (20%) of the bid price in cash and/or by certified or cashier's check, payable to the "Sheriff of Cumberland County", immediately upon the conclusion of the foreclosure sale. The balance of the purchase price shall be due in thirty (30) calendar days. The Cumberland County Sheriff's Office will not accept cash payments in excess of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) without prior written approval so that special arrangements can be made. Bidders are advised to bring certified and/or cashier's checks for any and all payments in excess of this amount. PURSUANT TO THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", in the case of residential property in which the successful bidder is the foreclosed upon defendant, next of kin, tenant, nonprofit community development corporation, or a bidder who shall occupy the property as the bidder's primary residence for a period of at least eighty-four (84) months, the successful bidder who has fulfilled all of the requirements of the Community Wealth Preservation Program shall pay a three and one-half percent (3.5%) deposit of the original Upset Price listed in the notice provided by the foreclosing plaintiff pursuant N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8(5)(a), or the final starting Upset Price listed for the sale of the property, whichever is less, with the remaining balance due within ninety (90) business days payable by cash, certified or cashier's check, or by wire transfer, made payable to the Sheriff of Cumberland County. NEW JERSEY FORECLOSURE INTERVENTION FUND: Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 2A:17-38, the Sheriff will charge and collect $350.00 from each sale. These funds are utilized in accordance with the New Jersey Foreclosure Prevention Act (codified at N.J.S.A. 55:14K-94 et seq.); and will be included in the Upset Price announced at the time of the Sheriff's Sale. CLAIMING SURPLUS MONEY: If after the sale and satisfaction of the mortgage debt, including costs and expenses, there remains any surplus money, the money will be deposited into the Superior Court Trust Fund and any person claiming the surplus, or any part thereof, may file a Motion pursuant to Court Rules 4:64-3 and 4:57-2 stating the nature and extent of that person's claim and asking for an order directing payment of the surplus money. The Sheriff or other person conducting the sale will have information regarding the surplus, if any. RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES: Prior to the sale of residential property, the foreclosing plaintiff shall disclose, if known, whether the property is vacant, tenant-occupied, or owner-occupied. If the property is vacant, the foreclosing plaintiff shall provide the successful bidder access to the property if the foreclosing plaintiff has such access and may condition access by the successful bidder on being accompanied by a representative of the foreclosing plaintiff. ADJOURNMENTS: The Sheriff reserves the right to adjourn the sale from time to time as provided by law without further notice or publication. Persons that need an accommodation (e.g. sign language, interpreter, assisted listening devices, etc.) must notify the County Office for the Disabled, 800 East Commerce Street, Bridgeton, New Jersey 08302, (856)453-2156 within fourteen (14) days of the scheduled meeting. Cumberland County cannot provide any accommodation not requested. ALL PUBLICATION COSTS SHALL BE PAID FOR BY THE PLAINTIFF. MICHAEL DONATO SHERIFF ROBERTSON ANSCHUTZ SCHNEID CRANE & PARTNERS PLLC FKA RAS CITRON LLC Atty (s) Phone: 973-575-0707 6/18/2024, 6/25/2024, 7/2/2024, 7/9/2024 Ptr Fee: $365.80 Ad#10225793

text: TOWNSHIP OF FREEHOLD NOTICE TO BIDDERS Notice is hereby given that sealed bids will be received by the Township Purchasing Agent for the Township of Freehold, County of Monmouth, State of New Jersey on TUESDAY, JULY 30, 2024 at 10:00 AM local prevailing time at the Municipal Building, 1 Municipal Plaza, Freehold, New Jersey at which time and place bids will be opened and read in public for the following bid: MICHAEL J. TIGHE PARK TRAIL AND PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE The project scope includes site clearing, the construction of an 1,100-linear foot hot mix asphalt trail, installation of a 50-foot prefabricated pedestrian truss bridge and foundations, extension of an existing 30" storm sewer outfall pipe, site restoration, and associated work. The project area is accessible via the Remembrance Road entrance to Michael J. Tighe Park from Georgia Road. The proposed improvements are situated east of the existing easternmost softball fields and will extend across a tributary branch of the Manasquan River to an existing asphalt path located along Polo Club Drive. Specifications and other bid information may be obtained at the office of the Freehold Township Purchasing Agent, One Municipal Plaza, Freehold, N.J., during regular business hours 8:30 am - 4:30 pm. for a non-refundable fee of $120.00 will be required for each set of specifications. Bids must be made on the proposal forms included with the bid specification, be enclosed in a sealed package bearing the name and address of the bidder and "Bid Title, Name and Contract" on the outside, addressed to the Purchasing Agent at the address above. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of P.L.1975, c.127 (N.J.A.C. 17:27-1 et seq.), N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq.; N.J.S.A. 19:44-20.5 et seq. The bid award will be made to the lowest possible bidder in accordance with applicable law. ($26.84)

MIDDLESEX COUNTY UTILITIES AUTHORITY NOTICE TO BIDDERS FOR CONTRACT NO. 24-8SW FURNISH AND DELIVER LANDFILL SIDE COVER MATERIAL AT THE MIDDLESEX COUNTY LANDFILL NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that sealed bids for Contract No. 24-8SW/Furnish and Deliver Landfill Side Cover Material at the Middlesex County Landfill will be received by the Middlesex County Utilities Authority, County of Middlesex, State of New Jersey (the "Authority"), at its offices located at 2571 Main Street Extension, Sayreville, New Jersey, 08872, until 11:00 AM on Friday, August 2, 2024. The bids will be publicly opened and read aloud at the Authority's Administration Building located at the same address at 11:00 AM that same day. Services under this Contract shall include Furnishing and Delivering Landfill Side Cover Material at the Middlesex County Landfill. Successful Contractor shall pay the Authority a per ton price for said material. Information concerning this procurement is provided in the Authority's Request for Bids ("RFB") for such services. A copy of the RFB, which includes the Specifications and Contract Documents, Form of Contract and other Bid requirements, may be obtained only from Quest Construction Data Network (QuestCDN) at www.questcdn.com. QuestCDN is a web-based platform for project advertisements and bid documents. Prospective Bidders will need the seven-digit QuestCDN Project number (eBidDoc(tm)) 9200962 to locate the bid documents on the QuestCDN website search page. Bids will not be accepted from any prospective Bidder who has not downloaded the Contract documents through QuestCDN. Contact Quest Customer Support at 952-233-1632 or support@questcdn.com for registration and downloading assistance. The RFB may be viewed at www.questcdn.com or in person at the Authority's offices at 2571 Main Street Extension, Sayreville, NJ 08872. The Authority will not be responsible for RFB documents obtained from other sources. No Bid will be accepted after the above referenced date and time. Any Bid received after the due date, whether by mail or otherwise, will be returned unopened. Each Bidder must submit with its Bid, Bid Security in the amount, form and subject to the conditions set forth in the RFB. Bidders must also submit a Consent of Surety as set forth in the RFB, demonstrating that in the event of an award of the Contract to the Bidder, the Surety will furnish the required Contract Bond(s) in the sum(s) required by the RFB. Bids must be submitted in sealed envelopes with the name "Contract No. 24-8SW/Furnish and Deliver Landfill Side Cover Material at the Middlesex County Landfill," clearly marked on the outside of the envelope. Bids may not be e-mailed, faxed or transmitted over the telephone. Bidders are required, when applicable to this RFB, to comply with the requirements of the Prevailing Wage Act (N.J.S.A. 34:11-56.25 et seq.); the Public Works Contractor Registration Act (N.J.S.A. 34:56-48); the Business Registration Act (N.J.S.A. 52:32-44); the State's Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Laws and Regulations (N.J.S.A. 10:2-1 et seq., N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27-3.7 and 3.8); the Americans with Disabilities Act (42 U.S.C. 12101); and the New Jersey Campaign Contributions and Expenditure Reporting Act (N.J.S.A. 19:44A-1 et seq.). Bidders' attention is also called to comply with the requirements as applicable, of (a) the conditions of employment and requirements of Federal prevailing wage rates; and (b) Segregated Facility. Any questions regarding this "Notice" should be directed to Deirdre Berry, Solid Waste Division at dberry@mcua.com. Please call Ms. Berry at 732-721-3800, ext. 589 to confirm receipt of any submitted questions. The Authority reserves the right to waive any informalities or reject any and all bids in accordance with the Local Public Contracts Law, N.J.S.A. 40A:11-1 et seq., as well as any other applicable law. John Wiley Chairman Middlesex County Utilities Authority Sayreville, New Jersey 7/9/24 ($58.89)
