THE FULL LEGAL DESCRIPTION CAN BE FOUND IN THE OFFICE OF THE CLERK OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY IN BOOK 3497 AT PAGE 301. PROPERTY STATUS- BORROWER OCCUPIED THIS SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE MADE SUBJECT TO THE FOLLOWING: * Any and all unpaid taxes, assessments, water and sewer charges and/or liens (if any). Any and all interested parties must check with the tax collector, municipality, and/or utilities authority for the exact amount(s) due; * Any and all prior mortgage(s), judgment(s), and/or lien(s) (if any); * Any and all condominium association and/or homeowner association liens (if any) which may exist. * Zoning ordinances, easements, restrictions, and/or covenants of record (if any); * The rights of tenants and/or occupants of the property (if any); * Federal, state, and/or local laws, rules, regulations, and/or ordinances including, but not limited to, the "Community Wealth Preservation Program" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - modified January 12, 2024); * The rights (including, but not limited to, the right of redemption) of the United States of America (if any); and * Such state of facts as an accurate survey, title search, and/or physical inspection of the property may reveal. SUBJECT TO: CERTIFICATE NO. 23-00353 AS 5/8/2024 $1,156.09, MUST CONTACT CITY OF BRIDGETON FOR PAYOFF. UTILITIES OWED $316.64 AS OF 5/8/2024. * Subject to any and all prior matters, liens, and/or encumbrances. Any and all interested parties shall conduct and rely solely upon their own independent investigation to ascertain whether any outstanding interest(s) remain of record and/or have priority over the mortgage/lien being foreclosed; and, if so, the current amount due thereon. Interested parties are further directed to review the Notice of Sale (see New Jersey Court Rule 4:65-2 and N.J.S.A. 46:26A-11) on file in the Sheriff's Office prior to bidding. ALL PROSPECTIVE BIDDERS ARE ADVISED TO FAMILIARIZE THEMSELVES WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - MODIFIED JANUARY 12, 2024) (HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM") PRIOR TO BIDDING. THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE CANNOT AND WILL NOT PROVIDE INTERESTED PARTIES WITH ADVICE REGARDING THE APPLICATION OF THIS PROGRAM. THE APPROXIMATE AMOUNT OF THE JUDGMENT TO BE SATISFIED BY SAID THIS SALE IS $103,289.11, WITH INTEREST COSTS OF THIS SALE. PLAINTIFF HAS ADVISED THE SHERIFF THAT A GOOD FAITH ESTIMATE OF THE "UPSET PRICE" ON THE DAY OF THE SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE $112,356.56. The Upset Price on the day of the Sheriff's sale shall not increase by more than three percent (3.0%) from the Upset Price originally provided in the notice served upon the defendant. If this Sheriff's Sale is delayed or postponed, or if circumstances occur that require unforeseen advances to protect the borrower or the foreclosed upon residential property in the event of vandalism, weather damage, or other emergency property preservation needs, the Upset Price may be adjusted to reflect these costs. EXCEPT AS SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR IN THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", the successful (i.e. high) bidder shall tender a deposit in the amount of twenty percent (20%) of the bid price in cash and/or by certified or cashier's check, payable to the "Sheriff of Cumberland County", immediately upon the conclusion of the foreclosure sale. The balance of the purchase price shall be due in thirty (30) calendar days. The Cumberland County Sheriff's Office will not accept cash payments in excess of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) without prior written approval so that special arrangements can be made. Bidders are advised to bring certified and/or cashier's checks for any and all payments in excess of this amount. PURSUANT TO THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", in the case of residential property in which the successful bidder is the foreclosed upon defendant, next of kin, tenant, nonprofit community development corporation, or a bidder who shall occupy the property as the bidder's primary residence for a period of at least eighty-four (84) months, the successful bidder who has fulfilled all of the requirements of the Community Wealth Preservation Program shall pay a three and one-half percent (3.5%) deposit of the original Upset Price listed in the notice provided by the foreclosing plaintiff pursuant N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8(5)(a), or the final starting Upset Price listed for the sale of the property, whichever is less, with the remaining balance due within ninety (90) business days payable by cash, certified or cashier's check, or by wire transfer, made payable to the Sheriff of Cumberland County. NEW JERSEY FORECLOSURE INTERVENTION FUND: Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 2A:17-38, the Sheriff will charge and collect $350.00 from each sale. These funds are utilized in accordance with the New Jersey Foreclosure Prevention Act (codified at N.J.S.A. 55:14K-94 et seq.); and will be included in the Upset Price announced at the time of the Sheriff's Sale. CLAIMING SURPLUS MONEY: If after the sale and satisfaction of the mortgage debt, including costs and expenses, there remains any surplus money, the money will be deposited into the Superior Court Trust Fund and any person claiming the surplus, or any part thereof, may file a Motion pursuant to Court Rules 4:64-3 and 4:57-2 stating the nature and extent of that person's claim and asking for an order directing payment of the surplus money. The Sheriff or other person conducting the sale will have information regarding the surplus, if any. RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES: Prior to the sale of residential property, the foreclosing plaintiff shall disclose, if known, whether the property is vacant, tenant-occupied, or owner-occupied. If the property is vacant, the foreclosing plaintiff shall provide the successful bidder access to the property if the foreclosing plaintiff has such access and may condition access by the successful bidder on being accompanied by a representative of the foreclosing plaintiff. ADJOURNMENTS: The Sheriff reserves the right to adjourn the sale from time to time as provided by law without further notice or publication. Persons that need an accommodation (e.g. sign language, interpreter, assisted listening devices, etc.) must notify the County Office for the Disabled, 800 East Commerce Street, Bridgeton, New Jersey 08302, (856)453-2156 within fourteen (14) days of the scheduled meeting. Cumberland County cannot provide any accommodation not requested. ALL PUBLICATION COSTS SHALL BE PAID FOR BY THE PLAINTIFF. MICHAEL DONATO SHERIFF MCCABE WEISBERG & CONWAY, LLC Atty (s) Phone: 856-858-7080 6/18/2024, 6/25/2024, 7/2/2024, 7/9/2024 Ptr Fee: $349.68 Ad#10225506

text: Sheriff's File No. 24000523 SUPERIOR COURT OF NEW JERSEY, CHANCERY DIVISION CUMBERLAND COUNTY, DOCKET NO. F01213722, WILMINGTON SAVINGS FUND SOCIETY FSB AS TRUSTEE OF QUERCUS MORTGAGE INVESTMENT TRUST vs. JOSEPH E JOHNSON ET AL. Execution of sale of mortgaged Premises. By virtue of a Writ of Execution, directed to me (the "Sheriff of Cumberland County" or "Sheriff"), out of the Superior Court of New Jersey, in the above entitled matter, I shall expose for sale to the highest bidder by Public Auction to be held at the Cumberland County Sheriff's Office located at 220 N. Laurel Street, City of Bridgeton, County of Cumberland, State of New Jersey 08302, on: Wednesday, the 17th day of July next, at 2:00 P.M. [prevailing time] all of that certain tract of land, situate, lying and being in the City of Vineland, County of Cumberland and State of New Jersey: PROPERTY COMMONLY KNOWN AS: 981 West Chestnut Avenue, Vineland, NJ 08360 TAX LOT: 12 AND BLOCK: 4709 DIMENSIONS OF LOT: 96' x 635' x 60' x 480' NUMBER OF FEET TO NEAREST CROSS STREET: 21 rods Westerly from the center of Malaga Road THIS CONCISE STATEMENT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A FULL LEGAL DESCRIPTION. THE FULL LEGAL DESCRIPTION CAN BE FOUND IN THE OFFICE OF THE CLERK OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY IN BOOK 04174 AT PAGE 2925 AS INSTRUMENT NO. 566733. Occupancy status at the property is unknown. THIS SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE MADE SUBJECT TO THE FOLLOWING: * Any and all unpaid taxes, assessments, water and sewer charges and/or liens (if any). Any and all interested parties must check with the tax collector, municipality, and/or utilities authority for the exact amount(s) due; * Any and all prior mortgage(s), judgment(s), and/or lien(s) (if any); * Any and all condominium association and/or homeowner association liens (if any) which may exist. * Zoning ordinances, easements, restrictions, and/or covenants of record (if any); * The rights of tenants and/or occupants of the property (if any); * Federal, state, and/or local laws, rules, regulations, and/or ordinances including, but not limited to, the "Community Wealth Preservation Program" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - modified January 12, 2024); * The rights (including, but not limited to, the right of redemption) of the United States of America (if any); and * Such state of facts as an accurate survey, title search, and/or physical inspection of the property may reveal. Subject to any and all prior matters, liens, and/or encumbrances. * If the sale is set aside for any reason, the Purchaser at the sale shall be entitled only to a return of the deposit paid. The Purchaser shall have no further recourse against the Mortgagor, the Mortgagee or the Mortgagee's attorney. * Taxes and Other Encumbrances: * Taxes current through 1st Quarter of 2024 * Water/Sewer - Plaintiff is unable to confirm these amounts. Prospective purchasers must conduct their own investigation to determine the same. * *Plus interest on these figures through date of payoff and any and all subsequent taxes, water and sewer amounts. Any and all interested parties shall conduct and rely solely upon their own independent investigation to ascertain whether any outstanding interest(s) remain of record and/or have priority over the mortgage/lien being foreclosed; and, if so, the current amount due thereon. Interested parties are further directed to review the Notice of Sale (see New Jersey Court Rule 4:65-2 and N.J.S.A. 46:26A-11) on file in the Sheriff's Office prior to bidding. ALL PROSPECTIVE BIDDERS ARE ADVISED TO FAMILIARIZE THEMSELVES WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - MODIFIED JANUARY 12, 2024) (HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM") PRIOR TO BIDDING. THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE CANNOT AND WILL NOT PROVIDE INTERESTED PARTIES WITH ADVICE REGARDING THE APPLICATION OF THIS PROGRAM. THE APPROXIMATE AMOUNT OF THE JUDGMENT TO BE SATISFIED BY SAID THIS SALE IS $157,102.19 , WITH INTEREST COSTS OF THIS SALE. PLAINTIFF HAS ADVISED THE SHERIFF THAT A GOOD FAITH ESTIMATE OF THE "UPSET PRICE" ON THE DAY OF THE SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE $177,655.44. The Upset Price on the day of the Sheriff's sale shall not increase by more than three percent (3.0%) from the Upset Price originally provided in the notice served upon the defendant. If this Sheriff's Sale is delayed or postponed, or if circumstances occur that require unforeseen advances to protect the borrower or the foreclosed upon residential property in the event of vandalism, weather damage, or other emergency property preservation needs, the Upset Price may be adjusted to reflect these costs. EXCEPT AS SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR IN THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", the successful (i.e. high) bidder shall tender a deposit in the amount of twenty percent (20%) of the bid price in cash and/or by certified or cashier's check, payable to the "Sheriff of Cumberland County", immediately upon the conclusion of the foreclosure sale. The balance of the purchase price shall be due in thirty (30) calendar days. The Cumberland County Sheriff's Office will not accept cash payments in excess of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) without prior written approval so that special arrangements can be made. Bidders are advised to bring certified and/or cashier's checks for any and all payments in excess of this amount. PURSUANT TO THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", in the case of residential property in which the successful bidder is the foreclosed upon defendant, next of kin, tenant, nonprofit community development corporation, or a bidder who shall occupy the property as the bidder's primary residence for a period of at least eighty-four (84) months, the successful bidder who has fulfilled all of the requirements of the Community Wealth Preservation Program shall pay a three and one-half percent (3.5%) deposit of the original Upset Price listed in the notice provided by the foreclosing plaintiff pursuant N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8(5)(a), or the final starting Upset Price listed for the sale of the property, whichever is less, with the remaining balance due within ninety (90) business days payable by cash, certified or cashier's check, or by wire transfer, made payable to the Sheriff of Cumberland County. NEW JERSEY FORECLOSURE INTERVENTION FUND: Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 2A:17-38, the Sheriff will charge and collect $350.00 from each sale. These funds are utilized in accordance with the New Jersey Foreclosure Prevention Act (codified at N.J.S.A. 55:14K-94 et seq.); and will be included in the Upset Price announced at the time of the Sheriff's Sale. CLAIMING SURPLUS MONEY: If after the sale and satisfaction of the mortgage debt, including costs and expenses, there remains any surplus money, the money will be deposited into the Superior Court Trust Fund and any person claiming the surplus, or any part thereof, may file a Motion pursuant to Court Rules 4:64-3 and 4:57-2 stating the nature and extent of that person's claim and asking for an order directing payment of the surplus money. The Sheriff or other person conducting the sale will have information regarding the surplus, if any. RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES: Prior to the sale of residential property, the foreclosing plaintiff shall disclose, if known, whether the property is vacant, tenant-occupied, or owner-occupied. If the property is vacant, the foreclosing plaintiff shall provide the successful bidder access to the property if the foreclosing plaintiff has such access and may condition access by the successful bidder on being accompanied by a representative of the foreclosing plaintiff. ADJOURNMENTS: The Sheriff reserves the right to adjourn the sale from time to time as provided by law without further notice or publication. Persons that need an accommodation (e.g. sign language, interpreter, assisted listening devices, etc.) must notify the County Office for the Disabled, 800 East Commerce Street, Bridgeton, New Jersey 08302, (856)453-2156 within fourteen (14) days of the scheduled meeting. Cumberland County cannot provide any accommodation not requested. ALL PUBLICATION COSTS SHALL BE PAID FOR BY THE PLAINTIFF. MICHAEL DONATO SHERIFF STERN & EISENBERG, PC Atty (s) Phone: 609-397-9200 6/18/2024, 6/25/2024, 7/2/2024, 7/9/2024 Ptr Fee: $367.04 Ad#10225701

NOTICE OF DIVORCE ANNA L. AKRAM v. MOHAMMED AKRAM SUPERIOR COURT OF NEW JERSEY CHANCERY DIVISION - FAMILY PART COUNTY OF CUMBERLAND DOCKET NO: FM-06-247-21 FINAL JUDGMENT OF DIVORCE The State of New Jersey to defendant, Mohammed Akram. Please be advised that a Final Judgment of Divorce shall be entered at the discretion of the Court as set out below: THIS MATTER, coming before the Court for a Final Divorce Hearing pursuant to R. 5:5-10 on April 24, 2024; plaintiff, Anna L. Akram, represented by Bohdan Zachariasevych, Esq.; the defendant, Mohammed Akram, absent from the proceeding; Counsel for the plaintiff represented to the Court that service of the Complaint for Divorce had been published, pursuant to the Order entered on July 2, 2021, in the Daily Journal, a weekly newspaper published in the Minotola, New Jersey area; plaintiff having testified that she had no information on defendant's present whereabouts, and had received no communication from defendant upon his inexplicable separation from plaintiff approximately three (3) months after their marriage; further, plaintiff expressing her inference that defendant had likely relocated to his home country of Pakistan as he had overstayed his Visitor Visa, the Court finds that adequate Notice to defendant of this proceeding has been made by plaintiff; The Court having, then, taken plaintiff's testimony and reviewed evidence presented, together with the Notice of Proposed Final Judgment of Divorce; It appearing that a Complaint for Divorce was properly served upon the defendant by Substitute Service pursuant to the aforementioned Order; no responsive pleading or request for an extension of time having been filed by the defendant; Default having been entered against the defendant upon request made on July 31, 2022; The Court having heard and considered the Complaint and proofs and it appearing that the parties were married, that plaintiff having pleaded and proved a cause of action for divorce under the Statute in such case made and provided, and plaintiff having been a bona fide resident of this State for more than one year next preceding the commencement of this action, and jurisdiction having been acquired over both parties pursuant to the Rules of Court; IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED, nunc pro tunc to April 24, 2024, that the plaintiff, Anna L. Akram, and the defendant, Mohammed Akram, be and they are divorced from the bonds of matrimony and the parties and each of them be and the same are freed and discharged from the obligations thereof and that the marriage between the parties, be and the same is hereby dissolved; IT IS FURTHER ORDERED AND ADJUDGED that: 1. Each party shall be assigned any real estate interest in their own name, if any, irrespective of value; 2. Each party shall be assigned the retirement accounts of any nature in their name, if any, irrespective of value; 3. Each party shall be assigned the financial assets of any nature in their name, if any, irrespective of value; 4. Each party shall be assigned the personal property of any nature in their possession and control or titled in their name, if any, irrespective of value; 5. MIDDLESEX COUNTY UTILITIES AUTHORITY NOTICE TO BIDDERS FOR CONTRACT NO. 24-9SW FURNISHING OFF-ROAD TIRES FOR VARIOUS HEAVY EQUIPMENT FOR THE MIDDLESEX COUNTY LANDFILL NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that sealed bids for Contract No. 24-9SW/Furnishing Off-Road Tires for Various Heavy Equipment for the Middlesex County Landfill, will be received by the Middlesex County Utilities Authority, County of Middlesex, State of New Jersey (the "Authority"), at its offices located at 2571 Main Street Extension, Sayreville, New Jersey, 08872, until 11:00 AM on Thursday, August 15, 2024. The bids will be publicly opened and read aloud at the Authority's Administration Building located at the same address at 11:00 AM that same day. Services under this Contract shall include furnishing off-road tires for various heavy equipment for the Middlesex County Landfill. Information concerning this procurement is provided in the Authority's Request for Bids ("RFB") for such services. A copy of the RFB, which includes the Specifications and Contract Documents, Form of Contract and other Bid requirements, may be obtained only from Quest Construction Data Network (QuestCDN) at www.questcdn.com. QuestCDN is a web-based platform for project advertisements and bid documents. Prospective Bidders will need the seven-digit QuestCDN Project number (eBidDoc(tm)) 9200963 to locate the bid documents on the QuestCDN website search page. Bids will not be accepted from any prospective Bidder who has not downloaded the Contract documents through QuestCDN. Contact Quest Customer Support at 952-233-1632 or support@questcdn.com for registration and downloading assistance. The RFB may be viewed at www.questcdn.com or in person at the Authority's offices at 2571 Main Street Extension, Sayreville, NJ 08872, prior to purchasing. The Authority will not be responsible for RFB documents obtained from other sources. No Bid will be accepted after the above referenced date and time. Any Bid received after the due date, whether by mail or otherwise, will be returned unopened. Each Bidder must submit with its Bid, Bid Security in the amount, form and subject to the conditions set forth in the RFB. Bids must be submitted in sealed envelopes with the name "Contract No. 24-9SW/ Furnishing Off-Road Tires for Various Heavy Equipment for the Middlesex County Landfill" clearly marked on the outside of the envelope. Bids may not be e-mailed, faxed or transmitted over the telephone. Bidders are required, when applicable to this RFB, to comply with the requirements of the Business Registration Act (N.J.S.A. 52:32-44); the State's Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Laws and Regulations (N.J.S.A. 10:2-1 etseq., N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 etseq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27-3.7 and 3.8); the Americans with Disabilities Act (42 U.S.C. 12101); and the New Jersey Campaign Contributions and Expenditure Reporting Act (N.J.S.A. 19:44A-1 etseq.). Any questions regarding this "Notice" should be directed to Deirdre Berry, at dberry@mcua.com. Please call Ms. Berry at 732-721-3800, ext. 589 to confirm receipt of any submitted questions. The Authority reserves the right to waive any informalities or reject any and all bids in accordance with the Local Public Contracts Law, N.J.S.A. 40A:11-1 etseq., as well as any other applicable law. John Wiley Chairman Middlesex County Utilities Authority Sayreville, New Jersey ($58.59)

text: Sheriff's File No24000670. SUPERIOR COURT OF NEW JERSEY, CHANCERY DIVISION CUMBERLAND COUNTY, DOCKET NO F01171323 FREEDOM MORTGAGE CORPORATION vs KALYNDA N WILLIAMS ET AL. Execution of sale of mortgaged Premises. By virtue of a Writ of Execution, directed to me (the "Sheriff of Cumberland County" or "Sheriff"), out of the Superior Court of New Jersey, in the above entitled matter, I shall expose for sale to the highest bidder by Public Auction to be held at the Cumberland County Sheriff's Office located at 220 N. Laurel Street, City of Bridgeton, County of Cumberland, State of New Jersey 08302, on: Wednesday, the 17th day of JULY next, at 2:00 P.M. [prevailing time] all of that certain tract of land, situate, lying and being in the CITY of MILLVILLE, County of Cumberland and State of New Jersey: PROPERTY COMMONLY KNOWN AS: 1024 NORTH STREET, MILLVILLE, NJ 08332 TAX LOT: 29, 30 AND BLOCK: 273 DIMENSIONS (APPROX.): 50 FEET BY 125 FEET NUMBER OF FEET TO NEAREST CROSS STREET: TRACT # 1: APPROXIMATELY 125 FEET FROM THE WESTERLY LINE OF NORTH STREET TO THE SOUTHEASTERLY LINE OF CHURCH STREET. TRACT # 2 APPROXIMATELY 329.5 FEET FROM THE SOUTHWESTERLY SIDELINE OF NORTH STREET TO THE NORTHWESTERLY SIDELINE OF AN ALLEY. THIS CONCISE STATEMENT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A FULL LEGAL DESCRIPTION. THE FULL LEGAL DESCRIPTION CAN BE FOUND IN THE OFFICE OF THE CLERK OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY IN BOOK 498 AT PAGE 521 AS INSTRUMENT NO. 524134 OCCUPANCY STATUS: OWNER OCCUPIED THIS SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE MADE SUBJECT TO THE FOLLOWING: * Any and all unpaid taxes, assessments, water and sewer charges and/or liens (if any). Any and all interested parties must check with the tax collector, municipality, and/or utilities authority for the exact amount(s) due; * Any and all prior mortgage(s), judgment(s), and/or lien(s) (if any); * Any and all condominium association and/or homeowner association liens (if any) which may exist. * Zoning ordinances, easements, restrictions, and/or covenants of record (if any); * The rights of tenants and/or occupants of the property (if any); * Federal, state, and/or local laws, rules, regulations, and/or ordinances including, but not limited to, the "Community Wealth Preservation Program" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - modified January 12, 2024); * The rights (including, but not limited to, the right of redemption) of the United States of America (if any); and * Such state of facts as an accurate survey, title search, and/or physical inspection of the property may reveal. Subject to any and all prior matters, liens, and/or encumbrances. * AMOUNT DUE FOR TAXES: TAXES PAID AND CURRENT AS OF 05/10/24. * SALE MAY BE SUBJECT TO SUBSEQUENT TAXES, LIENS, UTILITIES AND INTEREST SINCE 05/10/24. * WATER/TRASH/SEWER DUE AND OWING IN THE APPROXIMATE AMOUNT OF $322.00 AS OF 05/10/24 IF THE SALE IS SET ASIDE FOR ANY REASON, THE PURCHASER AT THE SALE SHALL BE ENTITLED ONLY A RETURN OF THE DEPOSIT PAID. THE PURCHASER SHALL HAVE NO FURTHER RECOURSE AGAINST THE MORTGAGOR, MORTGAGEE OR THE MORTGAGEE'S ATTORNEY. Any and all interested parties shall conduct and rely solely upon their own independent investigation to ascertain whether any outstanding interest(s) remain of record and/or have priority over the mortgage/lien being foreclosed; and, if so, the current amount due thereon. Interested parties are further directed to review the Notice of Sale (see New Jersey Court Rule 4:65-2 and N.J.S.A. 46:26A-11) on file in the Sheriff's Office prior to bidding. ALL PROSPECTIVE BIDDERS ARE ADVISED TO FAMILIARIZE THEMSELVES WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - MODIFIED JANUARY 12, 2024) (HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM") PRIOR TO BIDDING. THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE CANNOT AND WILL NOT PROVIDE INTERESTED PARTIES WITH ADVICE REGARDING THE APPLICATION OF THIS PROGRAM. THE APPROXIMATE AMOUNT OF THE JUDGMENT TO BE SATISFIED BY SAID THIS SALE $87,401.45, WITH INTEREST COSTS OF THIS SALE. PLAINTIFF HAS ADVISED THE SHERIFF THAT A GOOD FAITH ESTIMATE OF THE "UPSET PRICE" ON THE DAY OF THE SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE $91,712.41. The Upset Price on the day of the Sheriff's sale shall not increase by more than three percent (3.0%) from the Upset Price originally provided in the notice served upon the defendant. If this Sheriff's Sale is delayed or postponed, or if circumstances occur that require unforeseen advances to protect the borrower or the foreclosed upon residential property in the event of vandalism, weather damage, or other emergency property preservation needs, the Upset Price may be adjusted to reflect these costs. EXCEPT AS SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR IN THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", the successful (i.e. high) bidder shall tender a deposit in the amount of twenty percent (20%) of the bid price in cash and/or by certified or cashier's check, payable to the "Sheriff of Cumberland County", immediately upon the conclusion of the foreclosure sale. The balance of the purchase price shall be due in thirty (30) calendar days. The Cumberland County Sheriff's Office will not accept cash payments in excess of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) without prior written approval so that special arrangements can be made. Bidders are advised to bring certified and/or cashier's checks for any and all payments in excess of this amount. PURSUANT TO THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", in the case of residential property in which the successful bidder is the foreclosed upon defendant, next of kin, tenant, nonprofit community development corporation, or a bidder who shall occupy the property as the bidder's primary residence for a period of at least eighty-four (84) months, the successful bidder who has fulfilled all of the requirements of the Community Wealth Preservation Program shall pay a three and one-half percent (3.5%) deposit of the original Upset Price listed in the notice provided by the foreclosing plaintiff pursuant N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8(5)(a), or the final starting Upset Price listed for the sale of the property, whichever is less, with the remaining balance due within ninety (90) business days payable by cash, certified or cashier's check, or by wire transfer, made payable to the Sheriff of Cumberland County. NEW JERSEY FORECLOSURE INTERVENTION FUND: Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 2A:17-38, the Sheriff will charge and collect $350.00 from each sale. These funds are utilized in accordance with the New Jersey Foreclosure Prevention Act (codified at N.J.S.A. 55:14K-94 et seq.); and will be included in the Upset Price announced at the time of the Sheriff's Sale. CLAIMING SURPLUS MONEY: If after the sale and satisfaction of the mortgage debt, including costs and expenses, there remains any surplus money, the money will be deposited into the Superior Court Trust Fund and any person claiming the surplus, or any part thereof, may file a Motion pursuant to Court Rules 4:64-3 and 4:57-2 stating the nature and extent of that person's claim and asking for an order directing payment of the surplus money. The Sheriff or other person conducting the sale will have information regarding the surplus, if any. RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES: Prior to the sale of residential property, the foreclosing plaintiff shall disclose, if known, whether the property is vacant, tenant-occupied, or owner-occupied. If the property is vacant, the foreclosing plaintiff shall provide the successful bidder access to the property if the foreclosing plaintiff has such access and may condition access by the successful bidder on being accompanied by a representative of the foreclosing plaintiff. ADJOURNMENTS: The Sheriff reserves the right to adjourn the sale from time to time as provided by law without further notice or publication. Persons that need an accommodation (e.g. sign language, interpreter, assisted listening devices, etc.) must notify the County Office for the Disabled, 800 East Commerce Street, Bridgeton, New Jersey 08302, (856)453-2156 within fourteen (14) days of the scheduled meeting. Cumberland County cannot provide any accommodation not requested. ALL PUBLICATION COSTS SHALL BE PAID FOR BY THE PLAINTIFF. MICHAEL DONATO SHERIFF GROSS POLOWY LLC Atty (s) Phone: 716-204-1700 6/18/2024, 6/25/2024, 7/2/2024, 7/9/2024 Ptr Fee: $376.96 Ad#10225981

text: THE BOARD OF EDUCATION OF THE SPECIAL SERVICES SCHOOL DISTRICT AND THE VOCATIONAL SCHOOL DISTRICT OF THE COUNTY OF ATLANTIC RESOLUTION #23/24 - 06 APPROVING REGULARLY SCHEDULED MEETINGS OF THE BOARD BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Education of the Special Services School District and the Vocational School District of the County of Atlantic that the regularly scheduled meetings of the Board for the 2024/2025 school year, at which official actions may be taken as come before the Board, be held on the following dates and locations Day Date Time Meeting Location Monday July 29, 2024 4:00 p.m. Special Services School District Monday August 26, 2024 4:00 p.m. Vocational School District Monday September 23, 2024 4:00p.m. Special Services School District Monday October 28, 2024 4:00 p.m. Vocational School District Monday November 25, 2024 4:00p.m. Special Services School District Monday December 16, 2024 4:00p.m. Vocational School District Monday January 27, 2025 4:00 p.m. Special Services School District Monday February 24, 2025 4:00 p.m. Vocational School District Monday March 24, 2025 4:00 p.m. Special Services School District Wednesday April 30, 2025 4:00 p.m. Vocational School District Wednesday May 28, 2025 4:00 p.m. Special Services School District Monday June 23, 2025 4:00 p.m. Vocational School District The meeting location for the Special Services School District is 4805 Nawakwa Boulevard, Mays Landing, NJ 08330. The meeting location for the Vocational School District a/k/a the Atlantic County Institute of Technology is 5080 Atlantic Avenue, Mays Landing, NJ 08330. Meeting to be held in the Boardroom at each location. That the Secretary of the Board of Education prominently post and maintain a copy of the schedule of regular meetings of the Board of Education and all legal notices as required by the "Open Public Meeting Act" on the bulletin boards of the Administrative and School Offices of the Atlantic County Special Services School District, the Vocational School District, and with the Atlantic County Clerk. BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the Secretary shall forthwith file a copy of this Certified Resolution to be a true copy with the Clerk of the Board of Chosen Commissioners and with the Clerk of Atlantic County. BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the Secretary provides copies of the schedule of the meetings of the Board of Education as herein established to The Press of Atlantic City and the Daily Journal, (FKA Mainland Journal) for the publication notices, BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that the Secretary shall post notice of special and rescheduled meetings at least forty-eight hours in advance of the meeting, and shall forward such notice to The Press of Atlantic City. By order of the Board of Education of the Special Services School District and the Vocational School District of the County of Atlantic. Nicholas Brown School Business Administrator/Board Secretary DJ-39813503,

The Purchasing Agent will publicly open the responses in the Purchasing Office beginning at 2:00 PM, July 23,2024. text: OCEAN COUNTY ORDINANCE #2024-21 AN ORDINANCE APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF $1,000,000 FROM THE CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT FUND AUTHORIZING RENOVATIONS TO THE JUVENILE DETENTION CENTER PHASE II, LOCATED IN TOMS RIVER TOWNSHIP, COUNTY OF OCEAN, STATE OF NEW JERSEY. WHEREAS, the Board of Commissioners of the County of Ocean recognizes the need for renovations to the Juvenile Detention Center Phase II, located in Toms River Township, County of Ocean, State of New Jersey; and WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of the County that funds be available for this purpose. NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED by the BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS of the COUNTY OF OCEAN, STATE OF NEW JERSEY (NOT LESS THAN TWO THIRDS OF ALL MEMBERS THEREOF AFFIRMATIVELY CONCURRING), as follows: SECTION 1: $1,000,000 is hereby appropriated from the Capital Improvement Fund for the cost of renovations to the Juvenile Detention Center Phase II, located in Toms River Township, County of Ocean, including all else necessary therefor and incidental thereto, which sum shall also cover fees and contingencies. SECTION 2: The capital budget of the County of Ocean is hereby amended to conform with the provisions of this ordinance to the extent of any inconsistency herewith. The resolution in the form promulgated by the Local Finance Board showing full detail of the amended capital budget and capital program as approved by the Director of Local Government Services is on file with the Clerk and is available there for public inspection. SECTION 3: After passage upon first reading of this Ordinance, the Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is hereby directed to publish the full text of the Ordinance, together with the notice set forth below entitled: "NOTICE OF PENDING ORDINANCE" (with appropriate completions, insertions and corrections), at least once in a newspaper qualified under N.J.S.A. 40A:2-19, at least seven days prior to the date set for public hearing and further consideration for final passage (which date shall be at least ten days after introduction and first reading). The Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is further directed to comply with all provisions of N.J.S.A. 40A:2-17(b) regarding postings, publications, and the provision of copies of this Ordinance. SECTION 4: After final adoption of this Ordinance by the Board of Commissioners, the Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is hereby directed to publish the full text of this Ordinance, as finally adopted, together with the notice set forth below entitled: "NOTICE OF ADOPTION OF ORDINANCE" (with appropriate completions, insertions and corrections), at least once in a newspaper qualified under N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-19. SECTION 5: This Ordinance shall take effect twenty (20) days after the first publication thereof after final passage. NOTICE OF ADOPTION OF ORDINANCE PUBLIC NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the Ordinance published herewith has been finally adopted by the Board of Commissioners of the County of Ocean on July 2, 2024, and the twenty (20) day period of limitation within which a suit, action or proceeding questioning the validity of such Ordinance can be commenced, as provided in the Local Bond Law, has begun to run from the date of the first publication of this notice. MICHELLE I. GUNTHER, Clerk Board of Commissioners JOHN C. SAHRADNIK County Counsel ($66.88)

The Upset Price on the day of the Sheriff's sale shall not increase by more than three percent (3.0%) from the Upset Price originally provided in the notice served upon the defendant. If this Sheriff's Sale is delayed or postponed, or if circumstances occur that require unforeseen advances to protect the borrower or the foreclosed upon residential property in the event of vandalism, weather damage, or other emergency property preservation needs, the Upset Price may be adjusted to reflect these costs. EXCEPT AS SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR IN THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", the successful (i.e. high) bidder shall tender a deposit in the amount of twenty percent (20%) of the bid price in cash and/or by certified or cashier's check, payable to the "Sheriff of Cumberland County", immediately upon the conclusion of the foreclosure sale. The balance of the purchase price shall be due in thirty (30) calendar days. The Cumberland County Sheriff's Office will not accept cash payments in excess of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) without prior written approval so that special arrangements can be made. Bidders are advised to bring certified and/or cashier's checks for any and all payments in excess of this amount. PURSUANT TO THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", in the case of residential property in which the successful bidder is the foreclosed upon defendant, next of kin, tenant, nonprofit community development corporation, or a bidder who shall occupy the property as the bidder's primary residence for a period of at least eighty-four (84) months, the successful bidder who has fulfilled all of the requirements of the Community Wealth Preservation Program shall pay a three and one-half percent (3.5%) deposit of the original Upset Price listed in the notice provided by the foreclosing plaintiff pursuant N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8(5)(a), or the final starting Upset Price listed for the sale of the property, whichever is less, with the remaining balance due within ninety (90) business days payable by cash, certified or cashier's check, or by wire transfer, made payable to the Sheriff of Cumberland County. NEW JERSEY FORECLOSURE INTERVENTION FUND: Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 2A:17-38, the Sheriff will charge and collect $350.00 from each sale. These funds are utilized in accordance with the New Jersey Foreclosure Prevention Act (codified at N.J.S.A. 55:14K-94 et seq.); and will be included in the Upset Price announced at the time of the Sheriff's Sale. CLAIMING SURPLUS MONEY: If after the sale and satisfaction of the mortgage debt, including costs and expenses, there remains any surplus money, the money will be deposited into the Superior Court Trust Fund and any person claiming the surplus, or any part thereof, may file a Motion pursuant to Court Rules 4:64-3 and 4:57-2 stating the nature and extent of that person's claim and asking for an order directing payment of the surplus money. The Sheriff or other person conducting the sale will have information regarding the surplus, if any. RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES: Prior to the sale of residential property, the foreclosing plaintiff shall disclose, if known, whether the property is vacant, tenant-occupied, or owner-occupied. If the property is vacant, the foreclosing plaintiff shall provide the successful bidder access to the property if the foreclosing plaintiff has such access and may condition access by the successful bidder on being accompanied by a representative of the foreclosing plaintiff. ADJOURNMENTS: The Sheriff reserves the right to adjourn the sale from time to time as provided by law without further notice or publication. Persons that need an accommodation (e.g. sign language, interpreter, assisted listening devices, etc.) must notify the County Office for the Disabled, 800 East Commerce Street, Bridgeton, New Jersey 08302, (856)453-2156 within fourteen (14) days of the scheduled meeting. Cumberland County cannot provide any accommodation not requested. ALL PUBLICATION COSTS SHALL BE PAID FOR BY THE PLAINTIFF. text: PUBLIC NOTICE GLOUCESTER COUNTY UTILITIES AUTHORITY NOTICE TO BIDDERS Notice is hereby given that sealed bids will be received by the Gloucester County Utilities Authority (GCUA) on Tuesday, July 30, 2024 at 10:30 a.m., prevailing time at the GCUA Administrative Office, located at 2 Paradise Road, West Deptford, New Jersey 08066, at which time and place bids will be publicly opened and immediately read for: 2024 Bioassay Laboratory Testing Services Contract. The project principally consists of providing Laboratory Testing Services to the GCUA on an "as needed, if needed, and when needed" basis. Specifications, instructions to bidders and proposal forms may be obtained on or after Monday, July 8, 2024. ALL REQUESTS FOR BID DOCUMENTS SHOULD BE MADE BY EMAIL TO dkolman@gcuanj.com at the GCUA Administrative Office, 2 Paradise Road, West Deptford, New Jersey 08066 between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, except legal holidays). Bids will be made on the proposal form provided, in the manner designated therein and required in the specifications, enclosed in an opaque sealed envelope and plainly marked on the outside with the date, time and item being bid. All bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et. seq and N.J.A.C. 17:27 (Affirmative Action), and Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12101, et. seq.). All bidders are further notified that they must comply with P.L. 1977, C. 33 and submit a Disclosure Statement listing stockholders with the bid. In addition all bidders must comply with the requirements of P.L. 2004, c. 57 and submit a copy of their New Jersey Business Registration Certificate with their bid proposal. The Owner reserves the right to reject any or all bids, to waive any informalities, deviations, or omissions in any bid or all bids, and to accept such bids and make such awards as may be in the best interest of the Owner. Furthermore, the Owner may request written clarification of any aspect of the proposal where, in the Owner's opinion, ambiguities exist. No bidder may withdraw its bid for a period of sixty (60) days after the actual date of the opening of the bids. By the Order of the Gloucester County Utilities Authority, Howard Bruner, Chairman Cost: $61.52 7/9/2024 1T (10887722)

text: Sussex Wantage Regional School District Board of Education Vacant Seat - Wantage Township The Sussex-Wantage Regional Board of Education is seeking an applicant for a vacant Wantage Township seat on the Board of Education. Candidates must be 18 years of age or older and reside in Wantage Township. The seat is available immediately through the end of calendar year 2024. Anyone interested can apply by sending a letter of interest to Christina M. Riker, Board Secretary, 27 Bank Street, Sussex, NJ 07461 or via email to criker@swregional.org. Deadline for receiving applications is Wednesday, July 24, 2024 and interviews for the seat will be conducted at the Regular Session Meeting to be held on Thursday, July 25, 2024. Christina Riker Board Secretary July 3, 2024 ($9.61) 7/9/2024

PUBLIC NOTICE THE BOARD OF EDUCATION OF THE SPECIAL SERVICES SCHOOL DISTRICT AND THE VOCATIONAL SCHOOL DISTRICT OF THE COUNTY OF ATLANTIC RESOLUTION #24/25 - 09 APPROVING APPOINTMENTS OF THE BOARD SPECIAL SERVICES SCHOOL DISTRICT AND VOCATIONAL SCHOOL DISTRICT WHEREAS, pursuant to New Jersey statutes, administrative code, the rules and regulations of the State Board of Education, and the policies, bylaws and regulations of the Board of Education, it is the duty of this Board to make certain appointments to advise and support the operation of the Board, and WHEREAS, The Board of Education of the Special Services School District and the Vocational School District of the County of Atlantic has determined that certain actions are necessary to effectively accomplish the goals, purposes and practices of the school district. BE IT RESOLVED that Keith A. Davis, Esq. of the firm Nehmad Davis and Goldstein is appointed Solicitor of this Board for the renewal term July 1, 2024 through June 30, 2025, at an annual retainer of $18,400.00. The hourly rate as needed not to exceed $150 per hour. Per RFP received June 12, 2024. NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED that the firm of Jasinski, P.C. is hereby appointed to provide legal services concerning employment, labor law, and negotiations issues for the renewal term of one year, from July 1, 2024 to June 30, 2025 at the rate of $170.00 per hour. Per RFP received June 12, 2024. BE IT RESOLVED that the firm Manders Merighi Portadin Farrell Architects, LLC. is hereby appointed as Architect of Record for the renewal term of one year, from July 1, 2024 to June 30, 2025 at a rate not to exceed $180 per hour (no increase in the current rate) - not to exceed budgeted amount per project. BE IT RESOLVED that the firm of Ford-Scott & Associates, L.L.C. is hereby appointed School Auditing Firm for the term of July 1, 2024 to June 30, 2025 for the Atlantic County Special Services School District and the Vocational School District at the following rate - Per RFP received June 12, 2024. ACSSSD ACVSD 2024/2025 $30,000.00 $26,000.00 BE IT RESOLVED that Dr. Barry Glasser, M.D. is hereby appointed as School Physician for the renewal term of one year, from July 1, 2024 through June 30, 2025 at the rate of $6,000.00. Fee to be shared between the districts: $3,000.00 for the Special Services School Staff and $3,000.00 for the Vocational School Staff and Students. BE IT RESOLVED, that the firms of Glenn Insurance, Inc. of Malaga, New Jersey and C.J. Adams and Co., Northfield, New Jersey, are hereby appointed Co-Insurance Brokers of Record for the schools' Commercial Insurance, including, but not limited to Workmen's Compensation, Property and Casualty Insurance for the renewal term of one year, from July 1, 2024 to June 30, 2025. BE IT RESOLVED that Brown & Brown Ins. / Innovative Risk Solutions of Egg Harbor Township, New Jersey is hereby appointed Insurance Broker of Record for Employee Health/Rx/Dental/Vision benefit coverage for the renewal term of one year, from July 1, 2024 to June 30, 2025. BE IT RESOLVED that Performance Marketing Group is hereby appointed Public Relations Consultant for the term of one year, from July 1, 2024 to June 30, 2025. By order of the Board of Education of the Special Services School District and the Vocational School District of the County of Atlantic. Nicholas Brown School Business Administrator/Board Secretary 7/9/2024 ($41.23)

Invitation for Bids LEGAL NOTICE ENGLEWOOD HOUSING AUTHORITY 111 WEST STREET ENGLEWOOD, NEW JERSEY 07631 APARTMENT RENOVATIONS AT VINCENT K. TIBBS SENIOR BUILDING 111 West Street, Englewood, NJ 07631 PUBLIC NOTICE is hereby given that sealed Bids will be received by the Englewood Housing Authority, (hereinafter called the Authority), in the County of Bergen, State of New Jersey at Coppa Montalbano Architects Offices, located at 97 Lackawanna Avenue, Suite 202, Totowa, New Jersey 07512, NO LATER THAN, Wednesday, August 7, 2024 at 12:00PM prevailing time. All Bids will be opened publicly and read aloud at that time. Any bids received after that date and time will be unopened and rejected. Each bid must be submitted in a sealed envelope marked on the exterior with the words "Apartment Renovations at Vincent K. Tibbs Senior Building". The Authority reserves the unqualified right to waive any informalities in bids and to reject any and all bids if it is in the best interest of the Authority to do so. CONTRACT: APARTMENT RENOVATIONS AT VINCENT K. TIBBS SENIOR BUILDING All work necessary and incidental thereto, in accordance with the Contract Documents, for the Apartment Renovations at Vincent K. Tibbs Senior Building at Ill West Street, Englewood, NJ 07631 Bids must be accompanied by a guarantee in the amount of 5% of the bid, but not in excess of $20,000.00, in the form of a certified check, cashier's check or bid bond. Bids must be accompanied by Consent of surety regardless of whether a check or Bid Bond is submitted. The Successful Bidder will be required to furnish an acceptable Performance and Labor and Material Payment Bond. All Bonds and consents of Surety must be written by Surety Companies listed in the most recent Circular No. 570 United States Department of the Treasury and licensed to do business in the State of New Jersey. Commencing Wednesday, July 10, 2024 the Contract Documents will be on file and may be examined at Coppa Montalbano Architects Offices, located at 97 Lackawanna Avenue, Totowa, New Jersey 07512 on Monday through Friday between the hours of 9:00 AM and 4:00 PM. No advance appointment is necessary. Digital media of the Contract Documents may be obtained at the Architects office during the same days and timess upon payment by check or bank draft in the amount of $25.00 for each set, payable to the Coppa Montalbano Architects. Payment for Contract Documents is non-refundable. A Pre-Bid Conference for all Bidders will be held at Ill West Street, Englewood, New Jersey 07631 in the administrative office followed by a site walk-thru, on Tuesday, July 16, 2024 at 11:30AM for the purpose of considering questions posed by Bidders. It is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that Bidders attend the Pre-Bid Conference for purposes of clarifying specific information concerning the project work, hearing other bidder's questions regarding various aspects of the Project and the answers thereto, and learning the manner of proper completion and submission of the Bid Documents to ensure a responsive Bid. A Bidder's failure to attend the PreBid Conference is at its own risk. All technical questions, comments, and inquiries should be directed in writing to Coppa Montalbano Architects no later Wednesday, July 24, 2024, via Fax 973-890-8855 or email at jmqlina@coppamontalbano.com . Written replies to any such questions will be provided to all potential offerors. No oral responses regarding technical questions or interpretations of the specifications will be provided. Addendum if applicable will be issued on Monday, July 29, 2024. Bidders must be fully licensed, certified, and insured to perform all of the work required under the Contract Documents and must be authorized to do business in the State ofNew Jersey. Any Bidder that is a corporation not chartered under the laws ofthe State ofNew Jersey must submit an affidavit certifying that said corporation is authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey. Bidders must be registered with the Department of Labor and are required to comply with the requirements of Public Law 1999, c.238, "The Public Works Contractor Registration Act", which became effective on April 11, 2000. Bidders, their subcontractors and suppliers, must comply with the New Jersey Business Registration requirements. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of Public Law 1975, c. 127 and the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27-1 et seq. which pertain to "Non-Discrimination" and "Affirmative Actions" and with the requirements of Public Law 1977, c. 33, which requires a Statement of Corporate Ownership. Domingo Senande, Executive Director Englewood Housing Authority 111 West Street, Englewood, NJ 07631 Publication Date: July 3, 2024 Record/Herald 7/9/2024 Fee $93.28 (107) 10360894

Laurel Street, City of Bridgeton, County of Cumberland, State of New Jersey 08302, on: Wednesday, the 17th day of July next, at 2:00 P.M. THE FULL LEGAL DESCRIPTION CAN BE FOUND IN THE OFFICE OF THE CLERK OF CUMBERLAND COUNTY IN BOOK 04231 AT PAGE 4605 OCCUPANCY STATUS: OCCUPIED SUBJECT TO: 2024 2ND QUARTER IN THE AMUNT $ 1,319.39 OPEN WATER IN THE AMOUNT OF $ 0.06 OPEN PLUS PENALTY; TRASH IN THE AMOUNT OF $60.00 OPEN PLUS PENALTY; POSSIBLE VACANT/ABANDONED PROPERTY REGISTRATION FEES TO THE BEST OF THIS FIRM'S KNOWLEDGE, THE PROPERTY IS NOT AN AFFORDABLE UNIT SUBJECT TO THE FAIR HOUSING ACT. THIS SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE MADE SUBJECT TO THE FOLLOWING: * Any and all unpaid taxes, assessments, water and sewer charges and/or liens (if any). Any and all interested parties must check with the tax collector, municipality, and/or utilities authority for the exact amount(s) due; * Any and all prior mortgage(s), judgment(s), and/or lien(s) (if any); * Any and all condominium association and/or homeowner association liens (if any) which may exist. * Zoning ordinances, easements, restrictions, and/or covenants of record (if any); * The rights of tenants and/or occupants of the property (if any); * Federal, state, and/or local laws, rules, regulations, and/or ordinances including, but not limited to, the "Community Wealth Preservation Program" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - modified January 12, 2024); * The rights (including, but not limited to, the right of redemption) of the United States of America (if any); and * Such state of facts as an accurate survey, title search, and/or physical inspection of the property may reveal. Subject to any and all prior matters, liens, and/or encumbrances. Any and all interested parties shall conduct and rely solely upon their own independent investigation to ascertain whether any outstanding interest(s) remain of record and/or have priority over the mortgage/lien being foreclosed; and, if so, the current amount due thereon. Interested parties are further directed to review the Notice of Sale (see New Jersey Court Rule 4:65-2 and N.J.S.A. 46:26A-11) on file in the Sheriff's Office prior to bidding. ALL PROSPECTIVE BIDDERS ARE ADVISED TO FAMILIARIZE THEMSELVES WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM" (A5664/S4240 - N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8 - MODIFIED JANUARY 12, 2024) (HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM") PRIOR TO BIDDING. THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE CANNOT AND WILL NOT PROVIDE INTERESTED PARTIES WITH ADVICE REGARDING THE APPLICATION OF THIS PROGRAM. THE APPROXIMATE AMOUNT OF THE JUDGMENT TO BE SATISFIED BY SAID THIS SALE IS $145,770.85, PLAINTIFF HAS ADVISED THE SHERIFF THAT A GOOD FAITH ESTIMATE OF THE "UPSET PRICE" ON THE DAY OF THE SHERIFF'S SALE SHALL BE $170,840.63. The Upset Price on the day of the Sheriff's sale shall not increase by more than three percent (3.0%) from the Upset Price originally provided in the notice served upon the defendant. If this Sheriff's Sale is delayed or postponed, or if circumstances occur that require unforeseen advances to protect the borrower or the foreclosed upon residential property in the event of vandalism, weather damage, or other emergency property preservation needs, the Upset Price may be adjusted to reflect these costs. EXCEPT AS SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR IN THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", the successful (i.e. high) bidder shall tender a deposit in the amount of twenty percent (20%) of the bid price in cash and/or by certified or cashier's check, payable to the "Sheriff of Cumberland County", immediately upon the conclusion of the foreclosure sale. The balance of the purchase price shall be due in thirty (30) calendar days. The Cumberland County Sheriff's Office will not accept cash payments in excess of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00) without prior written approval so that special arrangements can be made. Bidders are advised to bring certified and/or cashier's checks for any and all payments in excess of this amount. PURSUANT TO THE "COMMUNITY WEALTH PRESERVATION PROGRAM", in the case of residential property in which the successful bidder is the foreclosed upon defendant, next of kin, tenant, nonprofit community development corporation, or a bidder who shall occupy the property as the bidder's primary residence for a period of at least eighty-four (84) months, the successful bidder who has fulfilled all of the requirements of the Community Wealth Preservation Program shall pay a three and one-half percent (3.5%) deposit of the original Upset Price listed in the notice provided by the foreclosing plaintiff pursuant N.J.S.A. 22A:4-8(5)(a), or the final starting Upset Price listed for the sale of the property, whichever is less, with the remaining balance due within ninety (90) business days payable by cash, certified or cashier's check, or by wire transfer, made payable to the Sheriff of Cumberland County. NEW JERSEY FORECLOSURE INTERVENTION FUND: Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 2A:17-38, the Sheriff will charge and collect $350.00 from each sale. These funds are utilized in accordance with the New Jersey Foreclosure Prevention Act (codified at N.J.S.A. 55:14K-94 et seq.); and will be included in the Upset Price announced at the time of the Sheriff's Sale. CLAIMING SURPLUS MONEY: If after the sale and satisfaction of the mortgage debt, including costs and expenses, there remains any surplus money, the money will be deposited into the Superior Court Trust Fund and any person claiming the surplus, or any part thereof, may file a Motion pursuant to Court Rules 4:64-3 and 4:57-2 stating the nature and extent of that person's claim and asking for an order directing payment of the surplus money. The Sheriff or other person conducting the sale will have information regarding the surplus, if any. RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES: Prior to the sale of residential property, the foreclosing plaintiff shall disclose, if known, whether the property is vacant, tenant-occupied, or owner-occupied. If the property is vacant, the foreclosing plaintiff shall provide the successful bidder access to the property if the foreclosing plaintiff has such access and may condition access by the successful bidder on being accompanied by a representative of the foreclosing plaintiff. ADJOURNMENTS: The Sheriff reserves the right to adjourn the sale from time to time as provided by law without further notice or publication. Persons that need an accommodation (e.g. sign language, interpreter, assisted listening devices, etc.) must notify the County Office for the Disabled, 800 East Commerce Street, Bridgeton, New Jersey 08302, (856)453-2156 within fourteen (14) days of the scheduled meeting. Cumberland County cannot provide any accommodation not requested. ALL PUBLICATION COSTS SHALL BE PAID FOR BY THE PLAINTIFF. MICHAEL DONATO SHERIFF MCCALLA RAYMER LEIBERT PIERCE LLC Atty (s) Phone: 678-281-6500 6/18/2024, 6/25/2024, 7/2/2024, 7/9/2024 Ptr Fee: $360.84 Ad#10225844

CITY OF NEW BRUNSWICK ZONING BOARD OF ADJUSTMENT Region 9 - CHM III LLC ("Applicant") TAKE NOTICE THAT Applicant has submitted an application to the City of New Brunswick Zoning Board of Adjustment ("Zoning Board") with respect to the Applicant's property located at 45 Remsen Avenue, New Brunswick, New Jersey and listed as Block 140, Lot 4.01 on the official tax map of the City of New Brunswick, for preliminary and final major site plan approval, building height variance approval and bulk variance approval, in connection with the construction of two low-rise residential buildings consisting of ten (10) residential apartments of affordable supportive housing and one (1) on-site case management office. The Applicant has requested a variance for building height pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40:55D-70(d)(6), where 35 feet is the maximum permitted building height, and where the proposed building height will be 39 feet and six (6) inches. The Applicant has requested the following bulk variances pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40:55D-70(c): (a) lot area must exceed 10,000 square feet, where proposed lot area will be 8,625 square feet; (b) lot width must exceed 100 feet, where proposed lot width will be 75 feet; (c) rear yard setback must exceed 39.6 feet, where proposed rear yard setback will be five (5) feet; (d) side yard setback must be 15 feet; where proposed side yard setback will be five (5) feet; (e) building coverage must be no greater than 50%, where proposed building coverage will be 52.2%; (f) impervious surface coverage must be no greater than 75%, where proposed impervious surface coverage will be 93.2%; (g) parking must provide for at least 21 spaces; where proposed parking will include eight (8) spaces; (h) drive aisle width must be at least 24 feet, where proposed drive aisle width will be 21.4 feet; and (i) parking must include at least three (3) electric vehicle equipped spaces, where two spaces will be provided. Additionally, the Applicant requests such other relief as may be required including any variances, waivers, or exceptions that may be required in connection with parking lot setback, curb cut setback, landscape plantings, and buffers from adjacent residential uses. In addition to the above-described preliminary and final major site plan approval, building height variance approval, bulk variance approval, and other relief requested, the Applicant will request any additional deviations, variances, waivers, exceptions, interpretations, modifications of conditions of prior approvals, continuation of any preexisting nonconforming conditions and other approvals reflected on the filed plans (as same may be further amended or revised from time to time without further notice) and/or relief that may be deemed necessary by the Zoning Board during its review and processing of the application and/or based upon the analysis of the plans and testimony at the public hearing on the application. The Zoning Board will conduct a public hearing to obtain testimony on the application. The hearing will take place in the Council Chambers, City Hall, 3rd Floor, 78 Bayard Street, New Brunswick, during a meeting of the Zoning Board which will be called to order at 7:00 P.M. EST on July 22, 2024, and which will be conducted in person. All documents concerning the applications to be heard are on file with the New Brunswick Department of Planning, Community and Economic Development located at 25 Kirkpatrick Street, Second Floor, New Brunswick. To schedule an appointment to review any documents please call the office at (732) 745-5050 or email Board Secretary Dan Dominguez at ddominguez@cityofnewbrunswick.org. The Board Secretary can also arrange for these documents to be emailed to you. Any interested party may appear at the hearing and participate in accordance with the rules of the Zoning Board. This Notice is being sent to you pursuant to the requirements of N.J.S.A. 40:55D-1 et seq. and by order of the Zoning Board. Windels Marx Lane & Mittendorf, LLP Attorneys for Region 9 - CHM III LLC Applicant ($60.84)

NOTICE TO BIDDERS PROPOSED WATER SYSTEM UPGRADES TOWNSHIP OF BYRAM, COUNTY OF SUSSEX, STATE OF NEW JERSEY FILE No.: SCE-R13340.021 Sealed Bids for the North Shore Water Association Proposed Water System Upgrades will be received by SUBURBAN CONSULTING ENGINEERS INC., 96 U.S. Highway 206, Flanders, New Jersey 07836 on August 1, 2024, at 10:00am, prevailing time, at which time and place they will be publicly opened and read aloud. No Bids will be accepted after said hour. A non-mandatory pre-bid meeting will be held on July 17, 2024 at 10:00am, prevailing time, at the North Shore Water Association, located at 1 Hi To Ga Trail, Andover, New Jersey 07821. The work will include but is not limited to the construction of a new treatment facility near Well No. 2, complete and inclusive of all components as depicted herein the Construction Documents as well as the demolition of the existing treatment facility, and decommissioning of Well No. 1 upon successful startup of the new facility. The scope of work consists of all structural, mechanical, electrical, and related utility appurtenances, for the installation of the new well treatment facility. The treatment facility comprises all well process piping appurtenances (including the ion exchange system, and Submersible Well Pump), yard piping, site improvements, electrical improvements (including generator), and related appurtenances. The contractor is responsible for providing all labor, supervision, trade skills, materials, and equipment required for this project as described in the Construction Documents. The contractor is responsible for providing all labor, supervision, trade skills, materials, and equipment required for this project as described in the Construction Documents. The Contract shall be substantially complete by December 31, 2024. Final completion shall be 60 days after substantial completion. All necessary bid specifications and bid forms may be secured on or after July 9, 2024, upon written request to: SUBURBAN CONSULTING ENGINEERS INC. Email procurement@suburbanconsulting.com 96 U.S. Highway 206 Flanders, New Jersey 07836 Telephone 973-398-1776 Fax 973-398-2121 Written request must contain company name, company address, contact name, contact telephone number, contact fax telephone number, and contact email address in order to receive link to download documents. In submitting this request you will be registered for this bid, only registered bidders will be allowed to submit a bid. All digital documents are at no cost to bidder. One hard copy and one electronic copy of the Bids shall be made on the forms provided and made part of the Contract Documents. A certified check or cashier's check made payable to the order of the North Shore Water Association, or a duly executed Bid Bond, in the amount of ten percent (10%) of each bid, but in no case in excess of $20,000.00 must be deposited by the Bidder together with a Surety Consent evidencing that They can obtain the required Performance Bond. The successful Bidder will be required to deliver to the Owner an executed Performance Bond and Payment Bond of a responsible indemnity company authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of the New Jersey State Statutes: N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27 Affirmative Action Section 1 of P.L.1977, c.33 Statement of Ownership (N.J.S.A. C.52:25-24.2) N.J.S.A. 40A:11-18 American Goods and Products to be Used Where Possible Section 21 of P.L.1971, c.198 Guarantee to be Furnished with Bid (N.J.S.A. OCEAN COUNTY ORDINANCE #2024-24 AN ORDINANCE APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF $2,000,000 FROM THE CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT FUND FOR THE COST OF RENOVATIONS, IMPROVEMENTS & UPGRADES, TO THE OCEAN COUNTY VOCATIONAL TECHNICAL SCHOOLS, IN THE TOWNSHIP OF BRICK AND OTHER VARIOUS LOCATIONS, COUNTY OF OCEAN, STATE OF NEW JERSEY. WHEREAS, the Board of Commissioners of the County of Ocean recognizes the need for the renovations, improvements & upgrades, to the Ocean County Vocational Technical Schools, in the Township of Brick and other various locations, County of Ocean, State of New Jersey; and WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of the County that funds be available for this purpose. NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED by the BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS of the COUNTY OF OCEAN, STATE OF NEW JERSEY (NOT LESS THAN TWO THIRDS OF ALL MEMBERS THEREOF AFFIRMATIVELY CONCURRING), as follows: SECTION 1: $2,000,000 is hereby appropriated from the Capital Improvement Fund for the cost of renovations, improvements & upgrades, to the Ocean County Vocational Technical Schools, in the Township of Brick and other various locations, County of Ocean, which sum shall also cover fees and contingencies. SECTION 2: The capital budget of the County of Ocean is hereby amended to conform with the provisions of this ordinance to the extent of any inconsistency herewith. The resolution in the form promulgated by the Local Finance Board showing full detail of the amended capital budget and capital program as approved by the Director of Local Government Services is on file with the Clerk and is available there for public inspection. SECTION 3: After passage upon first reading of this Ordinance, the Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is hereby directed to publish the full text of the Ordinance, together with the notice set forth below entitled: "NOTICE OF PENDING ORDINANCE" (with appropriate completions, insertions and corrections), at least once in a newspaper qualified under N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-19, at least seven days prior to the date set for public hearing and further consideration for final passage (which date shall be at least ten days after introduction and first reading). The Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is further directed to comply with all provisions of N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-17(b) regarding postings, publications, and the provision of copies of this Ordinance. SECTION 4: After final adoption of this Ordinance by the Board of Commissioners, the Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is hereby directed to publish the full text of this Ordinance, as finally adopted, together with the notice set forth below entitled: "NOTICE OF ADOPTION OF ORDINANCE" (with appropriate completions, insertions and corrections), at least once in a newspaper qualified under N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-19. SECTION 5: This Ordinance shall take effect twenty (20) days after the first publication thereof after final passage. NOTICE OF ADOPTION OF ORDINANCE PUBLIC NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the Ordinance published herewith has been finally adopted by the Board of Commissioners of the County of Ocean on July 2, 2024, and the twenty (20) day period of limitation within which a suit, action or proceeding questioning the validity of such Ordinance can be commenced, as provided in the Local Bond Law, has begun to run from the date of the first publication of this notice. MICHELLE I. GUNTHER, Clerk Board of Commissioners JOHN C. SAHRADNIK County Counsel ($68.64)

ZONING BOARD OF ADJUSTMENT BERKELEY HEIGHTS, NJ LEGAL NOTICE TAKE NOTICE THAT Philip and Rachel Brodkin have appealed to the Board of Adjustment of the Township of Berkeley Heights for relief from the provisions of Article 6.1, Section 6.1.1B, of the Zoning Ordinance so as to permit the construction of a new garage with an addition above, a one-story addition at the right rear of the house, new front portico, new front walkway, and interior renovations. The proposed construction would take place on premises located at 33 Campbell Lane and also known as Block 507, Lot 15, on the Tax Map, which is within 200 feet of property owned by you. Variances are needed for insufficient front-yard setback, side-yard setback, and combined side-yard setbacks. The proposed driveway location would also require relief from the zoning ordinance. Existing nonconforming issues are lot width, principal front-yard setback, principal side-yard setback, and location of the driveway. The applicant requests any and all such other variances, design waivers, site plan exceptions and/or other relief from the Board of Adjustment as may be deemed necessary or required at the time of the hearing of this matter. This appeal is now on the Secretary's calendar, and a public hearing has been ordered for Thursday evening, July 25, 2024, at 7:00 p.m. prevailing time, in the public meeting room of the Municipal Building (Room 155, the "Berkeley Room"), 29 Park Avenue, Berkeley Heights, NJ at which time you may appear either in person or by attorney and present any objection which you may have to the granting of this appeal. Copies of said plans may be found in the office of the Board Secretary between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. Monday through Thursday. (The office closes at 1:00 p.m. on Fridays during the summer.) You may also contact the Board Secretary at (908) 464-2700, Ext. 2124, or cvalenti@bhtwp.com to request copies of the plans and/or documents related to the proposed application. SOMERSET COUNTY NOTICE TO BIDDERS Notice is hereby given that on TUESDAY, JULY 30, 2024, at 4:00 PM, sealed bids will be opened and read in public by the Purchasing Agent in the County of Somerset, Administration Building, 20 Grove Street, Somerville, New Jersey 08876, 3rd Floor, County Commissioner's Meeting Room for: EXTERIOR REPAIRS TO VAN HORNE HOUSE PHASE III, 941 EAST MAIN STREET, BRIDGEWATER TOWNSHIP, SOMERSET COUNTY, NEW JERSEY, CONTRACT NO. 23009 Bids shall be delivered in sealed envelopes and addressed to Melissa A. Kosensky, Purchasing Agent, County Administration Building, Purchasing - 3rd Floor, 20 Grove Street, Somerville, New Jersey 08876, clearly marked on the outside with the contract name and number, bearing the name and address of the bidder on the outside. We value the integrity of the procurement process, and in full transparency, the bid opening will be conducted via Live-Stream from the County Commissioner's Meeting Room. You can access the Live-Stream from the County's homepage at the prevailing date and time stated in this Notice to Bidders. During the bid opening process, the bidders will be announced as will bid amounts. A bid review providing unit prices will not take place at the openings. Instead, this information will be posted, as always to the Purchasing webpage once available. Instructions for downloading Specifications and Plans/Drawings from the County's website can be obtained by contacting the Purchasing Division at PurchasingDiv@co.somerset.nj.us. Release of all Plans/Drawings requires receipt of a form of identification from the requesting individual and Company information. [Examples: Company ID/Business Card] All information is subject to verification. A hard copy of the contract documents can be requested through the Engineering Office at EngineeringDiv@co.somerset.nj.us for a non-refundable fee of $75.00 payable to the Somerset County Treasurer. A pre-bid meeting will be held on Thursday, July 18th, 2024, at 10:00AM at the project site located at 941 East Main Street, Bridgewater, NJ 08807. Bidder shall submit with the bid a certified check, cashier's check or bid bond in the amount of ten percent (10%) of the total price bid, but not in excess of $20,000.00, payable unconditionally to Somerset County Treasurer, along with a Certificate (Consent of Surety) with Power of Attorney for full amount of bid price from a Surety Company authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey and that said Surety will furnish a Performance and Payment Bond in amounts of 100% of successful bidder's contract. Invitation to Bid Notice to Bidders is hereby given that sealed proposals will be received as set forth below. 1. Owner: Borough of Fair Haven 2. Work Title: Improvements to Fair Haven Road - Phases 1 and 2 3. Work Site: From River Road to Ridge Road 4. Work Description: Removal/replacement and/or installation of concrete curb, sidewalk, ADA ramps, and driveways; milling and paving; installation of inlets and pipe; signage, striping, and miscellaneous restorations. 5. Engineer: Richard Gardella, PE, PP, CME, CPWM Telephone: 732.747.0241 ext. *204 Email: rgardella@fhboro.net 6. Contract Documents: Contract documents and drawings for the proposed work (the "Contract Documents", which have been prepared by Richard Gardella, PE, PP, CME, CPWM will be on file at the below date in the Borough of Fair Haven, 748 River Road, Fair Haven, NJ 07704. Contract Documents may be examined, Monday through Friday, except legal holidays, from 8:30 AM to 3:30 PM, prevailing time, at the Owner's address. There is no fee for plans and specifications. PDF's of the plans and specifications will be emailed for those who request a copy. No hard copies will be available for distribution. 7. Pre-Bid Meeting: None Date: Not Applicable Time: Not Applicable Location: Not Applicable 8. Completion Time: All work on this contract must be completed within 250 calendar days from issuance of a Notice to Proceed. 9. Submission of Bid: Proposals must be made on the standard proposal forms included with the Contract Documents in the manner designated in the Contract Documents, must be enclosed in sealed envelopes bearing the name and address of the bidder and the name of the project on the outside and be addressed to the Borough of Fair Haven. 10. Bid Guarantee and Consent of Surety: All proposals must be accompanied by a statement of consent of surety from a surety company authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey and acceptable to the Owner and either a bid bond or a certified check drawn to the order of Borough of Fair Haven for not less than ten percent (10%) of the amount bid, except that the check shall not exceed $20,000.00. The successful bidder is hereby notified that a performance bond and labor and material (payment) bond for the full amount of this project is required. 11. Public Bid Opening and Reading: Date: Friday, July 19, 2024 Time: 10:00 AM prevailing time Location: Fair Haven Borough Hall, 748 River Road, Fair Haven, NJ 07704 12. Funding Source(s): Please be advised that the project is partially funded by NJDOT. 13. Statutory Requirements: The successful bidder shall be required to comply with all applicable statutory and regulatory requirements, which include but are not limited to the affirmative action requirements of P.L. 1975, c. 127, N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27-1 et seq. Bidders will be required to comply with the public disclosure provisions of N.J.S.A. 52:25-24.2. 14. Award or Rejection of Bids: The award of the Contract for this project will not be made until the necessary funds have been provided by the Owner in a lawful manner. Proposals for this contract will only be accepted from bidders who have properly qualified in accordance with the requirements of the Contract Documents. The right is also reserved to reject any or all bids or to waive any informalities where such informality is not detrimental to the best interest of the Owner, except as to those items which are deemed mandatory and non-waivable set forth in N.J.S.A. 40A:11-23.2. Further, the Owner reserves the right to abandon the project and reject the bids entirely if any legal or state or federal administrative action is taken against the Owner which could delay or jeopardize the project from commencing. The right is also reserved to increase or decrease the quantities specified in the manner designated in the Specifications. BY ORDER OF Borough of Fair Haven Allyson M. Cinquegrana, Borough Clerk ($105.60)
