NOTICE OF DECISION Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40:55D-10(i) PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that the Zoning Board of Adjustment of the Township of Ocean ("Board") did, on the 19th day of June, 2024 formally adopt a Resolution memorializing the action of the Board taken at its meeting of May 7, 2024, granting Synagogue of Oakhurst Community Center, Inc. ("Applicant") approvals for property known as Lot 1 in Block 12.02 as shown on the Official Tax Map of the Township of Ocean and located at 1 Bauer Avenue, Ocean Township, New Jersey ("Property"). The Property is located at the southeast corner of the intersection of Bauer Avenue and South Lincoln Avenue. The Property contains a 3-story synagogue, associated parking and related site improvements, all of which were approved by the Board via Resolution adopted September 9, 2009 ("2009 Approval"). The use is a conditionally permitted use in the R-2 Low Density Residential Single-Family Residential Zone in which the Property is located. The current approval permits preliminary and final major site plan approval to demolish the existing building and construct a new, 2-story, approximately 12,449 square foot (including basement) synagogue containing a 404-seat sanctuary as well as related offices, study areas and gathering rooms. As part of the current approval, the Board agreed to modify a Deed Restriction imposed by the 2009 Approval to eliminate the limitation on the use of the basement for storage only. In conjunction with the approvals, the Board granted the following variance relief: New conditional use variance relief pursuant to NJSA 40:55D-70.d.3 as follows: * Lot area of 0.446 acres, whereas a minimum of 2 acres is required. * Lot depth of 67 feet, whereas a minimum of 200 feet is required. * Front yard setback (South Lincoln Avenue to window wells) of 26.33 feet and to building of 30 feet, whereas a minimum of 56.9 feet is required. * Rear yard (east) setback of 10 feet, whereas a minimum of 13.4 feet is required. * Lot (building) coverage of 44.4%, whereas a maximum of 30% is permitted. * Parking buffer to residential zone of 3.4 feet, whereas a minimum of 25 feet is required. Bulk variance relief pursuant to NJSA 40:55D-70.c as follows: * Lot (impervious) coverage of 65.24%, whereas a maximum of 75% is permitted. * Parking stall width of 9 feet, whereas 10 feet is required. * Provision of 17 off-street parking spaces, whereas a minimum of 202 spaces are required. * Two (2) curb cuts, whereas 1 curb cut is permitted. * Parking setback from Bauer Avenue of 8 feet, whereas a minimum of 25 feet is required. * Paving setback of 3.4 feet, whereas a minimum of 5 feet is required . * Signage: * Three (3) facade signs and a canopy sign for a total of 4 signs along Bauer Avenue frontage, whereas a maximum number of 1 facade sign is permitted per street frontage. * Three (3) facade signs on the south elevation facing the parking lot, whereas facade signs are only permitted on facades facing a street frontage. PLEASE TAKE FURTHER NOTICE that the Resolution and materials relied on by the Board at the meetings of May 7, 2024 and June 19, 2024 are on file at the office of the Board located at 399 Monmouth Road, Oakhurst, New Jersey. In order to review these materials please call the Board Secretary at 732-531-5000 ext. 3351 during the Township's normal business hours. ANSELL GRIMM & AARON, P.C. Attorneys for Applicant JENNIFER S. KRIMKO, ESQ. July 3, 2024 ($60.72)

NOTICE OF DECISION Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40:55D-10(i) PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that the Land Use Board of the Borough of Bradley Beach ("Board") did, on the 20th day of June, 2024, formally adopt a Resolution memorializing the action of the Board taken at its May 16, 2024 meeting, granting Bradley Lab, LLC amended site plan approval with regard to property known as Lot 30 in Block 71 as shown on the Official Tax Map of the Borough of Bradley Beach and located at 110 Main Street, Bradley Beach, New Jersey ("Property"). The Property contains a two-story cinema building which is not a permitted use in the General Business Zone, in which the Property is located. By Resolution adopted June 16, 2022, the Board granted the minor site plan approval with bulk and use variance relief to permit interior and exterior renovations to the existing building and to permit the expansion of the pre-existing, nonconforming movie theater use to include service of food and beverages as well as additional screening rooms. The current approval grants amended minor site plan approval to further reconfigure the interior and exterior over what was previously approved. The interior renovations are proposed to include: concessions, bathrooms, bar, cafe, offices, and conversion of a rear function space into a second theater with a seating capacity not to exceed 39 seats. PLEASE TAKE FURTHER NOTICE that the Resolution and materials relied on by the Board at the meetings of May 16, 2024 and June 20, 2024 are on file and available for inspection at the office of the Board, located at Borough Hall, 710 Main Street, Bradley Beach 07720, New Jersey. In order to review these materials, please contact the Board Secretary via e-mail by submitting a request to kdickert@bradleybeachnj.gov. ANSELL GRIMM & AARON, P.C. Attorneys for Applicant ________________________________ JENNIFER S. KRIMKO, ESQ. July 3, 2024 ($38.72)

Bidders are reminded that proposals shall be enclosed in a sealed opaque envelope and the outside of the envelope shall bear the name, address and email address of the bidder as well as the indication, "HOFSTRA PARK PLAYGROUND IMPROVEMENTS". It is the bidder's responsibility to ensure that the bid is received on time. Neither the Borough, nor the Engineer will assume any responsibility for bids mis-mailed, misdelivered, or misdirected. A certified check or bank draft, payable to the order of Borough of Prospect Park, or negotiable U. S. Government Bonds (at par value), or a satisfactory Bid Bond executed by the Bidder and an acceptable surety, in an amount of ten (10%) percent of the total of the Total Bid not to exceed $20,000 shall be submitted with each bid. Bids shall include a Consent of Surety obligating the issuing surety to provide the bidder, if awarded a contract for the Project, with performance and payment bonds as required by the Project Specifications. The Borough of Prospect Park reserves the right to waive any informality in and to accept or reject any and all bids. No bid may be withdrawn for a period of sixty (60) days. Bidders must submit with their bids the non-collusion affidavit contained in the contract documents. The successful bidder will be required to comply with all provisions of prevailing wage rates as determined by the New Jersey Department of Labor. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31, et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27, regarding Affirmative Action and Executive Order 11246 regarding Equal Opportunity, and with all provisions of the Local Public Contracts Law, N.J.S.A. 40A:11-1 et. seq. and all rules and regulations promulgated thereunder, the provisions of which are incorporated herein by reference. Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 34:11-56.50 et seq., Bidders and their subcontractors are required to be registered with the New Jersey Department of Labor and to possess a current certificate from said Department indicating compliance at the time of Bidding. Please be advised that State funds through the Green Acres Program are being utilized in this project. Bidders and the successful contractor will be required to comply with all Rules and Regulations relating to Green Acres Funding. Under N.J.A.C. 7:1-5, vendors currently suspended, debarred, or disqualified are excluded from participation in this project. New Jersey Business Registration Requirements: N.J.S.A. 40A:11-23.2 requires all contractors and subcontractors with public contracting agencies to provide proof of registration with the Department of Treasury, Division of Revenue. The contractor shall provide written notice to its subcontractors of the responsibility to submit proof of business registration to the contractor. The requirement of proof of business registration extends down through all levels (tiers) of the project. Before final payment on the contract is made by the contracting agency, the contractor shall submit an accurate list and the proof of business registration of each subcontractor or supplier used in the fulfillment of the contract or shall attest that no subcontractors were used. For the term of the contract, the contractor and each of its affiliates and a subcontractor and each of its affiliates [N.J.S.A. 52:32-44(g) (3)] shall collect and remit to the Director, New Jersey Division of Taxation, the use tax due pursuant to the Sales and Use Tax Act on all sales of tangible personal property delivered into this State, regardless of whether the tangible personal property is intended for a contract with a contracting agency. The successful bidder will be required to break ground on or before July 15, 2024, granted that the governing body awards the contract before this date. The owner reserves the right to reject any or all bids or to waive any informality in the bidding. No vendor or listed subcontractor who is listed on the State Treasurer's or the Federal Government's List of Debarred, Suspended or Disqualified Vendors shall be eligible to submit a bid or proposal. BOROUGH OF PROSPECT PARK Fahim Abedrabbo, Acting Municipal Clerk Record/Herald News 07/09/2024 (244) $107.36 10361068

Public Notice YOU ARE HEREBY NOTIFIED as required by law and in compliance with Chapter 305-E of the Township of Lakewood Unified Development Ordinance (the "Ordinance") that the Planning Board of the Township of Lakewood, Ocean County, New Jersey, will hold a public hearing on July 23, 2024 at 6:00 p.m. in the Lakewood Township Municipal Building, 231 Third Street, Lakewood, New Jersey to consider the application of H & B Trust (the "Applicant") for the following approvals: 1. The subject property is located at Block 133, Lot 6 at 141 Ninth Street in the Township of Lakewood in the R-M Multi-Family Zone' (the "Property"). 2. Applicant seeks the following: A. Minor Subdivision Approval to create two new zero lot line lots upon which a duplex will be constructed. B. In the R-M Zone, the minimum required lot area for a duplex is 10,000 square feet. The Property contains 9,750 square feet. Hence Applicant seeks a variance for minimum lot area. C. In the RM Zone, the minimum required side yard setback is 7 feet. Applicant proposes sideyard setback of 6 feet and hence requests a variance for same. D. In the RM Zone, the maximum allowable building coverage is 35%. Applicant proposes building coverage of 39.32% and hence requests a variance for same. E. Applicant further seeks such other variances and/or design waivers that the Board may require as may be disclosed on the plans. NOTICE OF DECISION Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40:55D-10(i) PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that the Planning Board of the Township of Ocean ("Board") did, on the 24th day of June, 2024, formally adopt a Resolution memorializing the action of the Board taken at its May 23, 2024 meeting granting 1416 Roller Road, LLC site plan approval with bulk variance relief with regard to properties known as Lots 1 and 2 in Block 182 as shown on the Official Tax Map of the Township of Ocean and located at located at 1416 South Roller Road (Lot 1) and 1414 South Roller Road (Lot 2), Ocean Township, New Jersey (collectively "Property"). The approval permits: demolition of the existing manufacturing facility and related improvements located on Lot 1 in order to construct a 22,429 square foot warehouse and office addition to the existing building located on Lot 2 along with landscaping, loading, parking, drainage and related site improvements. Lots 1 and 2 will be consolidated into a single lot. In conjunction with the approval, the Board granted bulk variance relief pursuant to NJSA 40:55D-70.c as follows: * Side yard (north) setback of 50 feet to the addition, whereas a minimum of 100 feet is required. * Lot coverage of 153.2% based on buildable lot area, whereas a maximum of 54% is permitted. * Change of grade in excess of the maximum 2 feet permitted without a variance. * Parking space size width of 9 feet, whereas a minimum of 10 feet is required. * Parking spaces located partially on a public street, whereas all parking spaces are required to be connected to a public street through a driveway and must maintain a 25 foot setback from the public street. * Parking in a front yard that is not limited to visitor parking only. * Curb cuts on South Roller Road of 130 feet, 90 feet and 50 feet wide, whereas a maximum of 30 feet wide is permitted. * Five (5) curb cuts, whereas a maximum of 2 are permitted. * Thirty-three (33) parking spaces on site (21 to be constructed and 12 to be green banked), whereas a minimum of 77 off-street parking spaces are required. An additional 23 striped parking spaces are proposed partially on South Roller Road. * Loading area in a front yard, whereas loading areas are not permitted in front yards. * Buffer to residential zone of 50 feet, whereas a minimum of 150 feet is required. * Lack of required landscaped areas along front, side and rear property lines. * Lack of required street trees along South Roller Road. In addition, the Board also granted design waiver relief pursuant to NJSA 40:55D-51 for sod requirements, Tree Location and Preservation Plan, and lighting. PLEASE TAKE FURTHER NOTICE that the Resolution and materials relied on by the Board at the meetings of May 23, 2024 and June 24, 2024 are on file at the office of the Board located at 399 Monmouth Road, Oakhurst, New Jersey. In order to review these materials please call the Board Secretary at 732-531-5000 ext. 3351 during the Township's normal business hours. ANSELL GRIMM & AARON, P.C. Attorneys for Applicant /S/ JENNIFER S. KRIMKO, ESQ. July 3, 2024 ($72.60)

NOTICE REGARDING SALE OF MUNICIPALLY OWNED REAL ESTATE Pursuant to N.J.S.A. Title 40A:12-13, NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN THAT A PUBLIC SALE OF MUNICIPALLY OWNED REAL ESTATE shall be conducted on 25th day of July, 2024, at 2:00 P.M. in the Borough Council Chambers, 701 Main Street, Bradley Beach, NJ 07720 in Monmouth County. The real estate is owned by the Borough of Bradley Beach and shall be offered for sale at a public auction to the highest qualified bidder under the Options outlined below. The Borough Governing Body will determine under which Option the award will be made. The subject real estate consists of 24,000 square feet as shown on the Tax Map of the Borough of Bradley Beach as Lot 41 in Block 1 located in the R-1 Single Family Residential Zone. The property may be physically inspected Monday through Friday from the hours of 9:00 AM to 2:00 PM by appointment only prior to the day of the Auction Sale. Appointments to schedule an inspection can be arranged by contacting the Borough Office at 732-776-2999 x1029. The subject property will be sold in accordance with the highest bid of one of the two following Options, as it is determined by the Governing Body at its regular meeting of June 26th, 2024 to be in the best interest of the Borough: 1. Option A: The conditions according to which the sale of the subject property would be subject are: a. All existing structures and improvements shall be demolished in accordance with all extent and applicable regulations, statutes, ordinances applicable thereto. b. The resulting vacant property shall be subdivided into 4 market rate single family building lots in accordance with the Major Subdivision Plat prepared by CME Associates, dated 4/13/2023. c. In the event that title is proven to be unmarketable, the sole liability of the Borough shall be to return any deposit money. d. Any sale shall be subject to any easement or restrictions of record and such statement of facts as an accurate survey shall reveal. e. The successful bidder shall be responsible for the cleanup of any environmental contamination located on, under, over or within the above parcel, if any. No deduction shall be made from the purchase price for such cleanup. The successful bidder shall indemnify and hold harmless the Borough from any claims relating to such environmental contamination or the cleanup thereof. f. The property is sold "as is." The Borough makes no representations as to the condition or quality of the land or improvements upon said parcel. Bidders may inspect said parcel prior to the public sale and shall be responsible to fully acquaint themselves with the condition and quality of the property prior to the public sale. g. The Borough shall not pay any broker's commission in connection with this sale and the successful bidder shall indemnify and hold harmless the Borough from any such claim therefor arising by reason of the conduct of the successful bidder. h. Certain historical artifacts, as set forth in the bid package, are excluded from the sale of the property, and the purchaser shall permit the removal of such artifacts prior to demolition of the structures upon the property. i. The sale of the property shall be subject to the following deed restrictions which shall be deemed to run with the land: i. The property may not be used or developed for any purpose for which property tax exemption may be granted. ii. The property may only be used for single-family residential dwelling purposes with lawful accessory structures. iii. The purchaser shall release and forever discharge any right or ability to file a builder's remedy lawsuit against the Borough pertaining to the subject property. j. All improvements shall be subject to provisions of the various Borough, State and Federal land use, zoning and other applicable laws, ordinances and restrictions. k. Minimum Bid Price: $3,500,000.00 2. Option B: Is a sale of the property "free of all such restrictions, conditions, interests or estates on the part of the ... municipality," except existing applicable regulatory, land use, zoning and other restrictions. a. Minimum Bid Price of $3,500,000.00. Prospective purchasers are urged to consult with the Code of the Borough of Bradley Beach with respect to land use and other restrictions affecting this property. The Code is available for reading at the Borough Clerk's Office in Borough Hall during normal business hours and by visiting the Borough of Bradley Beach website (www.bradleybeachnj.gov). The Contract for Sale shall not be subject to Attorney Review. Prospective bidders are urged to consult with an attorney regarding the terms of the sale and the content of the Contract for Sale; said consultation shall take place prior to attending the auction and executing the Contract for Sale. The real estate will be sold at a public auction which will be conducted under the direction of Gregory Cannon, Borough Attorney. Mr. Cannon will have exclusive control and authority over the conduct of the auction sale. His decisions regarding any aspect of the auction shall be final and binding upon all parties. The award of the sale shall be by the Borough Governing Body and "shall be made not later than at the second regular meeting of the Governing Body following the sale, and, if the Governing Body shall not so accept such highest bid, or reject all bids, said bids shall be deemed to have been rejected. Any such sale may be adjourned at the time advertised for not more than one week without readvertising." (N.J.S.A. 40A:12-13) The real estate will be sold to the highest qualified bidder for the Option chosen by the Governing Body and a registration deposit in the amount of $10,000 shall be required. The registration deposit must be tendered at the time of registration and must be in the form of a certified check or official bank check. Prospective bidders must register by appointment with the Borough Clerk before 12:00 Noon, July 24th, 2024 (the day prior to the date of the auction) between the hours of 9:00 AM and 12:00 Noon. Registration will take place in Borough Hall, 701 Main Street, Bradley Beach, NJ 07720. In order to qualify to register, a prospective bidder must provide the Clerk with acceptable proof of ability to tender the deposit (10% of the highest minimum bid) and to close the subject sale on or before September 4th, 2024, under Options A and B, time of the essence. At the time of registration, the prospective bidders shall tender certified funds of $10,000.00 and proof from a third-party financial institution, brokerage house or lending institution in the nature of prequalification letter of a least the minimum bid price to consummate the sale. Failure to submit proof will disqualify an individual from registering. Bidding will begin at the minimum bid price. The Borough reserves the right to reject any and all bids. The successful highest bidder in each Option (A and B) shall be required to execute an Agreement for Sale of the Real Estate immediately following the conclusion of the auction and to tender a deposit of ten percent (10%) of the bid. Final closing of title shall take place on or before September 4th, 2024 for Option A and B, and closing is subject only to those terms contained in the contract. In the event the successful bidder is unable to close by the aforesaid date, through no fault of the Borough of Bradley Beach, the successful bidder shall forfeit the deposit monies. A copy of the form of contract and auction bid package are available for inspection at the Borough Office during normal business hours. A copy of the Notice and bid package may be obtained at a cost of $25.00 by calling 732-776-2999, extension 1029. The sale of this property has been authorized by the Governing Body of the Borough of Bradley Beach by adoption of Resolution R-2024-150 on June 26, 2024. ($285.12)

INVITATION to BID Re-Bid for the HOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF UNION CITY The Housing Authority of the City of Union City, State of New Jersey, will receive sealed bids for New Roofs @ Two (2) Housing Authority Buildings 3901 Kennedy Boulevard & 3911 Kennedy Boulevard, Union City, NJ 07087 The work is as described and in accordance with the Specifications / Project Manual prepared together with such addenda as may be issued prior to the date of receipt of bids. Bids will be received by the Public Housing Authority on Wednesday, July 24, 2024 at 11:00 A.M. at the Office of the City Clerk of the City of Union City, 2nd Floor, 3715 Palisade Ave., Union City, NJ. 07087 Attn : City Clerk at which time and place the bids will be publicly opened and read aloud. Bidders must comply with the requirements of P.L.1975, c.127 and N.J.S.A. 17:27; the requirements for Alternative Dispute Resolution ADR as established by P.L.I 977, c.371; N.J.S.A. 40.A: 11-50 and specification of subcontractor's scope of work as established by P.L.1997, c.408, N.J.S.A. 40.A:11-16. Sealed proposals will be received for all labor and materials to complete the project. The Public Housing Authority reserves the right to waive any informality in any bid or bids, to reject any and all bids, and to accept such bid or bids and to make such awards as may be in the best interest of the Public Housing Authority in accordance with any and all applicable laws and regulations. Bid proposals must be submitted as directed by the Project Manual, in a sealed envelope, addressed to Office of the City Clerk of the City of Union City 3715 Palisade Ave. 2nd Floor, Union City, NJ. 07087 Attn : City Clerk Re: Bid Package for Union City Housing Authority New Roofs @ Two (2) Housing Authority Buildings 3901 Kennedy Boulevard & 3911 Kennedy Boulevard, Union City, NJ 07087 From: Name of Bidder Address of Bidder Envelopes shall, on the exterior, be designated as to the Contract for which the proposal is entered, and the name and address of the Bidder. Bid proposals for up to $400,000.00 must be accompanied by a negotiable bid guarantee which shall not be less than ten percent (10%) of the amount of the bid, but not more than $20,000.00. Bids over $400,000.00 shall be accompanied with a negotiable bid guarantee of five percent (5%) of the bid amount. The bid guarantee may be a certified check, bank draft, payable to the Housing Authority or a Bid Bond executed by the Bidder and Sureties acceptable to the U.S. Government and authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey. Bid guarantee must be made out to the Housing Authority of the City of Union City. The bid guarantee shall insure the execution of the contract and the furnishing of a method of assurance of completion by the successful bidder as required by the solicitation. The bid guarantee must be accompanied by certification from Surety Company that they will provide performance and labor bond for 100% of the contract price (see enclosed Consent of Surety Form). Failure to submit a bid guarantee with the bid shall result in the rejection of the bid. Bid guarantees submitted by unsuccessful bidders will be returned as soon as practicable after bid opening. Proposals must also be accompanied by the affidavits, etc., referred to in the Instruction to Bidders in the Project Manual. All Bidders, including Corporations, Partnerships and Sole Proprietorships must submit a Statement of Ownership and must be register with the Department of Labor as a Public Works Contractor as per PL1999 C238NJSA39:11-56.48 and must provide a Business Registration Certificate issued by the NJ State Division of Revenue for the prime contractor and any subcontractor they may use. Proposals must be accompanied by a project schedule. All bidders and subcontractors must comply with Section 3 regulations and reporting requirements. See Federal Regulation 24 CFR Part 135.1. The Specifications / Project Manuals may be obtained at the offices of The Housing Authority of the City of Union City , NJ 3911 Kennedy Boulevard, Union City, NJ from 9:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M. and 1:00 P.M. to 4:00 P.M. There will be a Pre-Bid Meeting/Site Walk Thru on Tuesday, July 16, 2024 at 11:00 ambeginning at the Housing Authority Administration Office located at 3911 Kennedy Blvd, Union City, New Jersey. Interested bidders are requested, but not required to attend this meeting. Prospective bidders are hereby informed that not less than the minimum prevailing wage rates as required by HUD shall be paid on this project. This project is being executed with funds provided by the U.S. Government through the Department of Housing and Urban Development. No bidders may withdraw their bid within thirty (30) days after the actual date of the bid opening. Minorities/Women owned firms are welcome to bid. The Union City Housing Authority is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Issued Date: Mr. Stanley M. Sanger, Executive Director Record/Herald-July 9, 2024 Fee: $86.24 10333338

OCEAN COUNTY ORDINANCE #2024-23 AN ORDINANCE APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF $1,200,000 FROM THE CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT FUND FOR THE COST OF RENOVATIONS, IMPROVEMENTS AND UPGRADES AT THE NORTHERN RECYCLING CENTER LOCATED IN LAKEWOOD TOWNSHIP, COUNTY OF OCEAN, STATE OF NEW JERSEY. WHEREAS, the Board of Commissioners of the County of Ocean recognizes the need for renovations, improvements and upgrades at the Northern Recycling Center located in Lakewood Township, County of Ocean, State of New Jersey; and WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of the County that funds be available for this purpose. NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED by the BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS of the COUNTY OF OCEAN, STATE OF NEW JERSEY (NOT LESS THAN TWO THIRDS OF ALL MEMBERS THEREOF AFFIRMATIVELY CONCURRING), as follows: SECTION 1: $1,200,000 is hereby appropriated from the Capital Improvement Fund for the cost of renovations, improvements and upgrades at the Northern Recycling Center located in Lakewood Township, County of Ocean, which sum shall also cover fees and contingencies. SECTION 2: The capital budget of the County of Ocean is hereby amended to conform with the provisions of this ordinance to the extent of any inconsistency herewith. The resolution in the form promulgated by the Local Finance Board showing full detail of the amended capital budget and capital program as approved by the Director of Local Government Services is on file with the Clerk and is available there for public inspection. SECTION 3: After passage upon first reading of this Ordinance, the Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is hereby directed to publish the full text of the Ordinance, together with the notice set forth below entitled: "NOTICE OF PENDING ORDINANCE" (with appropriate completions, insertions and corrections), at least once in a newspaper qualified under N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-19, at least seven days prior to the date set for public hearing and further consideration for final passage (which date shall be at least ten days after introduction and first reading). The Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is further directed to comply with all provisions of N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-17(b) regarding postings, publications, and the provision of copies of this Ordinance. SECTION 4: After final adoption of this Ordinance by the Board of Commissioners, the Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is hereby directed to publish the full text of this Ordinance, as finally adopted, together with the notice set forth below entitled: "NOTICE OF ADOPTION OF ORDINANCE" (with appropriate completions, insertions and corrections), at least once in a newspaper qualified under N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-19. SECTION 5: This Ordinance shall take effect twenty (20) days after the first publication thereof after final passage. NOTICE OF ADOPTION OF ORDINANCE PUBLIC NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the Ordinance published herewith has been finally adopted by the Board of Commissioners of the County of Ocean on July 2, 2024, and the twenty (20) day period of limitation within which a suit, action or proceeding questioning the validity of such Ordinance can be commenced, as provided in the Local Bond Law, has begun to run from the date of the first publication of this notice. MICHELLE I. GUNTHER, Clerk Board of Commissioners JOHN C. SAHRADNIK County Counsel ($66.88)

JEFFERSON TOWNSHIP PLANNING BOARD MUNICIPAL BUILDING 1033 WELDON ROAD LAKE HOPATCONG, NEW JERSEY 07489 NOTICE TO PROPERTY OWNERS AND OTHERS ENTITLED TO SERVICE PLEASE TAKE NOTICE, that the undersigned, Pitman Realty LLC has filed an application with the Jefferson Township Planning Board seeking land use approvals in order to develop property along Ackerman Road. The subject property consists of one tract of land located in Jefferson Township identified as Block 249, Lot 22 on the Tax and Assessment Map of the Township of Jefferson and consists of approximately 1 acre. Within the Township of Jefferson, the site is located in the RC Zone District. The Applicant is proposing Variance Plan approval for the construction a residential home. The Applicant will also install associated site improvements in regard to this application as more specifically set forth on the plans. The Applicant seeks the following variances: 1) Variance approval with regard to the definition of a flag lot ordinance Section 490-5. 2) Variance approval for a lot which does not abut a municipal street N.J.S.A. 40:55D-35. The Applicant may also apply for such additional variance relief, exceptions, waivers, permits, approvals or licenses that are deemed necessary or appropriate by the Applicant or the Board and which may arise during the course of the hearing process. This application is on the calendar for the Planning Board for the Township of Jefferson. The initial public hearing in regard to this application will take place on Monday, July 22, 2024 at 7:00 p.m. at the Jefferson Township Municipal Building, 1033 Weldon Road, Lake Hopatcong, New Jersey 07849. When the case is called, you may appear either in person or by an attorney to present any evidence which you may have regarding the application. This case may be heard on the above date or any adjourned date designated by the Board at this public meeting without additional notice. The maps, plans, plats and applications for approval of this matter are on file with the Office of the Planning Department and are available for inspection at the Planning Department located within the Jefferson Township Municipal Building, 1033 Weldon Road, Lake Hopatcong, New Jersey 07849 during normal business hours. This Notice is being published in accordance with the requirements of the Municipal Land Use Law and the Ordinances of the Township of Jefferson. Bernd E. Hefele, Esq. Attorney for the Applicant, Pitman Realty LLC

Notice of Public Hearing Borough of Monmouth Beach NOTCE OF HEARING Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40:55D-12 IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF KEVIN J. DELL FOR PREMISES KNOWN AS LOT 2.01, Block 55 OF THE OFFICIAL TAX MAP OF THE BOROUGH OF MONMOUTH BEACH PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that the Planning Board of the Borough of Monmouth Beach (the "Board") will hold a public hearing on Tuesday, July 23, 2024, at 7 pm at the Monmouth Beach Boro Hall, 22 Beach Road, Monmouth Beach, New Jersey to consider the application of Kevin J. Dell ("Applicant") for premises known as Lot 2.01, in Block 55 as shown on the Official Tax Map of the Borough of Monmouth Beach and located at 39 Valentine Street, Monmouth Beach, New Jersey. Applicant is seeking a side yard setback variance for a recently constructed elevated deck surrounding a recently constructed swimming pool. The lot contains an existing single-family dwelling, swimming pool, elevated deck, covered porch, stone driveway and other appurtenances. The property is located in the A-1 Zone of the Borough and the AE8 flood zone as per the FEMA flood maps. The property contains a lot area of 14,984 SF (0.34 AC). The construction of the pool and elevated deck was approved on June 10, 2021. Upon completion of the construction, it was determined that the elevated deck was constructed in a location which is not in compliance with Monmouth Beach side yard setback requirements and requires a variance. Per Section 30.8.22 of the applicable Ordinance, the minimum side yard setback requirement for the elevated deck is 10 feet. The corner of the elevated deck closest to Valentine Street is approximately 9.9 feet from the adjacent side yard property line and mistakenly continues for approximately 33 feet in a northeast direction and ending approximately 8.2 feet from the adjacent side yard property line. The engineering firm reviewing the application advised the Planning Board Secretary that the existing dwelling has a side yard setback of 7.5 feet. This is a pre-existing non-conformity, which is not being changed with the application. Applicant also expressly makes application for any additional exceptions, interpretations, waivers, variances, and other approvals as may be determined to be necessary by the Board or its professional advisors during the review and processing of the application, including with respect to the pre-existing non-conformity. PLEASE TAKE FURTHER NOTICE that you are privileged to be present at said public hearing to present any and all comments you may have to the granting of said approvals. The hearing may be continued without further notice on such additional or other dates as the Board may determine. The application and supporting documents are on file with the Borough of Monmouth Beach, Planning Board, 18 Willow Avenue, Monmouth Beach, New Jersey and are available during the Borough's normal business hours. To review these materials, please contact the Board Secretary, Ms. Regina Hirsch, at 732-229-2204, ext. 1003. /s/ Kein J. Dell Kevin J. Dell Applicant and Attorney for Applicant July 9, 2024 Publication Dates L00000000 $

PUBLIC NOTICE NOTICE PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that upon the Application of Colfer Enterprises, LLC (the "Applicant"), the Township of West Deptford Planning Board (the "Planning Board") shall conduct a public hearing on July 23, 2024, commencing at 7:00PM in the Township of West Deptford Municipal Building, located at 400 Crown Point Road, West Deptford, New Jersey 08086 to consider an Application for Amended Preliminary and Final Site Plan Approval and Bulk Variance Approval to allow for the development of a 3,885 /- square foot office with associated car parking spaces, which will support a trucking terminal operation. The development will also include landscaping, lighting, and stormwater improvements. The site is located along River Lane off of Crown Point Road, within the M-1 Light Manufacturing Zoning District, and the C-Commercial District, and more particularly known as Block 335, Lot 2.03 on the Official Township of West Deptford Tax Maps (the "Property"). The Applicant is also seeking Bulk Variance Approval to allow (i) 18 off-street parking spaces when 19 off-street parking spaces are required by Ordinance, and (ii) a buffer of 40-feet from the residential use to the south of the site and a buffer of 30-feet to the residential use immediately east of the site, when a buffer of at least 100 feet in width is required along the boundary of any residential district or use. Additionally, the Applicant requests a design waiver from the requirement that parking lots shall be designed so that no more than 10 parking spaces shall be placed in a continuous row without an intervening planting area of at least 100 square feet. To the extent necessary, the Applicant is also requesting that the Planning Board grant any and all other approvals, submission waivers, design waivers, bulk variances, interpretations, and any / all other relief necessary to allow for the development of the Property as proposed by the Applicant. Anyone affected by this Application will have the opportunity to appear in person at a meeting of the Planning Board to be held on April 23, 2024, commencing at 7:00PM in the Township of West Deptford Municipal Building located at 400 Crown Point Road, West Deptford, New Jersey 08086, to present any support or objection they may have for the Approval of this Application. The Planning Board may at its discretion, adjourn, postpone, or continue this hearing from time to time, and you are hereby notified that you should make diligent inquiry to the Planning Board concerning any such adjournments, postponements, or continuations. Copies of the Application, plans, reports, correspondence, and supporting documentation are available for public inspection and public review in the West Deptford Township Planning Board Office in the West Deptford Township Municipal Building, located at 400 Crown Point Road, West Deptford, New Jersey 08086, during regular business hours. If you have any questions or seek additional information, prior to the date of the hearing please contact the West Deptford Township Director of Planning, Zoning & Code Enforcement, Zach Hilt, at zhilt@westdeptford.com, or by calling 856-845-4004, ext. 126. NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that on July 22, 2023 at 7:30 P.M. the Planning Board of the Borough of Carlstadt will hold a public hearing at the Borough of Carlstadt, 500 Madison Street, Carlstadt, New Jersey, on the application of Prologis LP ("Applicant"), for a variance application approval for the property located at 100 Amor Avenue, Carlstadt, New Jersey, also known as Block 123, Lot 26, on the Borough of Carlstadt Tax Map ("Property"). Applicant is proposing minor improvements to the existing facade of the building on the Property resulting in a minimal encroachment upon the front yard setback. The Property is located in the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority ("NJSEA") Light Industrial B Zone. The purpose of Applicant's variance application is to request a variance for a front yard setback. Under N.J.A.C. 19:4-5.84(a)3i of the NJSEA regulations, a minimum front yard setback of 35 feet is required in the Light Industrial B Zone, and Applicant's proposed minor improvements to the facade of the existing building result in a minimal encroachment upon the required 35-foot front yard setback. If required, Applicant also intends to request at the hearing such other deviations, variances and/or waivers of design standards and/or submission requirements as the Planning Board may deem necessary to develop the Property in the manner indicated in the application plans and materials. The application and all supporting maps, site plans and documents are on file in the office of the Planning Board at the Borough of Carlstadt, New Jersey, and are available for public inspection, Monday through Friday, during normal business hours, except holidays. Any interested party may appear at the aforesaid hearing, either in person or by their attorney, and be given an opportunity to be heard with respect to the application. THIS NOTICE is being provided by the Applicant in accordance with the laws of the State of New Jersey and by Order of the Planning Board of Borough of Carlstadt, New Jersey. Applicant Prologis LP By: Thomas J. O'Connor, Esq. TIBBS SENIOR BUILDING 111 West Street, Englewood, NJ 07631 PUBLIC NOTICE is hereby given that sealed Bids will be received by the Housing Authority of the City of Englewood, (hereinafter called the Authority), in the County of Bergen, State of New Jersey at LAN Associates, Engineering, Planning, Architecture, Surveying, Inc. located at 445 Godwin Avenue, Suite 9, Midland Park, NJ 07432 NO LATER THAN, Wednesday, August 7, 2024, at 11:00 am prevailing time. All Bids will be opened publicly and read aloud at that time. Any bids received after that date and time will be unopened and rejected. Each bid must be submitted in a sealed envelope marked on the exterior with the words "Landscape Improvements at Vincent K. Tibbs Senior Building". The Authority reserves the unqualified right to waive any informalities in bids and to reject any and all bids if it is in the best interest of the Authority to do so. CONTRACT: LANDSCAPE IMPROVEMENTS AT VINCENT K. TIBBS SENIOR BUILDING All work necessary and incidental thereto, in accordance with the Contract Documents, for the Landscape Improvements at Vincent K. Tibbs Senior Building at 111 West Street, Englewood, NJ 07631. Bids must be accompanied by a guarantee in the amount of 5% of the bid, but not in excess of $20,000.00, in the form of a certified check, cashier's check or bid bond. Bids must be accompanied by consent of surety regardless of whether a check or Bid Bond is submitted. The Successful Bidder will be required to furnish an acceptable Performance and Labor and Material Payment Bond. All Bonds and consents of Surety must be written by Surety Companies listed in the most recent Circular No. 570 United States Department of the Treasury and licensed to do business in the State of New Jersey. Complete digital sets of Bidding Documents, drawings and specifications, may be obtained online as a download at the following website: LAN.BIDDYHQ.COM under 'public projects'. Commencing Wednesday, July 10, 2024, complete sets of Bidding Documents, Drawings and Specifications, may be obtained from REVPlans, 28 Church Street, Unit 7, Warwick, NY 10990, Tel: 845-651-3845, upon depositing the sum of $25 (Twenty-Five Dollars) for each combined set of documents. Checks or money orders shall be made payable to Englewood Housing Authority. Plan deposit is non-refundable in accordance with the terms in the Instructions to Bidders to all submitting bids. Any bidder requiring documents to be shipped shall make arrangements with the printer and pay for all packaging and shipping costs. Please note REVPIans (revplans.biddyhq.com and lan.biddyhq.com) are the designated location and means for distributing and obtaining all bid package information. Only those Contract Documents obtained in this manner will enable a prospective bidder to be identified as an official plan holder of record. The Provider takes no responsibility for the completeness of Contract Documents obtained from other sources. Contract Documents obtained from other sources may not be accurate or may not contain addenda that may have been issued. All bid addenda, if applicable, will be transmitted by Monday, July 29, 2024 to registered plan holders via email and will be available at revplans.biddyhq.com and lan.biddyhq.com. Plan holders who have paid for hard copies of the bid documents will need to make the determination if hard copies of the addenda are required for their use and coordinate directly with the printer for hard copies of addenda to be issued. There will be no charge for registered plan holders to obtain hard copies of the bid addenda. A Pre-Bid Conference for all Bidders will be held at 111 West Street, Englewood, New Jersey 07631 in the administrative office followed by a site walk-thru, on Tuesday, July 16, 2024 at 11:00 am for the purpose of considering questions posed by Bidders. It is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that Bidders attend the Pre-Bid Conference for purposes of clarifying specific information concerning the project work, hearing other bidder's questions regarding various aspects of the Project and the answers thereto, and learning the manner of proper completion and submission of the Bid Documents to ensure a responsive Bid. A Bidder's failure to attend the Pre-Bid Conference is at its own risk. All technical questions, comments, and inquiries should be directed in writing to Peter Manouvelos no later Wednesday, July 24, 2024 via email to peter.manouvelosPlanassociates.com. Written replies to any such questions will be provided to all potential offerors. No oral responses regarding technical questions or interpretations of the specifications will be provided. Bidders must be fully licensed, certified, and insured to perform all of the work required under the Contract Documents and must be authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey. Any Bidder that is a corporation not chartered under the laws of the State ofNew Jersey must submit an affidavit certifying that said corporation is authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey. Bidders must be registered with the Department of Labor and are required to comply with the requirements of Public Law 1999, c.238, "The Public Works Contractor Registration Act", which became effective on April 11, 2000. Bidders, their subcontractors and suppliers, must comply with the New Jersey Business Registration requirements. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of Public Law 1975, c. 127 and the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27-1 et seq. which pertain to "Non-Discrimination" and "Affirmative Actions" and with the requirements of Public Law 1977, c. 33, which requires a Statement of Corporate Ownership. MOUNT LAUREL TOWNSHIP MUNICIPAL UTILITIES AUTHORITY BURLINGTON COUNTY, NEW JERSEY ELBO LANE WATER TREATMENT PLANT HVAC REPLACEMENT PROJECT STATE LOAN PROJECT NO. 0324001-004 CONTRACT NO. 2022-08 NOTICE TO BIDDERS NOTICE is hereby given that sealed bids will be received by the Mount Laurel Township Municipal Utilities Authority (hereinafter called the "Owner") for: MOUNT LAUREL TOWNSHIP MUNICIPAL UTILITIES AUTHORITY BURLINGTON COUNTY, NEW JERSEY ELBO LANE WATER TREATMENT PLANT HVAC REPLACEMENT PROJECT STATE LOAN PROJECT NO. 0324001-004 CONTRACT NO. 2022-08 Sealed Bids for the above named Contract, which is comprised of the removal replacement of the existing Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems at the Elbo Lane Water Treatment Plant, located within the Township of Mount Laurel, Burlington County, New Jersey ("Owner"), will be received at the Mount Laurel Township Municipal Utilities Authority, 1201 South Church Street, Mount Laurel, New Jersey 08054 on August 8, 2024, at 10:00 a.m. prevailing time, at which time they will be publicly unsealed and the contents publicly announced. The work is located in the Filter Building of the Elbo Lane Water Treatment Plant and includes the furnishing of all labor, materials and equipment necessary to complete the work as shown on the Drawings and as described in the Specifications. The work consists of the removal and replacement of the following Filter Building HVAC equipment: Air handling unit serving administrative areas (located on roof); variable air volume boxes and ductwork distribution system serving administrative areas (located inside the facility); AC split system serving the electrical room (condensing unit on the roof); dehumidification unit serving the pump & filter rooms (located on the roof); exhaust fans serving administrative areas and the parts/maintenance room (located on the roof); and the inline exhaust fan (located inside the attic of the facility). Additionally, the existing Air-Cooled chiller (located on roof), which is no longer required for treatment operations, will be decommissioned and removed. The project also includes site work, electrical and controls work, and general construction work related to mechanical improvements. The work shall be completed within 360 calendar days of the Contractor's receipt of written Notice to Proceed. No bid will be received unless in writing on the forms furnished, and unless accompanied by bid security in the form of a bid bond, cashier's check, or a certified check made payable to the Mount Laurel Township Municipal Utilities Authority in an amount equal to 10% of the amount of the total bid, but not exceeding $20,000. The bid shall be accompanied by a Certificate of Surety on the form included in the Contract Documents, from a surety company licensed to do business in the State of New Jersey, which shall represent that the surety company will provide the Contractor with the required bonds in the sums required in the Contract Documents and in a form satisfactory to the Owner's Attorney and in compliance with the requirements of law. Surety bonds shall be written by a company listed on the Department Circular 570 in accordance with N.J.A.C. 7:22-3.17(g). Bidders must use the prepared bid form, which is contained in the Contract Documents. Each individual proposal must be separately enclosed in a sealed envelope addressed to the Mount Laurel Township Municipal Utilities Authority, 1201 South Church Street, Mount Laurel, New Jersey 08054. The envelope shall also be marked on the outside with the name of the project being bid on. No bids will be received after the time and date specified, and no bids will be received by mail. Bids shall be received by courier service (date and time recorded) or shall be hand delivered. The Owner shall award the Contract or reject all bids within 60 days of bid opening, except that the bids of any bidders who consent thereto may, at the request of the Owner, be held for consideration for such longer period as may be agreed. The Owner will tabulate the bids and any award will be made to the lowest responsible bidder in accordance with N.J.S.A. 40A:11-4. The Owner reserves the right to reject all bids pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40A:11-13.2. All bid security except the security of the three apparent lowest responsible bidders shall be returned, unless otherwise requested by the bidder, within ten (10) days after the opening of the bids, Sundays and holidays excepted, and the bids of the bidders whose bid security is returned shall be considered withdrawn. Each bidder must submit with his bid a signed certificate stating that he owns, leases or controls all the necessary equipment required to accomplish the work shown and described in the Contract Documents. Should the bidder not be the actual owner or leasee of such equipment, his certificate shall state the source from which the equipment will be obtained and, in addition, shall be accompanied by a signed certificate from the owner or person in control of the equipment definitely granting to the bidder the control of the equipment required during such time as may be necessary for the completion of that portion of the Contract for which it is necessary. The bidder shall comply with the documentation requirements set forth in the Article of the Information for Bidders, entitled, "Bidder Submissions". The successful bidder will be required to submit bonds and proof of insurance on or before execution of their respective Contracts as explained in the Contract Documents. Bidders are required to comply with all relevant Federal and State Statutes, Rules and Regulations including but not limited to the applicable provisions of Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended (42 USC 2000d 2000D 4A), the discrimination and affirmative action provisions of N.J.S.A. 10:2 1 through 10:2 4, the New Jersey Law against Discrimination, N.J.S.A. 10:5 1, et seq., the rules and regulations promulgated pursuant thereto, the State requirement for bidders to supply statements of ownership (N.J.S.A. 52:25 24.2) and the State requirement for submission of the names and addresses of certain subcontractors (N.J.S.A. 40A:11 16). The Contract Documents may be reviewed online at no cost at www.bidset.com/mott or at the Mount Laurel Township Municipal Utilities Authority, 1201 South Church Street, Mount Laurel, New Jersey 08054, between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. The Contract Documents may be obtained by any prospective bidder upon payment of a fee for each set of full-sized drawings with specifications by calling 1-877-424-3738 or by online request. Shipping charges are additional and variable depending upon the pick-up or delivery option selected by the purchaser. Bid documents cannot be obtained at the Mount Laurel Township Municipal Utilities Authority or at Mott MacDonald's office. The printing cost is not refundable. Pursuant to N.J.A.C. 10:5-33, bidders are required to comply with the requirements of P.L. 1975, c. 127. Each Bidder must submit with his bid an "Ownership Disclosure Statement" and is requested to submit with his bid the "Non-Collusion Affidavit" on the forms included in the Contract Documents. Bidders and their subcontractors of any tier must comply with all applicable provisions of the Public Works Contractor Registration Act (N.J.S.A. 34:11-56.48) and the New Jersey Prevailing Wage Act (N.J.S.A. 34:11-56.25). P.L. 2021, c. 301 requires that if a contract is subject to the Prevailing Wage Act and the contractor submitting the lowest bid for a contract is 10 percent (or more) lower than the next lowest bid, the bidder must certify to the public body that the prevailing wage rates required by the Act shall be paid. If the bidder does not provide the certification prior to the award of the contract, the public body shall award the contract to the next lowest responsible and responsive bidder. Further, P.L. 2021, c. 301 also amended N.J.S.A. 34:11-56.27 to require that any contract for public work expressly stipulate that workers performing work under the contract shall not be paid less than the required prevailing wage rate. Contractors and their sureties shall be liable to the public body, any lessee to whom the public body is leasing a property or premises or to any lessor from whom the public body is leasing or will be leasing a property or premises, for any excess costs occasioned by the termination of their right to proceed with the work, or such part of the work as to which there has been a failure to pay required wages. Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 52:32-44, all business organizations that conduct business with a New Jersey government agency are required to be registered with the State of New Jersey. Bidders and their subcontractors must submit proof that they are registered with the New Jersey Department of Treasury, Division of Revenue by submitting a copy of their Business Registration Certificate prior to Contract award. The Contract is expected to be funded in part with the funds from the New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection and the New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust. Neither the United States nor the State of New Jersey, the New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust, nor any of their departments, agencies, or employees is, or will be, a party to the Contract or any lower tier contract or subcontract. The Contract or Subcontract will be subject to regulations contained in N.J.A.C. 7:22-3.1 et seq., 4.1 et seq., 5.1 et seq., 9.1 et seq. and 10 et seq., Local Public Contract, Department of Labor Current Wage Rate Determination, Prevailing Wage Act, Contract Work Hours and Safety Standard Act, Copland Act, Davis Bacon Act, Buy American Clause, Debarment and Suspension, and Socially and Economically Disadvantaged (SED) (N.J.A.C. 7:22-9). All bids shall include a commitment to the use of small, minority, women's and labor surplus area businesses and shall be in conformity with N.J.A.C. 7:22-3.17(a) (24) with a goal of not less than 10% participation of small business enterprises owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals (SED's). Further details regarding required SED participation are included in the Information for Bidders and the Supplemental General Conditions. It is the purpose of this Notice to Bidders to summarize some of the more important provisions of the Contract Documents. Prospective bidders are cautioned not to rely solely on this summary, but to read the Contract Documents in their entirety. By Order of Mount Laurel Township Municipal Utilities Authority Pamela J. Carolan, P.E. Executive Director 7/9/24 ($145.86)

OCEAN COUNTY ORDINANCE #2024-22 AN ORDINANCE APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF $3,600,000 FROM THE CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT FUND FOR THE COST OF IMPROVEMENTS TO ATLANTIS GOLF COURSE IRRIGATION, RECONSTRUCTION, AND OTHER UPGRADES, LOCATED IN LITTLE EGG HARBOR TOWNSHIP, COUNTY OF OCEAN, STATE OF NEW JERSEY. WHEREAS, the Board of Commissioners of the County of Ocean recognizes the need for improvements to Atlantis Golf Course irrigation, reconstruction, and other upgrades, located in Little Egg Harbor Township, County of Ocean, State of New Jersey; and WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of the County that funds be available for this purpose. NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED by the BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS of the COUNTY OF OCEAN, STATE OF NEW JERSEY (NOT LESS THAN TWO THIRDS OF ALL MEMBERS THEREOF AFFIRMATIVELY CONCURRING), as follows: SECTION 1: $3,600,000 is hereby appropriated from the Capital Improvement Fund for improvements to Atlantis Golf Course irrigation, reconstruction, and other upgrades, located in Little Egg Harbor Township, County of Ocean, which sum shall also cover fees and contingencies. SECTION 2: The capital budget of the County of Ocean is hereby amended to conform with the provisions of this ordinance to the extent of any inconsistency herewith. The resolution in the form promulgated by the Local Finance Board showing full detail of the amended capital budget and capital program as approved by the Director of Local Government Services is on file with the Clerk and is available there for public inspection. SECTION 3: After passage upon first reading of this Ordinance, the Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is hereby directed to publish the full text of the Ordinance, together with the notice set forth below entitled: "NOTICE OF PENDING ORDINANCE" (with appropriate completions, insertions and corrections), at least once in a newspaper qualified under N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-19, at least seven days prior to the date set for public hearing and further consideration for final passage (which date shall be at least ten days after introduction and first reading). The Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is further directed to comply with all provisions of N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-17(b) regarding postings, publications, and the provision of copies of this Ordinance. SECTION 4: After final adoption of this Ordinance by the Board of Commissioners, the Clerk of the Board of Commissioners is hereby directed to publish the full text of this Ordinance, as finally adopted, together with the notice set forth below entitled: "NOTICE OF ADOPTION OF ORDINANCE" (with appropriate completions, insertions and corrections), at least once in a newspaper qualified under N.J.S.A. 40A: 2-19. SECTION 5: This Ordinance shall take effect twenty (20) days after the first publication thereof after final passage. NOTICE OF ADOPTION OF ORDINANCE PUBLIC NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the Ordinance published herewith has been finally adopted by the Board of Commissioners of the County of Ocean on July 2, 2024, and the twenty (20) day period of limitation within which a suit, action or proceeding questioning the validity of such Ordinance can be commenced, as provided in the Local Bond Law, has begun to run from the date of the first publication of this notice. MICHELLE I. GUNTHER, Clerk Board of Commissioners JOHN C. SAHRADNIK County Counsel ($67.76)

BOROUGH OF DEMAREST COUNTY OF BERGEN ORDINANCE 1142-24 AN ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING THE ACQUISITION BY DONATION OF REAL PROPERTY COMMONLY KNOWN AS 563 PIERMONT ROAD, AND DESIGNATED ON THE OFFICIAL TAX MAP OF THE BOROUGH OF DEMAREST AS BLOCK 67, LOTS 5.01 AND 6 FOR PUBLIC USE STATEMENT OF PURPOSE: This ordinance is being proposed to authorize the acquisition of real property in the Borough of Demarest (the "Borough") for public use. WHEREAS, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40A:12-5, the Borough has the power to acquire, by ordinance, any real property, capital improvement or personal property for a public purpose through negotiated agreement or by the exercise of its powers of eminent domain; and WHEREAS, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40:61-1 et seq., the Borough may acquire lands for public purposes; and WHEREAS, the Demarest Baptist Church has offered to donate real property with all improvements located at 563 Piermont Road, designated as Block 67, Lots 5.01 and 6 on the official tax map of the Borough (the "Property") to the Borough and in furtherance of same, the parties previously entered into a Memorandum of Understanding whereby the Borough agreed to accept the donation subject to a Quiet Title Action confirming that the covenants restricting the use of the Property have been extinguished; and WHEREAS, a Quiet Title Action has been filed and by Order entered June 25, 2024 a Consent Order was entered to Quiet Title by the Honorable Darren T. DiBiasi, J.S.C. ordering and adjudging that the restrictive covenant and reverter clause set forth in a Deed dated October 10, 1974 from Ralph S. Demarest and Jane Demarest to William M. Whitmore and John Neslage was extinguished by Quitclaim Deed dated January 10, 1962 and ordering and adjudging that the restrictive covenant and reverter clause is deemed null and void and of no further effect; and WHEREAS, the Property offers attractive public use for the Borough, including a possible senior center for Borough of Demarest residents; and WHEREAS, the Borough has determined that the aforementioned real property is needed for public use and has identified a public use; and WHEREAS, the Grantor, the Demarest Baptist Church, has agreed to donate the Property to the Borough at no cost to the Borough except that the Borough shall be responsible to pay the Grantor's reasonable legal expenses and costs incurred in connection with the transfer of title; and WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of the Borough to acquire the Property for a public use and to pay the Grantor Demarest Baptist Church's reasonable legal fees and costs incurred in connection with the transfer of title. NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED by the Borough of Demarest, Bergen County, New Jersey that the Borough is hereby authorized to accept the donation of the Property and to acquire the Property as referenced above from the Grantor Demarest Baptist Church and to pay the reasonable legal fees and closing costs of the Demarest Baptist Church incurred in connection with the transfer of title to the Borough; and BE IT FURTHER ORDAINED, that the Mayor and Acting Clerk of the Borough of Demarest are hereby authorized to execute all necessary documents to acquire said Property. The Ordinance was introduced and passed upon first reading by title at a meeting of the Borough Council of the Borough of Demarest on July 8, 2024. It will be further considered for final passage, after public hearing thereon, at a meeting of the Borough Council to be held at its meeting room in the Borough Hall, 118 Serpentine Rd. Demarest, New Jersey, on July 22, at 7:30 PM. BY ORDER OF THE MAYOR AND COUNCIL Julie Falkenstern, Acting Borough Clerk The Record/Herald: 7/9/24 Fee:$75.68 (86) 10353434

text: WILLINGBORO TOWNSHIP COUNTY OF BURLINGTON, NEW JERSEY NOTICE OF PENDING ORDINANCE AND SUMMARY The ordinance, the summary terms of which are included herein, was introduced and passed upon first reading at a meeting of the governing body of the Township of Willingboro, in the County of Burlington, State of New Jersey, on July 2nd, 2024. It will be further considered for final passage, after public hearing thereon, at a meeting of the governing body to be held at the August 6th, in the Township on August 6th, 2024 at 7 o'clock _p.m. During the week prior to and up to and including the date of such meeting, copies of the full ordinance will be available at no cost and during regular business hours at the Township Clerk's office for the members of the general public who shall request the same. The summary of the terms of such ordinance follows: Title: ORDINANCE AMENDING SECTION 1 OF ORDINANCE #2022-6, AS AMENDED BY ORDINANCE #2023-20 AND ORDINANCE #2024-06, OF THE TOWNSHIP OF WILLINGBORO, IN THE COUNTY OF BURLINGTON, NEW JERSEY, FINALLY ADOPTED JUNE 21, 2022, AS AMENDED NOVEMBER 8, 2023 AND MAY 21, 2024, IN ORDER TO AMEND THE DESCRIPTION OF THE PROJECT TO INCLUDE EMERGENCY REPAIRS TO PENNYPACKER DRIVE STORMWATER WASHOUT Purpose: To amend in its entirety Section 1 of Ordinance #2022-6, as amended by Ordinance #2023-20 and Ordinance #2024-06, of the Township of Willingboro, in the County of Burlington, New Jersey, finally adopted June 21, 2022, as amended November 8, 2023 and May 21, 2024, to include emergency repairs to Pennypacker Drive stormwater washout and read as follows: "$865,200 is hereby appropriated from American Rescue Plan Act funds for stormwater infrastructure repairs, including Buckingham Drive, Berkshire Lane, 115 Clubhouse Drive, Clubhouse Drive, Babbit Lane, Windsor Lane and the Holstone Lane outfall, Charleston Road storm outfall underdrain replacement and emergency repairs to Pennypacker Drive stormwater washout, including all work and materials necessary therefor and incidental thereto, in and by the Township of Willingboro, in the County of Burlington, New Jersey (the "Township")." Appropriation: N/A Bonds/Notes Authorized: N/A Grant Appropriated: N/A Section 20 Costs: N/A Useful Life: N/A Everett Falt, MPA, RMC, CMC Township Clerk 7/9/24 ($36.66)

Invitation for Bids LEGAL NOTICE HOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE BOROUGH OF CLIFFSIDE PARK 500 Gorge Road, Cliffside Park, New Jersey 07010 ADDITION & RENOVATION TO SENIOR CENTER & OFFICES (RE-BID) at 500 Gorge Road, Cliffside Park, New Jersey 07010 PUBLIC NOTICE is hereby given that sealed Bids will be received by the Housing Authority of the Borough of Cliffside Park, (hereinafter called the Authority), in the County of Bergen, State of New Jersey at the Administrative Office of the Authority, located at 500 Gorge Road, Cliffside Park New Jersey 07010, NO LATER THAN, Wednesday, July 31, 2024 at 11:00 AM prevailing time. All Bids will be opened publicly and read aloud at that time. Any bids received after that date and time will be unopened and rejected. Each bid must be submitted in a sealed envelope marked on the exterior with the words "Addition & Renovation to Senior Center & Offices Bid". The Authority reserves the unqualified right to waive any informalities in bids and to reject any and all bids if it is in the best interest of the Authority to do so. CONTRACT: ADDITION & RENOVATION TO SENIOR CENTER & OFFICES (RE-BID) All work necessary and incidental thereto, in accordance with the Contract Documents, for the Addition & Renovation to Senior Center & Offices (Re-Bid) project at 500 Gorge Road, Cliffside Park, New Jersey. Bids must be accompanied by a guarantee in the amount of 5% of the bid, but not in excess of $20,000.00, in the form of a certified check, cashier's check or bid bond. Bids must be accompanied by consent of surety regardless of whether a check or Bid Bond is submitted. The Successful Bidder will be required to furnish an acceptable Performance and Labor and Material Payment Bond. All Bonds and consents of Surety must be written by Surety Companies listed in the most recent Circular No. 570 United States Department of the Treasury and licensed to do business in the State of New Jersey. Commencing Tuesday, July 7, 2024 the Contract Documents will be on file and may be examined at Coppa Montalbano Architects Offices, located at 97 Lackawanna Avenue, Totowa, New Jersey 07512 on Monday through Friday between the hours of 9:00 AM and 4:00 PM. No advance appointment is necessary. Digital media of the Contract Documents may be obtained at the Architects office during the same days and times, upon payment by check or bank draft in the amount of $25.00 for each set, payable to the Coppa Montalbano Architects. Payment for Contract Documents is non-refundable. Site Access can be coordinated with the Cliffside Park Housing Authority at 201-941-0655 or 201-941-0231. It is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that Bidders visit the Site for purposes of clarifying specific information concerning the Project work and Site Conditions. Site visits will be scheduled Monday through Friday between the hours of 10AM and 3PM, between the dates of July 9, 2024 and July 17, 2024. All technical questions, comments, and inquiries should be directed in writing to Coppa Montalbano Architects no later than Wednesday, July 17, 2024, via Fax 973- 890-8855 or email to jmolina@coppamontalbano.com . Written replies to any such questions will be provided to all potential offerors. No oral responses regarding technical questions or interpretations of the specifications will be provided. Addendum if applicable will be issued on Monday, July 22, 2024. Bidders must be fully licensed, certified, and insured to perform all of the work required under the Contract Documents and must be authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey. Any Bidder that is a corporation not chartered under the laws of the State of New Jersey must submit an affidavit certifying that said corporation is authorized to do business in the State of New Jersey. Bidders must be registered with the Department of Labor and are required to comply with the requirements of Public Law 1999, c.238, "The Public Works Contractor Registration Act", which became effective on April 11, 2000. Bidders, their subcontractors and suppliers, must comply with the New Jersey Business Registration requirements. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of Public Law 1975, c. 127 and the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27-1 et seq. which pertain to "Non-Discrimination" and "Affirmative Actions" and with the requirements of Public Law 1977, c. 33, which requires a Statement of Corporate Ownership. Joseph Capano, Executive Director Cliffside Park Housing Authority 500 Gorge Road Cliffside Park, NJ 07010 Publication Date:

PUBLIC NOTICE Bridgeton Board of Education REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS The Bridgeton Board of Education of Bridgeton, New Jersey, solicits proposals for the following service: RFP 25-008 - Spanish Writing Program for Bilingual Students in Grades K-5 All necessary proposal specifications and proposal forms may be secured upon written request to: Jamie Weldon, Purchasing Agent Bridgeton Board of Education 41 Bank Street Bridgeton, New Jersey 08302 Fax (856)459-2398 E mail purchasing@bridgeton.k12.nj.us Proposals may be submitted in a sealed envelope and delivered to the Office of the School Business Administrator/ Board Secretary of the Bridgeton Board of Education OR Bids may be electronically submitted via School District's e-Procurement Portal at https://procurement.opengov.com/portal/bridgetonk12nj on or before date and time indicated below. The envelope is to bear the following information: Title: Spanish Writing Program for Bilingual Students in Grades K-5 Project No. RFP 25-008 Name and Address of the Respondent Date: Tuesday, July 30, 2024 Time: 10:00 a.m. Location of Proposal Opening BRIDGETON BOARD OF EDUCATION 41 Bank Street Bridgeton, New Jersey 08302 The proposal opening process will begin on the above date and time at the Bridgeton Board of Education, Bridgeton, New Jersey. Proposals may also be submitted to the School Business Administrator/Board Secretary or his designee at the proposal opening meeting, in the Thomas C. Lane, IV Administration Building, prior to the advertised date and time. On the advertised date and time, the School Business Administrator/Board Secretary shall publicly receive and open all proposals. No proposals shall be received after the time designated in the advertisement. (N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-21(b)). All respondents are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq., Affirmative Action Against Discrimination and N.J.A.C. 17:27 et seq. If required, each proposal shall be accompanied by a bid bond, cashier's check or certified check made payable to the Bridgeton Board of Education, for ten percent (10%) of the amount of the total contract, but not in excess of twenty thousand dollars ($20,000.00). The Board of Education reserves the right to reject any or all proposals pursuant to N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-2(s), (t), (x), (y), 18A:18A-4(a), 18A:18A-22, and to waive any informalities. Nicole Albanese School Business Administrator, Board Secretary Cost: $90.67 (0010887632) 1t 7/8/24

CHATHAM COUNTY BOARD OF ELECTIONS New Precinct Announcement The Chatham County Board of Elections in conjunction with the Board of Registrar has added a new precinct to the Pooler area, effective for the November 5 General Election. Precinct 7-16 was split at Quacco Road to form Precinct 7-17. Precinct 7-16 is now east of Quacco Road and Precinct 7-17 is west. Voters in both precincts will continue to vote at Pooler Rec Center until further notice. Please check your voting location information at https://mvp.sos.ga.gov/s/. CC#169378 Publication Dates L00000000

George Lee v. LaTonya Lee Wayne County Court of Common Pleas No. 186-2017-DR You have been sued in court. If you wish to defend against the claims set forth in the following pages, you must take prompt action. You are warned that if you fail to do so the case may proceed without you and a decree of divorce may be entered against you by the court. A judgment may also be entered against you for any other claim or relief requested in these papers by Plaintiff. You may lose money or property or other rights important to you. When the ground for divorce is indignities or irretrievable breakdown of the marriage, you may request marriage counseling. A list of marriage counselors is available in the Office of the Prothonotary at Wayne County Courthouse, Honesdale, PA 18431. IF YOU DO NOT FILE A CLAM FOR ALIMONY, DIVISION OF PROPERTY, LAWYER'S FEES OR EXPENSES BEFORE A DIVORCE IS GRANTED, YOU MAY LOSE THE RIGHT TO CLAIM ANY OF THEM. YOU SHOULD TAKE THIS PAPER TO YOUR LAWYER AT ONCE. IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A LAWYER OR CANNOT AFFORD ONE, GO TO OR TELEPHONE THIS OFFICE TO FIND OUT WHERE YOU CAN GET LEGAL HELP: Northern PA Legal Services, Wayne County Courthouse, Honesdale, PA. 877-515-7465. Plaintiff filed an Amended Complaint in Divorce in Wayne County Pennsylvania Court of Common Pleas on April 3, 2024, seeking a divorce pursuant to Section 3301(d) and Section 3301(a)(1) of the Divorce Code. Plaintiff and Defendant were married on June 9, 2002, in Tennessee, and were separated in 2013. Latonya Lee is hereby directed to contact Plaintiff's attorney for a full copy of the Amended Complaint in Divorce: Christine Rechner, Esquire, 924 Church St, Honesdale, PA 18431, 570- 253-2200. 7/8/2024 $71.20

CASINO REINVESTMENT DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY DIVISION OF LAND USE AND REGULATORY ENFORCEMENT NOTICE OF HEARING TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN: In compliance with the pertinent provisions of the Atlantic City Land Use Development Ordinance, the Casino Reinvestment Development Authority Tourism District Land Development Rules, N.J.A.C. 19:66-1.1 et seq., and the New Jersey Municipal Land Use Act, N.J.S.A. 40:55D-1 et seq., notice is hereby given that a written application has been filed by the undersigned with the Casino Reinvestment Development Authority for minor site plan approval with "c" variance relief pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40:55D-70(c)(1) and/or N.J.S.A. 40:55D-70(c)(2) for relief from onsite parking requirements to utilize nearby offsite parking as well as loading zone requirements to permit the Applicant to receive deliveries from Mississippi Avenue rather than Atlantic Avenue. This relief is sought together with all other variances, waivers or other relief CRDA may reasonably require in the exercise of its discretion, and without further public notice, to allow the undersigned Applicant to renovate the existing structure in order to operate a Class 5 Retail Cannabis Facility, with related interior improvements associated with security and odor. This relief affects property located at 2305 Atlantic Avenue and designated on the tax map of City of Atlantic City as Block 280, Lot 40. The property in question is located in the Ducktown Arts District of the CRDA Tourism District, within the Green Zone Redevelopment Area ("GZRA"). Public hearing on the above-mentioned application has been scheduled for July 18, 2024, at 10:00AM in the Board Room of the Casino Reinvestment Development Authority located at 15 South Pennsylvania Avenue, Atlantic City, New Jersey 08401, at which time and place any interested party (as defined in N.J.S.A. 40:55D-4) will have an opportunity to be heard. All documents relating to this application may be inspected by the public during regular business hours (9:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.) in the office of the Casino Reinvestment Development Authority ,Division of Land Use and Regulatory Enforcement located at 15 South Pennsylvania Avenue, Atlantic City, New Jersey 08401. Please take further notice that the Authority may, in its discretion, adjourn, postpone, or continue said hearing from time to time and you are hereby notified that you should make diligent inquiry of the Land Use Regulation Enforcement Officer concerning such adjournments, postponements, or continuations. NEHMAD DAVIS & GOLDSTEIN, P.C. Attorneys for Applicant, Juniper Lane Cannabis BY: RACHEL LIDA KOUTISHIAN, ESQUIRE 4030 Ocean Heights Avenue Egg Harbor Township, NJ 08234 (609) 927-1177 DATED: July 8, 2024 7/8/24 $149.76

Notice of Application to Amend Existing Zoning Variance - Mahwah Board of Adjustment Hearing Please take notice that Daniel Anghel has submitted an application to the Mahwah Board of Adjustment to amend an existing application. The hearing will be held onJuly 24, 2024, at 7:30 PM in the Honorable Anthony J. Gianni Courtroom Chambers, located in the Mahwah Municipal Building at 475 Corporate Drive, Mahwah, NJ 07430. The hearing concerns the property at 39 Mohawk Trail, Mahwah, NJ 07430, Block 147, Lot 30. The applicant seeks a variance for zoning ordinance 24-3.6b7. Previously, on October 18th, an application to reduce the setback from 15 feet was approved. However, the applicant is now seeking an amendment to change the approved setback from 9'4" to 7'1" to accommodate a rebuilt garage that was damaged by a falling tree. Publication Dates L00000000 $
