Public Notice -30 Day-Contract Hearing of Superintendent of Schools Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 18A:11-11, the Fort Lee Board of Education (hereinafter the "Board") is providing notice of its intent to hold a public hearing and to take action to amend, extend, renegotiate and/or alter contract terms and conditions of the Fort Lee Public Schools Superintendent of Schools at its regular meeting to be held at the Lewis F. Cole Intermediate Cafetorium, located at 467 Stillwell Avenue, Fort Lee, NJ 07024, on August 5, 2024 at 7:30 p.m. Section 5 of the Act amended N.J.S.A. 18A: 11-11 requires boards of education to provide public notice 30 days prior to the renegotiation, extension, amendment, or alteration of an employment contract with the Superintendent of Schools. This advertisement provides the said public notice, and has been posted on the District's website on July 2, 2024. The Fort Lee Board of Education hereby designates starting at 7:30 pm in the Lewis F. Cole Intermediate School Cafetorium, located at 467 Stillwell Avenue, Fort Lee, NJ 07024 as the public hearing required by the Act, after which the Board may take action to amend the Superintendent of Schools' contract. Prior to this action, the Board will permit the public to make comments on the proposed contract at the aforementioned meeting. The Board, pursuant to the Open Public Meetings Act, specifically N.J.S.A. 10:4-12 (b), shall not publicly discuss personnel matters. However, the Board will give all comments appropriate consideration. A copy of the contract is on file and available for review by the public at the office of the Board Secretary, located at 231 Main Street, 3rd Floor, Fort Lee, NJ 07024. The Board, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 10:4-12 (b), the Open Public Meetings Act, shall not publicly discuss personnel matters and shall not respond to comments made by members of the public. Please be aware that the subject of this hearing retains the right of privacy and shall retain all rights regarding defamation and slander according to the laws of New Jersey. The Board shall not be held liable for comments made by members of the public. BY ORDER OF THE BOARD OF EDUCATION. Mrs. Dina Messery Board Secretary July 2, 2024 30 day notice 7/8/24 $80.84

The West Windsor-Plainsboro Regional School District invites the submission of sealed bids on: BID NO: 2024-03 LANDSCAPING AND MOWING SERVICES. Bids will be received until 10:00 AM on Tuesday, July 23, 2024 at the Business Office, 321 Village Road E, West Windsor, NJ 08550 at which time and place all bids will be publicly opened. No bids shall be received after the time designated in the advertisement per N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-21(b). At this time, the Board of Education does not accept electronic (e-mail) submission of bids. The Board assumes no responsibility for bids mailed or misdirected in delivery. Pre-bid Meeting will be held on Monday, July 15, 2024 at 10:00 am at the West Windsor-Plainsboro Regional School District, 321 Village Road East, West Windsor, NJ 08550. Attendance is strongly suggested as no other walkthrough will be permitted. Attendees must register prior to 3:00 pm on Wednesday, July 10, 2024 via email purchasing@wwprsd.org. Specification and Bid Forms may be obtained at the same office or requested by email to purchasing@wwprsd.org. All bid packages will be sent out via email. Bids must be in strict compliance with specifications. Proposals must be endorsed on the outside of the sealed envelope with the name and address of bidder and clearly labeled "BID: 2024-03 Landscaping and Mowing Services". The Board of Education reserves the right to reject any or all bids. Any bid submitted will be binding for 60 days subsequent to the date of the bid opening. Bidding shall be conducted in accordance with the New Jersey Public School Contracts Law, N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-1 et seq. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A 10:5-31 et seq. and NJAC 17:27. Bidders are required to submit a NJ Business Registration Certificate and certification of compliance with Affirmative Action/EEO statutes prior to award of contract and the bidder must have obtained the NJ Business Registration Certificate prior to receipt of bids per P.L.2009, c.315. BOARD OF EDUCATION WEST WINDSOR-PLAINSBORO REGIONAL MERCER COUNTY, NEW JERSEY Dr. Christopher Russo, Assistant Superintendent for Finance/Board Secretary tary 7/8/24 THE TIMES $65.36

PORT AUTHORITY TRANS-HUDSON CORPORATION NOTICE OF INTENT TO SOLE SOURCE The Port Authority Trans-Hudson Corporation (PATH) intends to establish a sole source contract with ENSCO Rail, Inc., located in Springfield, VA to provide the following: TITLE: Track Inspection Vehicle (TIV) Analysis -- Provide System-wide, Auto- matic Track Inspections and Imaging Recordings of the PATH Transit System, and Maintenance of the Measurement and Inspection Systems Aboard PATH's TIV, Three-Year Contract BRIEF DESCRIPTION: ENSCO is the manufacturer of the TIV currently in use by PATH. Work requires inspection system operators, geometry testing, ultrasonic test- ing, other specific services, data reporting, and maintenance and repair utilizing parts specific to the OEM of the TIV for compatibility. Manufacturers/firms who believe they can compete for this requirement are required to submit an email with a brief statement of their intent to compete. The statement and any other questions regarding this sole source should be directed to the Buyer, john.santiago@panynj.gov by July 16, 2024. The Port Authority does not guarantee that firms responding to this notice will be rendered a request to tender an offer for this procurement. In addition, the Port Authority does not guarantee that any solicita- tion will occur for this procurement, but reserves the right to solicit proposals. Firms who have not done business with the Port Authority should register as a vendor at https://www.panynjprocure.com. Also, visit our website to view advertised bids at http://www. panynj.gov/business-opportunities/bid-proposal-advertisements.html. NOTICE OF SOLE SOURCE PROCUREMENT RESPONSES DUE: JULY 16, 2024 BY 11:00 A.M. BUYER NAME: JOHN SANTIAGO BUYER EMAIL: john.santiago@panynj.gov The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey (Port Authority), in accordance with the provisions of Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (78 Stat. 252, 42 USC SSSS 2000d to 2000d-4) and the Regulations, hereby notifies all bidders or offerors that it will affirmatively ensure that for any contract entered into pursuant to this advertise- ment, businesses will be afforded full and fair opportunity to submit bids in response to this invitation and no businesses will be discriminated against on the grounds of race, color, national origin (including limited English proficiency), creed, sex (including sexual orientation and gender identity), age, or disability in consideration for an award. SOLICITATION OF PROFESSIONAL SERVICES STATE OF NEW JERSEY DIVISION OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AND CONSTRUCTION (DPMC) DPMC NUMBER: C1088-01 Construction Management Services New Correctional Facility for Women Chesterfield, Burlington County, NJ The DPMC is seeking to engage the services of a construction management firm with the objective to act as the owner's authorized representative to manage both the services of the Design consultant and the construction Contractors under the supervision of the Department of Property Management and Construction for this facility. The scope of work for this project can be obtained via the DPMC web site at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/project_major_advertisements.shtml The Consultant shall be a firm prequalified with the DPMC in: Construction Management (P029) with a dollar rating of Unlimited. The Consultant shall also have in-house capabilities or identify sub-consultants prequalified in the following disciplines: 1. Building Commissioning P019, 2. Estimating/Cost Analysis P025 and 3. CPM P030 The Consultant should also identify all other architectural, engineering and specialty disciplines necessary to complete the project as described in the scope of work. DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS Preliminary technical proposals (DPMC Form 48B) are due to DPMC no later than 2:00 p.m., Tuesday, July 30, 2024 and shall be submitted to William Mahan, Consultant Selection Coordinator, Contracts & Procurement Unit, DPMC, via email to the following email addresses: william.mahan@treas.nj.gov & mariah.greco@treas.nj.gov. Only Adobe PDF files will be accepted. The file size cannot exceed 20 mb. Hard copies will not be accepted. Submissions received after 2:00 p.m., Tuesday, July 30, 2024 will not be considered. Only firms currently prequalified with DPMC in Construction Management P029 with a rating of Unlimited may submit. All joint venture firms must be separately prequalified in Construction Management with at least one firm having a dollar rating of Unlimited. Please note there is a maximum 40-page limit for preliminary technical proposals (DPMC Form 48B) submitted for this project. Any information beyond the 40-page limit will not be considered. Preliminary technical proposal forms (DPMC Form 48B) are also available on the DPMC web site at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/forms.shtml Please note: all consultant(s)/sub-consultant(s) participating on the project team must be separately prequalified by DPMC in the discipline(s) for which they will be providing professional services. If a firm is not currently prequalified, a completed prequalification application must be received by Tuesday, July 23, 2024 no later than 4:00 PM in order for a firm to be eligible to submit on this project. Please visit the DPMC website at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/forms.shtml to obtain a prequalification application (form 48A) or contact the prequalification unit at (609) 777-4561. The consultant selection committee for this project will evaluate the form 48 B preliminary technical proposals based upon: 1. Demonstration of the firm / project team's organization and 2. The firm / project team's experience on projects of a similar size and nature. The consultant's project approach and management plan, CPM scheduling, and cost estimating / budget control will also be reviewed as part of the full technical proposals which will be submitted at a later date. Interested firms that possess the required pre-qualifications mentioned above, may obtain an RFP package by contacting William Mahan of DPMC at (609) 292-4234 or by e-mail to william.mahan@treas.nj.gov. All competing firms are required to comply with the requirements of PL 1975, c. 127 (N.J.A.C. 17:27), regarding non-discrimination requirements in the performance of state contracts. CHRISTOPHER R. GEARY, ASSISTANT DEPUTY DIRECTOR CONTRACTS & PROCUREMENT DIVISION OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AND CONSTRUCTION STATE OF NEW JERSEY P.O. BOX 034 TRENTON, NJ 08625-0034 $66.04 THE TIMES 7/8/24

Box 971, Trenton, New Jersey 08625, in accordance with the Rules of Civil Practice and Procedure. This action has been instituted for the purpose of foreclosing tax sale certificate #14-00668 dated June 26, 2014, made by the Collector of Taxes for the City of Camden, County of Camden and State of New Jersey, and recorded in the office of the Camden County Clerk/Register in mortgage book 10066, page 250; and covers real estate located at 2014 S Broadway, City of Camden, County of Camden and State of New Jersey known as Block 500, Lot 8, as shown on the Tax Assessment Map and Tax Map duplicate of the City of Camden . NOTIFICATION OF RIGHTS RELATING TO SURPLUS EQUITY (a) the within action could result in the loss of the property owners' equity in the property; (b) the potential loss of equity is a valid basis for contesting the tax foreclosure; and (c) the property owner has the ability to request a sheriff's sale of the property which would require any surplus beyond the amount owed to be deposited with the Superior Court Trust Fund. NOTICE OF SURPLUS EQUITY AFFIRMATIVE DEFENSE: Pursuant to New Jersey Court Rule 4:64-1c ("Definition of Uncontested Action") any allegation in a responsive pleading to this complaint that a party has existing equity in the property shall be treated as a contesting answer to this tax foreclosure complaint. Pursuant to Tyler v. Hennepin County, 598 U.S. 631, 143 S. Ct. 1369 (2023), a property owner may be entitled to the surplus which would be realized over and above the amount due to the plaintiff lienholder. According to Black's Law Dictionary 657 (10th ed. 2014), "surplus" is "an amount of something that is more than what is required or used." If you believe there is a surplus beyond the amount owed to the plaintiff, you must assert same in a responsive pleading. YOU, DANIEL P. SMITH, his heirs, devisees and personal representatives and their or any of their successors in right, title and interest is joined as a defendant to this action by virtue of a deed dated July 11, 2018 and recorded September 12, 2018 at book 10963 page 1323. YOU, MELINDA A. RIJOS, Individually and as possible heir to Daniel P. Smith; DANNY RIJOS, Individually and as possible heir to Daniel P. Smith are joined as party defendants to this action for any right, title, interest or claim he/she, his/her heirs or successors may have in or to the subject property by virtue of dower, curtesy, inheritance or for any other reason. YOU, BRITTANY L RIVERA a/k/a ERICKSON BRITTANY are joined as a Defendant to this action by virtue of the following judgment: judgment number J-092347-2022 dated July 31, 2022 in an amount that varies from date to date for child support against Danny J. Rios. If you are unable to obtain an attorney, you may communicate with the New Jersey State Bar Association by calling (732)249-5000. You may also contact the Lawyer Referral Services of the county of venue by calling (856) 964-4520. If you cannot afford an attorney, you may communicate with the Legal Services Office of the county of venue by calling (856) 964-2010. The nature of which and the reason that you and each of you are joined as defendants is set forth with particularity in the complaint (and any amendments thereto) a copy of which will be furnished you on request addressed to the attorneys of the Plaintiff at the above mentioned address. Dated: July 2, 2024 /s/ Michelle M. Smith, Esq. Michelle M. Smith, Esquire, Clerk Superior Court of New Jersey Publication Dates L00000000 $

SOLICITATION OF PROFESSIONAL SERVICES STATE OF NEW JERSEY DIVISION OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AND CONSTRUCTION (DPMC) DPMC NUMBER: C1088-01 Construction Management Services New Correctional Facility for Women Chesterfield, Burlington County, NJ The DPMC is seeking to engage the services of a construction management firm with the objective to act as the owner's authorized representative to manage both the services of the Design consultant and the construction Contractors under the supervision of the Department of Property Management and Construction for this facility. The scope of work for this project can be obtained via the DPMC web site at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/project_major_advertisements.shtml The Consultant shall be a firm prequalified with the DPMC in: Construction Management (P029) with a dollar rating of Unlimited. The Consultant shall also have in-house capabilities or identify sub-consultants prequalified in the following disciplines: 1. Building Commissioning P019, 2. Estimating/Cost Analysis P025 and 3. CPM P030 The Consultant should also identify all other architectural, engineering and specialty disciplines necessary to complete the project as described in the scope of work. DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS Preliminary technical proposals (DPMC Form 48B) are due to DPMC no later than 2:00 p.m., Tuesday, July 30, 2024 and shall be submitted to William Mahan, Consultant Selection Coordinator, Contracts & Procurement Unit, DPMC, via email to the following email addresses: william.mahan@treas.nj.gov & mariah.greco@treas.nj.gov. Only Adobe PDF files will be accepted. The file size cannot exceed 20 mb. Hard copies will not be accepted. Submissions received after 2:00 p.m., Tuesday, July 30, 2024 will not be considered. Only firms currently prequalified with DPMC in Construction Management P029 with a rating of Unlimited may submit. All joint venture firms must be separately prequalified in Construction Management with at least one firm having a dollar rating of Unlimited. Please note there is a maximum 40-page limit for preliminary technical proposals (DPMC Form 48B) submitted for this project. Any information beyond the 40-page limit will not be considered. Preliminary technical proposal forms (DPMC Form 48B) are also available on the DPMC web site at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/forms.shtml Please note: all consultant(s)/sub-consultant(s) participating on the project team must be separately prequalified by DPMC in the discipline(s) for which they will be providing professional services. If a firm is not currently prequalified, a completed prequalification application must be received by Tuesday, July 23, 2024 no later than 4:00 PM in order for a firm to be eligible to submit on this project. Please visit the DPMC website at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/forms.shtml to obtain a prequalification application (form 48A) or contact the prequalification unit at (609) 777-4561. The consultant selection committee for this project will evaluate the form 48 B preliminary technical proposals based upon: 1. Demonstration of the firm / project team's organization and 2. The firm / project team's experience on projects of a similar size and nature. The consultant's project approach and management plan, CPM scheduling, and cost estimating / budget control will also be reviewed as part of the full technical proposals which will be submitted at a later date. Interested firms that possess the required pre-qualifications mentioned above, may obtain an RFP package by contacting William Mahan of DPMC at (609) 292-4234 or by e-mail to william.mahan@treas.nj.gov. All competing firms are required to comply with the requirements of PL 1975, c. 127 (N.J.A.C. 17:27), regarding non-discrimination requirements in the performance of state contracts. CHRISTOPHER R. GEARY, ASSISTANT DEPUTY DIRECTOR CONTRACTS & PROCUREMENT DIVISION OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AND CONSTRUCTION STATE OF NEW JERSEY P.O. BOX 034 TRENTON, NJ 08625-0034 7/8/24 $193.13

Each bid must be accompanied by a certified check, cashier's check or bid bond in the amount of ten percent (10%) (not to exceed $20,000.00) of the total bid, payable to the County of Morris, as a guarantee that if the contract is awarded to the Bidder, they will enter into a contract and provide the necessary bonds and insurance as required by the County and the Division of Risk Management. Bid proposals shall be delivered to the Purchasing Agent either in person at the hour designated, or previous thereto, by delivery or mail, at the Morris County Purchasing Division, Room 517, 5th Floor, Administration & Records Building, PO Box 900, Morristown, New Jersey, 07963 0900. No bids shall be accepted after the designated time, and Morris County will not assume responsibility for bids forwarded by mail or delivery service, nor any other conveyance. The successful Bidder will be required to furnish a Performance Bond, Payment Bond and Maintenance Bond as specified in the Contract Documents. EACH BID MUST BE ACCOMPANIED WITH A CONSENT OF SURETY which states that the surety company will provide the Bidder with the performance bond specified in the Contract Documents in the event the Bidder is awarded the Contract. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27. Bid and Proposal requests herein are solicited through a fair and open process, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 19:44A-20.4 et seq. The vendor shall maintain all documentation related to products, transactions, or services under this contract for a period of five years from the date of final payment. Request 1007 The properties listed below have been condemned as unfit for human habitation in accordance with the Code of the City of Savannah. The Code Official of the City of Savannah hereby orders the structure to be vacated and to remain vacant until all repairs necessary to bring the structure into compliance have been made. In the spirit of community pride and responsible property ownership, we ask that the property owner(s) and/or interested parties correct these violation(s). Any required permits must be obtained from the Development Services Department before beginning the required work. Unsecured properties must be secured in accordance with Appendix A (Boarding Standards) of the International Property Maintenance Code and remain secured until all code violations are corrected. The exterior of the structure must be maintained in good repair, structurally sound and sanitary so as not to pose a threat to the health, safety or welfare of the public. Additionally, all trash and debris must be removed from both the yard and interior of the structure. If you do not correct the unsecure violation(s), the City will contract to have the property cleaned and secured without any further notice. If the City employs a contractor to perform this work, the property owner will be charged for the cost of the work plus an administration fee of up to $300.00. The cost shall be charges against the real property and, if not paid, a lien filed against such real property. If these properties also have been found to have growth of weeds, rank vegetation and/or debris, these violation(s) must be corrected, if not, the City will contract to have the property cut and cleaned. If the City employs a contractor to perform this work, the property owner will be charged for the cost of the work plus a $200.00 administration fee. The cost shall be charges against the real property and, if not paid, a lien filed against such real property. If no action has been taken, the City will take necessary enforcement action without any further notice. All violations must be corrected and inspected by a Code Compliance Officer before this property can be used for human habitation. If the corrections are not completed and the property is reoccupied, the Code Official shall institute legal proceedings charging the responsible person(s), firm, corporation, or agent with violation of the Code of the City of Savannah. Please direct your response and/or inquires to the Code Compliance Department, P.O. Box 1027, Savannah, GA 31402 or (912) 651-6770. All objections should be sworn to before a notary public or Georgia probate court clerk and filing fees must be tendered with your objections, unless you qualify to file as an indigent party. Contact Probate Court personnel for the required amount of filing fees. NOTE: If a natural guardian files a timely objection to the creation of the temporary guardianship, the Petition will be dismissed. If a natural guardian files an objection to the appointment of the Petitioner as guardian, or if a parent who is not a natural guardian files an objection to the Petition, a hearing on the matter shall be scheduled at a later date. MEETING NOTICE COUNTY OF HUDSON PUBLIC HEARING ON PROPOSED 2024 OPEN SPACE TRUST FUND ALLOCATIONS Please Take Notice: As required by the State of New Jersey in N.J.S.A. 40:12-15, et seq., the Hudson County Board of County Commissioners will conduct a public hearing on the proposed allocations of its Open Space Trust Fund for Funding Year 2024 on August 8, 2024 at 1:00 p.m., in the Commissioner Chambers, 567 Pavonia Avenue, 1st Floor, Jersey, City, New Jersey, at which time public comment will be taken. In accordance with the N.J.S.A. 40:12-15.3(d), the County of Hudson is proposing the following funding allocations totaling $8,498,822 from the Hudson County Open Space, Recreation and Historic Preservation Trust Fund for the Trust Fund's 2024 funding cycle: Open Space Land Acquisition Projects totaling $422,000 as follows: (1) Town of Kearny - $422,000 for Site Acquisitions for a Continuous Waterfront Recreational Park Along the Passaic River. Parks and Recreation Improvement Projects totaling $7,797,000 as follows: (1) City of Bayonne - $500,000 for Peninsula at Bayonne Harbor Waterfront Walkway Extension. (2) City of Bayonne - $250,000 for Improvements to Veteran's Park. (3) Borough of East Newark - $167,000 for Veterans Soccer Field Turf. (4) Town of Guttenberg - $300,000 for Guttenberg Dog Park Project. (5) Town of Harrison - $300,000 for Policemen's Park Playground Rehabilitation. (6) City of Hoboken - $250,000 for Hoboken Skate Park and Walkway Upgrades Project. (7) City of Hoboken - $500,000 for Church Square Park Improvement Project - Phase 1. (8) City of Jersey City - $500,000 for Sinner Park Improvements Project. (9) City of Jersey City - $250,000 for Martiniak-Enright Park Improvements Project. (10) City of Jersey City - $500,000 for City Hall Park. (11) Jersey City Redevelopment Authority - $500,000 for Bayfront Promenade Park Phase I. (12) Town of Kearny - $150,000 for Kearny Recreational Center Site Improvements. (13) Township of North Bergen - $500,000 for Pickleball Court Improvements to Stan Newman Field. (14) Township of North Bergen - $250,000 for Improvements to the North Bergen Recreation Center. (15) Town of Secaucus - $500,000 for Ivanoski Park Inclusive Playground Project. (16) City of Union City - $500,000 for Liberty Place Playground. (17) City of Union City - $500,000 for 4100 Palisade Avenue Soccer Field. (18) Township of Weehawken - $500,000 for Louisa Park Improvement Project. (19) Township of Weehawken - $250,000 for Weehawken Pedestrian Bridge & Waterfront Walkway. (20) Town of West New York - $330,000 for Fillmore Park Improvement Project: Playground. (21) Town of West New York - $300,000 for Fillmore Park Improvement Project: Safety Improvements. Historic Preservation Projects totaling $279,822 as follows: (1) Old Bergen Church - $100,000 for Old Bergen Church Cemetery Restoration Project. (2) Hudson County Parks - $179,822 for Historic Preservation of Lincoln Park Sun Houses. The anticipated commencement date for these proposed projects is on or about September 26, 2024. The anticipated completion date for these proposed projects is by or about September 25, 2026. The public may submit written comments to the County on or before the date of the public hearing, or request additional information, by contacting Carol Jean Doyle, Clerk of the Board of County Commissioners, 567 Pavonia Avenue, 1st Floor, Jersey City, New Jersey 07306, (201) 795-6001. 7/8/24 $48.33

NOTICE TO ABSENT DEFENDANTS Docket No: F-4806-24 SUPERIOR COURT OF NEW JERSEY, CAMDEN COUNTY STATE OF NEW JERSEY TO: DIRK DELEON PARKER; NORTH STAR CAPITAL ACQUISITIONS LLC You are hereby summoned and required to serve upon GARY C. ZEITZ, L.L.C., Plaintiff's Attorney, whose address is 1101 Laurel Oak Road, Suite 170, Voorhees, New Jersey 08043, an answer to the Complaint (and any amendments thereto) filed in a civil action in which TLF 206 LLC is Plaintiff and Dirk Deleon Parker, et al. are Defendants pending in the Superior Court of New Jersey, Chancery Division, Camden County and bearing Docket No. F-4806-24, within thirty-five (35) days after July 8, 2024, exclusive of such date. If you fail to do so, judgment by default may be rendered against you for the relief demanded in the Complaint. You shall file your answer and proof of service in duplicate with the Clerk of the Superior Court of New Jersey, Hughes Justice Complex, 25 West Market Street, P.O. Box 971, Trenton, New Jersey 08625, in accordance with the Rules of Civil Practice and Procedure. This action has been instituted for the purpose of foreclosing tax sale certificate #3-1678 dated February 6,2003, made by the Collector of Taxes for the City of Camden, County of Camden and State of New Jersey, and recorded in the office of the Camden County Clerk/Register in mortgage book 6334, page 472; and covers real estate located at 1245 Lansdown Ave, City of Camden, County of Camden and State of New Jersey known as Block 1331, Lot 116, as shown on the Tax Assessment Map and Tax Map duplicate of the City of Camden . NOTIFICATION OF RIGHTS RELATING TO SURPLUS EQUITY (a) the within action could result in the loss of the property owners' equity in the property; (b) the potential loss of equity is a valid basis for contesting the tax foreclosure; and (c) the property owner has the ability to request a sheriff's sale of the property which would require any surplus beyond the amount owed to be deposited with the Superior Court Trust Fund. NOTICE OF SURPLUS EQUITY AFFIRMATIVE DEFENSE: Pursuant to New Jersey Court Rule 4:64-1c ("Definition of Uncontested Action") any allegation in a responsive pleading to this complaint that a party has existing equity in the property shall be treated as a contesting answer to this tax foreclosure complaint. Pursuant to Tyler v. Hennepin County, 598 U.S. 631, 143 S. Ct. 1369 (2023), a property owner may be entitled to the surplus which would be realized over and above the amount due to the plaintiff lienholder. According to Black's Law Dictionary 657 (10th ed. 2014), "surplus" is "an amount of something that is more than what is required or used." If you believe there is a surplus beyond the amount owed to the plaintiff, you must assert same in a responsive pleading. The record owner of the lands and premises is/are DIRK DELEON PARKER and such owner(s) is/are named as proper party Defendant(s) to this action to foreclose his/her/their interest, and that of his/her/their successors, in the land and premises described in the Complaint. YOU, NORTH STAR CAPITAL ACQUISITIONS LLC are joined as a Defendant to this action by virtue of the following judgment: judgment number DJ-163095-2008 dated July 16, 2008 in the amount of $2,953.14 against Betty Cox. If you are unable to obtain an attorney, you may communicate with the New Jersey State Bar Association by calling (732)249-5000. You may also contact the Lawyer Referral Services of the county of venue by calling (856) 964-4520. If you cannot afford an attorney, you may communicate with the Legal Services Office of the county of venue by calling (856) 964-2010. The nature of which and the reason that you and each of you are joined as defendants is set forth with particularity in the complaint (and any amendments thereto) a copy of which will be furnished you on request addressed to the attorneys of the Plaintiff at the above mentioned address. Dated: July 2, 2024 /s/ Michelle M. Smith, Esq. Michelle M. Smith, Esquire, Clerk Superior Court of New Jersey Publication Dates L00000000 $

SOLICITATION OF PROFESSIONAL SERVICES STATE OF NEW JERSEY DIVISION OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AND CONSTRUCTION (DPMC) DPMC NUMBER: C1088-01 Construction Management Services New Correctional Facility for Women Chesterfield, Burlington County, NJ The DPMC is seeking to engage the services of a construction management firm with the objective to act as the owner's authorized representative to manage both the services of the Design consultant and the construction Contractors under the supervision of the Department of Property Management and Construction for this facility. The scope of work for this project can be obtained via the DPMC web site at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/project_major_advertisements.shtml The Consultant shall be a firm prequalified with the DPMC in: Construction Management (P029) with a dollar rating of Unlimited. The Consultant shall also have in-house capabilities or identify sub-consultants prequalified in the following disciplines: 1. Building Commissioning P019, 2. Estimating/Cost Analysis P025 and 3. CPM P030 The Consultant should also identify all other architectural, engineering and specialty disciplines necessary to complete the project as described in the scope of work. DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS Preliminary technical proposals (DPMC Form 48B) are due to DPMC no later than 2:00 p.m., Tuesday, July 30, 2024 and shall be submitted to William Mahan, Consultant Selection Coordinator, Contracts & Procurement Unit, DPMC, via email to the following email addresses: william.mahan@treas.nj.gov & mariah.greco@treas.nj.gov. Only Adobe PDF files will be accepted. The file size cannot exceed 20 mb. Hard copies will not be accepted. Submissions received after 2:00 p.m., Tuesday, July 30, 2024 will not be considered. Only firms currently prequalified with DPMC in Construction Management P029 with a rating of Unlimited may submit. All joint venture firms must be separately prequalified in Construction Management with at least one firm having a dollar rating of Unlimited. Please note there is a maximum 40-page limit for preliminary technical proposals (DPMC Form 48B) submitted for this project. Any information beyond the 40-page limit will not be considered. Preliminary technical proposal forms (DPMC Form 48B) are also available on the DPMC web site at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/forms.shtml Please note: all consultant(s)/sub-consultant(s) participating on the project team must be separately prequalified by DPMC in the discipline(s) for which they will be providing professional services. If a firm is not currently prequalified, a completed prequalification application must be received by Tuesday, July 23, 2024 no later than 4:00 PM in order for a firm to be eligible to submit on this project. Please visit the DPMC website at https://www.nj.gov/treasury/dpmc/forms.shtml to obtain a prequalification application (form 48A) or contact the prequalification unit at (609) 777-4561. The consultant selection committee for this project will evaluate the form 48 B preliminary technical proposals based upon: 1. Demonstration of the firm / project team's organization and 2. The firm / project team's experience on projects of a similar size and nature. The consultant's project approach and management plan, CPM scheduling, and cost estimating / budget control will also be reviewed as part of the full technical proposals which will be submitted at a later date. Interested firms that possess the required pre-qualifications mentioned above, may obtain an RFP package by contacting William Mahan of DPMC at (609) 292-4234 or by e-mail to william.mahan@treas.nj.gov. All competing firms are required to comply with the requirements of PL 1975, c. 127 (N.J.A.C. 17:27), regarding non-discrimination requirements in the performance of state contracts. CHRISTOPHER R. GEARY, ASSISTANT DEPUTY DIRECTOR CONTRACTS & PROCUREMENT DIVISION OF PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AND CONSTRUCTION STATE OF NEW JERSEY P.O. BOX 034 TRENTON, NJ 08625-0034 10355074 7/8/24

NOTICE TO THE PUBLIC Please take notice that, at its regularly scheduled meeting on August 12, 2024, the Wyckoff Board of Education (hereinafter referred to as the "Board") shall meet for the purpose of renegotiating, amending or otherwise altering the terms of the employment contract with the Superintendent. At this hearing, members of the public are invited to submit public comments regarding this topic. ADVERTISEMENT OF REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL Purchase of Marine Engine Port Imperial Ferry Corp., d/b/a NY Waterway REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS - RFP No. ERP-0719: Purchase of Marine Engine NY Waterway is requesting proposals from qualified companies for the purchase of a Tier "3" 600 hp with marine transmissions, approximate 2.5:1 gear for repower of two of the fleet's twin engine propeller driven traditional ferries. Engines shall be diesel fueled, no more than 1800 RPM. The engines and gears will be rated for continuous duty. Torsional Vibration Analysis, control system for dual station, startup, couplers, mounts and start up shall be included in the proposal. The proposal shall include equipment for two vessels. Qualifying companies shall submit a sealed bid, including company information, listing all information pertinent to equipment. Price shall include purchase of equipment, any service/warranty information, and include cost of delivery to Weehawken, NJ or within a radius of 15 miles to be determined by the purchaser. Delivery shall be no later than February 15, 2025. Any and all questions shall be submitted no later than July, 10, 2024 to warren@nywaterway.com and will be answered and made available to all interested parties no later than July 12, 2024. Bids are to be emailed or mailed to the address below no later than 12:00 PM on July 19, 2024. Bids will be opened July 19, 2024. Terms will be Net 30 with up to 10 percent deposit being given upon signing of an agreement. Port Imperial Ferry Corp. d/b/a NY Waterway 4800 Avenue at Port Imperial Weehawken, NJ 07086 Re: RFP No. ERP-0719 Attention: Alan Warren warren@nywaterway.com hannigan@nywaterway.com Companies will be fully responsible for the delivery of their proposals. Reliance upon the U.S. Mail or other carriers is at the companies' risk. Late submissions will not be considered. 7/8/24 $71.38

CLASS:10900 CITY OF TALLAPOOSA NOTICE OF A PUBLIC HEARING REZONING REQUEST The Mayor and City Council of Tallapoosa shall hold a public hearing at 6:00 pm, Monday, July 8, 2024 in the Council Chambers at City Hall. CURRENT ZONING: Tax Map 49, parcel #67: Dual zoning: road frontage 3 acres, zoned M-2, Heavy Manufacturing; back 11 acres zoned A-P, Agriculture Pasture REQUESTED ZONING: Tax Map 49, parcel number #67: M-2, Heavy Manufacturing Rezoning request is from property owner David L. Coy. The parcel contains approximately 14.11 acres of land, with split zoning. 3 acres with road frontage is currently zoned M-2, the rear 11.11 acres was rezoned in 2010 from M-2 to A-P, Agriculture Pasture. The assigned street number is 120 Golf Course Road. Current owner David Coy would prefer the property be zoned as it originally was, M-2, Heavy Manufacturing. PURPOSE: To market the property as M-2, in hopes of having a manufacturing plant located on the property in the future. SWC-F-005328-22 NOTICE TO ABSENT DEFENDANTS STATE OF NEW JERSEY TO UNKNOWN HEIRS, DEVISEES AND PERSONAL REPRESENTATIVES, AND THEIR OR ANY OF THEIR SUCCESSORS, IN RIGHT, TITLE AND INTEREST OF EUGENE H. CHEAK AND RUTH B. CHEAK You are hereby summoned and required to serve upon the Law Office of Brian J. Duffield LLC, attorney for Plaintiff, whose address is 95 North Main Street, Mullica Hill, New Jersey, an answer to the Third Amended Complaint (and Amendment(s) to Third Amended Complaint, if any) in a civil action in which A. Martin Ott Irrevocable Trust is the Plaintiff and Eugene H. Cheak, et al. are the defendants, pending in the Superior Court of New Jersey within 35 days after July 8, 2024, exclusive of said date. If you fail to do so, judgment by default may be entered against you for the relief demanded in the Third Amended Complaint. You shall file your Answer and Proof of Service with the Clerk of the Superior Court, Hughes Justice Complex, Hughes Justice Complex, 25 Market Street, P.O. Box 971, Trenton, NJ 08625-0971, in accordance with the Rules of Civil Practice and Procedure. You are further advised that if you are unable to obtain an attorney, you may communicate with the New Jersey State Bar Association by calling 732-249-5000. You may also contact the Lawyer Referral Service of the County of Salem by calling 856-935-5629. If you cannot afford an attorney, you may communicate with the Legal Services Office of the County of Salem by calling 856-691-0494. The action has been instituted for the purpose of (1) foreclosing a Tax Sale Certificate dated November 26, 2019, and recorded against the Defendants' property, of which the Plaintiff is the current holder, recorded in the Salem County Clerk's Office on December 13, 2019, in Book 4541, Page 1415 and (2) to recover possession of and concerns premises commonly known as 28 New Street (Block 20, Lot 17), in the Township of Quinton, County of Salem and State of New Jersey. You, UNKNOWN HEIRS, DEVISEES AND PERSONAL REPRESENTATIVES, AND THEIR OR ANY OF THEIR SUCCESSORS, IN RIGHT, TITLE AND INTEREST OF EUGENE H. CHEAK AND RUTH B. CHEAK, are made party defendant to this foreclosure action because you are an heir or judgment creditor of the above premises and Plaintiff seeks to foreclose its mortgage and foreclose out your interest in the subject premises and acquire possession of the property and to preserve the Plaintiff's right to a deficiency. You are entitled to Notice of this action for any right, title or interest you may have in, to or against said premises. You must also send a copy of your answer or motion to Plaintiff's attorney whose name and address appear above, or to plaintiff, if no attorney is named above. A telephone call will not protect your rights; you must file and serve a written answer or motion (with fee of $175.00 and completed Case Information Statement) if you want the court to hear your defense. If you cannot afford an attorney, you may call the Legal Services office in the county where you live or the Legal Services of New Jersey Statewide Hotline at 1-888-LSNJ-LAW (1-888-576-5529). If you do not have an attorney and are not eligible for free legal assistance, you may obtain a referral to an attorney by calling one of the Lawyer Referral Services. A directory with contact information for local Legal Services Offices and Lawyer Referral Services is available in the Civil Division Management Office in the county listed above and online at http://www.judiciary.state.nj.us/prose/10153_deptyclerklawref.pdf. NOTICE TO BIDDERS BOROUGH OF LEBANON Notice is hereby given that sealed bids will be received by the Borough Administrator of the Borough of Lebanon in the County of Hunterdon, State of New Jersey, in the lower floor conference room located in the Municipal Building at 6 High Street, Lebanon, New Jersey, on Wednesday, July 24, 2024 at 10:00 a.m., prevailing time, and at that time and place publicly opened and read for the Myrtle Avenue Extension and Youngs Road Resurfacing Project. The work to be performed under this contract includes a base bid for the resetting of existing castings, installation of new inlet castings, approximately 3,000 square yards of hot mix asphalt milling and approximately 425 tons of hot mix asphalt resurfacing and other incidental items on Myrtle Avenue Extension from Brunswick Avenue to the end of Myrtle Avenue. The work on Myrtle Avenue Extension is being funded by the NJDOT through a Local Aid grant. The work to be performed under this contract also includes an alternate bid for the installation of new inlet castings, approximately 1,400 square yards of hot mix asphalt milling and approximately 200 tons of hot mix asphalt resurfacing and other incidental items on Youngs Road from Edgerton Drive to Main Street. The work on Youngs Road is being funded by the Borough. All bidders must bid on both the base bid and the alternate bid. The Governing Body, if electing to award, will award the base bid plus the alternate bid. Neither the base bid or the alternate bid will be awarded separately. Plans and specifications and proposal forms are on file and open to public inspection at the Borough Administrator's Office and may be obtained at the office of the Borough Engineer at 180 Main Street, Chester, New Jersey, (908) 879-6209, between the hours of 8:00 am and 5:00 pm, prevailing time, Monday through Friday, excluding legal holidays, upon payment of $25.00, payable to Boswell Engineering, said sum not refundable, beginning on Monday, July 8, 2024. Each bid must be made on the prescribed forms furnished with the Contract Drawings and Specifications, including Non-collusion Affidavit, and must be accompanied by a Consent of Surety and a Certified Check, Cashier's Check or Bid Bond of not less than ten (10%) percent of the amount bid, and not to exceed $20,000.00. Bids may be submitted by mail, but will be considered only if received on or before such date and time. Bidders are advised that New Jersey Department of Transportation Local Aid Funding will be utilized on this project for work on Clark Road. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and N.J.A.C. 17:27, and PL 1977, c.33. Bidders are required to comply with the New Jersey Business Registration Certificate Law, P.L. 2004,c. 57. Bidders are required to comply with the Public Works Contractor Registration Act, P.L. 1999,c. 238. The Borough reserves the right to reject any and all bids, to waive immaterial informalities, and/or to accept the bid which, in the opinion of the Borough, will be in the best interest of the Borough, all in accordance with the New Jersey Public Contract Law N.J.S.A. 40A:11-1 et. seq. Karen M. Romano Borough Administrator Borough of Lebanon ($36.58)

TOWNSHIP OF READINGTON AN ORDINANCE OF THE TOWNSHIP OF READINGTON AMENDING SECTION 121 (ENFORCEMENT) OF CHAPTER 148 (LAND DEVELOPMENT) TO DELEGATE ENFORCEMENT POWER TO ADDITIONAL INDIVIDUALS Ordinance #22-2024 WHEREAS, the Township has recently hired a part-time zoning and property maintenance inspector pursuant to Resolution No. 2023-183; and WHEREAS, the current enforcement provision in the Township's Land Development Ordinance found in Chapter 148 of the Township's municipal code delegates enforcement responsibilities to the Construction Official and the Zoning Officer; and WHEREAS, the Township seeks to increase the number of individuals who may enforce penalties incurred by the violation of provisions of Chapter 148 to this new zoning and property maintenance inspector. NOW THEREFORE BE IT ORDAINED by the Mayor and Committee of Readington Township as follows: Section I Section 148(a) of Chapter 121 of the municipal code of the Township of Readington is hereby amended as follows (struck through portions are to be removed; bolded and underlined portions are to be added): A. The Construction Official and the Zoning Officer. (1) It shall be the duty of the Construction Official, and the Zoning Officer, or their designeeof the Township to administer and enforce the provisions of this chapter. It shall be unlawful for any person to erect, add to, move or structurally alter, in whole or in part, any building or structure unless a construction permit is obtained from the Construction Official and no structure or lot shall be used in violation of this chapter. (2) It shall be the duty of the Zoning Officer to inspect the structures and land in the Township and order the owner in writing to remedy any condition found to exist in violation of the provision(s) of this chapter. For purposes of this inspection, the Zoning Officer shall have the right to enter under due process of law. Said order shall be effective immediately at the time of service. (3) It shall be the duty of the Construction Official , and the Zoning Officer, or their designee to administer and enforce the provision of this chapter. The Township Engineer shall be available to assist the Construction Official and Zoning Officer with respect to the enforcement and implementation of the provisions of subdivision and site plan approvals. (4) Upon notice being served of any use existing in violation of any provision(s) of this chapter, the certificate of occupancy for such shall thereupon, without further notice, be null and void and a new certificate of occupancy shall be required for any further use of the structure. Section II All ordinances or parts of Ordinances inconsistent with this Ordinance are hereby repealed to the extent of such inconsistency. Section III If any section, paragraph, subdivision, clause or provision of this Ordinance shall be adjudged invalid, such adjudication shall apply only to this section, paragraph, subdivision, clause or provision and the remainder of this Ordinance shall be deemed valid and effective. Section IV This ordinance shall take effect upon adoption and publication in the manner required by New Jersey general law. A TRUE COPY OF WHICH ORDINANCE IS PRINTED ABOVE WAS INTRODUCED AT THE MEETING OF THE TOWNSHIP COMMITTEE ON JULY 1, 2024 AND THAT IT IS THE INTENTION OF THE TOWNSHIP COMMITTEE OF THE TOWNSHIP OF READINGTON TO CONSIDER PASSAGE OF SAID ORDINANCE AT THE REGULAR MEETING OF THE TOWNSHIP COMMITTEE TO BE HELD AT THE MUNICIPAL BUILDING, 509 ROUTE 523, WHITEHOUSE STATION, NEW JERSEY, ON AUGUST 5, 2024 AT 7:45 P.M. AT WHICH TIME AND PLACE, OR AT ANY TIME OR PLACE TO WHICH THE MEETING SHALL BE FROM TIME TO TIME ADJOURNED AN OPPORTUNITY WILL BE GIVEN TO ALL PERSONS WHO MAY BE INTERESTED THEREIN TO BE HEARD CONCERNING SAID ORDINANCE. KARIN M PARKER, RMC MUNICIPAL CLERK 7/8/24 ($51.77)

text: MEETING NOTICE COUNTY OF HUDSON PUBLIC HEARING ON PROPOSED 2024 OPEN SPACE TRUST FUND ALLOCATIONS Please Take Notice: As required by the State of New Jersey in N.J.S.A. 40:12-15, et seq., the Hudson County Board of County Commissioners will conduct a public hearing on the proposed allocations of its Open Space Trust Fund for Funding Year 2024 on August 8, 2024 at 1:00 p.m., in the Commissioner Chambers, 567 Pavonia Avenue, 1st Floor, Jersey, City, New Jersey, at which time public comment will be taken. In accordance with the N.J.S.A. 40:12-15.3(d), the County of Hudson is proposing the following funding allocations totaling $8,498,822 from the Hudson County Open Space, Recreation and Historic Preservation Trust Fund for the Trust Fund's 2024 funding cycle: Open Space Land Acquisition Projects totaling $422,000 as follows: (1) Town of Kearny - $422,000 for Site Acquisitions for a Continuous Waterfront Recreational Park Along the Passaic River. Parks and Recreation Improvement Projects totaling $7,797,000 as follows: (1) City of Bayonne - $500,000 for Peninsula at Bayonne Harbor Waterfront Walkway Extension. (2) City of Bayonne - $250,000 for Improvements to Veteran's Park. (3) Borough of East Newark - $167,000 for Veterans Soccer Field Turf. (4) Town of Guttenberg - $300,000 for Guttenberg Dog Park Project. (5) Town of Harrison - $300,000 for Policemen's Park Playground Rehabilitation. (6) City of Hoboken - $250,000 for Hoboken Skate Park and Walkway Upgrades Project. (7) City of Hoboken - $500,000 for Church Square Park Improvement Project - Phase 1. (8) City of Jersey City - $500,000 for Sinner Park Improvements Project. (9) City of Jersey City - $250,000 for Martiniak-Enright Park Improvements Project. (10) City of Jersey City - $500,000 for City Hall Park. (11) Jersey City Redevelopment Authority - $500,000 for Bayfront Promenade Park Phase I. (12) Town of Kearny - $150,000 for Kearny Recreational Center Site Improvements. (13) Township of North Bergen - $500,000 for Pickleball Court Improvements to Stan Newman Field. (14) Township of North Bergen - $250,000 for Improvements to the North Bergen Recreation Center. (15) Town of Secaucus - $500,000 for Ivanoski Park Inclusive Playground Project. (16) City of Union City - $500,000 for Liberty Place Playground. (17) City of Union City - $500,000 for 4100 Palisade Avenue Soccer Field. (18) Township of Weehawken - $500,000 for Louisa Park Improvement Project. (19) Township of Weehawken - $250,000 for Weehawken Pedestrian Bridge & Waterfront Walkway. (20) Town of West New York - $330,000 for Fillmore Park Improvement Project: Playground. (21) Town of West New York - $300,000 for Fillmore Park Improvement Project: Safety Improvements. Historic Preservation Projects totaling $279,822 as follows: (1) Old Bergen Church - $100,000 for Old Bergen Church Cemetery Restoration Project. (2) Hudson County Parks - $179,822 for Historic Preservation of Lincoln Park Sun Houses. The anticipated commencement date for these proposed projects is on or about September 26, 2024. The anticipated completion date for these proposed projects is by or about September 25, 2026. The public may submit written comments to the County on or before the date of the public hearing, or request additional information, by contacting Carol Jean Doyle, Clerk of the Board of County Commissioners, 567 Pavonia Avenue, 1st Floor, Jersey City, New Jersey 07306, (201) 795-6001. 7/8/24 $115.24

NOTICE TO BIDDERS Sealed Competitive Contracting Proposals will be received by the County of Bergen on Thursday, August 15, 2024 at 12:00 P.M. prevailing through the County of Bergen's Bonfire E-Procurement system accessible at www.bergenbids.com for the provision of BC-RFP- 24-012 Bergen County Area Plan for the Division of Senior Services The goals of this Request for Proposals (RFP) are to: * Provide a continuum of services that promote independence, dignity and choice to adults age 60 and over; * Provide services to adult, informal caregivers providing assistance to an individual who is 60 years of age or older; or to grandparents 55 years or older taking care of grandchildren 18 years or younger; and * Address service gaps that exist in the community. Such services include but are not limited to help with housekeeping and food shopping; nutrition for people who are homebound and people living in poverty; door-to-door assisted transportation; housing services; and best-practice models for caregiver awareness, support and education. Specifications and instructions to bidders may be obtained through the County website at www.BergenBids.com. Please note RFP Proposals are only accepted through the Bonfire E-Procurement Platform. All Bid Addenda will be issued on the website. Therefore, all interested respondents should check the website from now through bid opening. It is the sole responsibility of the respondent to be knowledgeable of all addenda related to this procurement. Bidders shall comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A 10:5-31 and N.J.A.C. 17-27 et seq. Peter Gerrity, QPA, Purchasing Agent Record-News Herald July 8, 2024 FEE$34.32 (39) 10352830

Passaic Board of Education REQUEST FOR BIDS Bid Advertisement The Board of Education of the City of Passaic, New Jersey, hereby advertises for competitive bids in accordance with N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-21(a,b) for the School Year 2024-2025 : Bid No. Bid 22-25 Hazmat Abatement Design and Monitoring Services or Environmental Services All necessary bid specifications and bid forms may be secured upon visiting School District's e-Procurement Portal https://procurement.opengov.com/portal/passaicschools. Bids must be electronically submitted by PDF only via School District's e-Procurement Portal at https://procurement.opengov.com/portal/passaicschools/projects/103390, on or before the date and time indicated below. Title: Hazmat Abatement Design and Monitoring Services or Environmental Services Bid No.: Bid 22-25 Date: Friday, July 19, 2024 Time: 9:00 am Bid Opening Location: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85051927116?pwd=q5jtq8aQWJzI56osScHEqdW2l1HNCu.1 The bid opening process will begin on the above date and time in the Board of Education Meeting Room, Passaic, New Jersey. On the advertised date and time, the School Business Administrator shall publicly receive and open all bids. No bids shall be received after the time designated in the advertisement. (N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-21(b)). The Board of Education does not accept mail, UPS / FED EX / and other express delivery services, hand delivery, and email submission of Bids. All respondents are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq., Affirmative Action Against Discrimination and N.J.A.C. 17:27 et seq. Each bid shall be accompanied by a bid bond, cashier's check or certified check made payable to the Passaic Board of Education, for ten percent (10%) of the amount of the total bid, however, not to exceed $20,000. Bidders are required by law to submit a Statement of Ownership Disclosure form statement setting forth the names and addresses of all persons and entities that own ten (10%) percent or more of its stock or interest of any type at all levels of ownership. A Non-Collusion Affidavit and a Contractor Questionnaire/Certification also must be filed with the bid. The bid package will also include other documents that must be completed and returned with the bid. Failure to comply with Instructions to Bidders and to complete and submit all required forms may be cause for disqualification and rejection of the bid. The Board of Education reserves the right to reject any or all bids, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-2(s), (t), (x), (y), 18A:18A-4(a-c), and N.J.S.A. 18A:18A-22, and to waive any informalities that may be in the best interest of the board. Notice of Pending Bond Ordinance and Summary. It will be further considered for final passage, after public hearing thereon, at a meeting of the Board of Commissioners to be held at the Administration Building, 6805 Long Beach Boulevard, Brant Beach, New Jersey on August 5, 2024, at 4:00 P.M. During the week prior to and up to and including the date of such meeting copies of the full ordinance will be available at no cost and during regular business hours, at the Municipal Clerk's office for the members of the general public who shall request the same. CLASS:10900 Spalding County Board of Commissioners Request for Qualifications for Civil Engineering Services 2024 029 Spalding County Government is seeking qualifications from Civil and Construction Engineering firms that can support the county's mission to enhance the quality of life for its 69,9461 residents across 201 square miles. Our vision is to maintain the rural character of our community while promoting balanced growth. We aim to achieve this through the continued development of industrial, manufacturing, commercial, and residential spaces that harmonize with our natural, eco-green friendly landscape. We believe that the right engineering partners can help us realize this vision by bringing innovative solutions, technical proficiency, and a deep understanding of our community's unique needs and environmental considerations. In line with this, the Board of Commissioners intends to appoint two engineering firms for a two year contract, which is annually renewable. This RFQ is the first step in our search for these partners. We invite firms that share our commitment to sustainable development and have a proven track record in civil and construction engineering to submit their qualifications. Through this process, we aim to identify firms that can help us navigate the complexities of modern infrastructure development while preserving the rural charm and natural beauty of Spalding County. Responses to this solicitation are due no later than 10:00a.m. on July 9, 2024. Sealed responses are due to Dr. Steve Ledbetter, County Manager, PO Box 1087, Griffin, Georgia 30224. Upon receipt of proposals, a review team will evaluate the proposals and recommend to the Board of Commissioners the top-ranked firm or firms for an interview. The complete RFQ document is available for review at the Spalding County website (https://www.spaldingcounty.com) or the Georgia Procurement Registry website at (https://ssl.doas.state.ga.us/gpr/). Spalding County provides equal opportunity for all businesses and does not discriminate against any person or business because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, and handicap or veterans' status. This policy ensures all segments of the business community have access to supplying the goods and services needed by Spalding County. 06/15, 06/22, 06/29, 07/06

LEGAL NOTICE CITY OF PLAINFIELD NEW JERSEY PLANNING BOARD NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING Application No.: PB 2024-15 In accordance with the Ordinances of the City of Plainfield, and the Statutes of the State of New Jersey, TAKE NOTICE that on the Thursday, July 18, 2024 at 7:00 pm the City of Plainfield Planning Board (the "Board") will conduct a public hearing in the Plainfield City Hall Library, 515 Watchung Avenue, Plainfield, New Jersey 07060 on the amended application of SWE Plainfield Development Urban Renewal LP, (the "Applicant'') to construct a mixed-use project at premises located at 605-609 W. Front Street; 611-19 W. Front Street, 115-33 Waynewood Park, and 118-20 Plainfield Avenue, Plainfield, New Jersey and designated as Lots 2, 3, 7 and 12 in Block 233 (hereinafter collectively referred to as the "Properties") on the City of Plainfield Tax Map. On May 19, 2022, pursuant to PB 2022-10, the Applicant received Amended Preliminary and Final Site Plan Approval, deviations from the Block 231 and 233 Redevelopment Plan (f/k/a Marino's Tract Redevelopment) (hereinafter the "Plan"), supplemental zone variances, and design waivers to consolidate the lots, demolish all structures and construct two five (5) story mixed-use buildings designated as the North Building and South Building together with associated site improvements on the above-referenced Properties. The North Building which fronts on West Front Street comprised of approximately 18,000 square feet of commercial space on the first floor; and 217 residential apartment units on the upper floors, amenity spaces and a swimming pool. The proposed retail space included a neighborhood grocery store. The South Building with frontage on Waynewood Park proposed approximately 284 residential apartment units and amenity spaces. 561 off-street parking was proposed through surface parking and partial spaces located under the buildings. Both buildings proposed a resident lounge area, co-working space, a fitness room, community room, and a rooftop deck, except the South Building proposed a yoga studio rather than a swimming pool (the "2022 Amended Approval"). Applicant seeks amended approval with the following major changes ("2024 Amendment"). * Increase the height of both buildings to 6 stories; * Reduce the size of the ground floor commercial space from 18,000 square feet to 6,013 square feet in the North Building (eliminating the proposed grocery store); * Increase parking from 561 spaces to 706 physical spaces (758 inclusive of the electric vehicle credits) by adding a structure parking garage with new ramps in both buildings with access from the first floor to the second floor; * Remove underground parking beneath the North Building; * Swimming pool moved to ground floor of the North Building; * Remove the truck loading dock; * Eliminate the compact off-street parking stalls; * Change residential apartments with courtyards changed to parking with ramps in both buildings with access from the first floor to the second floor; * Residential units removed from the second floor of the South Building; * Elevator, stairs and amenity spaces are also added to the second floor * Round-about Access has been added at Waynewood Park. * Storage space for residential units added to the second floor of each building, thereby eliminating the insufficient storage space variance The proposed number of residential units (501), unit distribution remain unchanged. Applicant seeks Amended Preliminary and Final Site Plan Approval and the following supplemental variances, deviations and/or waivers from the Plan and the City of Plainfield Land Use Ordinance ("Land Use Ordinance"): Variances: A. Bulk Regulations of the Plan: 1. Insufficient Minimum Front Yard Setback: Required 5 feet, proposed 4.2 feet 2. Insufficient Lot Frontage: Required 100 feet, proposed 61 feet (Previously approved) 3. Insufficient Minimum Rear Yard Setback (South Building): Required 15 feet, proposed 5 feet (Previously approved)). B. Land Use Ordinance (Previously approved in the 2022 Amendment, except as otherwise noted below): 1. SS17:9-24.B - Required minimum 10 foot wide buffer around parking lot to adjacent non-residential use or district. Required 10 feet, proposed 2 feet. 2. SS17:9-42.D- Required parking shall be setback 5 feet from property line, proposed setback 2 feet from the property line. 4. SS17:9-42.D- Required building shall be setback 5 feet from driveways and parking areas, proposed setback 2 feet from the property line. 5. SS17:9-43.B- Required 5% of interior parking lot shall be provided with planting islands, proposed 3.3%. 6. SS17:9-43.B.1 - Required minimum 10 foot width of landscaping islands, proposed landscaping islands have 9 foot width and 1.8 ft. 7. SS17:9-42.A requires parking to be set back 5 feet from a property line; and proposed is a new 2-foot setback from Block 233, Lots 1.01, 5 and 6. 8. SS17:9-42.H requires that the maximum width of a curb cut is 26 feet; and a curb cut of 37 feet is proposed on West Front Street and a curb cut of 33 feet on Plainfield Avenue. 9. SS17:9-51 requires a maximum of one wall sign per business; and three (3) signs are proposed for the residential apartments in the South Building, two (2) signs are proposed for the residential apartments in the North Building and two (2) signs are proposed for the retail use in the North Building. 10 SS17:9-51 requires the base of a monument sign to have a maximum height of 18-inches; and proposed is 2 feet. 11. SS17:9-42.B.2 - Required no more than 8 spaces in a row without an intervening landscape island, the maximum number of spaces in one row is 34 (45 spaces, previously approved in the 2022 Amendment) C. Design Waivers (Previously approved in the 2022 Amendment) SS17:11-8.B.9.b requires that each unit above a ground floor be provided with a private balcony area; and only 260 of the new 501 residential apartment units are proposed with balconies. Applicant also seeks such variance relief, exceptions, waivers, permits, interpretations, approvals, or licenses that are deemed necessary or appropriate by the applicant or the Board, and/or specified by the Planning Board's planner or engineering consultants and which may arise during the course of the hearing process. Any person or persons affected by this application will have an opportunity to present any objections to or offer comments on the proposed development. The Board does, however, have the right to exclude repetitious testimony. All documents relating to this application may be inspected by the public Monday through Friday between the hours of 9:00 am until 4:30 p.m. at the Division of Planning and Community Development, Second Floor, City Hall, 515 Watchung Avenue, Plainfield, New Jersey. The contact information for the Board Secretary is as follows: Maximo Vazquez, Board Secretary, City of Plainfield, phone: (908) 753-3421; and email: maximo.vazquez@plainfieldnj.gov. In the event that the Board Secretary is not available to immediately answer the telephone, please leave a message and also call back during regular business hours. Date: July 8, 2024 By: /s/ Marsha M. Moore Marsha M. Moore, Esq. Attorney for Applicant, SWE Plainfield Development Urban Renewal LP Post, Polak, P.A. 425 Eagle Rock Avenue, Suite 200 Roseland, New Jersey 07068 (973) 228-9900 ext 220 Email: mmoore@postpolak.com ($107.88)

text: NOTICE TO BIDDERS TOWNSHIP OF JEFFERSON COUNTY OF MORRIS NEW JERSEY Notice is hereby given that sealed bids will be received by the Township of Jefferson, for WELDON ROAD IMPROVEMENTS, Contract No. RDE-24-1, and will be opened and read in public at Jefferson Township Municipal Building, 1033 Weldon Road, Lake Hopatcong, New Jersey, on Tuesday, July 30, 2024 at 10:00 a.m. prevailing time. The work includes the furnishing of all labor, material and equipment necessary or required to complete all work set forth in these Specifications. The estimated item quantities are summarized as follows: ITEM APPROXIMATE QUANTITY HMA 9.5M64 Surf. Course, 2" Thick 3,200 TN HMA 19M64 Base Course, 4" Thick 50 TN HMA Milling, 3" or Less 22,500 SY Roadway Excavation 50 CY Dense Graded Aggregate 25 CY 4" Wide Yellow Striping, Spr. Epox. 14,000 LF 6" Wide White Striping, Spr. Epox. 14,000 LF Construction Signs 112 SF Traffic Cones 50 UN Galv. Beam Guide Rail 2,400 LF Tangent Guide Rail Term. (Len.= 50 FT) 10 UN Beam Guide Rail Posts 44 EA Beam Guide Rail Posts, 8' Long 86 EA Topsoil, 4" Thick 200 SY Fertilizer & Seed & Straw Mulch 200 SY Tree Removal 1" to 5" Diameter 170 EA Tree Removal 6" to 12" Diameter 31 EA Tree Removal 12" to 18" Diameter 30 EA Tree Removal 18" to 24" Diameter 25 EA Tree Removal 24" to 30" Diameter 9 EA Tree Removal 30" to 36" Diameter 1 EA Tree Trimming 6" to 12" Diameter 80 EA Tree Trimming 12" to 18" Diameter 60 EA Tree Trimming 18" to 24" Diameter 30 EA Tree Trimming 24" to 30" Diameter 30 EA Police Traffic Directors 120 HR Fuel Price Adjustment Non Bid Item LS Asphalt Price Adjustment Non Bid Item LS Specifications and forms of bid for the proposed work prepared by James S. Lutz, Township Engineer and approved by the Township of Jefferson have been filed in the office of said PURCHASING DEPARTMENT, at 1033 Weldon Road, Lake Hopatcong, New Jersey, and may be inspected by prospective bidders during the regular business hours. Bidders will be furnished with a copy of the Specifications and Proposal by the PURCHASING DEPARTMENT at the cost of $65.00, non-refundable; plus $15.00 postage and handling if mailed via USPS. Bidder may provide their FedEx account number if FedEx is preferred. Bids must be made on the standard Proposal form in the manner designated therein and must be enclosed in a sealed envelope bearing the name and address of the bidder and the name of the project on the outside, addressed to the Township of Jefferson, and must be accompanied by a Certified Check, Bid Bond or Cashier's Check drawn to the order of the Township of Jefferson for ten percent (10%) of the total amount bid, provided said security need not be more than $20,000.00. All bid guarantees shall be accompanied by an executed consent on the enclosed Bid Bond and Consent of Surety Forms from an approved surety company, licensed to conduct business in the State of New Jersey, agreeing to furnish the required Performance and Maintenance Bond upon the award of contract. The signed Proposal forms and bid security must be delivered to the place on or before the hour named above. The accepted bidder must sign the contract within ten (10) days after the Notice of Award or forfeit his bid security. Bid securities will be returned to all but the three apparent lowest responsible bidders. All other bid securities will be returned within three days after awarding and signing of the contract and approval of the Contractor's Performance Bond, Saturdays, Sundays, and Holidays excepted. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and P.L. 1975, c. 127 (N.J.A.C. 17:27), Affirmative Action Regulations and P.L. 1977, Chapter 33 Stockholder's Disclosure Regulations. The right is reserved to reject any or all Proposals, in whole or in part, or to make awards to such bidder or bidders who, in the judgment of the Township of Jefferson makes the most advantageous bid and to waive such informalities as may be permitted by law. BY ORDER OF THE TOWNSHIP OF JEFFERSON DEBRA J. MILLIKIN Business Administrator 7/5/2024 ($80.34)

Notice of Pending Bond Ordinance and Summary. The bond ordinance, the summary terms of which are included herein, was introduced and passed upon first reading at a meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the Township of Long Beach, in the County of Ocean, State of New Jersey, on July 1, 2024. It will be further considered for final passage, after public hearing thereon, at a meeting of the Board of Commissioners to be held at the Administration Building, 6805 Long Beach Boulevard, Brant Beach, New Jersey on August 5, 2024, at 4:00 P.M. During the week prior to and up to and including the date of such meeting copies of the full ordinance will be available at no cost and during regular business hours, at the Township Clerk's office for the members of the general public who shall request the same. The summary of the terms of such bond ordinance follows: Title: BOND ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING THE CONSTRUCTION OF STORM WATER PUMP STATIONS AND PIPING IN AND FOR THE TOWNSHIP OF LONG BEACH, COUNTY OF OCEAN, NEW JERSEY; APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF $4,000,000 THEREFOR; AUTHORIZING THE ISSUANCE OF GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS OR BOND ANTICIPATION NOTES OF THE TOWNSHIP OF LONG BEACH, COUNTY OF OCEAN, NEW JERSEY IN THE AGGREGATE PRINCIPAL AMOUNT OF UP TO $3,800,000; MAKING CERTAIN DETERMINATIONS AND COVENANTS; AND AUTHORIZING CERTAIN RELATED ACTIONS IN CONNECTION WITH THE FOREGOING Purpose/Improvement Construction of Storm Water Pump Stations and piping at various locations throughout the Township including, but not limited to, W. 20th Street, W. 32nd Street, W. 33rd Street, 44th Street, 53rd Street, 76th Street and 89th Street, together with the acquisition of all materials and equipment and completion of all work necessary therefor or related thereto Estimated Total Cost $4,000,000 Down Payment $200,000 Amount of Obligations $3,800,000 Period of Usefulness 40 years Appropriation: $4,000,000 Bonds/Notes Authorized: $3,800,000 Grants (if any) Appropriated: None Section 20 Costs: $800,000 Useful Life: 40 years DANIELLE LA VALLE, RMC, Municipal Clerk This Notice is published pursuant to N.J.S.A. 40A:2-17. ($51.92)
