REBID INVITATION TO BID THE HOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF HOBOKEN Hoboken, New Jersey The Housing Authority of the City of Hoboken is receiving bids for COURTYARD IMPROVEMENTS, FENCING AT HARRISON GARDENS. The Housing Authority of the City of Hoboken (the "Owner") will receive sealed bids for this work in accordance with contract documents prepared together with such addenda as may be issued prior to the date of receipt of bids. The bid opening will be held at_10:00 AM (prevailing time) on Friday, August 2, 2024, at 400 Harrison Street, Hoboken, New Jersey 07030, at which time bids will be opened and publicly read. LATE BIDS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. PHOTOCOPIES OR FACSIMILES OF THE BID DOCUMENTS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED IN LIEU OF THE BID MATERIALS. BIDS DETERMINED BY THE OWNER TO BE LATE WILL BE RETURNED TO THE BIDDER, UNOPENED. Bids for the contract must be on the forms provided in Bid Materials and must be completed in the manner designated therein. The bidder shall not change the wording of or any wording to the bid form. Unauthorized conditions, limitations, or provisions attached to a bid will be cause for rejection of that bid. If alterations by erasure or interlineation are made for any reason, the bidder must explain over such erasure or interlineation, with a signed statement from the bidder. Bids must be enclosed in sealed envelopes bearing the name and address of the bidder and must be delivered to the Housing Authority of the City of Hoboken, 400 Harrison Street, Hoboken, New Jersey 07030, properly marked bearing the name of the project, prior to the 10:00 AM deadline. It is the bidder's responsibility to see that bids are presented to the Housing Authority of the City of Hoboken on the hour and at the place designated. Bids may be hand delivered or mailed; however, the Owner disclaims any responsibility for bids forwarded by regular or express mail or common carrier. Complete digital sets of Bidding Documents, drawings and specifications, may be obtained online as a download at the following website: LAN.BIDDYHQ.COM under 'public projects'. Complete sets of Bidding Documents, Drawings and Specifications, may be obtained from REV Plans, 28 Church Street, Unit 7, Warwick, NY 10990, Tel: 845-651-3845, upon depositing the sum of $100 (One Hundred Dollars) for each combined set of documents beginning on Monday, July 8, 2024. Checks or money orders shall be made payable to The Housing Authority of the City of Hoboken. Plan deposit is non-refundable in accordance with the terms in the Instructions to Bidders to all submitting bids. Any bidder requiring documents to be shipped shall make arrangements with the printer and pay for all packaging and shipping costs. Please note REV Plans (revplans.biddyhq.com and lan.biddyhq.com) are the designated location and means for distributing and obtaining all bid package information. Only those Contract Documents obtained in this manner will enable a prospective bidder to be identified as an official plan holder of record. The Provider takes no responsibility for the completeness of Contract Documents obtained from other sources. Contract Documents obtained from other sources may not be accurate or may not contain addenda that may have been issued. All bid addenda will be transmitted to registered plan holders via email and will be available at revplans.biddyhq.com and lan.biddyhq.com. Plan holders who have paid for hard copies of the bid documents will need to make the determination if hard copies of the addenda are required for their use and coordinate directly with the printer for hard copies of addenda to be issued. There will be no charge for registered plan holders to obtain hard copies of the bid addenda. All technical questions, comments, and inquiries should be directed to LAN Associates, Engineering, Planning, Architecture, Surveying, Inc. (Attention Justin Provencher at telephone number 201-447-6400 or email at justin.provencher@lanassociates.com). A non-mandatory pre-bid meeting and walk-through of the site will be conducted on Monday, July 15, 2024, at 10:00 AM, at 400 Harrison Street, Hoboken, New Jersey. Bidders are encouraged to attend. Access to the buildings at any other time is restricted, and wholly at the Owner's discretion. Each bid shall be accompanied by a Bid Bond issued by a New Jersey Licensed Surety Company which is listed in the most recently published U.S. Treasury Circular No. 570, or by certified check in the amount called for in the Specifications, made out to the Housing Authority of the City of Hoboken. Bids must also be accompanied by all the materials required by the bid documents. Regardless of whether the Bid Bond or Certified Check is submitted for bid guarantee, each bidder must submit a Consent of Surety also from a New Jersey Licensed Surety Company which is listed in the most recently published U.S. Treasury Circular No. 570, stating that it will issue the necessary performance and maintenance bonds should the bidder enter into contract for this work with the Owner. This Invitation for Bid and the contract awarded to it comply with the fair and open process, established and further defined by N.J.S.A. 19:44A-20.7. Consequently, the provisions of N.J.S.A. 19:44A-20.5 and N.J.S.A. 19:44A-20.26, as to campaign contributions, do not apply to the Invitation to Bid and the contract to be awarded hereunder. Each bidder must submit, with its Bid, security in the amount indicated below. No Bidder may withdraw its Bid for a period of sixty (60) days after the actual date of opening thereof. Amount of Bid Bid Guarantee Up to $200,00 10% of Bid $200,000 to $400,00 $20,000 Over $400,00 5% of Bid All Bidders are hereby notified that compliance with the most recently published and applicable Davis-Bacon Wage Requirements will be required in the performance of any contract awarded. All Bidders are hereby notified that compliance with the New Jersey Public Works Contractor Registration Act, N.J.S.A. 34:11-56.48, et seq., will be required at the time of bid submission. All Bidders are hereby notified that compliance with the business registration provisions of P.L. 2004, c.57 will be required at time of contract execution. All Bidders, including corporations, limited liability companies, partnerships, and sole proprietorships, must submit a Statement of Ownership. During the performance of this Contract, the contractor agrees to comply with P.L. 1975, c. 127 (N.J.A.C. 17:27), "Law Against Discrimination", current regulations. The successful bidder will be required to obtain a Performance Bond for the full amount of the Contract and a Maintenance Bond for a percentage of the construction cost as defined in the specifications, both from a New Jersey Licensed Surety Company which is listed in the most recently published U.S. Treasury Circular No. 570. The Owner reserves the right to reject any or all bids, waive any identified informalities or technicalities in the bidding, sever or make awards of all or parts of any bids to one of more responsible bidders if it is in the best interest of the Owner to do so. The Owner also reserves the right to reject the bid of any respondent who has previously failed to perform properly, or to complete on time any contract work of a similar nature or who is not in a position to perform the contract. No bid shall be withdrawn for a period of sixty (60) days subsequent to the bid opening without the consent of the Owner. MARC A. RECKO, Executive Director Housing Authority of the City of Hoboken 7/8/24 $300.82

CLASS:10900 NOTICE OF FINDING OF NO SIGNFICANT IMPACT AND NOTICE OF INTENT TO REQUEST RELEASE OF FUNDS June 29, 2024 Douglas County 6287 Fairburn Road Douglasville, Georgia 30134 770-489-3100 These notices shall satisfy two separate but related procedural requirements for activities to be undertaken by Douglas County. REQUEST FOR RELEASE OF FUNDS On or about July 15, 2024, Douglas County will submit a request to the Georgia Department of Community Affairs for the release of Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) funds under Title I of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974, as amended and as implemented by the most current HUD regulations (24 CFR Part 750), to undertake a project known as Douglas County's 2021 CDBG Amendment for the purpose of constructing a new Douglas County Senior Center. FINDING OF NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACT Douglas County has determined that the project will have no significant impact on the human environment. Therefore, an Environmental Impact Statement under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (NEPA) is not required. Additional project information is contained in the Environmental Review Record (ERR) on file at Douglas County's Senior Center at 6287 Fairburn Road, Douglasville, GA 30134. Please make requests to view the ERR by email to Dr. Konswella Gilchrist at kgilchrist@douglascountyga.gov. PUBLIC COMMENTS Any individual, group, or agency may submit written comments, mailed and/or emailed (kgilchrist@douglascountyga.gov and copy callie@allensmithconsulting.com) on the ERR to Douglas County. All comments received by July 13, 2024, will be considered by Douglas County prior to authorizing submission of a request for release of funds. Comments should specify which Notice they are addressing. ENVIRONMENTAL CERTIFICATION Douglas County certifies to Georgia Department of Community Affairs that Chairman Phil D. Miller, in his capacity as Chairman, consents to accept the jurisdiction of the Federal Courts if an action is brought to enforce responsibilities in relation to the environmental review process and that these responsibilities have been satisfied. The Georgia Department of Community Affair's approval of the certification satisfies its responsibilities under NEPA and related laws and authorities and allows Douglas County to use Program funds. OBJECTIONS TO RELEASE OF FUNDS The Georgia Department of Community Affairs will accept objections to its release of fund and Douglas County's certification for a period of fifteen days following the anticipated submission date or its actual receipt of the request (whichever is later) only if they are on one of the following bases: (a) the certification was not executed by the Certifying Officer of Douglas County; (b) the County has omitted a step or failed to make a decision or finding required by HUD regulations at 24 CFR part 58; (c) the grant recipient or other participants in the development process have committed funds, incurred costs or undertaken activities not authorized by 24 CFR Part 58 before approval of a release of funds by the Georgia Department of Community Affairs; or (d) another Federal agency acting pursuant to 40 CFR Part 1504 has submitted a written finding that the project is unsatisfactory from the standpoint of environmental quality. Objections must be prepared and submitted in writing in accordance with the required procedures (24 CFR Part 58, Sec. 58.76) and shall be addressed to the Georgia Department of Community Affairs in writing to Ms. Kathleen Vaughn, Compliance Officer, CDBG Section, 60 Executive Park South, Atlanta, Georgia 30329-2231 or by email to Kathleen.Vaughn@dca.ga.gov. Potential objectors should contact the Georgia Department of Community Affairs to verify the actual last day of the objection period. The estimated last comment period date is July 30, 2024. Phil D. Miller Chairman, Douglas County Board of Commissioners AVISO DE HALLAZGO DE NINGUN IMPACTO SIGNIFICATIVO Y AVISO DE INTENCION DE SOLICITAR LIBERACION DE FONDOS 29 de junio de 2024 Condado de Douglas 6287 Fairburn Road Douglasville, Georgia 30134 770-489-3100 Estas notificaciones deberan satisfacer dos requisitos procesales separados pero relacionados para actividades que llevara a cabo el condado de Douglas. SOLICITUD DE LIBERACION DE FONDOS Alrededor del 15 de julio de 2024, el condado de Douglas presentara una solicitud a el Departamento de Asuntos Comunitarios de Georgia para la liberacion de Community Fondos comunitarios de Subvencion en Bloque para el Desarrollo (CDBG) bajo el Titulo I de la Vivienda y Ley de Desarrollo Comunitario de 1974, modificada e implementada por la regulaciones mas actuales de HUD (24 CFR Parte 750), para llevar a cabo un Proyecto conocido como Enmienda CDBG 2021 del condado de Douglas con el proposito de construir un nuevo centro para personas mayores del condado de Douglas. HALLAZGO DE NO IMPACTO SIGNIFICATIVO El condado de Douglas ha determinado que el proyecto no tendra un impacto significativo en la Ambiente humano. Por lo tanto, una Declaracion de Impacto Ambiental bajo la Ley Nacional de Politica Ambiental de 1969 (NEPA), no es requerido. Informacion adicional del Proyecto esta ubicado en el Registro de revision ambiental (ERR) archivado en el. Centro para personas mayores del condado de Douglas ubicado en 6287 Fairburn Road, Douglasville, GA 30134. Por favor haga sus solicitudes para ver la ERR por correo electronico a la Dra. Konswella Gilchrist en kgilchrist@douglascountyga.gov. COMENTARIOS PUBLICOS Cualquier individuo, grupo o agencia puede enviar comentarios por escrito, por correo y/o por correo electronico. (kgilchrist@douglascountyga.gov y callie@allensmithconsulting.com) en el ERR al condado de Douglas. Todos los comentarios recibidos antes del 13 de julio de 2024 seran considerado por el condado de Douglas antes de autorizar la presentacion de una solicitud de liberacion de fondos. Los comentarios deben especificar a que Aviso se dirigen. CERTIFICACION AMBIENTAL El condado de Douglas certifica al Departamento de Asuntos Comunitarios de Georgia que el chairman Phil D. Miller, en su calidad de Chairman, acepta la jurisdiccion de los Tribunales Federales si se interpone una accion para hacer cumplir responsabilidades en relacion con el proceso de revision ambiental y que estas responsabilidades han sido satisfechas. La aprobacion de la certificacion por parte del Departamento de Asuntos Comunitarios de Georgia satisfice sus responsabilidades segun la NEPA y las leyes y autoridades relacionadas y permite que el condado de Douglas los fondos del programa. OBJECIONES A LA LIBERACION DE FONDOS El Departamento de Asuntos Comunitarios de Georgia aceptara objeciones a su liberacion de fondos y la certificacion del condado de Douglas por un periodo de quince dias despues de la fecha anticipada de la presentation o la recepcion l de la solicitud (lo que ocurra mas tarde) solo si se basan en una de las siguientes bases: (a) la certificacion no fue ejecutada por el Oficial certificador del condado de Douglas; (b) el Condado ha omitido un paso o no ha cumplido una decision o hallazgo requerido por las regulaciones de HUD en 24 CFR parte 58; c) la subvencion El destinatario u otros participantes en el proceso de desarrollo han comprometido fondos. Costos incurridos o actividades realizadas no autorizadas por 24 CFR Parte 58 antes de aprobacion de una liberacion de fondos por parte del Departamento de Asuntos Comunitarios de Georgia; o (d) otra agencia federal que actua de conformidad con 40 CFR Parte 1504 ha presentado un escrito considerando que el proyecto es insatisfactorio desde el punto de vista de la calidad ambiental. Las objeciones deben prepararse y presentarse por escrito de acuerdo con los requisites procedimientos (24 CFR Parte 58, Sec. 58.76) y debera dirigirse a Georgia Departamento de Asuntos Comunitarios por escrito a la Sra. Kathleen Vaughn, Oficial de Cumplimiento. Seccion CDBG, 60 Executive Park South, Atlanta, Georgia 30329-2231 o por envie un correo electronico a Kathleen.Vaughn@dca.ga.gov. Los posibles objetores deben comunicarse con. Departamento de Asuntos Comunitarios de Georgia para verificar el ultimo dia del period de objection periodo. La fecha estimada del ultimo periodo de comentarios es el 30 de julio de 2024. Phil D. Miller Presidente de la Junta de Comisionados del Condado de Douglas 06/29

PUBLIC NOTICE TOWNSHIP OF DEPTFORD ORDINANCE O.17.24 ORDINANCE OF THE TOWNSHIP OF DEPTFORD, COUNTY OF GLOUCESTER, STATE OF NEW JERSEY, AUTHORIZING THE VACATION OF A PORTION OF MURPHY AVENUE PUBLIC NOTICE is hereby given that the foregoing Ordinance was introduced on the first reading by the Township Governing Body of the Township of Deptford held on July 1, 2024. This Ordinance will be considered for final adoption after a public hearing to be held on August 5, 2024 at 6:00 o'clock p.m., prevailing time at the Municipal Building located at 1011 Cooper Street Deptford, NJ 08096. A copy of the Ordinance may be obtained without cost by any member of the general public at the Clerk's Office by calling 856-845-5300 on weekdays between the hours of 8:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. EXPLANATORY STATEMENT Township of Deptford has determined that portions of Murphy Avenue as shown on the official Tax Map of Deptford Township, are not needed for any public purpose(s) of the Township, and that the public interest would be best served by vacating and extinguishing all public right, title and interest in and to those portions of Madison Drive, so that the underlying lands may be combined with, and become and form parts of, adjacent properties. Upon adoption, a portion of Murphy Avenue shall be vacated in compliance with N.J.S.A. 40:67-19, et seq. Attest: Michelle Hack, RMC Township Clerk Cost: $43.38 (0010887614) 1t 7/8/24

NOTICE TO BIDDERS TOWNSHIP OF JEFFERSON COUNTY OF MORRIS NEW JERSEY Notice is hereby given that sealed bids will be received by the Township of Jefferson, for GARNET DRIVE ROAD IMPROVEMENTS, Contract No. RDE-23-6, and will be opened and read in public at Jefferson Township Municipal Building, 1033 Weldon Road, Lake Hopatcong, New Jersey, on Tuesday, July 30, 2024 at 11:00 a.m. prevailing time. The work includes the furnishing of all labor, material and equipment necessary or required to complete all work set forth in these Specifications. The estimated item quantities are summarized as follows: ITEM APPROXIMATE QUANTITY Breakaway Barricades 4 EA Construction Signs 32 SF Traffic Cones 12 EA Full Depth Reclamation, 10" Thick (8" Stabilization) 3,500 SY Portland Cement Stabilizing Agent 75 TN Asphalt Emulsion 3,500 GAL Disposal of Excess Reclaimed Material 300 CY Rock Excavation 15 CY HMA 9.5L64 Surf. Course, 2" Thick 470 TN Police Traffic Directors 16 HR Fuel Price Adjustment Non Bid Item LS Asphalt Price Adjustment Non Bid Item LS Specifications and forms of bid for the proposed work prepared by James S. Lutz, Township Engineer and approved by the Township of Jefferson have been filed in the office of said PURCHASING DEPARTMENT, at 1033 Weldon Road, Lake Hopatcong, New Jersey, and may be inspected by prospective bidders during the regular business hours. Bidders will be furnished with a copy of the Specifications and Proposal by the PURCHASING DEPARTMENT at the cost of $25.00, non-refundable; plus $15.00 postage and handling if mailed via USPS. Bidder may provide their FedEx account number if FedEx is preferred. Bids must be made on the standard Proposal form in the manner designated therein and must be enclosed in a sealed envelope bearing the name and address of the bidder and the name of the project on the outside, addressed to the Township of Jefferson, and must be accompanied by a Certified Check, Bid Bond or Cashier's Check drawn to the order of the Township of Jefferson for ten percent (10%) of the total amount bid, provided said security need not be more than $20,000.00. All bid guarantees shall be accompanied by an executed consent on the enclosed Bid Bond and Consent of Surety Forms from an approved surety company, licensed to conduct business in the State of New Jersey, agreeing to furnish the required Performance and Maintenance Bond upon the award of contract. The signed Proposal forms and bid security must be delivered to the place on or before the hour named above. The accepted bidder must sign the contract within ten (10) days after the Notice of Award or forfeit his bid security. Bid securities will be returned to all but the three apparent lowest responsible bidders. All other bid securities will be returned within three days after awarding and signing of the contract and approval of the Contractor's Performance Bond, Saturdays, Sundays, and Holidays excepted. Bidders are required to comply with the requirements of N.J.S.A. 10:5-31 et seq. and P.L. 1975, c. 127 (N.J.A.C. 17:27), Affirmative Action Regulations and P.L. 1977, Chapter 33 Stockholder's Disclosure Regulations. The right is reserved to reject any or all Proposals, in whole or in part, or to make awards to such bidder or bidders who, in the judgment of the Township of Jefferson makes the most advantageous bid and to waive such informalities as may be permitted by law. BY ORDER OF THE TOWNSHIP OF JEFFERSON DEBRA J. MILLIKIN Business Administrator 7/5/2024 ($77.22)

PUBLIC NOTICE FOR VIRTUAL HEARING CITY OF NEWARK CENTRAL PLANNING BOARD PLEASE TAKE NOTE that on Monday, July 22, 2024 at 6:00 P.M. the City of Newark's Central Planning Board (the "Board") will hold a VIRTUAL public hearing on Application CPB-24-36, on behalf of S.A.T. Urban Renewal Entity, LLC (the "Applicant") for a project to be located at 142-144 Elizabeth Avenue, also referred to as Block 2776, Lots 8 and 9 on the official tax records of the City of Newark (the "Property"), at which time all interested persons will be given an opportunity to question witnesses and be heard electronically in the manner described below. The Property is located in the C-2 Community Commercial. The Property is currently comprised of two (2) lots. The Applicant proposes to merge the existing two (2) lots into a 5,532 square foot lot and construct a five (5)-story mixed use building. The ground floor of the new mixed-use development shall consist of 1,542 square feet of retail space, a 779 square foot community room, one (1) bathroom, a mail/package room, a mechanical/trash room and an elevator. The second through fifth floors shall consist of twenty (20) residential units comprised of sixteen (16) two-bedroom units and four (4) one-bedroom units. In connection thereto, the Applicant is requesting "c" variance relief for insufficient side yard setback (corner street frontage), insufficient on-site trees, exceeding the maximum permitted building lot coverage, exceeding the maximum permitted impervious coverage, insufficient side faade building transparency, and insufficient shade trees. The Applicant shall also apply for such variance relief, exceptions, waivers, departures, permits or other approvals or licenses that are deemed necessary or appropriate by the Applicant or the Board and which may arise during the course of the hearing process. The Applicant may also revise the plans pursuant to comments made upon a review of the plans, testimony and other materials at the public hearing without further notice. Further, the Applicant reserves the right to supplement this application and/or seek at the time of hearing such other approvals, interpretations, variances and/or waivers as may be requested or required by the applicant or the Board. This hearing will take place remotely by videoconference or telephone conference only, via the Zoom platform. Any interested party may appear at the virtual meeting and participate therein in accordance with the rules of the Board. THE MEETING WILL BE OFFERED VIRTUALLY FOR ALL BOARD MEMBERS, BOARD PROFESSIONALS, APPLICANT AND APPLICANT'S TEAM, AND INTERESTED PARTIES AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC. CLASS:10900 Douglas County Board of Commissioners Purchasing Department Request for Proposals DOT Administration Building Solicitation 24-022 Douglas County ("Owner" or the "County") is issuing this Request for Proposal ("RFP") to solicit proposals ("Proposals") from a qualified Civil Architect team ("Respondents") to assist in the development of a concept and detailed design for a new Department of Transportation Administration building at Douglas County's transportation center, located at 8800 Dorris Rd, Douglasville, GA 30134, (the "Project"). Capitalized terms in this RFP, if not defined here, are defined in the Agreement (defined below) for the Project. The Project will be funded with SPLOST funds. The Project is required to comply with all applicable statutes, rules and regulations, as well as those of Douglas County, including local permitting of the project. Additionally, the Project must comply with all SPLOST rules, regulations, specifications, and requirements. All solicitation documents may be obtained from the Douglas County website https://www.bidnetdirect.com/georgia/douglascounty and the Georgia Procurement Registry https://ssl.doas.state.ga.us/gpr/index. Responses to this RFP must be received electronically via Douglas County BidNet's online bidding platform on or before Wednesday, August 7, 2024, 4:00 PM EST, , after which time and date they will no longer be accepted. There will be a MANDATORY pre-bid meeting will be held on Wednesday, July 10, 2024, at 10:00 A.M. held at the CONNECT DOUGLAS, MULTI-MODAL TRANSPORTATION CENTER, 8800 DORRIS ROAD, DOUGLASVILLE, GA 30134 Douglas County reserves the right to waive informalities, to reject any and all bids, to evaluate bids, to accept portions of any bid, and to accept any bid, which in its opinion, may be in the best interest of the County. The County reserves the right to add to or delete from the contract after the contract has been awarded. No bid will be received and accepted after the above specified date and time of the bid opening. Bids submitted after the designated date and time will be deemed invalid and returned unopened to the bidder. No bid may be withdrawn within ninety (90) days after the bid opening and all bids shall remain firm during this period. 07/02, 07/09

ORDINANCE NO. 24-05 AN ORDINANCE AMENDING AND SUPPLEMENTING AN ORDINANCE ENTITLED "AN ORDINANCE FIXING AND CONFIRMING THE SALARIES AND COMPENSATIONS OF CERTAIN APPOINTIVE AND ELECTIVE OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES OF THE TOWNSHIP OF MANNINGTON IN THE COUNTY OF SALEM, NEW JERSEY BEGINNING JANUARY 1, 1968", ADOPTED FEBRUARY 22, 1968 AND THE AMENDMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTS TO SAID ORDINANCE BE IT ORDAINED by the Township Committee of the Township of Mannington in Salem County, New Jersey as follows: SECTION 1. The Ordinance set forth by title in the title of this ordinance and amendments and supplements thereto are hereby further amended and supplemented as hereinafter set forth: SECTION 2. Section 1 of said Ordinance as amended and supplemented, is hereby further amended and supplemented as follows: ADMINISTRATIVE & EXECUTIVE All Salaries paid the 15th and 30th of each month, except February, which will be paid the 15th and the last day of the month. Acting Clerk/Administrator-$40,000 annually Acting Registrar of Vital Statistics - $12,000 annually Acting Board of Health secretary - $2,060 annually SECTION 4. All other terms and provisions of the said ordinance adopted on February 22, 1968 as amended and supplemented shall be and remain in full force and effect, save only as herein expressly amended, supplemented or repealed. SECTION 5. All ordinances or parts of ordinances inconsistent herewith, to the extent of such inconsistencies, be and the same are hereby repealed. SECTION 6. This Ordinance shall take effect and become operative as of August 1, 2024, upon its final passage and publication as required by law; and the provisions of this ordinance shall remain in full force and effect until amended, supplemented or repealed. Date: July 1, 2024 CERTIFICATION I hereby certify the above to be a true copy of an Ordinance introduced and passed by the Mannington Township Committee on first reading at a regular meeting held on July 1, 2024. A Public Hearing on said Ordinance is scheduled for August 5, 2024 at 5:30 pm at Mannington Townhall, 491 Route 45, Mannington, NJ, after which the Ordinance will be presented for adoption. Patti L. Davis, Deputy Clerk Cost: $66.42 7/8/2024 1T (10879401)
